" Oh , say ! "[93-amy] interrupted [Mrs. Everard]93-amy at this juncture ; " [I]93-amy am SO interested , [signor]1742-signor , to hear [you]1742-signor are engaged ! [I]93-amy suppose [she]1933-she is a dream of beauty ? "[93-amy]

" Who told [you]98-mademoiselle , [madame]1750-madame , that [I]97-cellini am engaged ? "[97-cellini]

" [She]1933-she is quite right , "[97-cellini] replied [Cellini]97-cellini , with another of those rare sweet smiles of [his]97-cellini ; " and [you]98-mademoiselle also are right , [madame]1750-madame , in [your]98-mademoiselle supposition : [[my]97-cellini betrothed]1936-my betrothed is a Dream of Beauty . "[97-cellini]

[I]0-i was infinitely relieved . [I]0-i had not , then , been guilty of a falsehood . But the mystery remained : how had [I]0-i discovered the truth of the matter at all ? [I]0-i was not engaged , and [I]0-i at once accepted [his]97-cellini proffered arm . [Two gentlemen]502-two gentlemen came hurriedly up to claim [Amy]93-amy and [[her]93-amy Austrian friend]503-her austrian friend ; and for one brief moment [Signor Cellini]97-cellini and [I]0-i stood alone in [a comparatively quiet corner of [the ballroom]481-the ballroom]504-a comparatively quiet corner of the ballroom , waiting for the music to begin . [The band]1862-the band burst forth just then in the voluptuous strains of a waltz by [Gung'l]119-gung'l , and together [we]507-we floated away to its exquisite gliding measure . [I]0-i use the word FLOATED , advisedly , for no other term could express the delightful sensation [I]0-i enjoyed . [Cellini]97-cellini was [a superb dancer]508-a superb dancer . It seemed to [me]0-i that [our]507-we feet scarcely touched the floor , so swiftly , so easily and lightly [we]507-we sped along . A few rapid turns , and [I]0-i noticed [we]507-we were nearing the open French windows , and , before [I]0-i well realized it , [we]507-we had stopped dancing and were pacing quietly side by side down [the ilex avenue]509-the ilex avenue , where the little lanterns twinkled like red fireflies and green glow - worms among the dark and leafy branches .

[We]507-we walked along in silence till [we]507-we reached the end of [the path]510-the path . There , before [us]507-we , lay [the open garden]511-the open garden , with [its]511-the open garden broad green lawn , bathed in the lovely light of the full moon , sailing aloft in a cloudless sky . The night was very warm , but , regardless of this fact , [Cellini]97-cellini wrapped carefully round [me]0-i a large fleecy white burnous that [he]97-cellini had taken from a chair where it was lying , on [his]97-cellini way through [the avenue]512-the avenue .

" [I]0-i am not cold , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , smiling .

" No ; but [you]0-i will be , perhaps . It is not wise to run any useless risks . "[0-i]

[I]0-i was again silent . A low breeze rustled in the tree - tops near [us]507-we ; the music of [the ballroom]481-the ballroom reached [us]507-we only in faint and far echoes ; the scent of roses and myrtle was wafted delicately on the balmy air ; the radiance of the moon softened the outlines of [the landscape]514-the landscape into a dreamy suggestiveness of its reality . Suddenly a sound broke on [our]507-we ears - a delicious , long , plaintive trill ; then a wonderful shower of sparkling roulades ; and finally , a clear , imploring , passionate note repeated many times . It was a nightingale , singing as only [the nightingales of [the South]516-the south]515-the nightingales of the south can sing . [I]0-i listened entranced .

" ' [Thou]1941-thou wast not born for death , [immortal Bird]1942-immortal bird ! No hungry generations tread [thee]1941-thou down ; The voice [I]0-i hear this passing night was heard In ancient days by [emperor]1943-emperor and [clown]1944-clown , ' "[0-i]

quoted [Cellini]97-cellini in earnest tones .

" [You]97-cellini admire [Keats]102-john keats ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked eagerly .

" More than [any other poet that has lived]1945-any other poet that has lived , "[97-cellini] [he]97-cellini replied . " [His]102-john keats was the most ethereal and delicate muse that ever consented to be tied down to [earth]1946-earth . But , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , [you]98-mademoiselle do not wish to examine [me]97-cellini as to [my]97-cellini taste in poetry . [You]98-mademoiselle have some other questions to put to [me]97-cellini , have [you]98-mademoiselle not ? "[97-cellini]

For one instant [I]0-i hesitated . Then [I]0-i spoke out frankly , and answered :

" Yes , [signor]1742-signor . What was there in that wine [you]97-cellini gave [me]0-i this morning ? "[0-i]

[He]97-cellini met [my]0-i searching gaze unflinchingly .

" A medicine , "[97-cellini] [he]97-cellini said . " An excellent and perfectly simple remedy made of the juice of plants , and absolutely harmless . "[97-cellini]

" But why , "[0-i] [I]0-i demanded , " why did [you]97-cellini give [me]0-i this medicine ? Was it not wrong to take so much responsibility upon [yourself]97-cellini ? "[0-i]

[He]97-cellini smiled .

" [I]97-cellini think not . If [you]0-i are injured or offended , then [I]97-cellini was wrong ; but if , on the contrary , [your]97-cellini health and spirits are ever so little improved , as [I]97-cellini see they are , [I]97-cellini deserve [your]97-cellini thanks , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle . "[97-cellini]

And [he]97-cellini waited with an air of satisfaction and expectancy . [I]0-i was puzzled and half - angry , yet [I]0-i could not help acknowledging to [myself]0-i that [I]0-i felt better and more cheerful than [I]0-i had done for many months . [I]0-i looked up at [the artist]348-the artist 's dark , intelligent face , and said almost humbly :

" [I]0-i DO thank [you]97-cellini , [signor]1742-signor . But surely [you]97-cellini will tell [me]0-i [your]97-cellini reasons for constituting [yourself]97-cellini [[my]0-i physician]1949-my physician without even asking [my]0-i leave . "[0-i]

[He]97-cellini laughed , and [his]97-cellini eyes looked very friendly .

" [Mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , [I]97-cellini am one of [those strangely constituted beings who can not bear to see any innocent thing]1950-those strangely constituted beings who can not bear to see any innocent thing suffer . It matters not whether it be a worm in the dust , a butterfly in the air , a bird , a flower , or [a human creature]1951-a human creature . The first time [I]97-cellini saw [you]97-cellini [I]97-cellini knew that [your]97-cellini state of health precluded [you]97-cellini from the enjoyment of life natural to [your]97-cellini sex and age . [I]97-cellini also perceived that [the physicians]1952-the physicians had been at work upon [you]97-cellini trying to probe into the causes of [your]97-cellini ailment , and that [they]1952-the physicians had signally failed . [Physicians]1953-physicians , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , are very clever and [estimable men]1954-estimable men , and there are a few things which come within the limit of [their]1953-physicians treatment ; but there are also other things which baffle [their]1953-physicians utmost profundity of knowledge . One of these is that wondrous piece of human machinery , the nervous system ; that intricate and delicate network of fine threads - electric wires on which run the messages of thought , impulse , affection , emotion . If these threads or wires become , from any subtle cause , entangled , the skill of [the mere medical practitioner]1955-the mere medical practitioner is of no avail to undo the injurious knot , or to unravel the confused skein . The drugs generally used in such cases are , for the most part , repellent to the human blood and natural instinct , therefore they are always dangerous , and often deadly . [I]97-cellini knew , by studying [your]97-cellini face , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , that [you]97-cellini were suffering as acutely as [I]97-cellini , too , suffered some five years ago , and [I]97-cellini ventured to try upon [you]97-cellini a simple vegetable essence , merely to see if [you]97-cellini were capable of benefiting by it . The experiment has been so far successful ; but - - "[97-cellini]

[He]518-i paused , and [his]518-i face became graver and more abstracted .

" But what ? "[0-i] [I]0-i queried eagerly .

" [I]518-i was about to say , "[518-i] [he]518-i continued , " that the effect is only transitory . Within forty - eight hours [you]97-cellini must naturally relapse into [your]97-cellini former prostrate condition , and [I]518-i , unfortunately , am powerless to prevent it . "[518-i]

[I]0-i sighed wearily , and a feeling of disappointment oppressed [me]0-i . Was it possible that [I]0-i must again be the victim of miserable dejection , pain , and stupor ?

" [You]518-i can give [me]0-i another dose of [your]518-i remedy , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" That [I]518-i can not , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , "[518-i] [he]518-i answered regretfully ; " [I]518-i dare not , without further advice and guidance . "[518-i]

" Advice and guidance from whom ? "[0-i] [I]0-i inquired .

" From [the friend who cured [me]97-cellini of [my]97-cellini long and almost hopeless illness]1956-the friend who cured me of my long and almost hopeless illness , "[97-cellini] said [Cellini]97-cellini . " [He]1956-the friend who cured me of my long and almost hopeless illness alone can tell [me]97-cellini whether [I]97-cellini am right in [my]97-cellini theories respecting [your]98-mademoiselle nature and constitution . "[97-cellini]

" And what are those theories ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , becoming deeply interested in the conversation .

[Cellini]97-cellini was silent for a minute or so ; [he]97-cellini seemed absorbed in a sort of inward communion with [himself]97-cellini . Then [he]97-cellini spoke with impressiveness and gravity :

" In [this world]1957-this world , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , there are [no two natures alike]1958-no two natures alike , yet all are born with a small portion of Divinity within [them]1958-no two natures alike , which [we]1959-we call the Soul . It is a mere spark smouldering in the centre of the weight of clay with which [we]1959-we are encumbered , yet it is there . Now this particular germ or seed can be cultivated if [we]1959-we will - that is , if [we]1959-we desire and insist on its growth . As [a child]369-a child 's taste for art or learning can be educated into high capabilities for the future , so can [the human Soul]1961-the human soul be educated into so high , so supreme an attainment , that no merely mortal standard of measurement can reach its magnificence . With much more than half [the inhabitants of [the globe]1963-the globe]1962-the inhabitants of the globe , this germ of immortality remains always a germ , never sprouting , overlaid and weighted down by the lymphatic laziness and materialistic propensities of its shell or husk - the body . But [I]97-cellini must put aside the forlorn prospect of the multitudes in whom the Divine Essence attains to no larger quantity than that proportioned out to a dog or bird - [I]97-cellini have only to speak of [the rare few with whom the soul is everything]1964-the rare few with whom the soul is everything - [those who , perceiving and admitting its existence within [them]1964-the rare few with whom the soul is everything , devote all [their]1964-the rare few with whom the soul is everything powers to fanning up [their]1964-the rare few with whom the soul is everything spark of light till it becomes a radiant , burning , inextinguishable flame]1965-those who , perceiving and admitting its existence within them , devote all their powers to fanning up their spark of light till it becomes a radiant , burning , inextinguishable flame . The mistake made by these examples of beatified Humanity is that [they]1964-the rare few with whom the soul is everything too often sacrifice the body to the demands of the spirit . It is difficult to find the medium path , but it can be found ; and the claims of both body and soul can be satisfied without sacrificing [the one]1966-the one to the other . [I]97-cellini beg [your]1967-you earnest attention , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , for what [I]97-cellini say concerning THE RARE FEW WITH WHOM THE SOUL IS EVERYTHING . [YOU]1967-you are [one of [those few]1969-those few]1968-one of those few , unless [I]97-cellini am greatly in error . And [you]1967-you have sacrificed [your]1967-you body so utterly to [your]1967-you spirit that the flesh rebels and suffers . This will not do . [You]1967-you have work before [you]1967-you in [the world]264-the world , and [you]1967-you can not perform it unless [you]1967-you have bodily health as well as spiritual desire . And why ? Because [you]1967-you are [a prisoner here on [earth]1946-earth]1971-a prisoner here on earth , and [you]1967-you must obey the laws of [the prison]1973-the prison , however unpleasant [they]1974-they may be to [you]1967-you . Were [you]1967-you free as [you]1967-you have been in ages past and as [you]1967-you will be in ages to come , things would be different ; but at present [you]1967-you must comply with the orders of [[your]1967-you gaolers]1975-your gaolers - [the Lords of Life and Death]1976-the lords of life and death . "[97-cellini]

[I]0-i heard [him]519-you , half awed , half fascinated . [His]519-you words were full of mysterious suggestions .

" How do [you]519-you know [I]0-i am of the temperament [you]519-you describe ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked in a low voice .

" [I]520-i do not know , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle ; [I]520-i can only guess . There is but [one person who can perhaps judge of [you]1967-you correctly , - [a man older than [myself]520-i]1978-a man older than myself by many years - whose life is [the very acme of spiritual perfection]1979-the very acme of spiritual perfection - whose learning is vast and unprejudiced . [I]520-i must see and speak to [him]1978-a man older than myself before [I]520-i try any more of [my]520-i , or rather [his]1978-a man older than myself , remedies]1977-one person who can perhaps judge of you correctly , - a man older than myself by many years - whose life is the very acme of spiritual perfection - whose learning is vast and unprejudiced . i must see and speak to him before i try any more of my , or rather his , remedies . But [we]1980-we have lingered long enough out here , and unless [you]1967-you have something more to say to [me]520-i , [we]1980-we will return to [the ballroom]481-the ballroom . [You]1967-you will otherwise miss the cotillon ; "[520-i] and [he]520-i turned to retrace the way through [the illuminated grove]521-the illuminated grove .

But a sudden thought had struck [me]0-i , and [I]0-i resolved to utter it aloud . Laying [my]0-i hand on [his]520-i arm and looking [him]520-i full in the face , [I]0-i said slowly and distinctly :

" [This friend of [yours]520-i that [you]520-i speak of]1982-this friend of yours that you speak of - is not [his]1982-this friend of yours that you speak of name [HELIOBAS]104-heliobas ? "[0-i]

[Cellini]97-cellini started violently ; the blood rushed up to [his]97-cellini brows and as quickly receded , leaving [him]97-cellini paler than before . [His]97-cellini dark eyes glowed with suppressed excitement - [his]97-cellini hand trembled . Recovering [himself]97-cellini slowly , [he]97-cellini met [my]0-i gaze fixedly ; [his]97-cellini glance softened , and [he]97-cellini bent [his]97-cellini head with an air of respect and reverence .

" [Mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , [I]97-cellini see that [you]98-mademoiselle must know all . It is [your]98-mademoiselle fate . [You]98-mademoiselle are greatly to be envied . Come to [me]97-cellini to - morrow , and [I]97-cellini will tell [you]98-mademoiselle everything that is to be told . Afterwards [your]98-mademoiselle destiny rests in [your]98-mademoiselle own hands . Ask nothing more of [me]97-cellini just now . "[97-cellini]

[He]97-cellini escorted [me]0-i without further words back to [the ballroom]481-the ballroom , where the merriment of the cotillon was then at [its]523-its height . Whispering to [Mrs. Everard]93-amy as [I]0-i passed [her]93-amy that [I]0-i was tired and was going to bed , [I]0-i reached [the outside passage]524-the outside passage , and there , turning to [Cellini]97-cellini , [I]0-i said gently :

" Good - night , [signor]1742-signor . To - morrow at noon [I]0-i will come . "[0-i]

[He]97-cellini replied :

" Good - night , mademoiselle ! To - morrow at noon [you]0-i will find [me]97-cellini ready . "[97-cellini]

With that [he]97-cellini saluted [me]0-i courteously and turned away . [I]0-i hurried up to [[my]0-i own room]413-my own room , and on arriving [there]526-there [I]0-i could not help observing the remarkable freshness of the lilies [I]0-i wore . They looked as if they had just been gathered . [I]0-i unfastened them all from [my]0-i dress , and placed them carefully in water ; then quickly disrobing , [I]0-i was soon in bed . [I]0-i meditated for a few minutes on the various odd occurrences of the day ; but [my]0-i thoughts soon grew misty and confused , and [I]0-i travelled quickly off into [the Land of [Nod]12-nod]527-the land of nod , and thence into [the region of sleep]528-the region of sleep , where [I]0-i remained undisturbed by so much as the shadow of a dream .

[CHAPTER V.

CELLINI]97-cellini 'S STORY .

The following morning at the appointed hour , [I]0-i went to [[Cellini]97-cellini 's studio]340-cellini 's studio , and was received by [him]97-cellini with a sort of gentle courtesy and kindliness that became [him]97-cellini very well . [I]0-i was already beginning to experience an increasing languor and weariness , the sure forerunner of what [the artist]348-the artist had prophesied - namely , a return of all [my]0-i old sufferings . [Amy]93-amy , tired out by the dancing of the previous night , was still in bed , as were [many of those who had enjoyed [Madame Didier]107-madame didier 's fete]531-many of those who had enjoyed madame didier 's fete ; and [the hotel]320-the hotel was unusually quiet , almost seeming as though half [the visitors]533-the visitors had departed during the night . It was a lovely morning , sunny and calm ; and [Cellini]97-cellini , observing that [I]0-i looked listless and fatigued , placed a comfortable easy - chair for [me]0-i near the window , from whence [I]0-i could see [one of the prettiest parterres of [the garden]315-the garden]534-one of the prettiest parterres of the garden , gay with flowers of every colour and perfume . [He]97-cellini [himself]97-cellini remained standing , one hand resting lightly on [his]97-cellini writing - table , which was strewn with a confusion of letters and newspapers .

" Where is [Leo]100-leo ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , as [I]0-i glanced round [the room]385-the room in search of that noble animal .

" [Leo]100-leo left for [Paris]5-paris last night , "[97-cellini] replied [Cellini]97-cellini ; " [he]100-leo carried an important despatch for [me]97-cellini , which [I]97-cellini feared to trust to [the post - office]1984-the post - office . "[97-cellini]

" Is it safer in [Leo]100-leo 's charge ? "[0-i] [I]0-i inquired , smiling , for the sagacity of the dog amused as well as interested [me]0-i .

" Much safer ! [Leo]100-leo carries on [his]100-leo collar a small tin case , just large enough to contain several folded sheets of paper . When [he]100-leo knows [he]100-leo has that box to guard during [his]100-leo journeys , [he]100-leo is simply unapproachable . [He]100-leo would fight [any one who attempted to touch it with the ferocity of a hungry tiger]1985-any one who attempted to touch it with the ferocity of a hungry tiger , and there is no edible dainty yet invented that could tempt [his]100-leo appetite or coax [him]100-leo into any momentary oblivion of [his]100-leo duty . There is [no more trustworthy or faithful messenger]1986-no more trustworthy or faithful messenger . "[0-i]

" [I]0-i suppose [you]97-cellini have sent [him]100-leo to [[your]97-cellini friend]1987-your friend - [[his]100-leo master]1772-his master , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Yes . [He]100-leo has gone straight [home]1856-home to - [Heliobas]104-heliobas . "[0-i]

This name now awakened in [me]0-i no surprise or even curiosity . It simply sounded homelike and familiar . [I]0-i gazed abstractedly out of the window at the brilliant blossoms in [the garden]315-the garden , that nodded their heads at [me]0-i like so many little elves with coloured caps on , but [I]0-i said nothing . [I]0-i felt that [Cellini]97-cellini watched [me]0-i keenly and closely . Presently [he]97-cellini continued :

" Shall [I]97-cellini tell [you]0-i everything now , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle ? "[97-cellini]

[I]0-i turned towards [him]97-cellini eagerly .

" If [you]97-cellini please , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" May [I]97-cellini ask [you]97-cellini one question ? "[97-cellini]

" Certainly . "[97-cellini]

" How and where did [you]97-cellini hear the name of [Heliobas]104-heliobas ? "[97-cellini]

[I]0-i looked up hesitatingly .

" In a dream , [signor]1742-signor , strange to say ; or rather in three dreams . [I]0-i will relate them to [you]97-cellini . "[0-i]

And [I]0-i described the visions [I]0-i had seen , being careful to omit no detail , for , indeed , [I]0-i remembered everything with curious distinctness .

[The artist]348-the artist listened with grave and fixed attention . When [I]0-i had concluded [he]348-the artist said :

" The elixir [I]348-the artist gave [you]98-mademoiselle acted more potently than even [I]348-the artist imagined it would . [You]98-mademoiselle are more sensitive than [I]348-the artist thought . Do not fatigue [yourself]98-mademoiselle any more , [mademoiselle]1745-mademoiselle , by talking . With [your]98-mademoiselle permission [I]348-the artist will sit down here opposite to [you]98-mademoiselle and tell [you]98-mademoiselle [my]348-the artist story . Afterwards [you]98-mademoiselle must decide for [yourself]98-mademoiselle whether [you]98-mademoiselle will adopt the method of treatment to which [I]348-the artist owe [my]348-the artist life , and something more than [my]348-the artist life - [my]348-the artist reason . "[348-the artist]

[He]348-the artist turned [his]348-the artist own library - chair towards [me]0-i , and seated [himself]348-the artist . A few moments passed in silence ; [his]348-the artist expression was very earnest and absorbed , and [he]348-the artist regarded [my]0-i face with a sympathetic interest which touched [me]0-i profoundly . Though [I]0-i felt [myself]0-i becoming more and more enervated and apathetic as the time went on , and though [I]0-i knew [I]0-i was gradually sinking down again into [[my]0-i old Slough of Despond]539-my old slough of despond , yet [I]0-i felt instinctively that [I]0-i was somehow actively concerned in what was about to be said , therefore [I]0-i forced [myself]0-i to attend closely to every word uttered . [Cellini]97-cellini began to speak in low and quiet tones as follows :

" [You]0-i must be aware , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , that [those who adopt any art as a means of livelihood]1992-those who adopt any art as a means of livelihood begin [the world]264-the world heavily handicapped - weighted down , as it were , in the race for fortune . The following of art is a very different thing to the following of trade or mercantile business . In buying or selling , in undertaking the work of import or export , a good head for figures , and an average quantity of shrewd common sense , are all that is necessary in order to win a fair share of success . But in the finer occupations , whose results are found in sculpture , painting , music and poetry , demands are made upon the imagination , the emotions , the entire spiritual susceptibility of [man]282-man . The most delicate fibres of the brain are taxed ; the subtle inner workings of thought are brought into active play ; and the temperament becomes daily and hourly more finely strung , more sensitive , more keenly alive to every passing sensation . Of course there are [many so - called ' ARTISTS]1995-many so - called ' artists ' who are [mere shams of the real thing]1996-mere shams of the real thing ; [persons who , having a little surface - education in one or the other branch of the arts , play idly with the paint - brush , or dabble carelessly in the deep waters of literature]1997-persons who , having a little surface - education in one or the other branch of the arts , play idly with the paint - brush , or dabble carelessly in the deep waters of literature , - or borrow a few crotchets and quavers from [other composers]1998-other composers , and putting them together in haste , call it ORIGINAL COMPOSITION . Among these are to be found [the self - called ' professors ' of painting]1999-the self - called ' professors ' of painting ; [the sculptors who allow the work of [their]2000-the sculptors who allow the work of their ' ghosts ' ghosts]2000-the sculptors who allow the work of their ' ghosts ' to be admired as [their]2000-the sculptors who allow the work of their ' ghosts own ; [the magazine - scribblers]2001-the magazine - scribblers ; [the ' smart ' young leader]2002-the ' smart ' young leader - [writers]2003-writers and [critics]2004-critics ; [the half - hearted performers on piano or violin]2005-the half - hearted performers on piano or violin who object to any innovation , and prefer to grind on in the unemotional , coldly correct manner which [they]2000-the sculptors who allow the work of their ' ghosts are pleased to term the ' classical ' - [such persons]2006-such persons exist , and will exist , so long as good and evil are leading forces of life . [They]2000-the sculptors who allow the work of their ' ghosts are [the aphides on the rose of art]2007-the aphides on the rose of art . But [the men]2008-the men and [women]441-women [I]97-cellini speak of as [ARTISTS]342-artists are [those who work day and night to attain even a small degree of perfection]2011-those who work day and night to attain even a small degree of perfection , and who are never satisfied with [their]2000-the sculptors who allow the work of their ' ghosts own best efforts . [I]97-cellini was one of these some years ago , and [I]97-cellini humbly assert [myself]97-cellini still to be of the same disposition ; only the difference between [myself]97-cellini then and [myself]97-cellini now is , that THEN [I]97-cellini struggled blindly and despairingly , and NOW [I]97-cellini labour patiently and with calmness , knowing positively that [I]97-cellini shall obtain what [I]97-cellini seek at the duly appointed hour . [I]97-cellini was educated as [a painter]2012-a painter , mademoiselle , by [[my]97-cellini father]2013-my father , [a good , simple - hearted man]2014-a good , simple - hearted man , whose little landscapes looked like bits cut out of [the actual field and woodland]2015-the actual field and woodland , so fresh and pure were they . But [I]97-cellini was not content to follow in the plain path [he]2013-my father first taught [me]97-cellini to tread . Merely correct drawing , merely correct colouring , were not sufficient for [my]97-cellini ambition . [I]97-cellini had dazzled [my]97-cellini eyes with the loveliness of [Correggio]121-correggio 's ' Madonna , ' and had marvelled at the wondrous blue of [her]2016-her robe - a blue so deep and intense that [I]97-cellini used to think one might scrape away the paint till a hole was bored in the canvas and yet not reach the end of that fathomless azure tint ; [I]97-cellini had studied the warm hues of [Titian]122-titian ; [I]97-cellini had felt ready to float away in the air with the marvellous ' Angel of the Annunciation ' - and with all these thoughts in [me]97-cellini , how could [I]97-cellini content [myself]97-cellini with the ordinary aspiration of [modern artists]2017-modern artists ? [I]97-cellini grew absorbed in one subject - Colour . [I]97-cellini noted how lifeless and pale the colouring of to - day appeared beside that of [the old masters]332-the old masters , and [I]97-cellini meditated deeply on the problem thus presented to [me]97-cellini . What was the secret of [Correggio]121-correggio - of [Fra Angelico]123-fra angelico - of [Raphael]124-raphael ? [I]97-cellini tried various experiments ; [I]97-cellini bought the most expensive and highly guaranteed pigments . In vain , for they were all adulterated by [the dealers]2019-the dealers ! Then [I]97-cellini obtained colours in the rough , and ground and mixed them [myself]97-cellini ; still , though a little better result was obtained , [I]97-cellini found trade adulteration still at work with the oils , the varnishes , the mediums - in fact , with everything that [painters]2020-painters use to gain effect in [their]2020-painters works . [I]97-cellini could nowhere escape from [vicious dealers]2021-vicious dealers , who , to gain a miserable percentage on every article sold , are content to be among [the most dishonest men in this dishonest age]2022-the most dishonest men in this dishonest age .[97-cellini]

" [I]97-cellini assure [you]2023-you , [mademoiselle]1745-mademoiselle , that not one of the pictures which are now being painted for [the salons of [Paris]5-paris and [London]2-london]2025-the salons of paris and london can possibly last a hundred years . [I]97-cellini recently visited [that Palace of Art]2026-that palace of art , [the South Kensington Museum]2027-the south kensington museum , in [London]2-london , and saw there a large fresco by [Sir Frederick Leighton]125-sir frederick leighton . It had just been completed , [I]97-cellini was informed . It was already fading ! Within a few years it will be a blur of indistinct outlines . [I]97-cellini compared its condition with the cartoons of [Raphael]124-raphael , and a superb Giorgione in [the same building]2028-the same building ; these were as warm and bright as though recently painted . It is not [Leighton]125-sir frederick leighton 's fault that [his]125-sir frederick leighton works are doomed to perish as completely off the canvas as though [he]125-sir frederick leighton had never traced them ; it is [his]125-sir frederick leighton dire misfortune , and that of [every other nineteenth - century painter]2029-every other nineteenth - century painter , thanks to the magnificent institution of free trade , which has resulted in a vulgar competition of [all countries]2030-all countries and all classes to see which can most quickly jostle the other out of existence . But [I]97-cellini am wearying [you]1745-mademoiselle , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle - pardon [me]97-cellini ! To resume [my]97-cellini own story . As [I]97-cellini told [you]1745-mademoiselle , [I]97-cellini could think of nothing but the one subject of Colour ; it haunted [me]97-cellini incessantly . [I]97-cellini saw in [my]97-cellini dreams visions , of exquisite forms and faces that [I]97-cellini longed to transfer to [my]97-cellini canvas , but [I]97-cellini could never succeed in the attempt . [My]97-cellini hand seemed to have lost all skill . About this time [[my]97-cellini father]2013-my father died , and [I]97-cellini , having no other relation in [the world]264-the world , and no ties of [home]1856-home to cling to , lived in utter solitude , and tortured [my]97-cellini brain more and more with the one question that baffled and perplexed [me]97-cellini . [I]97-cellini became moody and irritable ; [I]97-cellini avoided intercourse with [everyone]1821-everyone , and at last sleep forsook [my]97-cellini eyes . Then came a terrible season of feverish trouble , nervous dejection and despair . At times [I]97-cellini would sit silently brooding ; at others [I]97-cellini started up and walked rapidly for hours , in the hope to calm the wild unrest that took possession of [my]97-cellini brain . [I]97-cellini was then living in [Rome]6-rome , in [the studio that had been [[my]97-cellini father]2013-my father 's]2035-the studio that had been my father 's . One evening - how well [I]97-cellini remember it ! - [I]97-cellini was attacked by one of those fierce impulses that forbade [me]97-cellini to rest or think or sleep , and , as usual , [I]97-cellini hurried out for one of those long aimless excursions [I]97-cellini had latterly grown accustomed to . At the open street - door stood [the proprietress of [the house]2038-the house]2037-the proprietress of the house , [a stout , good - natured contadina]2039-a stout , good - natured contadina , with [[her]2039-a stout , good - natured contadina youngest child]2040-her youngest child [Pippa]126-pippa holding to [her]126-pippa skirt . As [she]2039-a stout , good - natured contadina saw [me]97-cellini approaching , [she]2039-a stout , good - natured contadina started back with an exclamation of alarm , and catching [the little girl]2041-the little girl up in [her]2039-a stout , good - natured contadina arms , [she]2039-a stout , good - natured contadina made the sign of the cross rapidly . Astonished at this , [I]97-cellini paused in [my]97-cellini hasty walk , and said with as much calmness as [I]97-cellini could muster :[97-cellini]

" ' What do [you]2039-a stout , good - natured contadina mean by that ? Have [I]97-cellini the evil - eye , think [you]2039-a stout , good - natured contadina ? '[97-cellini]

" Curly - haired [Pippa]126-pippa stretched out [her]126-pippa arms to [me]97-cellini - [I]97-cellini had often caressed [the little one]2042-the little one , and given [her]126-pippa sweetmeats and toys - but [[her]126-pippa mother]2043-her mother held [her]126-pippa back with a sort of smothered scream , and muttered :[97-cellini]

" ' [Holy Virgin]127-holy virgin ! [Pippa]126-pippa must not touch [him]2041-the little girl ; [he]2041-the little girl is mad . '[97-cellini]

" Mad ? [I]97-cellini looked at [the woman]2044-the woman and [child]1859-child in scornful amazement . Then without further words [I]97-cellini turned , and went swiftly away down [the street]2046-the street out of [their]2047-their sight . Mad ! Was [I]97-cellini indeed losing [my]97-cellini reason ? Was this the terrific meaning of [my]97-cellini sleepless nights , [my]97-cellini troubled thoughts , [my]97-cellini strange inquietude ? Fiercely [I]97-cellini strode along , heedless whither [I]97-cellini was going , till [I]97-cellini found [myself]97-cellini suddenly on [the borders of [the desolate Campagna]2049-the desolate campagna]2048-the borders of the desolate campagna . A young moon gleamed aloft , looking like a slender sickle thrust into the heavens to reap an over - abundant harvest of stars . [I]97-cellini paused irresolutely . There was a deep silence everywhere . [I]97-cellini felt faint and giddy : curious flashes of light danced past [my]97-cellini eyes , and [my]97-cellini limbs shook like those of [a palsied old man]2050-a palsied old man . [I]97-cellini sank upon a stone to rest , to try and arrange [my]97-cellini scattered ideas into some sort of connection and order . Mad ! [I]97-cellini clasped [my]97-cellini aching head between [my]97-cellini hands , and brooded on the fearful prospect looming before [me]97-cellini , and in the words of [poor King Lear]128-poor king lear , [I]97-cellini prayed in [my]97-cellini heart :[97-cellini]

" ' O let [me]97-cellini not be mad , not mad , sweet heavens ! '[97-cellini]

" PRAYER ! There was another thought . How could [I]97-cellini pray ? For [I]97-cellini was [a sceptic]2051-a sceptic . [[My]97-cellini father]2013-my father had educated [me]97-cellini with broadly materialistic views ; [he]2013-my father [himself]2013-my father was [a follower of [Voltaire]129-voltaire]2053-a follower of voltaire , and with [his]2013-my father finite rod [he]2013-my father took the measure of Divinity , greatly to [his]2013-my father own satisfaction . [He]2013-my father was [a good man]2054-a good man , too , and [he]2013-my father died with exemplary calmness in the absolute certainty of there being nothing in [his]2013-my father composition but dust , to which [he]2013-my father was as bound to return . [He]2013-my father had not a shred of belief in anything but what [he]2013-my father called the Universal Law of Necessity ; perhaps this was why all [his]2013-my father pictures lacked inspiration . [I]97-cellini accepted [his]2013-my father theories without thinking much about them , and [I]97-cellini had managed to live respectably without any religious belief . But NOW - now with the horrible phantom of madness rising before [me]97-cellini - [my]97-cellini firm nerves quailed . [I]97-cellini tried , [I]97-cellini longed to PRAY . Yet to whom ? To what ? To the Universal Law of Necessity ? In that there could be no hearing or answering of human petitions . [I]97-cellini meditated on this with a kind of sombre ferocity . Who portioned out this Law of Necessity ? What brutal Code compels [us]2055-us to be born , to live , to suffer , and to die without recompense or reason ? Why should this Universe be an ever - circling Wheel of Torture ? Then a fresh impetus came to [me]97-cellini . [I]97-cellini rose from [my]97-cellini recumbent posture and stood erect ; [I]97-cellini trembled no more . A curious sensation of defiant amusement possessed [me]97-cellini so violently that [I]97-cellini laughed aloud . Such a laugh , too ! [I]97-cellini recoiled from the sound , as from a blow , with a shudder . It was the laugh of - [a madman]2056-a madman ! [I]97-cellini thought no more ; [I]97-cellini was resolved . [I]97-cellini would fulfil the grim Law of Necessity to [its]2057-its letter . If [Necessity]130-necessity caused [my]97-cellini birth , it also demanded [my]97-cellini death . [Necessity]130-necessity could not force [me]97-cellini to live against [my]97-cellini will . Better eternal nothingness than madness . Slowly and deliberately [I]97-cellini took from [my]97-cellini vest a Milanese dagger of thin sharp steel - one that [I]97-cellini always carried with [me]97-cellini as a means of self - defence - [I]97-cellini drew it from its sheath , and looked at the fine edge glittering coldly in the pallid moon - rays . [I]97-cellini kissed it joyously ; it was [my]97-cellini final remedy ! [I]97-cellini poised it aloft with firm fingers - another instant and it would have been buried deep in [my]97-cellini heart , when [I]97-cellini felt a powerful grasp on [my]97-cellini wrist , and a strong arm struggling with [mine]97-cellini forced the dagger from [my]97-cellini hand . Savagely angry at being thus foiled in [my]97-cellini desperate intent , [I]97-cellini staggered back a few paces and sullenly stared at [[my]97-cellini rescuer]2058-my rescuer . [He]2058-my rescuer was [a tall man]2059-a tall man , clad in a dark overcoat bordered with fur ; [he]2058-my rescuer looked like [a wealthy Englishman]2060-a wealthy englishman or American travelling for pleasure . [His]2058-my rescuer features were fine and commanding ; [his]2058-my rescuer eyes gleamed with a gentle disdain as [he]2058-my rescuer coolly met [my]97-cellini resentful gaze . When [he]2058-my rescuer spoke [his]2058-my rescuer voice was rich and mellifluous , though [his]2058-my rescuer accents had a touch in them of grave scorn .[97-cellini]

" ' So [you]97-cellini are tired of [your]97-cellini life , [young man]2061-young man ! All the more reason have [you]97-cellini to live . [Anyone]2062-anyone can die . [A murderer]2063-a murderer has moral force enough to jeer at [[his]2063-a murderer hangman]2064-his hangman . It is very easy to draw the last breath . It can be accomplished successfully by [a child]369-a child or [a warrior]2066-a warrior . One pang of far less anguish than the toothache , and all is over . There is nothing heroic about it , [I]97-cellini assure [you]97-cellini ! It is as common as going to bed ; it is almost prosy . LIFE is heroism , if [you]97-cellini like ; but death is a mere cessation of business . And to make a rapid and rude exit off the stage before [the prompter]2067-the prompter gives the sign is always , to say the least of it , ungraceful . Act the part out , no matter how bad the play . What say [you]97-cellini ? '[97-cellini]

" And , balancing the dagger lightly on one finger , as though it were a paper - knife , [he]2058-my rescuer smiled at [me]97-cellini with so much frank kindliness that it was impossible to resist [him]2058-my rescuer . [I]97-cellini advanced and held out [my]97-cellini hand .[97-cellini]

" ' Whoever [you]2058-my rescuer are , ' [I]97-cellini said , ' [you]2058-my rescuer speak like [a true man]2068-a true man . But [you]2058-my rescuer are ignorant of the causes which compelled [me]97-cellini to - - ' and a hard sob choked [my]97-cellini utterance . [[My]97-cellini new acquaintance]2069-my new acquaintance pressed [my]97-cellini proffered hand cordially , but the gravity of [his]2058-my rescuer tone did not vary as [he]2058-my rescuer replied :[97-cellini]

" ' There is no cause , [[my]97-cellini friend]365-my friend , which compels [us]2071-us to take violent leave of existence , unless it be madness or cowardice . '[97-cellini]

" ' Aye , and what if it were madness ? ' [I]97-cellini asked [him]2058-my rescuer eagerly . [He]2058-my rescuer scanned [me]97-cellini attentively , and laying [his]2058-my rescuer fingers lightly on [my]97-cellini wrist , felt [my]97-cellini pulse .[97-cellini]

" ' Pooh , [[my]97-cellini dear sir]2072-my dear sir ! ' [he]2058-my rescuer said ; ' [you]97-cellini are no more mad than [I]97-cellini am . [You]97-cellini are a little overwrought and excited - that [I]97-cellini admit . [You]97-cellini have some mental worry that consumes [you]97-cellini . [You]97-cellini shall tell [me]97-cellini all about it . [I]97-cellini have no doubt [I]97-cellini can cure [you]97-cellini in a few days . '[97-cellini]

" Cure [me]97-cellini ? [I]97-cellini looked at [him]2058-my rescuer in wonderment and doubt .[97-cellini]

" ' Are [you]2058-my rescuer [a physician]2073-a physician ? ' [I]97-cellini asked .[97-cellini]

" [He]2058-my rescuer laughed . ' Not [I]97-cellini ! [I]97-cellini should be sorry to belong to the profession . Yet [I]97-cellini administer medicines and give advice in certain cases . [I]97-cellini am simply [a remedial agent]2074-a remedial agent - not [a doctor]2075-a doctor . But why do [we]2076-we stand here in this bleak place , which must be peopled by [the ghosts of [olden heroes]2078-olden heroes]2077-the ghosts of olden heroes ? Come with [me]97-cellini , will [you]97-cellini ? [I]97-cellini am going to [the Hotel Costanza]13-the hotel costanza , and [we]2076-we can talk [there]526-there . As for this pretty toy , permit [me]97-cellini to return it to [you]97-cellini . [You]97-cellini will not force [it]2080-it again to the unpleasant task of despatching [its owner]2081-its owner . '[97-cellini]

" And [he]97-cellini handed the dagger back to [me]97-cellini with a slight bow . [I]97-cellini sheathed it at once , feeling somewhat like [a chidden child]2082-a chidden child , as [I]97-cellini met the slightly satirical gleam of the clear blue eyes that watched [me]97-cellini .[97-cellini]

" ' Will [you]97-cellini give [me]97-cellini [your]97-cellini name , [signor]1742-signor ? ' [I]97-cellini asked , as [we]2076-we turned from [the Campagna]14-the campagna towards [the city]2084-the city .[97-cellini]

" ' With pleasure . [I]97-cellini am called [Heliobas]104-heliobas . A strange name ? Oh , not at all ! It is [pure Chaldee]131-pure chaldee . [[My]97-cellini mother]2085-my mother - as lovely an Eastern houri as [Murillo 's Madonna]132-murillo 's madonna , and as devout as [Santa Teresa]133-santa teresa - gave [me]97-cellini [the Christian saint]2086-the christian saint 's name of [Casimir]134-dr. casimir also , but [Heliobas]104-heliobas pur et simple suits [me]97-cellini best , and by it [I]97-cellini am generally known . '[97-cellini]

" ' [You]97-cellini are [a Chaldean]2087-a chaldean ? ' [I]97-cellini inquired .[97-cellini]

" ' Exactly so . [I]97-cellini am descended directly from [one of [those "[97-cellini] wise men of [the East]15-the east]2089-those " wise men of the east]2088-one of those " wise men of the east " and , by the way , there were more than three , and [they]2089-those " wise men of the east were [not all kings , who , being wide awake , happened to notice the birth - star of [Christ]101-god on the horizon before [the rest of [the world]264-the world 's inhabitants]2091-the rest of the world 's inhabitants]2090-not all kings , who , being wide awake , happened to notice the birth - star of christ on the horizon before the rest of the world 's inhabitants had so much as rubbed [their]2091-the rest of the world 's inhabitants sleepy eyes . [The Chaldeans]135-the chaldeans have been always quick of observation from time immemorial . But in return for [my]97-cellini name , [you]97-cellini will favour [me]97-cellini with [yours]97-cellini ? '[97-cellini]

" [I]97-cellini gave it readily , and [we]2093-we walked on together . [I]97-cellini felt wonderfully calmed and cheered - as soothed , mademoiselle , as [I]97-cellini have noticed [you]97-cellini [yourself]97-cellini have felt when in [MY]97-cellini company . "[97-cellini]

Here [Cellini]97-cellini paused , and looked at [me]0-i as though expecting a question ; but [I]0-i preferred to remain silent till [I]0-i had heard all [he]97-cellini had to say . [He]97-cellini therefore resumed :

" [We]2093-we reached [the Hotel Costanza]13-the hotel costanza , where [Heliobas]104-heliobas was evidently well known . [The waiters]2094-the waiters addressed [him]104-heliobas as [Monsieur le Comte]136-monsieur le comte ; but [he]104-heliobas gave [me]97-cellini no information as to this title . [He]104-heliobas had [a superb suite of rooms in [the hotel]320-the hotel]2095-a superb suite of rooms in the hotel , furnished with every modern luxury ; and as soon as [we]2093-we entered a light supper was served . [He]104-heliobas invited [me]97-cellini to partake , and within the space of half an hour [I]97-cellini had told [him]104-heliobas all [my]97-cellini history - [my]97-cellini ambition - [my]97-cellini strivings after the perfection of colour - [my]97-cellini disappointment , dejection , and despair - and , finally , the fearful dread of coming madness that had driven [me]97-cellini to attempt [my]97-cellini own life . [He]104-heliobas listened patiently and with unbroken attention . When [I]97-cellini had finished , [he]104-heliobas laid one hand on [my]97-cellini shoulder , and said gently :[97-cellini]

" ' [Young man]2061-young man , pardon [me]97-cellini if [I]97-cellini say that up to the present [your]2061-young man career has been [an inactive , useless , selfish "[97-cellini] kicking against the pricks]2098-an inactive , useless , selfish " kicking against the pricks , " as [St. Paul]114-st. paul says . [You]2061-young man set before [yourself]2061-young man a task of noble effort , namely , to discover the secret of colouring as known to [the old masters]332-the old masters ; and because [you]2061-young man meet with the petty difficulty of modern trade adulteration in [your]2061-young man materials , [you]2061-young man think that there is no chance - that all is lost . Fie ! Do [you]2061-young man think [Nature]137-nature is overcome by [a few dishonest traders]2100-a few dishonest traders ? [She]137-nature can still give [you]2061-young man in abundance the unspoilt colours [she]137-nature gave to [Raphael]124-raphael and [Titian]122-titian ; but not in haste - not if [you]2061-young man vulgarly scramble for [her]137-nature gifts in a mood that is impatient of obstacle and delay . "[97-cellini] Ohne hast , ohne rast , " is the motto of the stars . Learn it well . [You]2061-young man have injured [your]2061-young man bodily health by useless fretfulness and peevish discontent , and with that [we]2101-we have first to deal . In a week 's time , [I]97-cellini will make [a sound , sane man of [you]2061-young man]2102-a sound , sane man of you ; and then [I]97-cellini will teach [you]2061-young man how to get the colours [you]2061-young man seek - yes ! ' [he]97-cellini added , smiling , ' even to the compassing of Correggio 's blue . '[97-cellini]

" [I]97-cellini could not speak for joy and gratitude ; [I]97-cellini grasped [[my]97-cellini friend]365-my friend and [preserver]2104-preserver by the hand . [We]2101-we stood thus together for a brief interval , when suddenly [Heliobas]104-heliobas drew [himself]104-heliobas up to the full stateliness of [his]104-heliobas height and bent [his]104-heliobas calm eyes deliberately upon [me]97-cellini . A strange thrill ran through [me]97-cellini ; [I]97-cellini still held [his]104-heliobas hand .[97-cellini]

" ' Rest ! ' [he]104-heliobas said in slow and emphatic tones , ' Weary and overwrought frame , take [thy]2061-young man full and needful measure of repose ! [Struggling and deeply injured spirit]2105-struggling and deeply injured spirit , be free of [[thy]2061-young man narrow prison]2106-thy narrow prison ! By that Force which [I]97-cellini acknowledge within [me]97-cellini and [thee]2061-young man and in all created things , [I]97-cellini command [thee]2061-young man , REST ! '[97-cellini]

" Fascinated , awed , overcome by [his]97-cellini manner , [I]97-cellini gazed at [him]97-cellini and would have spoken , but [my]97-cellini tongue refused its office - [my]97-cellini senses swam - [my]97-cellini eyes closed - [my]97-cellini limbs gave way - [I]97-cellini fell senseless . "[97-cellini]

[Cellini]97-cellini again paused and looked at [me]0-i . Intent on [his]97-cellini words , [I]0-i would not interrupt [him]97-cellini . [He]97-cellini went on :

" When [I]97-cellini say senseless , mademoiselle , [I]97-cellini allude of course to [my]97-cellini body . But [I]97-cellini , [myself]97-cellini - that is , [my]97-cellini soul - was conscious ; [I]97-cellini lived , [I]97-cellini moved , [I]97-cellini heard , [I]97-cellini saw . Of that experience [I]97-cellini am forbidden to speak . When [I]97-cellini returned to mortal existence [I]97-cellini found [myself]97-cellini lying on a couch in [the same room where [I]97-cellini had supped with [Heliobas]104-heliobas]2107-the same room where i had supped with heliobas , and [Heliobas]104-heliobas [himself]104-heliobas sat near [me]97-cellini reading . It was broad noonday . A delicious sense of tranquillity and youthful buoyancy was upon [me]97-cellini , and without speaking [I]97-cellini sprang up from [my]97-cellini recumbent position and touched [him]104-heliobas on the arm . [He]104-heliobas looked up .[97-cellini]

" ' Well ? ' [he]104-heliobas asked , and [his]104-heliobas eyes smiled .[97-cellini]

" [I]97-cellini seized [his]104-heliobas hand , and pressed it reverently to [my]97-cellini lips .[97-cellini]

" ' [[My]97-cellini best friend]2108-my best friend ! ' [I]97-cellini exclaimed . ' What wonders have [I]97-cellini not seen - what truths have [I]97-cellini not learned - what mysteries ! '[97-cellini]

" ' On all these things be silent , ' replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas . ' They must not be lightly spoken of . And of the questions [you]97-cellini naturally desire to ask [me]97-cellini , [you]97-cellini shall have the answers in due time . What has happened to [you]97-cellini is not wonderful ; [you]97-cellini have simply been acted upon by scientific means . But [your]97-cellini cure is not yet complete . A few days more passed with [me]97-cellini will restore [you]97-cellini thoroughly . Will [you]97-cellini consent to remain so long in [my]97-cellini company ? '[97-cellini]

" Gladly and gratefully [I]97-cellini consented , and [we]2109-we spent the next ten days together , during which [Heliobas]104-heliobas administered to [me]97-cellini certain remedies , external and internal , which had a marvellous effect in renovating and invigorating [my]97-cellini system . By the expiration of that time [I]97-cellini was strong and well - [a sound and sane man]2110-a sound and sane man , as [[my]97-cellini rescuer]2058-my rescuer had promised [I]97-cellini should be - [my]97-cellini brain was fresh and eager for work , and [my]97-cellini mind was filled with new and grand ideas of art . And [I]97-cellini had gained through [Heliobas]104-heliobas two inestimable things - a full comprehension of the truth of religion , and the secret of human destiny ; and [I]97-cellini had won a LOVE so exquisite ! "[97-cellini]

Here [Cellini]97-cellini paused , and [his]97-cellini eyes were uplifted in a sort of wondering rapture . [He]97-cellini continued after a pause :

" Yes , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , [I]97-cellini discovered that [I]97-cellini was loved , and watched over and guided by ONE so divinely beautiful , so gloriously faithful , that mortal language fails before the description of such perfection ! "[97-cellini]

[He]97-cellini paused again , and again continued :

" When [he]104-heliobas found [me]97-cellini perfectly healthy again in mind and body , [Heliobas]104-heliobas showed [me]97-cellini [his]104-heliobas art of mixing colours . From that hour all [my]97-cellini works were successful . [You]98-mademoiselle know that [my]97-cellini pictures are eagerly purchased as soon as completed , and that the colour [I]97-cellini obtain in them is to [the world]264-the world a mystery almost magical . Yet there is not one among [the humblest of artists who could not , if [he]104-heliobas chose , make use of the same means as [I]97-cellini have done to gain the nearly imperishable hues that still glow on the canvases of [Raphael]124-raphael]2113-the humblest of artists who could not , if he chose , make use of the same means as i have done to gain the nearly imperishable hues that still glow on the canvases of raphael . But of this there is no need to speak just now . [I]97-cellini have told [you]98-mademoiselle [my]97-cellini story , mademoiselle , and it now rests with [me]97-cellini to apply its meaning to [yourself]98-mademoiselle . [You]98-mademoiselle are attending ? "[97-cellini]

" Perfectly , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied ; and , indeed , [my]0-i interest at this point was so strong that [I]0-i could almost hear the expectant beating of [my]0-i heart . [Cellini]97-cellini resumed :

" [Electricity]138-electricity , [mademoiselle]1745-mademoiselle , is , as [you]98-mademoiselle are aware , the wonder of [our]2115-our age . No end can be foreseen to the marvels it is capable of accomplishing . But one of the most important branches of this great science is ignorantly derided just now by [the larger portion of society]2116-the larger portion of society - [I]97-cellini mean the use of human electricity ; that force which is in each one of [us]2115-our - in [you]98-mademoiselle and in [me]97-cellini - and , to a very large extent , in [Heliobas]104-heliobas . [He]104-heliobas has cultivated the electricity in [his]104-heliobas own system to such an extent that [his]104-heliobas mere touch , [his]104-heliobas lightest glance , have healing in them , or the reverse , as [he]104-heliobas chooses to exert [his]104-heliobas power - [I]97-cellini may say it is never the reverse , for [he]104-heliobas is full of kindness , sympathy , and pity for [all humanity]2117-all humanity . [His]104-heliobas influence is so great that [he]104-heliobas can , without speaking , by [his]104-heliobas mere presence suggest [his]104-heliobas own thoughts to other people who are [perfect strangers]2118-perfect strangers , and cause [them]2118-perfect strangers to design and carry out certain actions in accordance with [his]104-heliobas plans . [You]98-mademoiselle are incredulous ? [Mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , this power is in [every one of [us]2120-us]2119-every one of us ; only [we]2120-us do not cultivate it , because [our]2120-us education is yet so imperfect . To prove the truth of what [I]97-cellini say , [I]97-cellini , though [I]97-cellini have only advanced a little way in the cultivation of [my]97-cellini own electric force , even [I]97-cellini have influenced [YOU]98-mademoiselle . [You]98-mademoiselle can not deny it . By [my]97-cellini thought , impelled to [you]98-mademoiselle , [you]98-mademoiselle saw clearly [my]97-cellini picture that was actually veiled . By [MY]97-cellini force , [you]98-mademoiselle replied correctly to a question [I]97-cellini asked [you]98-mademoiselle concerning that same picture . By [MY]97-cellini desire , [you]98-mademoiselle gave [me]97-cellini , without being aware of it , a message from one [I]97-cellini love when [you]98-mademoiselle said , ' Dieu vous garde ! ' [You]98-mademoiselle remember ? And the elixir [I]97-cellini gave [you]98-mademoiselle , which is one of the simplest remedies discovered by [Heliobas]104-heliobas , had the effect of making [you]98-mademoiselle learn what [he]104-heliobas intended [you]98-mademoiselle to learn - [his]104-heliobas name . "[97-cellini]

" [He]104-heliobas ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed . " Why , [he]104-heliobas does not know [me]0-i - [he]104-heliobas can have no intentions towards [me]0-i ! "[0-i]

" [Mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , "[97-cellini] replied [Cellini]97-cellini gravely , " if [you]98-mademoiselle will think again of the last of [your]98-mademoiselle three dreams , [you]98-mademoiselle will not doubt that [he]104-heliobas HAS intentions towards [you]98-mademoiselle . As [I]97-cellini told [you]98-mademoiselle , [he]104-heliobas is [a PHYSICAL ELECTRICIAN]2121-a physical electrician . By that is meant a great deal . [He]104-heliobas knows by instinct whether [he]104-heliobas is or will be needed sooner or later . Let [me]97-cellini finish what [I]97-cellini have to say . [You]98-mademoiselle are ill , mademoiselle - ill from over - work . [You]98-mademoiselle are [an improvisatrice]2122-an improvisatrice - that is , [you]98-mademoiselle have the emotional genius of music , a spiritual thing unfettered by rules , and utterly misunderstood by [the world]264-the world . [You]98-mademoiselle cultivate this faculty , regardless of cost ; [you]98-mademoiselle suffer , and [you]98-mademoiselle will suffer more . In proportion as [your]98-mademoiselle powers in music grow , so will [your]98-mademoiselle health decline . Go to [Heliobas]104-heliobas ; [he]104-heliobas will do for [you]98-mademoiselle what [he]104-heliobas did for [me]97-cellini . Surely [you]98-mademoiselle will not hesitate ? Between years of weak invalidism and perfect health , in less than a fortnight , there can be no question of choice . "[97-cellini]

[I]0-i rose from [my]0-i seat slowly .

" Where is this [Heliobas]104-heliobas ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " In [Paris]5-paris ? "[0-i]

" Yes , in [Paris]5-paris . If [you]98-mademoiselle decide to go [there]526-there , take [my]540-i advice , and go alone . [You]98-mademoiselle can easily make some excuse to [[your]98-mademoiselle friends]2125-your friends . [I]540-i will give [you]98-mademoiselle the address of [a ladies ' Pension]2126-a ladies ' pension , where [you]98-mademoiselle will be made at [home]1856-home and comfortable . May [I]540-i do this ? "[540-i]

" If [you]540-i please , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

[He]540-i wrote rapidly in pencil on a card of [his]540-i own :

" [MADAME DENISE]139-madame denise , "[540-i] 36 , [Avenue du Midi]541-avenue du midi , " [Paris]5-paris , "[540-i]

and handed it to [me]0-i . [I]0-i stood still where [I]0-i had risen , thinking deeply . [I]0-i had been impressed and somewhat startled by [Cellini]97-cellini 's story ; but [I]0-i was in no way alarmed at the idea of trusting [myself]0-i to the hands of [a physical electrician]2121-a physical electrician such as [Heliobas]104-heliobas professed to be . [I]0-i knew that there were many cases of serious illnesses being cured by means of electricity - that electric baths and electric appliances of all descriptions were in ordinary use ; and [I]0-i saw no reason to be surprised at the fact of [a man being in existence who had cultivated electric force]543-a man being in existence who had cultivated electric force within [himself]543-a man being in existence who had cultivated electric force to such an extent that [he]543-a man being in existence who had cultivated electric force was able to use it as a healing power . There seemed to [me]0-i to be really nothing extraordinary in it . The only part of [Cellini]97-cellini 's narration [I]0-i did not credit was the soul - transmigration [he]97-cellini professed to have experienced ; and [I]0-i put that down to the over - excitement of [his]97-cellini imagination at the time of [his]97-cellini first interview with [Heliobas]104-heliobas . But [I]0-i kept this thought to [myself]0-i . In any case , [I]0-i resolved to go to [Paris]5-paris . The great desire of [my]0-i life was to be in perfect health , and [I]0-i determined to omit no means of obtaining this inestimable blessing . [Cellini]97-cellini watched [me]0-i as [I]0-i remained standing before [him]97-cellini in silent abstraction .

" Will [you]0-i go ? "[97-cellini] [he]97-cellini inquired at last .

" Yes ; [I]0-i will go , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " But will [you]97-cellini give [me]0-i a letter to [[your]97-cellini friend]1987-your friend ? "[0-i]

" [Leo]100-leo has taken it and all necessary explanations already , "[97-cellini] said [Cellini]97-cellini , smiling ; " [I]97-cellini knew [you]0-i would go . [Heliobas]104-heliobas expects [you]0-i the day after to - morrow . [[His]104-heliobas residence]2129-his residence is [Hotel Mars]20-hotel mars , [Champs Elysees]18-champs elysees . [You]0-i are not angry with [me]97-cellini , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle ? [I]97-cellini could not help knowing that [you]0-i would go . "[97-cellini]

[I]0-i smiled faintly .

" [Electricity]138-electricity again , [I]97-cellini suppose ! No , [I]97-cellini am not angry . Why should [I]97-cellini be ? [I]97-cellini thank [you]97-cellini very much , [signor]1742-signor , and [I]97-cellini shall thank [you]97-cellini more if [Heliobas]104-heliobas indeed effects [my]97-cellini cure . "[97-cellini]

" Oh , that is certain , positively certain , "[97-cellini] answered [Cellini]97-cellini ; " [you]0-i can indulge that hope as much as [you]0-i like , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , for it is one that can not be disappointed . Before [you]0-i leave [me]97-cellini , [you]0-i will look at [your]0-i own picture , will [you]0-i not ? "[97-cellini] and , advancing to [his]97-cellini easel , [he]97-cellini uncovered it .

[I]0-i was greatly surprised . [I]0-i thought [he]97-cellini had but traced the outline of [my]0-i features , whereas the head was almost completed . [I]0-i looked at it as [I]0-i would look at the portrait of [a stranger]544-a stranger . It was a wistful , sad - eyed , plaintive face , and on the pale gold of the hair rested a coronal of lilies .

" It will soon be finished , "[97-cellini] said [Cellini]97-cellini , covering the easel again ; " [I]97-cellini shall not need another sitting , which is fortunate , as it is so necessary for [you]0-i to go away . And now will [you]0-i look at the ' Life and Death ' once more ? "[97-cellini]

[I]0-i raised [my]0-i eyes to the grand picture , unveiled that day in all its beauty .

" The face of [the Life - Angel there]2131-the life - angel there , "[97-cellini] went on [Cellini]97-cellini quietly , " is a poor and feeble resemblance of the One [I]97-cellini love . [You]0-i knew [I]97-cellini was betrothed , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle ? "[97-cellini]

[I]0-i felt confused , and was endeavouring to find an answer to this when [he]97-cellini continued :

" Do not trouble to explain , for [I]97-cellini know how [YOU]0-i knew . But no more of this . Will [you]0-i leave [Cannes]4-cannes to - morrow ? "[97-cellini]

" Yes . In the morning . "[97-cellini]

" Then good - bye , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle . Should [I]97-cellini never see [you]0-i again - - "[97-cellini]

" Never see [me]0-i again ! "[0-i] [I]0-i interrupted . " Why , what do [you]97-cellini mean ? "[0-i]

" [I]97-cellini do not allude to [your]0-i destinies , but to [mine]97-cellini , "[97-cellini] [he]97-cellini said , with a kindly look . " [My]97-cellini business may call [me]97-cellini away from here before [you]0-i come back - [our]2132-our paths may lie apart - many circumstances may occur to prevent [our]2132-our meeting - so that , [I]97-cellini repeat , should [I]97-cellini never see [you]0-i again , [you]0-i will , [I]97-cellini hope , bear [me]97-cellini in [your]0-i friendly remembrance as one who was sorry to see [you]0-i suffer , and who was the humble means of guiding [you]0-i to renewed health and happiness . "[97-cellini]

[I]0-i held out [my]0-i hand , and [my]0-i eyes filled with tears . There was something so gentle and chivalrous about [him]97-cellini , and withal so warm and sympathetic , that [I]0-i felt indeed as if [I]0-i were bidding adieu to one of [the truest friends [I]0-i should ever have in [my]0-i life]545-the truest friends i should ever have in my life .

" [I]0-i hope nothing will cause [you]97-cellini to leave [Cannes]4-cannes till [I]0-i return to it , "[0-i] [I]0-i said with real earnestness . " [I]0-i should like [you]97-cellini to judge of [my]0-i restoration to health . "[0-i]

" There will be no need for that , "[97-cellini] [he]97-cellini replied ; " [I]97-cellini shall know when [you]0-i are quite recovered through [Heliobas]104-heliobas . "[97-cellini]

[He]97-cellini pressed [my]0-i hand warmly .

" [I]0-i brought back the book [you]97-cellini lent [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i went on ; " but [I]0-i should like a copy of it for [myself]0-i . Can [I]0-i get it anywhere ? "[0-i]

" [Heliobas]104-heliobas will give [you]0-i one with pleasure , "[97-cellini] replied [Cellini]97-cellini ; " [you]0-i have only to make the request . The book is not on sale . It was printed for private circulation only . And now , mademoiselle , [we]2133-we part . [I]97-cellini congratulate [you]0-i on the comfort and joy awaiting [you]0-i in [Paris]5-paris . Do not forget the address - [Hotel Mars]20-hotel mars , [Champs Elysees]18-champs elysees . Farewell ! "[97-cellini]

And again shaking [my]0-i hand cordially , [he]97-cellini stood at [his]97-cellini door watching [me]0-i as [I]0-i passed out and began to ascend the stairs leading to [[my]0-i room]546-my room . On [the landing]547-the landing [I]0-i paused , and , looking round , saw [him]97-cellini still there . [I]0-i smiled and waved [my]0-i hand . [He]97-cellini did the same in response , once - twice ; then turning abruptly , disappeared .

That afternoon [I]0-i explained to [Colonel]92-colonel everard and [Mrs. Everard]93-amy that [I]0-i had resolved to consult [a celebrated physician in [Paris]5-paris whose name , however , [I]0-i did not mention , and should go [there]526-there alone for a few days]548-a celebrated physician in paris whose name , however , i did not mention , and should go there alone for a few days . On hearing that [I]0-i knew of [a well - recommended ladies]550-a well - recommended ladies ' Pension , [they]551-they made no objection to [my]0-i arrangements , and [they]551-they agreed to remain at [the Hotel de L - -till]552-the hotel de l - -till [I]0-i returned . [I]0-i gave [them]551-they no details of [my]0-i plans , and of course never mentioned [Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini in connection with the matter . A nervous and wretchedly agitated night made [me]0-i more than ever determined to try the means of cure proposed to [me]0-i . At ten o'clock the following morning [I]0-i left [Cannes]4-cannes by [express train]553-express train for [Paris]5-paris . Just before starting [I]0-i noticed that the lilies of [the valley]477-the valley [Cellini]97-cellini had given [me]0-i for the dance had , in spite of [my]0-i care , entirely withered , and were already black with decay - so black that they looked as though they had been scorched by a flash of lightning .

CHAPTER VI .

[THE HOTEL MARS]20-hotel mars AND [ITS OWNER]2081-its owner .

It was between three and four o'clock in the afternoon of the day succeeding the night of [my]0-i arrival in [Paris]5-paris , when [I]0-i found [myself]0-i standing at the door of [the Hotel Mars]556-the hotel mars , [Champs Elysees]18-champs elysees . [I]0-i had proved the Pension kept by [Madame Denise]139-madame denise to be everything that could be desired ; and on [my]0-i presentation of [Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini 's card of introduction , [I]0-i had been welcomed by [the maitresse de la maison]557-the maitresse de la maison with a cordial effusiveness that amounted almost to enthusiasm .

" Ce cher [Cellini]97-cellini ! "[558-the cheery and pleasant little woman] [the cheery and pleasant little woman]558-the cheery and pleasant little woman had exclaimed , as [she]558-the cheery and pleasant little woman set before [me]0-i a deliciously prepared breakfast . " Je l'aime tant ! Il a si bon coeur ! et ses beaux yeux ! Mon Dieu , comme un ange ! "[558-the cheery and pleasant little woman]

As soon as [I]0-i had settled the various little details respecting [[my]0-i room]546-my room and attendance , and had changed [my]0-i travelling - dress for a quiet visiting toilette , [I]0-i started for [the abode of [Heliobas]104-heliobas]560-the abode of heliobas .

The weather was very cold ; [I]0-i had left the summer behind [me]0-i at [Cannes]4-cannes , to find winter reigning supreme in [Paris]5-paris . A bitter east wind blew , and a few flakes of snow fell now and then from the frowning sky . [The house to which [I]0-i betook [myself]0-i]561-the house to which i betook myself was situated at [a commanding corner of [a road]563-a road facing [the Champs Elysees]564-the champs elysees]562-a commanding corner of a road facing the champs elysees . [It]561-the house to which i betook myself was [a noble - looking building]565-a noble - looking building . The broad steps leading to the entrance were guarded on either side by a sculptured Sphinx , each of whom held , in [its]566-its massive stone paws , a plain shield , inscribed with the old Roman greeting to [strangers]567-strangers , " Salve ! "[0-i] Over the portico was designed a scroll which bore the name " [Hotel Mars]20-hotel mars "[0-i] in clearly cut capitals , and the monogram " C. H. "[0-i]

[I]0-i ascended the steps with some hesitation , and twice [I]0-i extended [my]0-i hand towards the bell , desiring yet fearing to awaken its summons . [I]0-i noticed it was an electric bell , not needing to be pulled but pressed ; and at last , after many doubts and anxious suppositions , [I]0-i very gently laid [my]0-i fingers on the little button which formed its handle . Scarcely had [I]0-i done this than the great door slid open rapidly without the least noise . [I]0-i looked for [the servant in attendance]568-the servant in attendance - there was none . [I]0-i paused an instant ; the door remained invitingly open , and through it [I]0-i caught a glimpse of flowers . Resolving to be bold , and to hesitate no longer , [I]0-i entered . As [I]0-i crossed the threshold , the door closed behind [me]0-i instantly with its previous swiftness and silence .

[I]0-i found [myself]0-i in [a spacious hall]569-a spacious hall , light and lofty , surrounded with fluted pillars of white marble . In the centre a fountain bubbled melodiously , and tossed up every now and then a high jet of sparkling spray , while round [its]566-its basin grew the rarest ferns and exotics , which emitted a subtle and delicate perfume . No cold air penetrated here ; it was as warm and balmy as a spring day in [Southern Italy]21-southern italy . Light Indian bamboo chairs provided with luxurious velvet cushions were placed in various corners between the marble columns , and on one of these [I]0-i seated [myself]0-i to rest a minute , wondering what [I]0-i should do next , and whether [anyone]2062-anyone would come to ask [me]0-i the cause of [my]0-i intrusion . [My]0-i meditations were soon put to flight by the appearance of [a young lad , who crossed [the hall]572-the hall from the left - hand side and approached [me]0-i]571-a young lad , who crossed the hall from the left - hand side and approached me . [He]571-a young lad , who crossed the hall from the left - hand side and approached me was [a handsome boy of twelve or thirteen years of age]573-a handsome boy of twelve or thirteen years of age , and [he]571-a young lad , who crossed the hall from the left - hand side and approached me was attired in a simple Greek costume of white linen , relieved with a broad crimson silk sash . A small flat crimson cap rested on [his]571-a young lad , who crossed the hall from the left - hand side and approached me thick black curls ; this [he]571-a young lad , who crossed the hall from the left - hand side and approached me lifted with deferential grace , and , saluting [me]0-i , said respectfully :

" [[My]571-a young lad , who crossed the hall from the left - hand side and approached me master]1787-my master is ready to receive [you]0-i , mademoiselle . "[571-a young lad , who crossed the hall from the left - hand side and approached me]

[I]0-i rose without a word and followed [him]571-a young lad , who crossed the hall from the left - hand side and approached me , scarcely permitting [myself]0-i to speculate as to how [[his]571-a young lad , who crossed the hall from the left - hand side and approached me master]1772-his master knew [I]0-i was [there]526-there at all .

[The hall]572-the hall was soon traversed , and [the lad]577-the lad paused before a magnificent curtain of deep crimson velvet , heavily bordered with gold . Pulling a twisted cord that hung beside it , the heavy , regal folds parted in twain with noiseless regularity , and displayed [an octagon room]578-an octagon room , so exquisitely designed and ornamented that [I]0-i gazed upon [it]578-an octagon room as upon some rare and beautiful picture . [It]578-an octagon room was unoccupied , and [[my]0-i young escort]579-my young escort placed a chair for [me]0-i near the central window , informing [me]0-i as [he]579-my young escort did so that " [Monsieur le Comte]136-monsieur le comte "[579-my young escort] would be with [me]0-i instantly ; whereupon [he]579-my young escort departed .

Left alone , [I]0-i gazed in bewilderment at the loveliness round [me]0-i . The walls and ceiling were painted in fresco . [I]0-i could not make out the subjects , but [I]0-i could see faces of surpassing beauty smiling from clouds , and peering between stars and crescents . The furniture appeared to be of very ancient Arabian design ; each chair was a perfect masterpiece of wood - carving , picked out and inlaid with gold . The sight of a semi - grand piano , which stood open , brought [me]0-i back to the realization that [I]0-i was living in modern times , and not in a dream of the Arabian Nights ; while [the Paris Figaro]580-the paris figaro and [the London Times]581-the london times - both of that day 's issue - lying on a side - table , demonstrated the nineteenth century to [me]0-i with every possible clearness . There were flowers everywhere in [this apartment]582-this apartment - in graceful vases and in gilded osier baskets - and a queer lop - sided Oriental jar stood quite near [me]0-i , filled almost to overflowing with Neapolitan violets . Yet it was winter in [Paris]5-paris , and flowers were rare and costly .

Looking about [me]0-i , [I]0-i perceived an excellent cabinet photograph of [Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini , framed in antique silver ; and [I]0-i rose to examine it more closely , as being the face of [a friend]583-a friend . While [I]0-i looked at it , [I]0-i heard the sound of an organ in the distance playing softly an old familiar church chant . [I]0-i listened . Suddenly [I]0-i bethought [myself]0-i of the three dreams that had visited [me]0-i , and a kind of nervous dread came upon [me]0-i . [This Heliobas]104-heliobas , - was [I]0-i right after all in coming to consult [him]104-heliobas ? Was [he]104-heliobas not perhaps [a mere charlatan]584-a mere charlatan ? and might not [his]104-heliobas experiments upon [me]0-i prove fruitless , and possibly fatal ? An idea seized [me]0-i that [I]0-i would escape while there was yet time . Yes ! ... [I]0-i would not see [him]104-heliobas to - day , at any rate ; [I]0-i would write and explain . These and other disjointed thoughts crossed [my]0-i mind ; and yielding to the unreasoning impulse of fear that possessed [me]0-i , [I]0-i actually turned to leave [the room]385-the room , when [I]0-i saw the crimson velvet portiere dividing again in its regular and graceful folds , and [Heliobas]104-heliobas [himself]104-heliobas entered .

[I]0-i stood mute and motionless . [I]0-i knew [him]104-heliobas well ; [he]104-heliobas was [the very man [I]0-i had seen in [my]0-i third and last dream]586-the very man i had seen in my third and last dream ; [the same noble , calm features ; the same commanding presence ; the same keen , clear eyes]587-the same noble , calm features ; the same commanding presence ; the same keen , clear eyes ; the same compelling smile . There was nothing extraordinary about [his]104-heliobas appearance except [his]104-heliobas stately bearing and handsome countenance ; [his]104-heliobas dress was that of [any well - to - do gentleman of the present day]588-any well - to - do gentleman of the present day , and there was no affectation of mystery in [his]104-heliobas manner . [He]104-heliobas advanced and bowed courteously ; then , with a friendly look , held out [his]104-heliobas hand . [I]0-i gave [him]104-heliobas [mine]0-i at once .

" So [you]0-i are [the young musician]2135-the young musician ? "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said , in those warm mellifluous accents that [I]0-i had heard before and that [I]0-i so well remembered . " [[My]104-heliobas friend]365-my friend [Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini has written to [me]104-heliobas about [you]0-i . [I]104-heliobas hear [you]0-i have been suffering from physical depression ? "[104-heliobas]

[He]104-heliobas spoke as [any physician]589-any physician might do who inquired after [a patient]590-a patient 's health . [I]0-i was surprised and relieved . [I]0-i had prepared [myself]0-i for something darkly mystical , almost cabalistic ; but there was nothing unusual in the demeanour of [this pleasant and good - looking gentleman who , bidding [me]0-i be seated , took a chair [himself]104-heliobas opposite to [me]0-i , and observed [me]0-i with that sympathetic and kindly interest which [any well - bred doctor]592-any well - bred doctor would esteem it [his]104-heliobas duty to exhibit]591-this pleasant and good - looking gentleman who , bidding me be seated , took a chair himself opposite to me , and observed me with that sympathetic and kindly interest which any well - bred doctor would esteem it his duty to exhibit . [I]0-i became quite at ease , and answered all [his]104-heliobas questions fully and frankly . [He]104-heliobas felt [my]0-i pulse in the customary way , and studied [my]0-i face attentively . [I]0-i described all [my]0-i symptoms , and [he]104-heliobas listened with the utmost patience . When [I]0-i had concluded , [he]104-heliobas leaned back in [his]104-heliobas chair and appeared to ponder deeply for some moments . Then [he]104-heliobas spoke .

" [You]0-i know , of course , that [I]104-heliobas am not [a doctor]2075-a doctor ? "[104-heliobas]

" [I]0-i know , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " [Signer Cellini]140-signer cellini explained to [me]0-i . "[0-i]
