" Ah ! "[104-heliobas] and [Heliobas]104-heliobas smiled . " [Raffaello]97-cellini explained as much as [he]97-cellini might ; but not everything . [I]104-heliobas must tell [you]0-i [I]104-heliobas have a simple pharmacopoeia of [my]104-heliobas own - it contains twelve remedies , and only twelve . In fact there [me]104-heliobas no more that are of any use to the human mechanism . All are made of the juice of plants , and six of them are electric . [Raffaello]97-cellini tried [you]0-i with one of them , did [he]97-cellini not ? "[104-heliobas]

As [he]104-heliobas put this question , [I]0-i was aware of a keenly inquiring look sent from the eyes of [[my]0-i interrogator]593-my interrogator into [mine]0-i .

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered frankly , " and it made [me]0-i dream , and [I]0-i dreamt of [YOU]104-heliobas . "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas laughed lightly .

" So ! - that is well . Now [I]104-heliobas am going in the first place to give [you]0-i what [I]104-heliobas am sure will be satisfactory information . If [you]0-i agree to trust [yourself]0-i to [my]104-heliobas care , [you]0-i will be in perfect health in a little less than a fortnight - but [you]0-i must follow [my]104-heliobas rules exactly . "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i started up from [my]0-i seat .

" Of course ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed eagerly , forgetting all [my]0-i previous fear of [him]104-heliobas ; " [I]0-i will do all [you]104-heliobas advise , even if [you]104-heliobas wish to magnetize [me]0-i as [you]104-heliobas magnetized [Signor Cellini]97-cellini ! "[0-i]

" [I]104-heliobas never MAGNETIZED [Raffaello]97-cellini , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said gravely ; " [he]97-cellini was on the verge of madness , and [he]97-cellini had no faith whereby to save [himself]97-cellini . [I]104-heliobas simply set [him]97-cellini free for a time , knowing that [his]97-cellini was a genius which would find out things for itself or perish in the effort . [I]104-heliobas let [him]97-cellini go on a voyage of discovery , and [he]97-cellini came back perfectly satisfied . That is all . [You]0-i do not need [his]97-cellini experience . "[104-heliobas]

" How do [you]104-heliobas know ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [You]0-i are [a woman]1738-a woman - [your]0-i desire is to be well and strong , health being beauty - to love and to be beloved - to wear pretty toilettes and to be admired ; and [you]0-i have a creed which satisfies [you]0-i , and which [you]0-i believe in without proofs . "[104-heliobas]

There was the slightest possible tinge of mockery in [his]104-heliobas voice as [he]104-heliobas said these words . A tumultuous rush of feelings overcame [me]0-i . [My]0-i high dreams of ambition , [my]0-i innate scorn of the trite and commonplace , [my]0-i deep love of art , [my]0-i desires of fame - all these things bore down upon [my]0-i heart and overcame it , and a pride too deep for tears arose in [me]0-i and found utterance .

" [You]0-i think [I]0-i am so slight and weak a thing ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed . " [YOU]0-i , who profess to understand the secrets of electricity - [you]0-i have no better instinctive knowledge of [me]0-i than that ! Do [you]0-i deem [women all alike]2139-women all alike - [all on one common level]2140-all on one common level , fit for nothing but to be the toys or drudges of [men]273-men ? Can [you]0-i not realize that there are some among [them]2139-women all alike [who despise the inanities of everyday life - who care nothing for the routine of society , and whose hearts are filled with cravings that no mere human love or life]2142-who despise the inanities of everyday life - who care nothing for the routine of society , and whose hearts are filled with cravings that no mere human love or life can satisfy ? Yes - [even weak women]2143-even weak women are capable of greatness ; and if [we]2144-we do sometimes dream of what [we]2144-we can not accomplish through lack of the physical force necessary for large achievements , that is not [our]2144-we fault but [our]2144-we misfortune . [We]2144-we did not create [ourselves]2144-we . [We]2144-we did not ask to be born with the over - sensitiveness , the fatal delicacy , the highly - strung nervousness of the feminine nature . [Monsieur Heliobas]104-heliobas , [you]104-heliobas are [a learned and far - seeing man]2145-a learned and far - seeing man , [I]0-i have no doubt ; but [you]104-heliobas do not read [me]0-i aright if [you]104-heliobas judge [me]0-i as [a mere woman who is perfectly contented with the petty commonplaces of ordinary living]2146-a mere woman who is perfectly contented with the petty commonplaces of ordinary living . And as for [my]0-i creed , what is it to [you]104-heliobas whether [I]0-i kneel in the silence of [[my]0-i own room]413-my own room or in the glory of [a lighted cathedral]2148-a lighted cathedral to pour out [my]0-i very soul to ONE whom [I]0-i know exists , and whom [I]0-i am satisfied to believe in , as [you]104-heliobas say , without proofs , save such proofs as [I]0-i obtain from [my]0-i own inner consciousness ? [I]0-i tell [you]104-heliobas , though , in [your]104-heliobas opinion it is evident [my]0-i sex is against [me]0-i , [I]0-i would rather die than sink into the miserable nonentity of such lives as are lived by [the majority of [women]441-women]2149-the majority of women . "[0-i]

[I]0-i paused , overcome by [my]0-i own feelings . [Heliobas]104-heliobas smiled .

" So ! [You]0-i are stung ! "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said quietly ; ' stung into action . That is as it should be . Resume [your]0-i seat , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , and do not be angry with [me]0-i . [I]0-i am studying [you]0-i for [your]0-i own good . In the meantime permit [me]0-i to analyze [your]0-i words a little . [You]0-i are young and inexperienced . [You]0-i speak of the ' over - sensitiveness , the fatal delicacy , the highly - strung nervousness of the feminine nature . ' [[My]0-i dear lady]594-my dear lady , if [you]0-i had lived as long as [I]0-i have , [you]0-i would know that these are mere stock phrases - for the most part meaningless . As a rule , [women]441-women are less sensitive than [men]273-men . There are many of [your]0-i sex who are nothing but lumps of lymph and fatty matter - [women with less instinct than the dumb beasts , and with more brutality]597-women with less instinct than the dumb beasts , and with more brutality . There are others who , - adding the low cunning of the monkey to the vanity of the peacock , - seek no other object but the furtherance of [their]598-their own designs , which are always petty even when not absolutely mean . There are [obese women whose existence is a doze between dinner and tea]599-obese women whose existence is a doze between dinner and tea . There are [women with thin lips and pointed noses]600-women with thin lips and pointed noses , who only live to squabble over domestic grievances and interfere in [[their]600-women with thin lips and pointed noses neighbours]601-their neighbours ' business . There are [[your]0-i murderous women with large almond eyes , fair white hands , and voluptuous red lips , who , deprived of the dagger or the poison - bowl , will slay a reputation in a few lazily enunciated words , delivered with a perfectly high - bred accent . There are [the miserly woman]603-the miserly woman , who look after cheese - parings and candle - ends , and lock up the soap]602-your murderous women with large almond eyes , fair white hands , and voluptuous red lips , who , deprived of the dagger or the poison - bowl , will slay a reputation in a few lazily enunciated words , delivered with a perfectly high - bred accent . there are the miserly woman , who look after cheese - parings and candle - ends , and lock up the soap . There are [the spiteful women whose very breath is acidity and venom]604-the spiteful women whose very breath is acidity and venom . There are [the frivolous women whose chitter - chatter and senseless giggle are as empty as the rattling of dry peas on a drum]605-the frivolous women whose chitter - chatter and senseless giggle are as empty as the rattling of dry peas on a drum . In fact , the delicacy of [women]441-women is extremely overrated - [their]441-women coarseness is never done full justice to . [I]0-i have heard [them]441-women recite in public selections of a kind that [no man]607-no man would dare to undertake - such as [Tennyson]141-tennyson 's ' Rizpah , ' for instance . [I]0-i know [a woman who utters every line of it]608-a woman who utters every line of it , with all its questionable allusions , boldly before any and [everybody]1916-everybody , without so much as an attempt at blushing . [I]0-i assure [you]0-i [men]273-men are far more delicate than [women]441-women - far more chivalrous - far larger in [their]273-men views , and more generous in [their]273-men sentiments . But [I]0-i will not deny the existence of about [four women in every two hundred and fifty , who may be , and possibly are , examples of what the female sex]612-four women in every two hundred and fifty , who may be , and possibly are , examples of what the female sex was originally intended to be - pure - hearted , self - denying , gentle and truthful - filled with tenderness and inspiration . Heaven knows [[my]0-i own mother]613-my own mother was all this and more ! And [[my]0-i sister]614-my sister is - . But let [me]0-i speak to [you]0-i of [yourself]0-i . [You]0-i love music , [I]0-i understand - [you]0-i are [a professional artist]615-a professional artist ? "[0-i]

" [I]0-i was , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " till [my]0-i state of health stopped [me]0-i from working . "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas bent [his]104-heliobas eyes upon [me]0-i in friendly sympathy .

" [You]0-i were , and [you]0-i will be again , an improvisatrice "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas went on . " Do [you]0-i not find it difficult to make [[your]0-i audiences]2151-your audiences understand [your]0-i aims ? "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i smiled as the remembrance of some of [my]0-i experiences in public came to [my]0-i mind .

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , half laughing . " In [England]10-england , at least , [people]1754-people do not know what is meant by IMPROVISING . [They]1754-people think it is to take a little theme and compose variations on it - the mere ABC of the art . But to sit down to the piano and plan a whole sonata or symphony in [your]0-i head , and play it while planning it , is a thing [they]1754-people do not and will not understand . [They]1754-people come to hear , and [they]1754-people wonder and go away , and [the critics]2153-the critics declare it to be [CLAP - TRAP]142-clap - trap . "[0-i]

" Exactly ! "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas . " But [you]0-i are to be congratulated on having attained this verdict . Everything that [people]1754-people can not quite understand is called [CLAP - TRAP]142-clap - trap in [England]10-england ; as for instance the matchless violin - playing of [Sarasate]143-sarasate ; the tempestuous splendor of [Rubinstein]144-rubinstein ; the wailing throb of passion in [Hollmann]145-hollmann 's violoncello - this is , according to the [London]2-london press , [CLAP - TRAP]142-clap - trap ; while the coldly correct performances of [Joachim]146-joachim and the ' icily - null ' renderings of [Charles Halle]147-charles halle are voted ' magnificent ' and ' full of colour . ' But to return to [yourself]0-i . Will [you]0-i play to [me]104-heliobas ? "[104-heliobas]

" [I]0-i have not touched the instrument for two months , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i am out of practice . "[0-i]

" Then [you]0-i shall not exert [yourself]0-i to - day , "[104-heliobas] returned [Heliobas]104-heliobas kindly . " But [I]104-heliobas believe [I]104-heliobas can help [you]0-i with [your]0-i improvisations . [You]0-i compose the music as [you]0-i play , [you]0-i tell [me]104-heliobas . Well , have [you]0-i any idea how the melodies or the harmonies form themselves in [your]0-i brain ? "[104-heliobas]

" Not the least in [the world]264-the world , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied .

" Is the act of thinking them out an effort to [you]0-i ? "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas asked .

" Not at all . [They]2156-they come as though [someone else]2157-someone else were planning them for [me]104-heliobas . "[104-heliobas]

" Well , well ! [I]104-heliobas think [I]104-heliobas can certainly be of use to [you]0-i in this matter as in [others]324-others . [I]104-heliobas understand [your]0-i temperament thoroughly . And now let [me]104-heliobas give [you]0-i [my]104-heliobas first prescription . "[104-heliobas]

[He]104-heliobas went to a corner of [the room]385-the room and lifted from the floor an ebony casket , curiously carved and ornamented with silver . This [he]104-heliobas unlocked . It contained twelve flasks of cut glass , stoppered with gold and numbered in order . [He]104-heliobas next pulled out a side drawer in this casket , and in it [I]0-i saw several little thin empty glass tubes , about the size of a cigarette - holder . Taking two of these [he]104-heliobas filled them from two of the larger flasks , corked them tightly , and then turning to [me]0-i , said :

" To - night , on going to bed , have a warm bath , empty the contents of the tube marked No . 1 into it , and then immerse [yourself]0-i thoroughly for about five minutes . After the bath , put the fluid in this other tube marked 2 , into a tumbler of fresh spring water , and drink it off . Then go straight to bed . "[104-heliobas]

" Shall [I]0-i have any dreams ? "[0-i] [I]0-i inquired with a little anxiety .

" Certainly not , "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas , smiling . " [I]104-heliobas wish [you]0-i to sleep as soundly as [a year - old child]2159-a year - old child . Dreams are not for [you]0-i to - night . Can [you]0-i come to [me]104-heliobas tomorrow afternoon at five o'clock ? If [you]0-i can arrange to stay to dinner , [[my]104-heliobas sister]614-my sister will be pleased to meet [you]0-i ; but perhaps [you]0-i are otherwise engaged ? "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i told [him]104-heliobas [I]0-i was not , and explained where [I]0-i had taken [rooms]617-rooms , adding that [I]0-i had come to [Paris]5-paris expressly to put [myself]0-i under [his]104-heliobas treatment .

" [You]0-i shall have no cause to regret this journey , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said earnestly . " [I]104-heliobas can cure [you]0-i thoroughly , and [I]104-heliobas will . [I]104-heliobas forget [your]0-i nationality - [you]0-i are not English ? "[104-heliobas]

" No , not entirely . [I]104-heliobas am [half Italian]2161-half italian . "[104-heliobas]

" Ah , yes ! [I]104-heliobas remember now . But [you]0-i have been educated in [England]10-england ? "[104-heliobas]

" Partly . "[104-heliobas]

" [I]104-heliobas am glad it is only partly , "[104-heliobas] remarked [Heliobas]104-heliobas . " If it had been entirely , [your]0-i improvisations would have had no chance . In fact [you]0-i never would have improvised . [You]0-i would have played the piano like poor mechanical [Arabella Goddard]148-arabella goddard . As it is , there is some hope of originality in [you]0-i - [you]0-i need not be one of the rank and file unless [you]0-i choose . "[104-heliobas]

" [I]0-i do not choose , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Well , but [you]0-i must take the consequences , and [they]2162-they are bitter . [A woman who does not go with [her]2163-a woman who does not go with her time time]2163-a woman who does not go with her time is voted eccentric ; [a woman who prefers music to tea and scandal]2164-a woman who prefers music to tea and scandal is [an undesirable acquaintance]2165-an undesirable acquaintance ; and [a woman who prefers [Byron]149-byron to [Austin Dobson]150-austin dobson]2166-a woman who prefers byron to austin dobson is - in fact , no measure can gauge [her]2166-a woman who prefers byron to austin dobson general impossibility ! "[0-i] [I]0-i laughed gaily . " [I]0-i will take all the consequences as willingly as [I]0-i will take [your]618-your medicines , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , stretching out [my]0-i hand for the little vases which [he]618-your gave [me]0-i wrapped in paper . " And [I]0-i thank [you]618-your very much , [monsieur]2167-monsieur . And "[0-i] - here [I]0-i hesitated . Ought [I]0-i not to ask [him]618-your [his]618-your fee ? Surely the medicines ought to be paid for ?

[Heliobas]104-heliobas appeared to read [my]0-i thoughts , for [he]104-heliobas said , as though answering [my]0-i unuttered question :

" [I]104-heliobas do not accept fees , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle . To relieve [your]0-i mind from any responsibility of gratitude to [me]104-heliobas , [I]104-heliobas will tell [you]0-i at once that [I]104-heliobas never promise to effect a cure unless [I]104-heliobas see that [the person who comes to be cured]2168-the person who comes to be cured has a certain connection with [myself]104-heliobas . If the connection exists [I]104-heliobas am bound by fixed laws to serve [him]2169-him or [her]2170-her . Of course [I]104-heliobas am able also to cure [those who are NOT by nature connected with [me]104-heliobas]2171-those who are not by nature connected with me ; but then [I]104-heliobas have to ESTABLISH a connection , and this takes time , and is sometimes very difficult to accomplish , almost as tremendous a task as the laying down of the Atlantic cable . But in [your]0-i case [I]104-heliobas am actually COMPELLED to do [my]104-heliobas best for [you]0-i , so [you]0-i need be under no sense of obligation . "[104-heliobas]

Here was a strange speech - the first really inexplicable one [I]0-i had heard from [his]619-his lips .

" [I]0-i am connected with [you]619-his ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , surprised . " How ? In what way ? "[0-i]

" It would take too long to explain to [you]0-i just now , "[104-heliobas] said [Heliobas]104-heliobas gently ; " but [I]104-heliobas can prove to [you]0-i in a moment that a connection DOES exist between [YOUR]0-i inner self , and [MY]104-heliobas inner self , if [you]0-i wish it . "[104-heliobas]

" [I]0-i do wish it very much , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Then take [my]104-heliobas hand , "[104-heliobas] continued [Heliobas]104-heliobas , stretching it out , " and look steadily at [me]104-heliobas . "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i obeyed , half trembling . As [I]0-i gazed , a veil appeared to fall from [my]0-i eyes . A sense of security , of comfort , and of absolute confidence came upon [me]0-i , and [I]0-i saw what might be termed THE IMAGE OF ANOTHER FACE looking at [me]0-i THROUGH or BEHIND the actual form and face of [Heliobas]104-heliobas . And that other face was [his]104-heliobas , and yet not [his]104-heliobas ; but whatever it appeared to be , it was the face of [a friend]583-a friend to [ME]0-i , one that [I]0-i was certain [I]0-i had known long , long ago , and moreover one that [I]0-i must have loved in some distant time , for [my]0-i whole soul seemed to yearn towards that indistinct haze where smiled the fully recognised yet unfamiliar countenance . This strange sensation lasted but a few seconds , for [Heliobas]104-heliobas suddenly dropped [my]0-i hand . [The room]385-the room swam round [me]0-i ; the walls seemed to rock ; then everything steadied and came right again , and all was as usual , only [I]0-i was amazed and bewildered .

" What does it mean ? "[0-i] [I]0-i murmured .

" It means the simplest thing in nature , "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas quietly , " namely , that [your]0-i soul and [mine]0-i are for some reason or other placed on the same circle of electricity . Nothing more nor less . Therefore [we]2172-we must serve [each other]2173-each other . Whatever [I]104-heliobas do for [you]0-i , [you]0-i have it in [your]0-i power to repay [me]104-heliobas amply for hereafter . "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i met the steady glance of [his]104-heliobas keen eyes , and a sense of some indestructible force within [me]0-i gave [me]0-i a sudden courage .

" Decide for [me]0-i as [you]104-heliobas please , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered fearlessly . " [I]0-i trust [you]104-heliobas completely , though [I]0-i do not know why [I]0-i do so . "[0-i]

" [You]0-i will know before long . [You]0-i are satisfied of the fact that [my]104-heliobas touch can influence [you]0-i ? "[104-heliobas]

" Yes ; most thoroughly . "[0-i]

" Very well . All other explanations , if [you]0-i desire them , shall be given [you]0-i in due time . In the power [I]104-heliobas possess over [you]0-i and some others , there is neither mesmerism nor magnetism - nothing but a purely scientific fact which can be clearly and reasonably proved and demonstrated . But till [you]0-i are thoroughly restored to health , [we]622-we will defer all discussion . And now , [mademoiselle]1745-mademoiselle , permit [me]104-heliobas to escort [you]0-i to the door . [I]104-heliobas shall expect [you]0-i to - morrow . "[104-heliobas]

Together [we]622-we left [the beautiful room in which this interview had taken place]623-the beautiful room in which this interview had taken place , and crossed [the hall]572-the hall . As [we]622-we approached the entrance , [Heliobas]104-heliobas turned towards [me]0-i and said with a smile :

" Did not the manoeuvres of [my]104-heliobas street - door astonish [you]0-i ? "[104-heliobas]

" A little , "[0-i] [I]0-i confessed .

" It is very simple . The button [you]0-i touch outside is electric ; it opens the door and at the same time rings the bell in [[my]104-heliobas study]2175-my study , thus informing [me]104-heliobas of [a visitor]2176-a visitor . When [the visitor]2177-the visitor steps across the threshold [he]2177-the visitor treads , whether [he]2177-the visitor will or no , on another apparatus , which closes the door behind [him]2177-the visitor and rings another bell in [[[my]104-heliobas page]2178-my page 's room]2179-my page 's room , who immediately comes to [me]104-heliobas for orders . [You]0-i see how easy ? And from within it is managed in almost the same manner . "[104-heliobas]

And [he]104-heliobas touched a handle similar to the one outside , and the door opened instantly . [Heliobas]104-heliobas held out [his]104-heliobas hand - that hand which a few minutes previously had exercised such strange authority over [me]0-i .

" Good - bye , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle . [You]104-heliobas are not afraid of [me]104-heliobas now ? "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i laughed . " [I]0-i do not think [I]0-i was ever really afraid of [you]104-heliobas , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " If [I]0-i was , [I]0-i am not so any longer . [You]104-heliobas have promised [me]0-i health , and that promise is sufficient to give [me]0-i entire courage . "[0-i]

" That is well , "[104-heliobas] said [Heliobas]104-heliobas . " Courage and hope in [themselves]2180-themselves are the precursors of physical and mental energy . Remember to - morrow at five , and do not keep late hours to - night . [I]104-heliobas should advise [you]0-i to be in bed by ten at the latest . "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i agreed to this , and [we]625-we shook hands and parted . [I]0-i walked blithely along , back to [the Avenue du Midi]626-the avenue du midi , where , on [my]0-i arrival [indoors]627-indoors , [I]0-i found a letter from [Mrs. Everard]93-amy . [She]93-amy wrote " in haste "[93-amy] to give [me]0-i the names of [some friends of [hers]93-amy whom [she]93-amy had discovered , through the " American Register , "[93-amy] to be staying at [the Grand Hotel]629-the grand hotel]628-some friends of hers whom she had discovered , through the " american register , " to be staying at the grand hotel . [She]93-amy begged [me]0-i to call upon [them]628-some friends of hers whom she had discovered , through the " american register , " to be staying at the grand hotel , and enclosed two letters of introduction for the purpose . [She]93-amy concluded [her]93-amy epistle by saying :

" [Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini has been invisible ever since [your]0-i departure , but [[our]625-we inimitable waiter]2181-our inimitable waiter , [Alphonse]109-alphonse , says [he]2181-our inimitable waiter is very busy finishing a picture for [the Salon]2182-the salon - something that [we]625-we have never seen . [I]93-amy shall intrude [myself]93-amy into [[his]2181-our inimitable waiter studio]337-his studio soon on some pretence or other , and will then let [you]0-i know all about it . In the meantime , believe [me]93-amy ,[93-amy]

" [[Your]0-i ever devoted friend]2184-your ever devoted friend , [AMY]93-amy . "[93-amy]

[I]0-i answered this letter , and then spent a pleasant evening at [the Pension]630-the pension , chatting sociably with [Madame Denise]139-madame denise and another cheery little Frenchwoman , [a day governess , who boarded there , and who had no end of droll experiences to relate]631-a day governess , who boarded there , and who had no end of droll experiences to relate , [her]631-a day governess , who boarded there , and who had no end of droll experiences to relate enviable temperament being to always see the humorous side of life . [I]0-i thoroughly enjoyed [her]631-a day governess , who boarded there , and who had no end of droll experiences to relate sparkling chatter and [her]631-a day governess , who boarded there , and who had no end of droll experiences to relate expressive gesticulations , and [we]632-we all three made [ourselves]632-we merry till bedtime . Acting on the advice of [Heliobas]104-heliobas , [I]0-i retired early to [[my]0-i room]546-my room , where a warm bath had been prepared in compliance with [my]0-i orders . [I]0-i uncorked the glass tube No . 1 , and poured the colourless fluid it contained into the water , which immediately bubbled gently , as though beginning to boil . After watching it for a minute or two , and observing that this seething movement steadily continued , [I]0-i undressed quickly and stepped in . Never shall [I]0-i forget the exquisite sensation [I]0-i experienced ! [I]0-i can only describe it as [the poor little [Doll]151-doll 's Dressmaker in " [[Our]632-we Mutual Friend]2186-our mutual friend]2185-the poor little doll 's dressmaker in " our mutual friend "[631-a day governess , who boarded there , and who had no end of droll experiences to relate] described [[her]631-a day governess , who boarded there , and who had no end of droll experiences to relate angel visitants]634-her angel visitants , [[her]631-a day governess , who boarded there , and who had no end of droll experiences to relate " blessed children , "[2187-her " blessed children , " who used to come and " take her up and make her light] who used to come and " take [her]631-a day governess , who boarded there , and who had no end of droll experiences to relate up and make [her]631-a day governess , who boarded there , and who had no end of droll experiences to relate light]2187-her " blessed children , " who used to come and " take her up and make her light . "[631-a day governess , who boarded there , and who had no end of droll experiences to relate] If [my]0-i body had been composed of no grosser matter than fire and air , [I]0-i could not have felt more weightless , more buoyant , more thoroughly exhilarated than when , at the end of the prescribed five minutes , [I]0-i got out of that marvellous bath of healing ! As [I]0-i prepared for bed , [I]0-i noticed that the bubbling of the water had entirely ceased ; but this was easy of comprehension , for if it had contained electricity , as [I]0-i supposed , [my]0-i body had absorbed it by contact , which would account for the movement being stilled . [I]0-i now took the second little phial , and prepared it as [I]0-i had been told . This time the fluid was motionless . [I]0-i noticed it was very faintly tinged with amber . [I]0-i drank it off - it was perfectly tasteless . Once in bed , [I]0-i seemed to have no power to think any more - [my]0-i eyes closed readily - the slumber of [a year - old child]2159-a year - old child , as [Heliobas]104-heliobas had said , came upon [me]0-i with resistless and sudden force , and [I]0-i remembered no more .

CHAPTER VII .

[ZARA]152-zara AND [PRINCE IVAN]153-prince ivan .

The sun poured brilliantly into [[my]0-i room]546-my room when [I]0-i awoke the next morning . [I]0-i was free from all [my]0-i customary aches and pains , and a delightful sense of vigour and elasticity pervaded [my]0-i frame . [I]0-i rose at once , and , looking at [my]0-i watch , found to [my]0-i amazement that it was twelve o'clock in the day ! Hastily throwing on [my]0-i dressing - gown , [I]0-i rang the bell , and [the servant]637-the servant appeared .

" Is it actually mid - day ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [her]637-the servant . " Why did [you]637-the servant not call [me]0-i ? "[0-i]

[The girl]638-the girl smiled apologetically .

" [I]638-the girl did knock at [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle 's door , but [she]98-mademoiselle gave [me]638-the girl no answer . [Madame Denise]139-madame denise came up also , and entered [the room]385-the room ; but seeing mademoiselle in so sound a sleep , [she]139-madame denise said it was a pity to disturb mademoiselle . "[638-the girl]

Which statement good [Madame Denise]139-madame denise , toiling [upstairs]639-upstairs just then with difficulty , [she]139-madame denise being stout and short of breath , confirmed with many smiling nods of [her]139-madame denise head .

" Breakfast shall be served at the instant , "[139-madame denise] [she]139-madame denise said , rubbing [her]139-madame denise fat hands together ; " but to disturb [you]0-i when [you]0-i slept - ah , Heaven ! the sleep of [an infant]1840-an infant - [I]139-madame denise could not do it ! [I]139-madame denise should have been wicked ! "[139-madame denise]

[I]0-i thanked [her]139-madame denise for [her]139-madame denise care of [me]0-i ; [I]0-i could have kissed [her]139-madame denise , [she]139-madame denise looked so motherly , and kind , and altogether lovable . And [I]0-i felt so merry and well ! [She]139-madame denise and [the servant]637-the servant retired to prepare [my]0-i coffee , and [I]0-i proceeded to make [my]0-i toilette . As [I]0-i brushed out [my]0-i hair [I]0-i heard the sound of a violin . [Someone]641-someone was playing next door . [I]0-i listened , and recognised a famous Beethoven Concerto . [The unseen musician]642-the unseen musician played brilliantly and withal tenderly , both touch and tone reminding [me]0-i of some beautiful verses in a book of poems [I]0-i had recently read , called " Love - Letters of [a Violinist]2190-a violinist , "[256-the poet] in which [the poet]256-the poet FOOTNOTE : [Author of the equally beautiful idyl]644-author of the equally beautiful idyl , " [Gladys the Singer]154-gladys the singer , "[644-author of the equally beautiful idyl] included in the new American copyright edition just issued . talks of [his]256-the poet " loved [Amati]155-amati , "[256-the poet] and says : " [I]256-the poet prayed [my]256-the poet prayer . [I]256-the poet wove into [my]256-the poet song[256-the poet]

Fervour , and joy , and mystery , and the bleak , The wan despair that words could never speak . [I]0-i prayed as if [my]0-i spirit did belong To [some old master who was wise and strong , Because [he]645-some old master who was wise and strong , because he lov'd and suffered , and was weak lov'd and suffered , and was weak]645-some old master who was wise and strong , because he lov'd and suffered , and was weak .

" [I]256-the poet trill'd the notes , and curb'd them to a sigh , And when they falter'd most , [I]256-the poet made them leap Fierce from [my]256-the poet bow , as from a summer sleep [A young she - devil]2191-a young she - devil . [I]256-the poet was fired thereby To bolder efforts - and a muffled cry Came from the strings as if [a saint]2192-a saint did weep .[256-the poet]

" [I]256-the poet changed the theme . [I]256-the poet dallied with the bow Just time enough to fit it to a mesh Of merry tones , and drew it back afresh , To talk of truth , and constancy , and woe , And life , and love , and madness , and the glow Of [mine]0-i own soul which burns into [my]256-the poet flesh . "[256-the poet]

All [my]0-i love for music welled freshly up in [my]0-i heart ; [I]0-i , who had felt disinclined to touch the piano for months , now longed to try [my]0-i strength again upon the familiar and responsive key - board . For a piano has never been a mere piano to [me]0-i ; it is [a friend who answers to [my]0-i thought]646-a friend who answers to my thought , and whose notes meet [my]0-i fingers with caressing readiness and obedience .

Breakfast came , and [I]0-i took it with great relish . Then , to pass the day , [I]0-i went out and called on [[Mrs. Everard]152-zara 's friends]647-mrs. everard 's friends , [Mr.]648-mr. and [Mrs. Challoner]156-mrs. challoner and [[their]647-mrs. everard 's friends daughters]649-their daughters . [I]0-i found [them]647-mrs. everard 's friends very agreeable , with that easy bonhomie and lack of stiffness that distinguishes the best [Americans]157-americans . Finding out through [Mrs. Everard]152-zara 's letter that [I]0-i was [an " artiste "]2193-an " artiste "[647-mrs. everard 's friends] [they]647-mrs. everard 's friends at once concluded [I]0-i must need support and patronage , and with impulsive large - heartedness were beginning to plan as to the best means of organizing a concert for [me]0-i . "[653-the handsome smiling mother of the family]

[I]0-i left [the Grand Hotel]23-the grand hotel in good time to prepare for [my]0-i second visit to [Heliobas]104-heliobas . As [I]0-i was going [there]526-there to dinner [I]0-i made a slightly dressy toilette , if a black silk robe relieved with a cluster of pale pink roses can be called dressy . This time [I]0-i drove to [the Hotel Mars]556-the hotel mars , dismissing [the coachman]661-the coachman , however , before ascending the steps . [He]104-heliobas rose and greeted [me]0-i cordially . Before [I]0-i could speak a word , [he]104-heliobas said :

" [You]0-i need not tell [me]104-heliobas that [you]0-i slept well . [I]104-heliobas see it in [your]0-i eyes and face . [You]0-i feel better ? "[104-heliobas]

[My]0-i gratitude to [him]104-heliobas was so great that [I]0-i found it difficult to express [my]0-i thanks . Tears rushed to [my]0-i eyes , yet [I]0-i tried to smile , though [I]0-i could not speak . [He]104-heliobas saw [my]0-i emotion , and continued kindly :

" [I]104-heliobas am as thankful as [you]0-i can be for the cure which [I]104-heliobas see has begun , and will soon be effected . [[My]104-heliobas sister]614-my sister is waiting to see [you]0-i . Will [you]0-i come to [[her]614-my sister room]2202-her room ? "[104-heliobas]

[We]664-we ascended a flight of stairs thickly carpeted , and bordered on each side by tropical ferns and flowers , placed in exquisitely painted china pots and vases . [I]0-i heard the distant singing of many birds mingled with the ripple and plash of waters . [We]664-we reached [a landing]665-a landing where the afterglow of the set sun streamed through a high oriel window of richly stained glass . Turning towards the left , [Heliobas]104-heliobas drew aside the folds of some azure satin hangings , and calling in a low voice " [Zara]152-zara ! "[104-heliobas] motioned [me]0-i to enter . [I]0-i stepped into [a spacious and lofty apartment]666-a spacious and lofty apartment where the light seemed to soften and merge into many shades of opaline radiance and delicacy - a room the beauty of which would at any other time have astonished and delighted [me]0-i , but which now appeared as nothing beside the surpassing loveliness of [the woman who occupied [it]666-a spacious and lofty apartment]667-the woman who occupied it . Never shall [I]0-i behold again any face or form so divinely beautiful ! [She]667-the woman who occupied it was about the medium height of [women]441-women , but [her]667-the woman who occupied it small finely - shaped head was set upon so slender and proud a throat that [she]667-the woman who occupied it appeared taller than [she]667-the woman who occupied it actually was . [Her]667-the woman who occupied it figure was most exquisitely rounded and proportioned , and [she]667-the woman who occupied it came across [the room]385-the room to give [me]0-i greeting with a sort of gliding graceful movement , like that of a stately swan floating on [calm sunlit water]670-calm sunlit water . " [Fairy lakes]2203-fairy lakes , where tender thoughts Swam softly to and fro . "[667-the woman who occupied it]

[Her]667-the woman who occupied it rich black hair was arranged a la Marguerite , and hung down in one long loose thick braid that nearly reached the end of [her]667-the woman who occupied it dress , and [she]667-the woman who occupied it was attired in a robe of deep old gold Indian silk as soft as cashmere , which was gathered in round [her]667-the woman who occupied it waist by an antique belt of curious jewel - work , in which rubies and turquoises seemed to be thickly studded . On [her]667-the woman who occupied it bosom shone a strange gem , the colour and form of which [I]0-i could not determine . It was never the same for two minutes together . It glowed with many various hues - now bright crimson , now lightning - blue , sometimes deepening into a rich purple or tawny orange . Its lustre was intense , almost dazzling to the eye . [[Its]671-its beautiful wearer]672-its beautiful wearer gave [me]0-i welcome with a radiant smile and a few cordial words , and drawing [me]0-i by the hand to [the low couch [she]667-the woman who occupied it had just vacated]673-the low couch she had just vacated , made [me]0-i sit down beside [her]667-the woman who occupied it . " And so , "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara - how soft and full of music was [her]152-zara voice ! - ' so [you]0-i are [one of [[Casimir]152-zara 's patients]675-casimir 's patients]674-one of casimir 's patients ? " Much better , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , looking earnestly into the lovely star - like eyes that regarded [me]0-i with such interest and friendliness . " Indeed , to - day [I]0-i have felt so well , that [I]0-i can not realize ever having been ill . "[0-i]

" [I]152-zara am very glad , "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara , " [I]152-zara know [you]0-i are [a musician]1797-a musician , and [I]152-zara think there can be no bitterer fate than for one belonging to [your]0-i art to be incapacitated from performance of work by [some physical obstacle]2205-some physical obstacle . Strength is needed to accomplish great things - the double strength of body and soul . "[152-zara]

" Are [you]0-i , too , [a musician]1797-a musician ? "[0-i] [I]0-i inquired .

" No . [I]152-zara love music passionately , and [I]152-zara play a little on the organ in [[our]2207-our private chapel]2208-our private chapel ; but [I]152-zara follow a different art altogether . " [You]0-i ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said in some wonder , looking at the very small , beautifully formed white hand that lay passively on the edge of the couch beside [me]0-i . " [You]0-i make statues in marble like [Michael Angelo]162-angelo ? "[0-i]

Here [she]152-zara broke off abruptly , and a deep blush suffused [her]152-zara cheeks . Then , looking up suddenly , [she]152-zara took [my]0-i hand impulsively , and pressed it .

" And now [we]2222-we have drawn up , signed , and sealed [our]2222-we compact of friendship , "[678-her] [she]678-her said gaily , " will [you]0-i come and see [[my]678-her studio]2223-my studio ? Come ! "[678-her]

And [she]678-her led the way through [[her]678-her lovely room]680-her lovely room , which [I]0-i now noticed was full of delicate statuary , fine paintings , and exquisite embroidery , while flowers were everywhere in abundance . Lifting the hangings at the farther end of [the apartment]681-the apartment , [she]678-her passed , [I]0-i following , into [a lofty studio]682-a lofty studio , filled with all the appurtenances of [the sculptor]683-the sculptor 's art . Here and there were the usual spectral effects which are always suggested to the mind by unfinished plaster models - an arm in one place , a head in another ; a torso , or a single hand , protruding ghost - like from a fold of dark drapery . At the very end of [the room]385-the room stood [a large erect figure , the outlines of which could but dimly be seen]685-a large erect figure , the outlines of which could but dimly be seen through its linen coverings ; and to this work , whatever it was , [Zara]152-zara did not appear desirous of attracting [my]0-i attention . [She]678-her led [me]0-i to one particular corner ; and , throwing aside a small crimson velvet curtain , said :

" This is the last thing [I]678-her have finished in marble . [I]678-her call it ' Approaching Evening . ' "[678-her]

[I]0-i stood silently before the statue , lost in admiration . [I]0-i could not conceive it possible that the fragile little hand of [the woman who stood beside [me]0-i]686-the woman who stood beside me could have executed such a perfect work . [She]678-her had depicted " Evening "[678-her] as [a beautiful nude female figure in the act of stepping forward on tip - toe]687-a beautiful nude female figure in the act of stepping forward on tip - toe ; the eyes were half closed , and the sweet mouth slightly parted in a dreamily serious smile . The right forefinger was laid lightly on the lips , as though suggesting silence ; and in the left hand was loosely clasped a bunch of poppies . That was all . But the poetry and force of the whole conception as carried out in the statue was marvellous .

" Do [you]0-i like it ? "[152-zara] asked [Zara]152-zara , half timidly .

" Like it ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed . " It is lovely - wonderful ! It is worthy to rank with the finest Italian masterpieces . "[0-i]

' [Giants]164-giants - veritable ones ; and [we]2229-we [modernists]2230-modernists are [the pigmies]2231-the pigmies . " And [you]688-you - are not [you]688-you blase to talk like that , with [your]688-you genius and all [the world]264-the world before [you]688-you ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked laughingly , slipping [my]0-i arm through [hers]688-you . " Come , confess ! "[0-i]

" [I]152-zara do not like [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan [myself]152-zara , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said ; " but [he]153-prince ivan is [a singularly brave and resolute man]2243-a singularly brave and resolute man , and [Casimir]152-zara has some reason for admitting [him]153-prince ivan to [our]695-our companionship . [She]152-zara bent [her]152-zara head slightly in answer , and still holding [me]0-i by the hand , moved to [her]152-zara seat at the bottom of the table , while [[her]152-zara brother]703-her brother took the head . [My]0-i seat was at the right hand of [Heliobas]104-heliobas , [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan 's at the left , so that [we]704-us directly faced [each other]2173-each other .

There were [two men]706-two men - [servants in attendance]707-servants in attendance , dressed in dark livery , who waited upon [us]704-us with noiseless alacrity . The dinner was exceedingly choice ; there was nothing coarse or vulgar in the dishes - no great heavy joints swimming in thin gravy a la Anglaise ; no tureens of unpalatable sauce ; no clumsy decanters filled with burning sherry or drowsy port . The table itself was laid out in the most perfect taste , with the finest Venetian glass and old Dresden ware , in which tempting fruits gleamed amid clusters of glossy dark leaves . Flowers in tall vases bloomed wherever they could be placed effectively ; and in the centre of the board a small fountain played , tinkling as it rose and fell like a very faintly echoing fairy chime . The wines that were served to [us]704-us were most delicious , though their flavour was quite unknown to [me]0-i - one in especial , of a pale pink colour , that sparkled slightly as it was poured into [my]0-i glass , seemed to [me]0-i a kind of nectar of the gods , so soft it was to the palate . The conversation , at first somewhat desultory , grew more concentrated as the time went on , though [Zara]152-zara spoke little and seemed absorbed in [her]152-zara own thoughts more than once . [The Prince]708-the prince , warmed with the wine and the general good cheer , became witty and amusing in [his]708-the prince conversation ; [he]708-the prince was [a man who had evidently seen a good deal of [the world]264-the world , and who was accustomed to take everything in life a la bagatelle]709-a man who had evidently seen a good deal of the world , and who was accustomed to take everything in life a la bagatelle . [He]708-the prince told [us]704-us gay stories of [his]708-the prince life in [St. Petersburg]24-st. petersburg ; of the pranks [he]708-the prince had played in [the Florentine Carnival]25-the florentine carnival ; of [his]708-the prince journey to [the American States]711-the american states , and [his]708-the prince narrow escape from the matrimonial clutches of [a Boston heiress]712-a boston heiress .

[Heliobas]104-heliobas listened to [him]708-the prince with a sort of indulgent kindness , only smiling now and then at the preposterous puns [the young man]713-the young man would insist on making at every opportunity that presented itself .

" [You]153-prince ivan are [a lucky fellow]2244-a lucky fellow , [Ivan]153-prince ivan , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said at last . " [You]153-prince ivan like the good things of life , and [you]153-prince ivan have got them all without any trouble on [your]153-prince ivan own part . [You]153-prince ivan are one of [those men who have absolutely nothing to wish for]2245-those men who have absolutely nothing to wish for . "[104-heliobas]

[Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan frowned and pulled [his]153-prince ivan dark moustache with no very satisfied air .

" [I]153-prince ivan am not so sure about that , "[153-prince ivan] [he]153-prince ivan returned . " [No one]1820-no one is contented in [this world]1957-this world , [I]153-prince ivan believe . There is always something left to desire , and the last thing longed for always seems the most necessary to happiness . "[153-prince ivan]

" The truest philosophy , "[104-heliobas] said [Heliobas]104-heliobas , " is not to long for anything in particular , but to accept everything as it comes , and find out the reason of its coming . "[104-heliobas]

" What do [you]153-prince ivan mean by ' the reason of its coming ' ? "[153-prince ivan] questioned [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan . " Do [you]153-prince ivan know , [Casimir]152-zara , [I]153-prince ivan find [you]153-prince ivan sometimes as puzzling as [Socrates]167-socrates . "[153-prince ivan]

" [Socrates]167-socrates ? - [Socrates]167-socrates was as clear as a drop of morning dew , [[my]104-heliobas dear fellow]2248-my dear fellow , "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas . " There was nothing puzzling about [him]167-socrates . [His]167-socrates remarks were all true and trenchant - hitting smartly home to the heart like daggers plunged down to the hilt . That was the worst of [him]167-socrates - [he]167-socrates was too clear - too honest - too disdainful of opinions . Society does not love [such men]2249-such men . What do [I]104-heliobas mean , [you]153-prince ivan ask , by accepting everything as it comes , and trying to find out the reason of its coming ? Why , [I]104-heliobas mean what [I]104-heliobas say . Each circumstance that happens to [each one of [us]2251-we]2250-each one of us brings its own special lesson and meaning - forms a link or part of a link in the chain of [our]2251-we existence . It seems nothing to [you]153-prince ivan that [you]153-prince ivan walk down [a particular street]2252-a particular street at a particular hour , and yet that slight action of [yours]153-prince ivan may lead to a result [you]153-prince ivan wot not of . ' Accept the hint of each new experience , ' says [the American imitator of [Plato - Emerson]166-plato]2253-the american imitator of plato - emerson . If this advice is faithfully followed , [we]2251-we all have enough to occupy [us]2251-we busily from the cradle to the grave . "[104-heliobas]

[Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan looked at [Zara]152-zara , who sat quietly thoughtful , only lifting [her]152-zara bright eyes now and then to glance at [[her]152-zara brother]703-her brother as [he]153-prince ivan spoke .

" [I]153-prince ivan tell [you]152-zara , "[153-prince ivan] [he]153-prince ivan said , with sudden moroseness , " there are some hints that [we]2251-we can not accept - some circumstances that [we]2251-we must not yield to . Why should [a man]278-a man , for instance , be subjected to an undeserved and bitter disappointment ? "[153-prince ivan]

" Because , "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara , joining in the conversation for the first time , " [he]278-a man has most likely desired what [he]278-a man is not fated to obtain . "[152-zara]

[The Prince]708-the prince bit [his]708-the prince lips , and gave a forced laugh .

" [I]153-prince ivan know , [madame]1750-madame , [you]1750-madame are against [me]153-prince ivan in all [our]2251-we arguments , "[153-prince ivan] [he]153-prince ivan observed , with some bitterness in [his]153-prince ivan tone . " As [Casimir]152-zara suggests , [I]153-prince ivan am [a bad philosopher]2256-a bad philosopher . [I]153-prince ivan do not pretend to more than the ordinary attributes of [an ordinary man]2257-an ordinary man ; it is fortunate , if [I]153-prince ivan may be permitted to say so , that the rest of [the word 's inhabitants]2258-the word 's inhabitants are very like [me]153-prince ivan , for if [everyone]1821-everyone reached to the sublime heights of science and knowledge that [you]1750-madame and [[your]1750-madame brother]2260-your brother have attained - - "[153-prince ivan]

" The course of human destiny would run out , and Paradise would be an established fact , "[104-heliobas] laughed [Heliobas]104-heliobas . " Come , [Ivan]153-prince ivan ! Dessert was now served , and luscious fruits in profusion , including peaches , bananas , plantains , green figs , melons , pine - apples , and magnificent grapes , were offered for [our]719-our choice . " [You]0-i know [Leo]100-leo , of course , "[104-heliobas] said [Heliobas]104-heliobas , turning to [me]0-i . " [He]100-leo went to see [Raffaello]97-cellini while [you]0-i were at [Cannes]4-cannes . "[721-prince ivan , whose transient moodiness had passed away like a bad devil exorcised by the power of good wine]

" Yes , "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas , calling the dog , who went to [him]104-heliobas immediately to be fondled . " [I]104-heliobas should never have been much encouraged in [my]104-heliobas researches , had [he]100-leo not been at hand . [I]104-heliobas feared to experimentalize much on [[my]104-heliobas sister]614-my sister , [she]614-my sister being young at the time - and [women]441-women are always frail of construction - but [Leo]100-leo was willing and ready to be a victim to science , if necessary . [My]0-i curiosity was much excited by these remarks , and [I]0-i said eagerly :

" Will [you]104-heliobas tell [me]0-i in what way [Leo]100-leo has been useful to [you]104-heliobas ? [I]0-i have a great affection for dogs , and [I]0-i never tire of hearing stories of [their]2267-their wonderful intelligence . "[0-i]

" [I]104-heliobas will certainly tell [you]0-i , "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas . " To [some people]2268-some people the story might appear improbable , but it is perfectly true and at the same time simple of comprehension . When [I]104-heliobas was [a very young man]2269-a very young man , younger than [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan , [I]104-heliobas absorbed [myself]104-heliobas in the study of electricity - its wonderful powers , and its various capabilities . From the consideration of electricity in the different forms by which it is known to civilized [Europe]26-europe , [I]104-heliobas began to look back through history , to what are ignorantly called ' the dark ages , ' but which might more justly be termed [the enlightened youth of [the world]264-the world]2270-the enlightened youth of the world . [I]104-heliobas found that the force of electricity was well understood by [the ancients]1763-the ancients - better understood by [them]1763-the ancients , in fact , than it is by [the scientists of [our]2274-we day]2273-the scientists of our day . The ' MENE , [MENE]168-mene , [TEKEL]169-tekel , UPHARSIN ' that glittered in unearthly characters on the wall at [Belshazzar]170-belshazzar 's feast , was written by electricity ; and [the Chaldean kings]2275-the chaldean kings and [priests]2276-priests understood a great many secrets of another form of electric force which [the world]264-the world to - day scoffs at and almost ignores - [I]104-heliobas mean human electricity , which [we]2274-we all possess , but which [we]2274-we do not all cultivate within [us]2274-we . When once [I]104-heliobas realized the existence of the fact of human electric force , [I]104-heliobas applied the discovery to [myself]104-heliobas , and spared no pains to foster and educate whatever germ of this power lay within [me]104-heliobas . [I]104-heliobas succeeded with more ease and celerity than [I]104-heliobas had imagined possible . At the time [I]104-heliobas pursued these studies , [Leo]100-leo here was quite a young dog , full of the clumsy playfulness and untrained ignorance of [a Newfoundland puppy]2278-a newfoundland puppy . One day [I]104-heliobas was very busy reading an interesting Sanskrit scroll which treated of ancient medicines and remedies , and [Leo]100-leo was gambolling in [his]100-leo awkward way about [the room]385-the room , playing with an old slipper and worrying it with [his]100-leo teeth . The noise [he]100-leo made irritated and disturbed [me]104-heliobas , and [I]104-heliobas rose in [my]104-heliobas chair and called [him]100-leo by name , somewhat angrily . [He]100-leo paused in [his]100-leo game and looked up - [his]100-leo eyes met [mine]104-heliobas exactly . [His]100-leo head drooped ; [he]100-leo shivered uneasily , whined , and lay down motionless . [He]100-leo never stirred once from the position [he]100-leo had taken , till [I]104-heliobas gave [him]100-leo permission - and remember , [he]100-leo was untrained . This strange behaviour led [me]104-heliobas to try other experiments with [him]100-leo , and all succeeded . [I]104-heliobas gradually led [him]100-leo up to the point [I]104-heliobas desired - that is , [I]104-heliobas FORCED [HIM]100-leo TO RECEIVE [MY]104-heliobas THOUGHT AND ACT UPON IT , as far as [his]100-leo canine capabilities could do , and [he]100-leo has never once failed . It is sufficient for [me]104-heliobas to strongly WILL [him]100-leo to do a certain thing , and [I]104-heliobas can convey that command of mine to [his]100-leo brain without uttering a single word , and [he]100-leo will obey [me]104-heliobas . "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i suppose [I]0-i showed surprise and incredulity in [my]0-i face , for [Heliobas]104-heliobas smiled at [me]0-i and continued :

" [I]104-heliobas will put [him]100-leo to the proof at any time [you]0-i like . "[104-heliobas]

"[153-prince ivan]

[I]0-i remembered that [I]0-i had left an embroidered handkerchief on the couch in [[Zara]152-zara 's room]724-zara 's room , and [I]0-i wrote this down on the paper , which [I]0-i passed to [Heliobas]104-heliobas . [He]104-heliobas glanced at it and tore it up . [Leo]100-leo was indulging [himself]100-leo with a bone under the table , but came instantly to [[his]100-leo master]1772-his master 's call . [Heliobas]104-heliobas took the dog 's head between [his]104-heliobas two hands , and gazed steadily into the grave brown eyes that regarded [him]100-leo with equal steadiness . This interchange of looks lasted but a few seconds . [Leo]100-leo left [the room]385-the room , walking with an unruffled and dignified pace , while [we]727-we awaited [his]100-leo return - [Heliobas]104-heliobas and [Zara]152-zara with indifference , [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan with amusement , and [I]0-i with interest and expectancy . Two or three minutes elapsed , and the dog returned with the same majestic demeanour , carrying between [his]100-leo teeth [my]0-i handkerchief . [He]100-leo came straight to [me]0-i and placed it in [my]0-i hand ; shook [himself]100-leo , wagged [his]100-leo tail , and conveying a perfectly human expression of satisfaction into [his]100-leo face , went under the table again to [his]100-leo bone . [I]0-i was utterly amazed , but at the same time convinced . [I]0-i had not seen the dog since [my]0-i arrival in [Paris]5-paris , and it was impossible for [him]100-leo to have known where to find [my]0-i handkerchief , or to recognize it as being [mine]0-i , unless through the means [Heliobas]104-heliobas had explained .

" Can [you]104-heliobas command [human beings]2284-human beings so ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , with a slight tremor of nervousness .

" Not all , "[104-heliobas] returned [Heliobas]104-heliobas quietly . " In fact , [I]104-heliobas may say , very few . [Those who are on [my]104-heliobas own circle of power [I]104-heliobas can , naturally , draw to or repel from [me]104-heliobas]2285-those who are on my own circle of power i can , naturally , draw to or repel from me ; but [those who are not]2286-those who are not , have to be treated by different means . " Then , if it can be done , "[153-prince ivan] said [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan , " why do [you]104-heliobas not accomplish it for [me]153-prince ivan ? "[153-prince ivan]

" Because [you]104-heliobas are being forcibly drawn towards [me]104-heliobas without any effort on [my]104-heliobas part , "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas , with one of [his]104-heliobas steady , keen looks . [The Prince]708-the prince fidgeted restlessly in [his]708-the prince chair , and toyed with the fruit on [his]708-the prince plate in a nervous manner .

" If [I]104-heliobas did not know [you]104-heliobas to be [an absolutely truthful and honourable man]2288-an absolutely truthful and honourable man , [Casimir]152-zara , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said , " [I]104-heliobas should think [you]104-heliobas were trying to deceive [me]104-heliobas . But [I]104-heliobas have seen what [you]104-heliobas can do , therefore [I]104-heliobas must believe [you]104-heliobas . Still [I]104-heliobas confess [I]104-heliobas do not follow [you]104-heliobas in [your]104-heliobas circle theory . "[104-heliobas]

" To begin with , "[104-heliobas] returned [Heliobas]104-heliobas , " [the Universe]1-the universe is a circle . Everything is circular , from the motion of planets down to the human eye , or the cup of a flower , or a drop of dew . [MY]104-heliobas ' circle theory , ' as [you]2289-you call it , applied to human electric force , is very simple ; but [I]104-heliobas have proved it to be mathematically correct . [Every human being]2290-every human being is provided INTERNALLY and EXTERNALLY with a certain amount of electricity , which is as necessary to existence as the life - blood to the heart or fresh air to the lungs . Internally it is the germ of a soul or spirit , and is placed there to be either cultivated or neglected as suits the WILL of [man]282-man . It is indestructible ; yet , if neglected , it remains always a germ ; and , at the death of the body [it]2292-it inhabits , goes elsewhere to seek another chance of development . If , on the contrary , its growth is fostered by a persevering , resolute WILL , it becomes [a spiritual creature]2293-a spiritual creature , glorious and supremely powerful , for which a new , brilliant , and endless existence commences when its clay chrysalis perishes . So much for the INTERNAL electrical force . The EXTERNAL binds [us]2294-our all by fixed laws , with which [our]2294-our wills have nothing whatever to do . [Each one of [us]2294-our]2250-each one of us walks [the earth]374-the earth encompassed by an invisible electric ring - wide or narrow according to [our]2294-our capabilities . Sometimes [our]2294-our rings meet and form one , as in the case of [two absolutely sympathetic souls , who labour and love together with perfect faith in each other]2297-two absolutely sympathetic souls , who labour and love together with perfect faith in each other . Sometimes [they]2297-two absolutely sympathetic souls , who labour and love together with perfect faith in each other clash , and storm ensues , as when a strong antipathy between [persons]2287-persons causes [them]2297-two absolutely sympathetic souls , who labour and love together with perfect faith in each other almost to loathe [each other]2173-each other 's presence . All these human electric rings are capable of attraction and repulsion . If [a man]278-a man , during [his]278-a man courtship of [a woman]1738-a woman , experiences once or twice a sudden instinctive feeling that there is something in [her]1738-a woman nature not altogether what [he]278-a man expected or desired , let [him]278-a man take warning and break off the attachment ; for the electric circles do not combine , and nothing but unhappiness would come from forcing a union . [I]104-heliobas would say the same thing to [a woman]1738-a woman . If [my]104-heliobas advice were followed , how many unhappy marriages would be avoided ! But [you]708-the prince have tempted [me]104-heliobas to talk too much , [Ivan]153-prince ivan . [I]104-heliobas see [the ladies]2303-the ladies wish to adjourn . Shall [we]729-we go to [the smoking - room]2304-the smoking - room for a little , and join [them]2303-the ladies in [the drawing - room]2283-the drawing - room afterwards ? "[104-heliobas]

[We]729-we all rose .

" Well , "[708-the prince] said [the Prince]708-the prince gaily , as [he]708-the prince prepared to follow [[his]708-the prince host]731-his host , " [I]708-the prince realize one thing which gives [me]708-the prince pleasure , [Casimir]152-zara . If in truth [I]708-the prince am being attracted towards [your]708-the prince electric circle , [I]708-the prince hope [I]708-the prince shall reach [it]2306-it soon , as [I]708-the prince shall then , [I]708-the prince suppose , be more en rapport with [madame]1750-madame , [[your]708-the prince sister]2308-your sister . "[708-the prince]

[Zara]152-zara 's luminous eyes surveyed [him]708-the prince with a sort of queenly pity and forbearance .

" By the time [YOU]708-the prince arrive at that goal , [Prince]2309-prince , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said calmly , " it is most probable that [I]152-zara shall have departed . "[152-zara]

And with one arm thrown round [my]0-i waist , [she]152-zara saluted [him]708-the prince gravely , and left [the room]385-the room with [me]0-i beside [her]152-zara .

" Would [you]708-the prince like to see [the chapel]2310-the chapel on [your]708-the prince way to [the drawing - room]2283-the drawing - room ? "[152-zara] [she]152-zara asked , as [we]733-we crossed [the hall]572-the hall .

[I]0-i gladly accepted this proposition , and [Zara]152-zara took [me]0-i down a flight of marble steps , which terminated in a handsomely - carved oaken door . Pushing this softly open , [she]152-zara made the sign of the cross and sank on [her]152-zara knees . [I]0-i did the same , and then looked with reverential wonder at the loveliness and serenity of [the place]2197-the place . [It]2197-the place was small , but lofty , and the painted dome - shaped roof was supported by eight light marble columns , wreathed with minutely - carved garlands of vine - leaves . [The chapel]2310-the chapel was fitted up in accordance with the rites of the Catholic religion , and before the High Altar and Tabernacle burned seven roseate lamps , which were suspended from the roof by slender gilt chains . A large crucifix , bearing a most sorrowful and pathetic figure of [Christ]101-god , was hung on one of the side walls ; and from a corner altar , shining with soft blue and silver , an exquisite statue of [the Madonna and Child]737-the madonna and child was dimly seen from where [we]733-we knelt . A few minutes passed , and [Zara]152-zara rose . Looking towards the Tabernacle , [her]152-zara lips moved as though murmuring a prayer , and then , taking [me]0-i by the hand , [she]152-zara led [me]0-i gently out . The heavy oaken door swung softly behind [us]733-we as [we]733-we ascended [the chapel steps]738-the chapel steps and re - entered [the great hall]739-the great hall .

" [You]0-i are [a Catholic]2312-a catholic , are [you]0-i not ? "[152-zara] then said [Zara]152-zara to [me]0-i .

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " but - "[0-i]

" But [you]0-i have doubts sometimes , [you]0-i would say ! Of course . [One]272-one always doubts when [one]272-one sees the dissensions , the hypocrisies , the false pretences and wickedness of [many professing Christians]2315-many professing christians . But [Christ]101-god and [His]101-god religion are living facts , in spite of the suicide of souls [He]101-god would gladly save . [You]0-i must ask [Casimir]152-zara some day about these things ; [he]101-god will clear up all the knotty points for [you]0-i . Here [we]2316-we are at the drawing - room door . "[152-zara]

It was [the same room into which [I]0-i had first been shown]740-the same room into which i had first been shown . [Zara]152-zara seated [herself]152-zara , and made [me]0-i occupy a low chair beside [her]152-zara .

" Tell [me]152-zara , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said , " can [you]0-i not come here and stay with [me]152-zara while [you]0-i are under [Casimir]152-zara 's treatment ? "[152-zara]

[I]0-i thought of [Madame Denise]139-madame denise and [her]139-madame denise Pension .

" [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " but [I]0-i fear [[my]0-i friends]336-my friends would want to know where [I]0-i am staying , and explanations would have to be given , which [I]0-i do not feel disposed to enter upon . "[0-i]

" Why , "[152-zara] went on [Zara]152-zara quietly , " [you]0-i have only to say that [you]0-i are being attended by [a Dr. Casimir]134-dr. casimir who wishes to have [you]0-i under [his]134-dr. casimir own supervision , and that [you]0-i are therefore staying in [[his]134-dr. casimir house]2318-his house under [the chaperonage of [[his]134-dr. casimir sister]2320-his sister]2319-the chaperonage of his sister . "[152-zara]

[I]0-i laughed at the idea of [Zara]152-zara playing [the chaperon]741-the chaperon , and told [her]152-zara [she]152-zara was far too young and beautiful to enact that character .

" Do [you]0-i know how old [I]152-zara am ? "[152-zara] [she]152-zara asked , with a slight smile .

[I]0-i guessed seventeen , or at any rate not more than twenty .

" [I]152-zara am thirty - eight , "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara .

Thirty - eight ! Impossible ! [I]0-i would not believe it . [I]0-i could not . [I]0-i laughed scornfully at such an absurdity , looking at [her]152-zara as [she]152-zara sat there a perfect model of youthful grace and loveliness , with [her]152-zara lustrous eyes and rose - tinted complexion .

" [You]0-i may doubt [me]152-zara if [you]0-i choose , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said , still smiling ; " but [I]152-zara have told [you]0-i the truth . [I]152-zara am thirty - eight years of age according to [the world]264-the world 's counting . What [I]152-zara am , measured by another standard of time , matters not just now . [You]0-i see [I]152-zara look young , and , what is more , [I]152-zara am young . [I]152-zara enjoy [my]152-zara youth . [I]152-zara hear that [women of society at thirty - eight]2322-women of society at thirty - eight are often faded and blase - what a pity it is that [they]2322-women of society at thirty - eight do not understand the first laws of self - preservation ! But to resume what [I]152-zara was saying , [you]0-i know now that [I]152-zara am quite old enough in the eyes of [the world]264-the world to chaperon [you]0-i or [anybody]2324-anybody . [You]0-i had better arrange to stay [here]1773-here . [Casimir]152-zara asked [me]152-zara to settle the matter with , [you]0-i . "[152-zara]

As [she]742-she spoke , [Heliobas]104-heliobas and [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan entered . [The latter]743-the latter looked flushed and excited - [Heliobas]104-heliobas was calm and stately as usual . [He]104-heliobas addressed [himself]104-heliobas to [me]0-i at once .

" [I]104-heliobas have ordered [[my]104-heliobas carriage]2326-my carriage , mademoiselle , to take [you]0-i back this evening to [the Avenue du Midi]626-the avenue du midi . If [you]0-i will do as [Zara]152-zara tells [you]0-i , and explain to [[your]0-i friends]2125-your friends the necessity there is for [your]0-i being under the personal supervision of [[your]0-i doctor]2200-your doctor , [you]0-i will find everything will arrange itself very naturally . And the sooner [you]0-i come here the better - in fact , [Zara]152-zara will expect [you]0-i here to - morrow early in the afternoon . [I]104-heliobas may rely upon [you]0-i ? "[104-heliobas]

[He]744-he spoke with a certain air of command , evidently expecting no resistance on [my]0-i part . Indeed , why should [I]0-i resist ? Already [I]0-i loved [Zara]152-zara , and wished to be more in [her]152-zara company ; and then , most probably , [my]0-i complete restoration to health would be more successfully and quickly accomplished if [I]0-i were actually in [the house of [the man who had promised to cure [me]0-i]746-the man who had promised to cure me]745-the house of the man who had promised to cure me . Therefore [I]0-i replied :

" [I]0-i will do as [you]104-heliobas wish , [monsieur]2167-monsieur . Having placed [myself]0-i in [your]104-heliobas hands , [I]0-i must obey . In this particular case , "[0-i] [I]0-i added , looking at [Zara]152-zara , " obedience is very agreeable to [me]0-i . "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas smiled and seemed satisfied . [He]104-heliobas then took a small goblet from a side - table and left [the room]385-the room . [Returning]171-returning , however , almost immediately with the cup filled to the brim , [he]104-heliobas said , handing it to [me]0-i :

" Drink this - it is [your]0-i dose for to - night ; and then [you]0-i will go [home]1856-home , and straight to bed . "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i drank it off at once . It was delicious in flavour - like very fine Chianti .

" Have [you]0-i no soothing draught for [me]153-prince ivan ? "[153-prince ivan] said [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan , who had been turning over a volume of photographs in a sullenly abstracted sort of way .

" No , "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas , with a keen glance at [him]0-i ; " the draught fitted for [your]0-i present condition might soothe [you]0-i too thoroughly . "[104-heliobas]

[The Prince]708-the prince looked at [Zara]152-zara , but [she]152-zara was mute . [She]152-zara had taken a piece of silk embroidery from a workbasket near [her]152-zara , and was busily employed with it . [Heliobas]104-heliobas advanced and laid [his]104-heliobas hand on [the young man]713-the young man 's arm .

" Sing to [us]2332-us , [Ivan]153-prince ivan , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said , in a kind tone . " Sing [us]2332-us one of [your]153-prince ivan wild Russian airs - [Zara]152-zara loves [them]2333-them , and [this young lady]2334-this young lady would like to hear [your]153-prince ivan voice before [she]2334-this young lady goes . "[104-heliobas]

[The Prince]708-the prince hesitated , and then , with another glance at [Zara]152-zara 's bent head , went to the piano . [He]713-the young man had a brilliant touch , and accompanied [himself]713-the young man with great taste and delicacy ; but [his]713-the young man voice was truly magnificent - a baritone of deep and mellow quality , sonorous , and at the same time tender . [He]713-the young man sang a French rendering of a Slavonic love - song , which , as nearly as [I]0-i can translate it into English , ran as follows :

" As the billows fling shells on [the shore]2335-the shore , As the sun poureth light on [the sea]1792-the sea , As a lark on the wing scatters song to the spring , So rushes [my]713-the young man love to [thee]152-zara .[713-the young man]

" As the ivy clings close to [the tower]2337-the tower , As the dew lieth deep in a flower , As the shadow to light , as the day unto night , So clings [my]713-the young man wild soul to [thee]152-zara ![713-the young man]

" As the moon glitters coldly alone , Above earth on [her]152-zara cloud - woven throne , As [the rocky - bound cave]2338-the rocky - bound cave repulses a wave , So [thy]152-zara anger repulseth [me]713-the young man .[713-the young man]

" As the bitter black frost of a night Slays the roses with pitiless might , As a sharp dagger - thrust hurls [a king]2339-a king to the dust , So [thy]152-zara cruelty murdereth [me]713-the young man .[713-the young man]

" Yet in spite of [thy]152-zara queenly disdain , [Thou]152-zara art seared by [my]713-the young man passion and pain ; [Thou]152-zara shalt hear [me]713-the young man repeat , till [I]713-the young man die for it , sweet ! ' [I]713-the young man love [thee]152-zara ! [I]713-the young man dare to love [THEE]152-zara ! ' "[713-the young man]

[He]751-he ended abruptly and with passion , and rose from the piano directly .

[I]0-i was enthusiastic in [my]0-i admiration of the song and of the splendid voice which had given it utterance , and [the Prince]708-the prince seemed almost grateful for the praise accorded [him]708-the prince both by [Heliobas]104-heliobas and [myself]0-i .

[The page]694-the page entered to announce that " [the carriage]2340-the carriage was waiting for mademoiselle , "[694-the page] and [I]0-i prepared to leave . [Zara]152-zara kissed [me]0-i affectionately , and whispering , " Come early to - morrow , "[152-zara] made a graceful salute to [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan , and left [the room]385-the room immediately .

[Heliobas]104-heliobas then offered [me]0-i [his]104-heliobas arm to take [me]0-i to [the carriage]2340-the carriage . [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan accompanied [us]756-us . As the hall door opened in its usual noiseless manner , [I]0-i perceived an elegant light brougham drawn by a pair of black horses , who were giving [the coachman]661-the coachman a great deal of trouble by the fretting and spirited manner in which [they]758-they pawed the stones and pranced . Before descending [the steps]759-the steps [I]0-i shook hands with [Heliobas]104-heliobas , and thanked [him]104-heliobas for the pleasant evening [I]0-i had passed .

" [We]756-us will try to make all [your]0-i time with [us]756-us pass as pleasantly , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas returned . " Good - night ! What , [Ivan]153-prince ivan , "[104-heliobas] as [he]104-heliobas perceived [the Prince]708-the prince attiring [himself]708-the prince in [his]708-the prince great - coat and hat , " are [you]153-prince ivan also going ? "[708-the prince]

" Yes , [I]104-heliobas am off , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas replied , with a kind of forced gaiety ; " [I]104-heliobas am bad company for [anyone]2062-anyone to - night , and [I]104-heliobas wo n't inflict [myself]104-heliobas upon [you]0-i , [Casimir]152-zara . Au revoir ! [I]104-heliobas will put mademoiselle into [the carriage]2340-the carriage if [she]2343-she will permit [me]104-heliobas . "[104-heliobas]

[We]761-we went down the steps together , [Heliobas]104-heliobas watching [us]761-we from the open door . As [the Prince]708-the prince assisted [me]0-i into the brougham , [he]708-the prince whispered :

" Are [you]0-i [one of [them]2345-them]2344-one of them ! "[708-the prince]

[I]0-i looked at [him]708-the prince in bewilderment .

" [One of [them]2345-them]2344-one of them ! "[0-i] [I]0-i repeated . " What do [you]708-the prince mean ? "[0-i]

" Never mind , "[708-the prince] [he]708-the prince muttered impatiently , as [he]708-the prince made a pretence of covering [me]0-i with the fur rugs inside [the carriage]2340-the carriage : " if [you]0-i are not now , [you]0-i will be , or [Zara]152-zara would not have kissed [you]0-i . If [you]0-i ever have the chance ask [her]152-zara to think of [me]708-the prince at [my]708-the prince best . Good - night . "[708-the prince]

[I]0-i was touched and a little sorry for [him]708-the prince . [I]0-i held out [my]0-i hand in silence . [He]708-the prince pressed it hard , and calling to [the coachman]661-the coachman , " 36 , [Avenue du Midi]28-avenue du midi , "[708-the prince] stood on [the pavement]765-the pavement bareheaded , looking singularly pale and grave in the starlight , as [the carriage]2340-the carriage rolled swiftly away , and the door of [the Hotel Mars]556-the hotel mars closed .

CHAPTER VIII .

A SYMPHONY IN [THE AIR]8-the air .

Within a very short time [I]0-i became [a temporary resident in [the house of [Heliobas]104-heliobas]769-the house of heliobas]768-a temporary resident in the house of heliobas , and felt [myself]0-i to be perfectly at [home]1856-home [there]526-there . [I]0-i had explained to [Madame Denise]139-madame denise the cause of [my]0-i leaving [[her]139-madame denise comfortable Pension]772-her comfortable pension , and [she]139-madame denise had fully approved of [my]0-i being under [a physician]2073-a physician 's personal care in order to ensure rapid recovery ; but when [she]139-madame denise heard the name of [that physician]774-that physician , which [I]0-i gave in accordance with [Zara]152-zara 's instructions as [Dr. Casimir]134-dr. casimir , [she]139-madame denise held up [her]139-madame denise fat hands in dismay .

" Oh , mademoiselle , "[139-madame denise] [she]139-madame denise exclaimed , " have [you]0-i not dread of [that terrible man]2347-that terrible man ? Is it not [he]2347-that terrible man that is reported to be [a cruel mesmerist who sacrifices [everybody]1916-everybody - yes , even [[his]2347-that terrible man own sister]2350-his own sister , to [his]2347-that terrible man medical experiments]2348-a cruel mesmerist who sacrifices everybody - yes , even his own sister , to his medical experiments ? Ah , [mon Dieu]172-mon dieu ! it makes [me]139-madame denise to shudder ! "[139-madame denise]

And [she]139-madame denise shuddered directly , as a proof of [her]139-madame denise veracity . [I]0-i was amused . [I]0-i saw in [her]139-madame denise an example of [the common multitude , who are more ready to believe in vulgar spirit - rapping and mesmerism]775-the common multitude , who are more ready to believe in vulgar spirit - rapping and mesmerism than to accept an established scientific fact .

" Do [you]139-madame denise know [Dr. Casimir]134-dr. casimir and [[his]134-dr. casimir sister]2320-his sister ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [her]139-madame denise .

" [I]139-madame denise have seen [them]2352-them , [mademoiselle]1745-mademoiselle ; perhaps once - twice - three times ! It is true [madame]1750-madame is lovely as [an angel]284-an angel ; but [they]2352-them say "[139-madame denise] - here [she]139-madame denise lowered [her]139-madame denise voice mysteriously - " that [she]1750-madame is wedded to [a devil]2356-a devil ! It is true , mademoiselle - [all people]2357-all people say so . And [Suzanne Michot]173-suzanne - [a very respectable young person]2358-a very respectable young person , mademoiselle , from [Auteuil]29-auteuil - [she]173-suzanne was employed at one time as [under - housemaid at [Dr. Casimir]134-dr. casimir 's]2359-under - housemaid at dr. casimir 's , and [she]173-suzanne had things to say - ah , to make the blood like ice ! "[139-madame denise]
