" What did [she]173-suzanne say ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked with a half smile .

" Well , "[139-madame denise] and [Madame Denise]139-madame denise came close to [me]0-i and looked confidential , " [Suzanne]173-suzanne - [I]139-madame denise assure [you]0-i [a most respectable girl]2360-a most respectable girl - said that one evening [she]173-suzanne was crossing [the passage]412-the passage near [[Madame Casimir]152-zara 's boudoir]2362-madame casimir 's boudoir , and [she]173-suzanne saw a light like fire coming through the curtains of [the portiere]361-the portiere . And [she]173-suzanne stopped to listen , and [she]173-suzanne heard a strange music like the sound of harps . [She]173-suzanne ventured to go nearer - [Suzanne]173-suzanne is [a brave girl]2364-a brave girl , mademoiselle , and most virtuous - and to raise the curtain the smallest portion just to permit the glance of an eye . And - imagine what [she]173-suzanne saw . "[139-madame denise]

" Well ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed impatiently . " WHAT did [she]173-suzanne see ? "[0-i]

" Ah , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , [you]98-mademoiselle will not believe [me]139-madame denise - but [Suzanne Michot]173-suzanne has [respectable parents]2365-respectable parents , and would not tell a lie - well , [Suzanne]173-suzanne saw [[her]173-suzanne mistress]2366-her mistress , [Madame Casimir]152-zara , standing up near [her]173-suzanne couch with both arms extended as to embrace the air . Round [her]173-suzanne there was - believe it or not , [mademoiselle]98-mademoiselle , as [you]98-mademoiselle please - a ring of light like a red fire , which seemed to grow larger and redder always . All suddenly , [madame]1750-madame grew pale and more pale , and then fell on [her]1750-madame couch as one dead , and all the red fire went out . [Suzanne]173-suzanne had fear , and [she]173-suzanne tried to call out - but now see what happened to [Suzanne]173-suzanne ! [She]173-suzanne was PUSHED from the spot , mademoiselle , pushed along as though by [some strong personage]2368-some strong personage ; yet [she]173-suzanne saw [no one]1820-no one till [she]173-suzanne reached [her]173-suzanne own door , and in [[her]173-suzanne room]2202-her room [she]173-suzanne fainted from alarm . The very next morning [Dr. Casimir]134-dr. casimir dismissed [her]173-suzanne , with [her]173-suzanne full wages and a handsome present besides ; but [he]134-dr. casimir LOOKED at [her]173-suzanne , [Suzanne]173-suzanne said , in a manner to make [her]173-suzanne tremble from head to foot . Now , [mademoiselle]1745-mademoiselle , judge [yourself]1745-mademoiselle whether it is fit for one who is suffering with nerves to go to [so strange a house]2372-so strange a house ! "[139-madame denise]

[I]0-i laughed . [Her]776-her story had not the least effect upon [me]0-i . In fact , [I]0-i made up [my]0-i mind that the so respectable and virtuous [Suzanne Michot]173-suzanne had been drinking some of [[her]173-suzanne master]777-her master 's wine . [I]0-i said :

" [Your]776-her words only make [me]0-i more desirous to go , [Madame Denise]139-madame denise . Besides , [Dr. Casimir]134-dr. casimir has already done [me]0-i a great deal of good . [You]776-her must have heard things of [him]134-dr. casimir that are not altogether bad , surely ? "[0-i]

[The little woman]778-the little woman reflected seriously , and then said , as with some reluctance :

" It is certainly true , [mademoiselle]1745-mademoiselle , that in the quarter of [the poor]2374-the poor [he]134-dr. casimir is much beloved . [Jean Duclos]174-jean duclos - [he]174-jean duclos is [a chiffonnier]2375-a chiffonnier - had [[his]174-jean duclos one child]2376-his one child dying of typhoid fever , and [he]174-jean duclos was watching it struggling for breath ; it was at the point to die . [Monsieur le Comte Casimir]136-monsieur le comte , or [Dr. Casimir]134-dr. casimir - for [he]134-dr. casimir is called both - came in all suddenly , and in half an hour had saved [the little one]2042-the little one 's life . [I]778-the little woman do not deny that [he]134-dr. casimir may have some good in [him]134-dr. casimir , and that [he]134-dr. casimir understands medicine ; but there is something wrong - "[778-the little woman] And [Madame Denise]139-madame denise shook [her]139-madame denise head forlornly a great number of times .

None of [her]139-madame denise statements deterred [me]0-i from [my]0-i intention , and [I]0-i was delighted when [I]0-i found [myself]0-i fairly installed at [the Hotel Mars]20-hotel mars . [Zara]152-zara gave [me]0-i [a beautiful room next to [her]152-zara own]779-a beautiful room next to her own ; [she]152-zara had taken pains to fit [it]779-a beautiful room next to her own up [herself]152-zara with everything that was in accordance with [my]0-i particular tastes , such as a choice selection of books ; music , including many of the fascinating scores of [Schubert]175-schubert and [Wagner]176-wagner ; writing materials ; and a pretty , full - toned pianette . [My]0-i window looked out on [a small courtyard]780-a small courtyard , which had been covered over with glass and transformed into [a conservatory]781-a conservatory . [I]0-i could enter [it]780-a small courtyard by going down a few steps , and could have the satisfaction of gathering roses and lilies of [the valley]477-the valley , while outside the east wind blew and the cold snowflakes fell over [Paris]5-paris . [I]0-i wrote to [Mrs. Everard]152-zara from [[my]0-i retreat]783-my retreat , and [I]0-i also informed [the Challoners]177-the challoners where [they]177-the challoners could find [me]0-i if [they]177-the challoners wanted [me]0-i . These duties done , [I]0-i gave [myself]0-i up to enjoyment . [Zara]152-zara and [I]0-i became [inseparables]784-inseparables ; [we]785-we worked together , read together , and together every morning gave those finishing - touches to the ordering and arrangement of [the household]786-the household which are essentially feminine , and which not the wisest philosopher in all [the world]264-the world has been , or ever will be , able to accomplish successfully . [We]785-we grew to love [each other]2173-each other dearly , with that ungrudging , sympathizing , confiding friendship that is very rarely found between [two women]789-two women . In the meantime [my]0-i cure went on rapidly . Every night on retiring to rest [Heliobas]104-heliobas prepared a medicinal dose for [me]0-i , of the qualities of which [I]0-i was absolutely ignorant , but which [I]0-i took trustingly from [his]104-heliobas hand . Every morning a different little phial of liquid was placed in [the bathroom]790-the bathroom for [me]0-i to empty into the water of [my]0-i daily bath , and every hour [I]0-i grew better , brighter , and stronger . The natural vivacity of [my]0-i temperament returned to [me]0-i ; [I]0-i suffered no pain , no anxiety , no depression , and [I]0-i slept as soundly as [a child]369-a child , unvisited by a single dream . The mere fact of [my]0-i being alive became a joy to [me]0-i ; [I]0-i felt grateful for everything - for [my]0-i eyesight , [my]0-i speech , [my]0-i hearing , [my]0-i touch - because all [my]0-i senses seemed to be sharpened and invigorated and braced up to the keenest delight . This happy condition of [my]0-i system did not come suddenly - sudden cures mean sudden relapses ; it was a gradual , steady , ever - increasing , reliable recovery .

[I]0-i found the society of [Heliobas]104-heliobas and [[his]104-heliobas sister]2320-his sister very fascinating . [Their]793-their conversation was both thoughtful and brilliant , [their]793-their manners were evenly gracious and kindly , and the life [they]793-their led was a model of perfect household peace and harmony . There was never a fuss about anything : the domestic arrangements seemed to work on smoothly oiled wheels ; the different repasts were served with quiet elegance and regularity ; [the servants]717-the servants were few , but admirably trained ; and [we]795-we all lived in an absolutely calm atmosphere , unruffled by so much as a breath of worry . Nothing of a mysterious nature went on , as far as [I]0-i could see .

[Heliobas]104-heliobas passed the greater part of the day in [[his]104-heliobas study]796-his study - [a small , plainly furnished room]797-a small , plainly furnished room , the facsimile of the one [I]0-i had beheld [him]104-heliobas in when [I]0-i had dreamed those three dreams at [Cannes]4-cannes . Whether [he]104-heliobas received many or [few patients]798-few patients [there]526-there [I]0-i could not tell ; but that [some]302-some applied to [him]104-heliobas for advice [I]0-i knew , as [I]0-i often met [strangers]567-strangers crossing [the hall]572-the hall on [their]567-strangers way in and out . [He]104-heliobas always joined [us]803-us at dinner , and was invariably cheerful , generally entertaining [us]803-us with lively converse and sparkling narrative , though now and then the thoughtful tendency of [his]104-heliobas mind predominated , and gave a serious tone to [his]104-heliobas remarks .

[Zara]152-zara was uniformly bright and even in [her]152-zara temperament . [She]152-zara was [my]0-i very ideal of the Greek Psyche , radiant yet calm , pensive yet mirthful . [She]152-zara was full of beautiful ideas and poetical fancies , and so thoroughly untouched by [the world]264-the world and its aims , that [she]152-zara seemed to [me]0-i just to poise on [the earth]374-the earth like a delicate butterfly on a flower ; and [I]0-i should have been scarcely surprised had [I]0-i seen [her]152-zara unfold a pair of shining wings and fly away to some other region . Yet in spite of this spirituelle nature , [she]152-zara was physically stronger and more robust than [any other woman [I]0-i ever saw]806-any other woman i ever saw . [She]152-zara was gay and active ; [she]152-zara was never tired , never ailing , and [she]152-zara enjoyed life with a keen zest such as is unknown to [the tired multitudes who toil on hopelessly and wearily]807-the tired multitudes who toil on hopelessly and wearily , wondering , as [they]807-the tired multitudes who toil on hopelessly and wearily work , why [they]807-the tired multitudes who toil on hopelessly and wearily were born . [Zara]152-zara evidently had no doubts or speculations of this kind ; [she]152-zara drank in every minute of [her]152-zara existence as if it were a drop of honey - dew prepared specially for [her]152-zara palate . [I]0-i never could believe that [her]152-zara age was what [she]152-zara had declared it to be . [She]152-zara seemed to look younger every day ; sometimes [her]152-zara eyes had that limpid , lustrous innocence that is seen in the eyes of [a very little child]808-a very little child ; and , again , they would change and glow with the earnest and lofty thought of [one who had lived through years of study , research , and discovery]809-one who had lived through years of study , research , and discovery . For the first few days of [my]0-i visit [she]152-zara did not work in [[her]152-zara studio]690-her studio at all , but appeared to prefer reading or talking with [me]0-i . One afternoon , however , when [we]811-we had returned from a short drive in [the Bois de Boulogne]812-the bois de boulogne , [she]152-zara said half hesitatingly :

" [I]152-zara think [I]152-zara will go to work again to - morrow morning , if [you]0-i will not think [me]152-zara unsociable . "[152-zara]

" Why , [[Zara]152-zara dearest]2378-zara dearest ! "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " Of course [I]0-i shall not think [you]152-zara unsociable . [I]0-i would not interfere with any of [your]152-zara pursuits for [the world]264-the world . "[0-i]

[She]152-zara looked at [me]0-i with a sort of wistful affection , and continued :

" But [you]0-i must know [I]152-zara like to work quite alone , and though it may look churlish , still not even [you]0-i must come into [the studio]343-the studio . [I]152-zara never can do anything before [a witness]2381-a witness ; [Casimir]152-zara [himself]152-zara knows that , and keeps away from [me]152-zara . "[152-zara]

" Well ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [I]0-i should be [an ungrateful wretch]2382-an ungrateful wretch if [I]0-i could not oblige [you]152-zara in so small a request . [I]0-i promise not to disturb [you]152-zara , [Zara]152-zara ; and do not think for one moment that [I]0-i shall be dull . [I]0-i have books , a piano , flowers - what more do [I]0-i want ? And if [I]0-i like [I]0-i can go out ; then [I]0-i have letters to write , and all sorts of things to occupy [me]0-i . [I]0-i shall be quite happy , and [I]0-i shall not come near [you]152-zara till [you]152-zara call [me]0-i . "[0-i]

[Zara]152-zara kissed [me]0-i .

" [You]0-i are [a dear girl]2383-a dear girl , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said ; " [I]152-zara hate to appear inhospitable , but [I]152-zara know [you]0-i are [a real friend]2384-a real friend - that [you]0-i will love [me]152-zara as much away from [you]0-i as near [you]0-i , and that [you]0-i have none of that vulgar curiosity which [some women]2385-some women give way to , when what [they]2385-some women desire to see is hidden from [them]2385-some women . [You]0-i are not inquisitive , are [you]0-i ? "[152-zara]

[I]0-i laughed .

" The affairs of [other people]2386-other people have never appeared so interesting to [me]0-i that [I]0-i have cared to bother [myself]0-i about [them]2386-other people , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " [[Blue - Beard]178-blue - beard 's Chamber]2387-blue - beard 's chamber would never have been unlocked had [I]0-i been [[that worthy man]2388-that worthy man 's wife]2389-that worthy man 's wife . "[0-i]

" What a fine moral lesson the old fairy - tale teaches ! "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara . " [I]152-zara always think [those wives of Blue - Beard]2390-those wives of blue - beard deserved [their]2390-those wives of blue - beard fate for not being able to obey [him]178-blue - beard in [his]178-blue - beard one request . But in regard to [your]0-i pursuits , [dear]1876-dear , while [I]152-zara am at work in [[my]152-zara studio]2223-my studio , [you]0-i can use the grand piano in [the drawing - room]2283-the drawing - room when [you]0-i please , as well as the little one in [[your]0-i own room]2394-your own room ; and [you]0-i can improvise on the chapel organ as much as [you]0-i like . "[152-zara]

[I]0-i was delighted at this idea , and thanked [her]152-zara heartily . [She]152-zara smiled thoughtfully .

" What happiness it must be for [you]0-i to love music so thoroughly ! "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said . " It fills [you]0-i with enthusiasm . [I]152-zara used to dislike to read the biographies of [musical people]2395-musical people ; [they]2395-musical people all seemed to find so much fault with [one another]2396-one another , and grudged each other every little bit of praise wrung from [the world]264-the world 's cold , death - doomed lips . It is to [me]152-zara pathetically absurd to see [gifted persons]2398-gifted persons all struggling along , and rudely elbowing [each other]2173-each other out of the way to win - what ? A few stilted commonplace words of approbation or fault - finding in the newspapers of the day , and a little clapping and shouting from [a gathering of ordinary minded persons , who only clap and shout because it is possibly the fashion to do so]2400-a gathering of ordinary minded persons , who only clap and shout because it is possibly the fashion to do so . It is really ludicrous . If the music [the musician]1818-the musician offers to [the public]2402-the public be really great , it will live by itself and defy praise or blame . Because [Schubert]175-schubert died of want and sorrow , that does not interfere with the life of [his]175-schubert creations . Because [Wagner]176-wagner is voted impossible and absurd by many who think [themselves]2395-musical people [good judges of musical art]2403-good judges of musical art , that does not offer any obstacle to the steady spread of [his]176-wagner fame , which is destined to become as universal as that of [Shakespeare]165-shakespeare . [Poor Joachim]146-joachim , [the violinist]2404-the violinist , has got a picture in [[his]146-joachim private house]2405-his private house , in which [Wagner]176-wagner is painted as suffering the tortures of hell ; can anything be more absurd , when [we]2406-we consider how soon [the learned fiddler , who has occupied [his]2407-the learned fiddler , who has occupied his life in playing other people 's compositions life in playing [other people]2386-other people 's compositions]2407-the learned fiddler , who has occupied his life in playing other people 's compositions , will be a handful of forgotten dust , while [multitudes yet to come]2409-multitudes yet to come will shout [their]2409-multitudes yet to come admiration of ' [Tristran]179-tristran ' and ' Parsifal . ' Yes , as [I]152-zara said , [I]152-zara never cared for [musical people]2395-musical people much , till [I]152-zara met [a friend of [[my]152-zara brother]676-my brother 's]2411-a friend of my brother 's - [a man whose inner life was an exquisite harmony]2413-a man whose inner life was an exquisite harmony . "[152-zara]

" [I]0-i know ! "[0-i] [I]0-i interrupted [her]813-her . " [He]2411-a friend of my brother 's wrote the ' Letters of [a Dead Musician]1796-a dead musician . ' "[0-i]

" Yes , "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara . " [I]152-zara suppose [you]0-i saw the book at [[Raffaello]97-cellini 's studio]2415-raffaello 's studio . [Good Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini ! [his]97-cellini is another absolutely ungrudging and unselfish spirit . But [this musician that [I]152-zara speak of]2416-this musician that i speak of was like [a child in humility and reverence]2417-a child in humility and reverence . [Casimir]152-zara told [me]152-zara [he]2416-this musician that i speak of had never sounded so perfect a nature . At one time [he]2416-this musician that i speak of , too , was a little anxious for recognition and praise , and [Casimir]152-zara saw that [he]2416-this musician that i speak of was likely to wreck [himself]2416-this musician that i speak of on that fatal rock of poor ambition . So [he]814-he took [him]2416-this musician that i speak of in hand , and taught [him]2416-this musician that i speak of the meaning of [his]2416-this musician that i speak of work , and why it was especially given [him]2416-this musician that i speak of to do ; and [that man]1875-that man 's life became ' one grand sweet song . ' But there are tears in [your]0-i eyes , [dear]1876-dear ! What have [I]152-zara said to grieve [you]0-i ? "[152-zara]

And [she]814-he caressed [me]0-i tenderly . The tears were indeed thick in [my]0-i eyes , and a minute or two elapsed before [I]0-i could master them . At last [I]0-i raised [my]0-i head and endeavoured to smile .

" They are not sad tears , [Zara]152-zara , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " [I]0-i think they come from a strong desire [I]0-i have to be what [you]152-zara are , what [[your]152-zara brother]2260-your brother is , what [that dead musician]2421-that dead musician must have been . Why , [I]0-i have longed , and do long for fame , for wealth , for [the world]264-the world 's applause , for all the things which [you]152-zara seem to think so petty and mean . How can [I]0-i help it ? Is not fame power ? Is not money a double power , strong to assist one 's self and those one loves ? Is not [the world]264-the world 's favour a necessary means to gain these things ? "[0-i]

[Zara]152-zara 's eyes gleamed with a soft and pitying gentleness .

" Do [you]0-i understand what [you]0-i mean by power ? "[152-zara] [she]152-zara asked . " World 's fame ? [World]2424-world 's wealth ? Will these things make [you]0-i enjoy life ? [You]0-i will perhaps say yes . [I]152-zara tell [you]0-i no . Laurels of earth 's growing fade ; gold of earth 's getting is good for a time , but it palls quickly . Suppose [a man]278-a man rich enough to purchase all the treasures of [the world]264-the world - what then ? [He]278-a man must die and leave [them]278-a man . Suppose [a poet]2427-a poet or [musician so famous that all nations]2428-musician so famous that all nations know and love [him]2427-a poet : [he]2427-a poet too must die , and go where [nations exist no longer]2429-nations exist no longer . And [you]0-i actually would grasp ashes and drink wormwood , [little friend]2430-little friend ? Music , [the heaven - born spirit of pure sound]2431-the heaven - born spirit of pure sound , does not teach [you]0-i so ! "[152-zara]

[I]0-i was silent . The gleam of the strange jewel [Zara]152-zara always wore flashed in [my]0-i eyes like lightning , and anon changed to the similitude of a crimson star . [I]0-i watched it , dreamily fascinated by its unearthly glitter .

" Still , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [you]0-i [yourself]0-i admit that such fame as that of [Shakespeare]165-shakespeare or [Wagner]176-wagner becomes a universal monument to [their]2428-musician so famous that all nations memories . That is something , surely ? "[0-i]

" Not to [them]2428-musician so famous that all nations , "[152-zara] replied [Zara]152-zara ; " [they]2428-musician so famous that all nations have partly forgotten that [they]2428-musician so famous that all nations ever were imprisoned in [such a narrow gaol as [this world]1957-this world]2432-such a narrow gaol as this world . Perhaps [they]2428-musician so famous that all nations do not care to remember it , though memory is part of immortality . "[152-zara]

" Ah ! "[0-i] [I]0-i sighed restlessly ; " [your]152-zara thoughts go beyond [me]0-i , [Zara]152-zara . [I]0-i can not follow [your]152-zara theories . "[0-i]

[Zara]152-zara smiled .

" [We]2434-we will not talk about them any more , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said ; " [you]0-i must tell [Casimir]152-zara - [he]2435-he will teach [you]0-i far better than [I]152-zara can . "[152-zara]

" What shall [I]0-i tell [him]2435-he ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked ; " and what will [he]2435-he teach [me]0-i ? "[0-i]

" [You]0-i will tell [him]2435-he what a high opinion [you]0-i have of [the world]264-the world and its judgments , "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara , " and [he]2435-he will teach [you]0-i that [the world]264-the world is no more than a grain of dust , measured by the standard of [your]0-i own soul . This is no mere platitude - no repetition of the poetical statement ' THE MIND 'S THE STANDARD OF [THE MAN]180-man ; ' it is a fact , and can be proved as completely as that two and two make four . Ask [Casimir]152-zara to set [you]0-i free . "[152-zara]

" To set [me]0-i free ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , surprised .

" Yes ! "[152-zara] and [Zara]152-zara looked at [me]0-i brightly . " [He]2435-he will know if [you]0-i are strong enough to travel ! "[152-zara] And , nodding [her]152-zara head gaily to [me]0-i , [she]152-zara left [the room]385-the room to prepare for the dinner - hour which was fast approaching .

[I]0-i pondered over [her]152-zara words a good deal without arriving at any satisfactory conclusion as to the meaning of them . [I]0-i did not resume the conversation with [her]152-zara , nor did [I]0-i speak to [Heliobas]104-heliobas as yet , and the days went on smoothly and pleasantly till [I]0-i had been nearly a week in residence at [the Hotel Mars]556-the hotel mars . [I]0-i now felt perfectly well and strong , though [Heliobas]104-heliobas continued to give [me]0-i [his]104-heliobas remedies regularly night and morning . [I]0-i began an energetic routine of musical practice : the beautiful piano in [the drawing - room]2283-the drawing - room answered readily to [my]0-i touch , and many a delightful hour slipped by as [I]0-i tried various new difficulties on the key - board , or worked out different combinations of harmony . [I]0-i spent a great deal of [my]0-i time at the organ in [the little chapel]818-the little chapel , the bellows of which were worked by electricity , in a manner that gave not the least trouble , and was perfectly simple of management .

The organ itself was peculiarly sweet in tone , the " vox humana "[0-i] stop especially producing an entrancingly rich and tender sound . The silence , warmth , and beauty of [the chapel]2310-the chapel , with the winter sunlight streaming through [its]2310-the chapel stained windows , and the unbroken solitude [I]0-i enjoyed [there]526-there , all gave fresh impetus to the fancies of [my]0-i brain , and a succession of solemn and tender melodies wove themselves under [my]0-i fingers as a broidered carpet is woven on the loom .

One particular afternoon , [I]0-i was sitting at the instrument as usual , and [my]0-i thoughts began to busy themselves with the sublime tragedy of Calvary . [I]0-i mused , playing softly all the while , on the wonderful , blameless , glorious life that had ended in the shame and cruelty of the Cross , when suddenly , like a cloud swooping darkly across the heaven of [my]0-i thoughts , came the suggestive question : " Is it all true ? Was [Christ]101-god indeed Divine - or is it all a myth , a fable - an imposture ? "[0-i] Unconsciously [I]0-i struck a discordant chord on the organ - a faint tremor shook [me]0-i , and [I]0-i ceased playing . An uncomfortable sensation came over [me]0-i , as of some invisible presence being near [me]0-i and approaching softly , slowly , yet always more closely ; and [I]0-i hurriedly rose from [my]0-i seat , shut the organ , and prepared to leave [the chapel]2310-the chapel , overcome by a strange incomprehensible terror . [I]0-i was glad when [I]0-i found [myself]0-i safely outside the door , and [I]0-i rushed into [the hall]572-the hall as though [I]0-i were being pursued ; yet the oddest part of [my]0-i feeling was , that whoever thus pursued [me]0-i , did so out of love , not enmity , and that [I]0-i was almost wrong in running away . [I]0-i leaned for a moment against one of the columns in [the hall]572-the hall , trying to calm the excited beating of [my]0-i heart , when a deep voice startled [me]0-i :

" So ! [you]0-i are agitated and alarmed ! [Unbelief]181-unbelief is easily scared ! "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i looked up and met the calm eyes of [Heliobas]104-heliobas . [He]104-heliobas appeared to be taller , statelier , more like [a Chaldean prophet]824-a chaldean prophet or [king]825-king than [I]0-i had ever seen [him]104-heliobas before . There was something in [his]104-heliobas steady scrutiny of [my]0-i face that put [me]0-i to a sort of shame , and when [he]104-heliobas spoke again it was in a tone of mild reproof .

" [You]0-i have been led astray , [[my]104-heliobas child]1853-my child , by the conflicting and vain opinions of [mankind]258-mankind . [You]0-i , like many others in [the world]264-the world , delight to question , to speculate , to weigh this , to measure that , with little or no profit to [yourself]0-i or [your]0-i fellow - creatures . And [you]0-i have come freshly from [a land where , in [the great Senate - house]2442-the great senate - house]2441-a land where , in the great senate - house , [a poor perishable lump of clay calling itself [a man]278-a man , dares to stand up boldly and deny the existence of [God]101-god]2443-a poor perishable lump of clay calling itself a man , dares to stand up boldly and deny the existence of god , while [[his]101-god compeers]2445-his compeers , less bold than [he]101-god , pretend a holy displeasure , yet secretly support [him]101-god - all blind worms denying the existence of the sun ; [a land where so - called Religion is split into hundreds of cold and narrow sects , gatherings assembled for the practice of hypocrisy , lip - service and lies - where [Self]182-self , not [the Creator]2447-the creator , is the prime object of worship]2446-a land where so - called religion is split into hundreds of cold and narrow sects , gatherings assembled for the practice of hypocrisy , lip - service and lies - where self , not the creator , is the prime object of worship ; [a land , mighty once among the mightiest , but which now , like an over - ripe pear , hangs loosely on its tree]2448-a land , mighty once among the mightiest , but which now , like an over - ripe pear , hangs loosely on its tree , awaiting but a touch to make it fall ! [A land]2449-a land - let [me]104-heliobas not name it ; - where [the wealthy , high - fed ministers of [the nation]2451-the nation]2450-the wealthy , high - fed ministers of the nation slowly argue away the lives of [better men than [themselves]2450-the wealthy , high - fed ministers of the nation , with vain words of colder and more cruel force than the whirling spears of [untaught savages]2453-untaught savages]2452-better men than themselves , with vain words of colder and more cruel force than the whirling spears of untaught savages ! What have [you]2454-you , [an ardent disciple of music]2455-an ardent disciple of music , to do in [such a land where favouritism and backstair influence win the day over even the merits of a [Schubert]175-schubert]2456-such a land where favouritism and backstair influence win the day over even the merits of a schubert ? Supposing [you]2454-you were [a second Beethoven]2457-a second beethoven , what could [you]2454-you do in [that land]2458-that land without faith or hope ? [that land which is like [a disappointed , churlish , and aged man with tottering feet and purblind eyes]2460-a disappointed , churlish , and aged man with tottering feet and purblind eyes , who has long ago exhausted all enjoyment and sees nothing new under the sun]2459-that land which is like a disappointed , churlish , and aged man with tottering feet and purblind eyes , who has long ago exhausted all enjoyment and sees nothing new under the sun . [The world]264-the world is wide - faith is yet extant - and the teachings of [Christ]101-god are true . ' Believe and live ; doubt and die ! ' That saying is true also . "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i had listened to these words in silence ; but now [I]0-i spoke eagerly and impatiently , remembering what [Zara]152-zara had told [me]0-i .

" Then , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " if [I]0-i have been misguided by modern opinions - if [I]0-i have unconsciously absorbed the doctrines of modern fashionable atheism - lead [me]0-i right . Teach [me]0-i what [you]104-heliobas know . [I]0-i am willing to learn . Let [me]0-i find out the reason of [my]0-i life . SET [ME]0-i FREE ! "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas regarded [me]0-i with earnest solemnity .

" Set [you]0-i free ! "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas murmured , in a low tone . " Do [you]0-i know what [you]0-i ask ? "[104-heliobas]

" No , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , with reckless fervour . " [I]0-i do not know what [I]0-i ask ; but [I]0-i feel that [you]104-heliobas have the power to show [me]0-i the unseen things of [another world]2462-another world . Did [you]104-heliobas not [yourself]104-heliobas tell [me]0-i in [our]2463-our first interview that [you]104-heliobas had let [Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini ' go on a voyage of discovery , and that [he]97-cellini came back perfectly satisfied ? ' Besides , [he]97-cellini told [me]0-i [his]97-cellini history . From [you]104-heliobas [he]97-cellini has gained all that gives [him]97-cellini peace and comfort . [You]104-heliobas possess electric secrets undreamt of by [the world]264-the world . Prove [your]104-heliobas powers upon [me]0-i ; [I]0-i am not afraid . "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas smiled . " Not afraid ! And [you]104-heliobas ran out of [the chapel]2310-the chapel just now as if [you]104-heliobas were pursued by [a fiend]2466-a fiend ! [You]104-heliobas must know that [the only WOMAN [I]104-heliobas ever tried [my]104-heliobas greatest experiment upon]2467-the only woman i ever tried my greatest experiment upon is [[my]104-heliobas sister]614-my sister [Zara]152-zara . [She]826-she was trained and prepared for it in the most careful manner ; and it succeeded . Now "[104-heliobas] - and [Heliobas]104-heliobas looked half - sad , half - triumphant - ' [she]826-she has passed beyond [my]0-i power ; [she]826-she is dominated by one greater than [I.]0-i But [she]826-she can not use [her]826-she force for [others]324-others ; [she]826-she can only employ it to defend [herself]826-she . Therefore , [I]0-i am willing to try [you]828-you if [you]828-you indeed desire it - to see if the same thing will occur to [you]828-you as to [Zara]152-zara ; and [I]0-i firmly believe it will . "[0-i]

A slight tremor came over [me]0-i ; but [I]0-i said with an attempt at indifference :

" [You]104-heliobas mean that [I]0-i shall be dominated also by some great force or influence ? "[0-i]

" [I]104-heliobas think so , "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas musingly . " [Your]828-you nature is more prone to love than to command . Try and follow [me]104-heliobas in the explanation [I]104-heliobas am going to give [you]828-you . Do [you]828-you know some lines by [Shelley]183-shelley that run -[104-heliobas]

" ' Nothing in [the world]264-the world is single , All things by a law divine In one another 's being mingle - Why not [I]0-i with thine ? ' "[0-i]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [I]0-i know the lines well . [I]0-i used to think them very sentimental and pretty . "[0-i]

" They contain , "[104-heliobas] said [Heliobas]104-heliobas , " the germ of a great truth , as many of the most fanciful verses of [the poets]2470-the poets do . As the ' image of a voice ' mentioned in the Book of [Job]184-job hinted at the telephone , and as [Shakespeare]165-shakespeare 's ' girdle round [the earth]374-the earth ' foretold the electric telegraph , so the utterances of the inspired starvelings of [the world]264-the world , known as [poets]2473-poets , suggest many more wonders of [the universe]2474-the universe than may be at first apparent . [Poets]2473-poets must always be [prophets]2476-prophets , or [their]2473-poets calling is in vain . Put this standard of judgment to [the verse - writers of the day]2477-the verse - writers of the day , and where would [they]2473-poets be ? [The English Laureate]185-the english laureate is [no seer]2478-no seer : [he]185-the english laureate is [a mere relater of pretty stories]2479-a mere relater of pretty stories . [Algernon Charles Swinburne]186-swinburne has more fire in [him]186-swinburne , and more wealth of expression , but [he]186-swinburne does not prophesy ; [he]186-swinburne has a clever way of combining Biblical similes with Provengal passion - et voila tout ! [The prophets]2480-the prophets are always poor - the sackcloth and ashes of [the world]264-the world are [their]2480-the prophets portion ; and [their]2480-the prophets bodies moulder a hundred years or more in the grave before [the world]264-the world finds out what [they]2480-the prophets meant by [their]2480-the prophets ravings . But apropos of these lines of [Shelley]183-shelley . [He]186-swinburne speaks of the duality of existence . ' Nothing in [the world]264-the world is single . ' [He]186-swinburne might have gone further , and said nothing in [the universe]2474-the universe is single . Cold and heat , storm and sunshine , good and evil , joy and sorrow - all go in pairs . This double life extends to all the spheres and above the spheres . Do [you]0-i understand ? "[104-heliobas]

" [I]0-i understand what [you]0-i say , "[0-i] [I]0-i said slowly ; " but [I]0-i can not see [your]0-i meaning as applied to [myself]0-i or [yourself]0-i . "[0-i]

" [I]104-heliobas will teach [you]0-i in a few words , "[104-heliobas] went on [Heliobas]104-heliobas . " [You]0-i believe in the soul ? "[104-heliobas]

" Yes . "[104-heliobas]

" Very well . Now realize that there is no soul on [this earth]2485-this earth that is complete , ALONE . Like everything else , it is dual . It is like half a flame that seeks the other half , and is dissatisfied and restless till it attains its object . [Lovers]2486-lovers , misled by the blinding light of Love , think [they]2486-lovers have reached completeness when [they]2486-lovers are united to [the person beloved]2487-the person beloved . Now , in very , very rare cases , perhaps one among a thousand , this desirable result is effected ; but [the majority of [people]1754-people]2488-the majority of people are content with the union of bodies only , and care little or nothing about the sympathy or attachment between [souls]2490-souls . There are [people]1754-people , however , who do care , and who never find [their]1754-people Twin - Flame or companion Spirit at all on [earth]1946-earth , and never will find it . And why ? Because it is not imprisoned in clay ; it is elsewhere . "[104-heliobas]

" Well ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked eagerly .

" Well , [you]0-i seem to ask [me]104-heliobas by [your]0-i eyes what this all means . [I]104-heliobas will apply it at once to [myself]104-heliobas . By [my]104-heliobas researches into human electrical science , [I]104-heliobas discovered that [[MY]104-heliobas companion]2493-my companion , [MY]104-heliobas other half of existence , though not on [earth]1946-earth , was near [me]104-heliobas , and could be commanded by [me]104-heliobas ; and , on being commanded , obeyed . With [Zara]152-zara it was different . [She]152-zara could not COMMAND - [she]152-zara OBEYED ; [she]152-zara was the weaker of the two . With [you]0-i , [I]104-heliobas think it will be the same thing . [Men]273-men sacrifice everything to ambition ; [women]441-women to love . It is natural . [I]104-heliobas see there is much of what [I]104-heliobas have said that appears to have mystified [you]0-i ; it is no good puzzling [your]0-i brain any more about it . No doubt [you]0-i think [I]104-heliobas am talking very wildly about Twin - Flames and Spiritual Affinities that live for [us]2497-us in another sphere . [You]0-i do not believe , perhaps , in the existence of beings in the very air that surrounds [us]2497-us , invisible to ordinary human eyes , yet actually akin to [us]2497-us , with a closer relationship than any tie of blood known on [earth]1946-earth ? "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i hesitated . [Heliobas]104-heliobas saw [my]0-i hesitation , and [his]104-heliobas eyes darkened with a sombre wrath .

" Are [you]0-i one of [those also who must see in order to believe]2499-those also who must see in order to believe ? "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said , half angrily . " Where do [you]0-i suppose [your]0-i music comes from ? Where do [you]0-i suppose any music comes from that is not mere imitation ? [The greatest composers of [the world]264-the world]2500-the greatest composers of the world have been mere receptacles of sound ; and the emptier [they]2500-the greatest composers of the world were of self - love and vanity , the greater quantity of heaven - born melody [they]2500-the greatest composers of the world held . [The German Wagner]176-wagner - did [he]176-wagner not [himself]176-wagner say that [he]176-wagner walked up and down in [the avenues]2502-the avenues , ' trying to catch the harmonies as they floated in the air ' ? Come with [me]104-heliobas - come back to the place [you]0-i left , and [I]104-heliobas will see if [you]0-i , like [Wagner]176-wagner , are able to catch a melody flying . "[104-heliobas]

[He]104-heliobas grasped [my]0-i unresisting arm , and led [me]0-i , half - frightened , half - curious , into [the little chapel]818-the little chapel , where [he]104-heliobas bade [me]0-i seat [myself]0-i at the organ .

" Do not play a single note , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said , " till [you]0-i are compelled . "[104-heliobas]

And standing beside [me]0-i , [Heliobas]104-heliobas laid [his]104-heliobas hands on [my]0-i head , then pressed them on [my]0-i ears , and finally touched [my]0-i hands , that rested passively on the keyboard .

[He]104-heliobas then raised [his]104-heliobas eyes , and uttered the name [I]0-i had often thought of but never mentioned - the name [he]104-heliobas had called upon in [my]0-i dream .

" [Azul]106-azul ! "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said , in a low , penetrating voice , " open the gateways of [the Air]8-the air that [we]2503-we may hear the sound of Song ! "[104-heliobas]

A soft rushing noise of wind answered [his]104-heliobas adjuration . This was followed by a burst of music , transcendently lovely , but unlike any music [I]0-i had ever heard . There were sounds of delicate and entrancing tenderness such as no instrument made by [human hands]830-human hands could produce ; there was singing of clear and tender tone , and of infinite purity such as no human voices could be capable of . [I]0-i listened , perplexed , alarmed , yet entranced . Suddenly [I]0-i distinguished a melody running through the wonderful air - symphonies - a melody like a flower , fresh and perfect . Instinctively [I]0-i touched the organ and began to play it ; [I]0-i found [I]0-i could produce it note for note . [I]0-i forgot all fear in [my]0-i delight , and [I]0-i played on and on in a sort of deepening rapture . Gradually [I]0-i became aware that the strange sounds about [me]0-i were dying slowly away ; fainter and fainter they grew - softer - farther - and finally ceased . But the melody - that one distinct passage of notes [I]0-i had followed out - remained with [me]0-i , and [I]0-i played it again and again with feverish eagerness lest it should escape [me]0-i . [I]0-i had forgotten the presence of [Heliobas]104-heliobas . But a touch on [my]0-i shoulder roused [me]0-i . [I]0-i looked up and met [his]104-heliobas eyes fixed upon , [me]0-i with a steady and earnest regard . A shiver ran through , [me]0-i , and [I]0-i felt bewildered .

" Have [I]0-i lost it ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Lost what ? "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas demanded .

" The tune [I]104-heliobas heard - the harmonies . "[104-heliobas]

" No , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas replied ; " at least [I]104-heliobas think not . But if [you]0-i have , no matter . [You]0-i will hear [others]324-others . Why do [you]0-i look so distressed ? "[104-heliobas]

" It is lovely , "[0-i] [I]0-i said wistfully , " all that music ; but it is not [MINE]0-i ; "[0-i] and tears of regret filled [my]0-i eyes . " Oh , if it were only [mine]0-i - [my]0-i very own composition ! "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas smiled kindly .

" It is as much [yours]0-i as any thing belongs to [anyone]2062-anyone . [Yours]0-i ? why , what can [you]0-i really call [your]0-i own ? Every talent [you]0-i have , every breath [you]0-i draw , every drop of blood flowing in [your]0-i veins , is lent to [you]0-i only ; [you]0-i must pay it all back . And as far as the arts go , it is a bad sign of [poet]2506-poet , [painter]2507-painter , or [musician]2508-musician , who is arrogant enough to call [his]104-heliobas work [his]104-heliobas own . It never was [his]104-heliobas , and never will be . It is planned by [a higher intelligence than [his]104-heliobas]2509-a higher intelligence than his , only [he]104-heliobas happens to be [the hired labourer chosen to carry out the conception]2510-the hired labourer chosen to carry out the conception ; [a sort of [mechanic in whom boastfulness looks absurd]2512-mechanic in whom boastfulness looks absurd ; as absurd as if one of [the stonemasons working at the cornice of [a cathedral]2514-a cathedral]2513-the stonemasons working at the cornice of a cathedral]2511-a sort of mechanic in whom boastfulness looks absurd ; as absurd as if one of the stonemasons working at the cornice of a cathedral were to vaunt [himself]104-heliobas as [the designer of the whole edifice]2515-the designer of the whole edifice . And when a work , any work , is completed , it passes out of [the labourer]2516-the labourer 's hands ; it belongs to the age and [the people for whom it was accomplished]2517-the people for whom it was accomplished , and , if deserving , goes on belonging to future ages and [future peoples]2518-future peoples . So far , and only so far , music is [your]2519-you own . But are [you]2519-you convinced ? or do [you]2519-you think [you]2519-you have been dreaming all that [you]2519-you heard just now ? "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i rose from the organ , closed it gently , and , moved by a sudden impulse , held out both [my]0-i hands to [Heliobas]104-heliobas . [He]104-heliobas took them and held them in a friendly clasp , watching [me]0-i intently as [I]0-i spoke .

" [I]0-i believe in [YOU]104-heliobas , "[0-i] [I]0-i said firmly ; " and [I]0-i know thoroughly well that [I]0-i was not dreaming ; [I]0-i certainly heard strange music , and entrancing voices . But in acknowledging [your]104-heliobas powers over something unseen , [I]0-i must explain to [you]104-heliobas the incredulity [I]0-i at first felt , which [I]0-i believe annoyed [you]104-heliobas . [I]0-i was made sceptical on one occasion , by attending a so - called spiritual seance , where [they]2520-they tried to convince [me]0-i of the truth of table - turning - "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas laughed softly , still holding [my]0-i hands .

" [Your]104-heliobas reason will at once tell [you]104-heliobas that disembodied spirits never become so undignified as to upset furniture or rap on tables . Neither do [they]2520-they write letters in pen and ink and put them under doors . [Spiritual beings]2521-spiritual beings are purely spiritual ; [they]2521-spiritual beings can not touch anything human , much less deal in such vulgar display as the throwing about of chairs , and the opening of locked sideboards . [You]104-heliobas were very rightly sceptical in these matters . But in what [I]104-heliobas have endeavoured to prove to [you]104-heliobas , [you]104-heliobas have no doubts , have [you]104-heliobas ? "[104-heliobas]

" None in [the world]264-the world , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [I]0-i only ask [you]104-heliobas to go on teaching [me]0-i the wonders that seem so familiar to [you]104-heliobas . Let [me]0-i know all [I]0-i may ; and soon ! "[0-i] [I]0-i spoke with trembling eagerness .

" [You]104-heliobas have been only eight days in [the house]2038-the house , [[my]104-heliobas child]1853-my child , "[104-heliobas] said [Heliobas]104-heliobas , loosening [my]0-i hands , and signing [me]0-i to come out of [the chapel]2310-the chapel with [him]104-heliobas ; " and [I]104-heliobas do not consider [you]104-heliobas sufficiently strong as yet for the experiment [you]104-heliobas wish [me]104-heliobas to try upon [you]104-heliobas . Even now [you]104-heliobas are agitated . Wait one week more , and then [you]104-heliobas shall be - "[104-heliobas]

" What ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked impatiently .

" Lifted up , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas replied . " Lifted up above [this little speck called [earth]1946-earth]2525-this little speck called earth . But now , no more of this . Go to [Zara]152-zara ; keep [your]104-heliobas mind well employed ; study , read , and pray - pray much and often in few and simple words , and with as utterly unselfish a heart as [you]104-heliobas can prepare . Think that [you]104-heliobas are going to some high festival , and attire [your]104-heliobas soul in readiness . [I]832-i do not say to [you]104-heliobas ' Have faith ; ' [I]832-i would not compel [your]104-heliobas belief in anything against [your]104-heliobas own will . [You]104-heliobas wish to be convinced of a future existence ; [you]104-heliobas seek proofs ; [you]104-heliobas shall have them . In the meantime avoid all conversation with [me]832-i on the subject . [You]104-heliobas can confide [your]104-heliobas desires to [Zara]152-zara if [you]104-heliobas like ; [her]152-zara experience may be of use to [you]104-heliobas . [You]104-heliobas had best join [her]152-zara now . Au revoir ! "[832-i] and with a kind parting gesture , [he]832-i left [me]0-i .

[I]0-i watched [his]832-i stately figure disappear in the shadow of the passage leading to [[his]832-i own study]833-his own study , and then [I]0-i hastened to [[Zara]152-zara 's room]724-zara 's room . The musical episode in [the chapel]2310-the chapel had certainly startled [me]0-i , and the words of [Heliobas]104-heliobas were full of mysterious meaning ; but , strange to say , [I]0-i was in no way rendered anxious or alarmed by the prospect [I]0-i had before [me]0-i of being " lifted up , "[97-cellini] as [[my]0-i physician]1949-my physician had expressed it . [I]0-i thought of [Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini and [his]97-cellini history , and [I]0-i determined within [myself]0-i that no cowardly hesitation or fear should prevent [me]0-i from making the attempt to see what [he]97-cellini professed to have seen . [I]0-i found [Zara]152-zara reading . [She]152-zara looked up as [I]0-i entered , and greeted [me]0-i with [her]152-zara usual bright smile .

" [You]0-i have had a long practice , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara began ; " [I]152-zara thought [you]0-i were never coming . "[152-zara]

[I]0-i sat down beside [her]152-zara , and related at once all that had happened to [me]0-i that afternoon . [Zara]152-zara listened with deep and almost breathless interest .

" [You]0-i are quite resolved , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said , when [I]0-i had concluded , " to let [Casimir]152-zara exert [his]2527-his force upon [you]0-i ? "[152-zara]

" [I]0-i am quite resolved , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" And [you]152-zara have no fear ? "[152-zara]

" None that [I]152-zara am just now conscious of . "[152-zara]

[Zara]152-zara 's eyes became darker and deeper in the gravity of [her]152-zara intense meditation . At last [she]152-zara said :

" [I]152-zara can help [you]0-i to keep [your]0-i courage firmly to the point , by letting [you]0-i know at once what [Casimir]152-zara will do to [you]0-i . Beyond that [I]152-zara can not go . [You]0-i understand the nature of an electric shock ? "[152-zara]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied .

" Well , there are different kinds of electric shocks - some that are remedial , some that are fatal . There are cures performed by a careful use of the electric battery - again , [people]1754-people are struck dead by lightning , which is the fatal result of electric force . But all this is EXTERNAL electricity ; now what [Casimir]152-zara will use on [you]0-i will be INTERNAL electricity . "[152-zara]

[I]0-i begged [her]152-zara to explain more clearly . [She]152-zara went on :

" [You]0-i have internally a certain amount of electricity , which has been increased recently by the remedies prescribed for [you]0-i by [Casimir]152-zara . But , however much [you]0-i have , [Casimir]152-zara has more , and [he]2529-he will exert [his]2529-he force over [your]0-i force , the greater over [the lesser]2530-the lesser . [You]0-i will experience an INTERNAL electric shock , which , like a sword , will separate in twain body and spirit . The spiritual part of [you]0-i will be lifted up above material forces ; the bodily part will remain inert and useless , till the life , which is actually [YOU]0-i , returns to put its machinery in motion once more . "[152-zara]

" But shall [I]0-i return at all ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked half doubtfully .

" [You]0-i must return , because [God]101-god has fixed the limits of [your]0-i life on [earth]1946-earth , and no human power can alter [His]101-god decree . [Casimir]152-zara 's will can set [you]0-i free for a time , but only for a time . [You]0-i are bound to return , be it never so reluctantly . Eternal liberty is given by Death alone , and [Death]187-death can not be forced to come . "[152-zara]

" How about suicide ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" The suicide , "[152-zara] replied [Zara]152-zara , " has no soul . [He]2529-he kills [his]2529-he body , and by the very act proves that whatever germ of an immortal existence [he]2529-he may have had once , has escaped from its unworthy habitation , and gone , like a flying spark , to find a chance of growth elsewhere . Surely [your]0-i own reason proves this to [you]0-i ? The very animals have more soul than [a man who commits suicide]2532-a man who commits suicide . The beasts of prey slay each other for hunger or in self - defence , but [they]2533-they do not slay [themselves]2533-they . That is a brutality left to [man]282-man alone , with its companion degradation , drunkenness . "[152-zara]

[I]0-i mused awhile in silence .

" In all the wickedness and cruelty of [mankind]258-mankind , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " it is almost a wonder that there is any spiritual existence left on [earth]1946-earth at all . Why should [God]101-god trouble [Himself]101-god to care for such few souls as thoroughly believe in and love [Him]101-god ? - [they]2537-they can be but [a mere handful]2538-a mere handful . "[0-i]

" [Such a mere handful]2539-such a mere handful are worth more than [the world]264-the world to [him]101-god , "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara gravely . " Oh , [[my]152-zara dear]1756-my dear , do not say such things as why should [God]101-god trouble [Himself]101-god ? Why do [you]1756-my dear trouble [yourself]1756-my dear for the safety and happiness of anyone [you]1756-my dear love ? "[152-zara]

[Her]152-zara eyes grew soft and tender , and the jewel [she]152-zara wore glimmered like moonlight on [the sea]1792-the sea . [I]0-i felt a little abashed , and , to change the subject , [I]0-i said :

" Tell [me]0-i , [Zara]152-zara , what is that stone [you]152-zara always wear ? Is it a talisman ? "[0-i]

" It belonged to [a king]2339-a king , "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara , - " at least , it was found in [a king]2339-a king 's coffin . It has been in [[our]2544-our family]2545-our family for generations . [Casimir]152-zara says it is an electric stone - there are such still to be found in [remote parts of [the sea]1792-the sea]2546-remote parts of the sea . Do [you]152-zara like it ? "[152-zara]

" It is very brilliant and lovely , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" When [I]152-zara die , "[152-zara] went on [Zara]152-zara slowly , " [I]152-zara will leave it to [you]152-zara . "[152-zara]

" [I]0-i hope [I]0-i shall have to wait a long time before [I]0-i get it , then , "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed , embracing [her]152-zara affectionately . " Indeed , [I]0-i will pray never to receive it . "[0-i]

" [You]152-zara will pray wrongly , "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara , smiling . " But tell [me]152-zara , do [you]152-zara quite understand from [my]152-zara explanation what [Casimir]152-zara will do to [you]152-zara ? "[152-zara]

" [I]0-i think [I]0-i do . "[0-i]

" And [you]152-zara are not afraid ? "[152-zara]

" Not at all . Shall [I]0-i suffer any pain ? "[0-i]

" No actual pang . [You]152-zara will feel giddy for a moment , and [your]152-zara body will become unconscious . That is all . "[152-zara]

[I]0-i meditated for a few moments , and then looking up , saw [Zara]152-zara 's eyes watching [me]0-i with a wistful inquiring tenderness . [I]0-i answered [her]152-zara look with a smile , and said , half gaily :

" L'audace , l'audace , et toujours l'audace ! That must be [my]0-i motto , [Zara]152-zara . [I]0-i have a chance now of proving how far [a woman]1738-a woman 's bravery can go , and [I]0-i assure [you]152-zara [I]0-i am proud of the opportunity . [[Your]152-zara brother]2260-your brother uttered some very cutting remarks on the general inaptitude of the female sex when [I]0-i first made [his]2260-your brother acquaintance ; so , for the honour of the thing , [I]0-i must follow the path [I]0-i have begun to tread . A plunge into [the unseen world]2550-the unseen world is surely a bold step for [a woman]1738-a woman , and [I]0-i am determined to take it courageously . "[0-i]

" That is well , "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara . " [I]152-zara do not think it possible for [you]0-i ever to regret it . It is growing late - shall [we]838-we prepare for dinner ? "[152-zara]

[I]0-i assented , and [we]838-we separated to [[our]838-we different rooms]839-our different rooms . Before commencing to dress [I]0-i opened the pianette that stood near [my]0-i window , and tried very softly to play the melody [I]0-i had heard in [the chapel]2310-the chapel . To [my]0-i joy it came at once to [my]0-i fingers , and [I]0-i was able to remember every note . [I]0-i did not attempt to write it down - somehow [I]0-i felt sure it would not escape [me]0-i now . A sense of profound gratitude filled [my]0-i heart , and , remembering the counsel given by [Heliobas]104-heliobas , [I]0-i knelt reverently down and thanked [God]101-god for the joy and grace of music . As [I]0-i did so , a faint breath of sound , like a distant whisper of harps played in unison , floated past [my]0-i ears , - then appeared to sweep round in ever - widening circles , till it gradually died away . But it was sweet and entrancing enough for [me]0-i to understand how glorious and full of rapture must have been the star - symphony played on that winter 's night long ago , when [the angels chanted together]841-the angels chanted together , " Glory to [God]101-god in the highest , and on earth peace and good - will to [Man]180-man ! "[841-the angels chanted together]

CHAPTER IX .

AN ELECTRIC SHOCK .

[Prince Ivan Petroffsky]153-prince ivan was [a constant visitor at [the Hotel Mars]556-the hotel mars]842-a constant visitor at the hotel mars , and [I]0-i began to take a certain interest in [him]153-prince ivan , not unmingled with pity , for it was evident that [he]153-prince ivan was hopelessly in love with [[my]0-i beautiful friend]844-my beautiful friend [Zara]152-zara . [She]152-zara received [him]153-prince ivan always with courtesy and kindness ; but [her]152-zara behaviour to [him]153-prince ivan was marked by a somewhat cold dignity , which , like a barrier of ice , repelled the warmth of [his]153-prince ivan admiration and attention . Once or twice , remembering what [he]153-prince ivan had said to [me]0-i , [I]0-i endeavoured to speak to [her]152-zara concerning [him]153-prince ivan and [his]153-prince ivan devotion ; but [she]152-zara so instantly and decisively turned the conversation that [I]0-i saw [I]0-i should displease [her]152-zara if [I]0-i persisted in it . [Heliobas]104-heliobas appeared to be really attached to [the Prince]708-the prince , at which [I]0-i secretly wondered ; [the worldly and frivolous young nobleman]846-the worldly and frivolous young nobleman was of so entirely different a temperament to that of [the thoughtful and studious Chaldean philosopher]847-the thoughtful and studious chaldean philosopher . Yet there was evidently some mysterious attraction between [them]848-them - [the Prince]708-the prince appeared to be profoundly interested in electric theories and experiments , and [Heliobas]104-heliobas never wearied of expounding them to so attentive [a listener]850-a listener . The wonderful capabilities of the dog [Leo]100-leo also were brought into constant requisition for [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan 's benefit , and without doubt they were most remarkable . This animal , commanded - or , [I]0-i should say , brain - electrified - by [Heliobas]104-heliobas , would fetch anything that was named to [him]153-prince ivan through [[his]153-prince ivan master]1772-his master 's force , providing it was light enough for [him]153-prince ivan to carry ; and [he]153-prince ivan would go into [the conservatory]383-the conservatory and pluck off with [his]153-prince ivan teeth any rare or common flower within [his]153-prince ivan reach that was described to [him]153-prince ivan by the same means . Spoken to or commanded by [others]324-others , [he]153-prince ivan was simply [a good - natured intelligent Newfoundland]854-a good - natured intelligent newfoundland ; but under the authority of [Heliobas]104-heliobas , [he]153-prince ivan became more than human in ready wit and quick obedience , and would have brought in a golden harvest to any great circus or menagerie .

[He]153-prince ivan was a never - failing source of wonder and interest to [me]0-i , and even more so to [the Prince]708-the prince , who made [him]153-prince ivan the subject of many an abstruse and difficult discussion with [[his]708-the prince friend]856-his friend [Casimir]152-zara . [I]0-i noticed that [Zara]152-zara seemed to regret the frequent companionship of [Ivan Petroffsky]153-prince ivan and [[her]152-zara brother]703-her brother , and a shade of sorrow or vexation often crossed [her]152-zara fair face when [she]152-zara saw [them]858-them together absorbed in conversation or argument .

One evening a strange circumstance occurred which startled and deeply impressed [me]0-i . [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan had dined with [us]859-us ; [he]153-prince ivan was in extraordinarily high spirits - [his]153-prince ivan gaiety was almost boisterous , and [his]153-prince ivan face was deeply flushed . [Zara]152-zara glanced at [him]153-prince ivan half indignantly more than once when [his]153-prince ivan laughter became unusually uproarious , and [I]0-i saw that [Heliobas]104-heliobas watched [him]153-prince ivan closely and half - inquiringly , as if [he]104-heliobas thought there was something amiss .

[The Prince]708-the prince , however , heedless of [[his]708-the prince host]731-his host 's observant eye , tossed off glass after glass of wine , and talked incessantly . After dinner , when [we]859-us all assembled in [the drawing - room]2283-the drawing - room , [he]708-the prince seated [himself]708-the prince at the piano without being asked , and sang several songs . Whether [he]708-the prince were influenced by drink or strong excitement , [his]708-the prince voice at any rate showed no sign of weakness or deterioration . Never had [I]0-i heard [him]708-the prince sing so magnificently . [He]708-the prince seemed possessed not by [an angel but by a demon of song]863-an angel but by a demon of song . It was impossible not to listen to [him]708-the prince , and while listening , equally impossible not to admire [him]708-the prince . [Even [Zara]152-zara , who was generally indifferent to [his]708-the prince music]152-zara , became , on this particular night , fascinated into a sort of dreamy attention . [He]708-the prince perceived this , and suddenly addressed [himself]708-the prince to [her]152-zara in softened tones which bore no trace of their previous loudness .

" [Madame]1750-madame , [you]1750-madame honour [me]708-the prince to - night by listening to [my]708-the prince poor efforts . It is seldom [I]708-the prince am thus rewarded ! "[708-the prince]

[Zara]152-zara flushed deeply , and then grew very pale .

" Indeed , [Prince]153-prince ivan , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara answered quietly , " [you]153-prince ivan mistake [me]152-zara . [I]152-zara always listen with pleasure to [your]153-prince ivan singing - to - night , perhaps , [my]152-zara mood is more fitted to music than is usual with [me]152-zara , and thus [I]152-zara may appear to [you]153-prince ivan to be more attentive . But [your]153-prince ivan voice always delights [me]152-zara as it must delight [everybody who hears it]2553-everybody who hears it . "[152-zara]

" While [you]153-prince ivan are in a musical mood then , "[153-prince ivan] returned [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan , " let [me]153-prince ivan sing [you]153-prince ivan an English song - one of the loveliest ever penned . [I]153-prince ivan have set it to music [myself]153-prince ivan , as such words are not of the kind to suit [ordinary composers]2554-ordinary composers or [publishers]2555-publishers ; they are too much in earnest , too passionate , too full of real human love and sorrow . The songs that suit [modern drawing - rooms and [concert - halls]2557-concert - halls]2556-modern drawing - rooms and concert - halls , as a rule , are those that are full of sham sentiment - a real , strong , throbbing HEART pulsing through a song is too terribly exciting for lackadaisical society . Listen ! "[153-prince ivan] And , playing a dreamy , murmuring prelude like the sound of a brook flowing through [a hollow cavern]864-a hollow cavern , [he]153-prince ivan sang [Swinburne]186-swinburne 's " Leave - Taking , "[153-prince ivan] surely one of the saddest and most beautiful poems in the English language .

[He]153-prince ivan subdued [his]153-prince ivan voice to suit the melancholy hopelessness of the lines , and rendered it with so much intensity of pathetic expression that it was difficult to keep tears from filling the eyes . When [he]153-prince ivan came to the last verse , the anguish of a wasted life seemed to declare itself in the complete despair of [his]153-prince ivan low vibrating tones :

" Let [us]2558-us go hence and rest ; [she]152-zara will not love . [She]152-zara shall not hear [us]2558-us if [we]2558-us sing hereof , Nor see love 's ways , how sore they are and steep . Come hence , let be , lie still ; it is enough . Love is [a barren sea]2559-a barren sea , bitter and deep ; And though [she]152-zara saw all heaven in flower above , [She]152-zara would not love ! "[153-prince ivan]

The deep melancholy of the music and the quivering pathos of the deep baritone voice were so affecting that it was almost a relief when the song ceased . [I]0-i had been looking out of the window at the fantastic patterns of the moonlight on [the garden walk]865-the garden walk , but now [I]0-i turned to see in [Zara]152-zara 's face [her]152-zara appreciation of what [we]866-we had just heard . To [my]0-i surprise [she]152-zara had left [the room]385-the room . [Heliobas]104-heliobas reclined in [his]104-heliobas easy - chair , glancing up and down the columns of the Figaro ; and [the Prince]708-the prince still sat at the piano , moving [his]708-the prince fingers idly up and down the keys without playing . The little page entered with a letter on a silver salver . It was for [[his]708-the prince master]1772-his master . [Heliobas]104-heliobas read it quickly , and rose , saying :

" [I]708-the prince must leave [you]0-i to entertain [yourselves]0-i for ten minutes while [I]708-the prince answer this letter . Will [you]0-i excuse [me]708-the prince ? "[708-the prince] and with the ever - courteous salute to [us]866-we which was part of [his]708-the prince manner , [he]708-the prince left [the room]385-the room .

[I]0-i still remained at the window . [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan still dumbly played the piano . There were a few minutes of absolute silence . Then [the Prince]708-the prince hastily got up , shut the piano , and approached [me]0-i .

" Do [you]0-i know where [Zara]152-zara is ? "[708-the prince] [he]708-the prince demanded in a low , fierce tone .

[I]0-i looked at [him]708-the prince in surprise and a little alarm - [he]708-the prince spoke with so much suppressed anger , and [his]708-the prince eyes glittered so strangely .

" No , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered frankly . " [I]0-i never saw [her]152-zara leave [the room]385-the room . "[0-i]

" [I]708-the prince did , "[708-the prince] [he]708-the prince said . " [She]152-zara slipped out like a ghost , or [a witch]2561-a witch , or [an angel]284-an angel , while [I]708-the prince was singing the last verse of [Swinburne]186-swinburne 's song . Do [you]708-the prince know [Swinburne]186-swinburne , mademoiselle ? "[708-the prince]

" No , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , wondering at [his]708-the prince manner more and more . " [I]0-i only know [him]186-swinburne , as [you]708-the prince do , to be [a poet]2427-a poet . "[0-i]

" [Poet]2506-poet , [madman]2565-madman , or [lover]2566-lover - all three should be [one and the same thing]2567-one and the same thing , "[708-the prince] muttered [the Prince]708-the prince , clenching and unclenching that strong right hand of [his]708-the prince on which sparkled a diamond like a star . " [I]708-the prince have often wondered if [poets]2473-poets feel what [they]2473-poets write - whether [Swinburne]186-swinburne , for instance , ever felt the weight of a dead cold thing within [him]708-the prince HERE , "[708-the prince] slightly touching the region of [his]708-the prince heart , " and realized that [he]708-the prince had to drag that corpse of unburied love with [him]708-the prince everywhere - even to the grave , and beyond - O God ! - beyond the grave ! "[0-i] [I]0-i touched [him]708-the prince gently on the arm . [I]0-i was full of pity for [him]708-the prince - [his]708-the prince despair was so bitter and keen .

" [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [you]153-prince ivan are excited and overwrought . [Zara]152-zara meant no slight to [you]153-prince ivan in leaving [the room]385-the room before [your]153-prince ivan song was finished . [I]0-i am quite sure of that . [She]873-she is kindness itself - [her]873-she nature is all sweetness and gentleness . [She]873-she would not willingly offend [you]153-prince ivan - "[0-i]

" Offend [me]708-the prince ! "[708-the prince] [he]708-the prince exclaimed ; ' [she]873-she could not offend [me]0-i if [she]873-she tried . [She]873-she could tread upon [me]0-i , stab [me]0-i , slay [me]0-i , but never offend [me]0-i . [I]0-i see [you]874-you are sorry for [me]0-i - and [I]0-i thank [you]874-you . [I]0-i kiss [your]874-you hand for [your]874-you gentle pity , [mademoiselle]1745-mademoiselle . "[0-i]

And [he]708-the prince did so , with a knightly grace that became [him]708-the prince well . [I]0-i thought [his]708-the prince momentary anger was passing , but [I]0-i was mistaken . Suddenly [he]708-the prince raised [his]708-the prince arm with a fierce gesture , and exclaimed :

" By heaven ! [I]708-the prince will wait no longer . [I]708-the prince am [a fool]2570-a fool to hesitate . [I]708-the prince may wait a century before [I]708-the prince draw out of [Casimir]152-zara the secret that would enable [me]708-the prince to measure swords with [[my]708-the prince rival]2571-my rival . Listen ! "[708-the prince] and [he]708-the prince grasped [my]0-i shoulder roughly . " Stay here , [you]0-i ! If [Casimir]152-zara returns , tell [him]708-the prince [I]708-the prince have gone for a walk of half an hour . Play to [him]708-the prince - keep [him]708-the prince occupied - be [[my]708-the prince friend]365-my friend in this one thing - [I]708-the prince trust [you]0-i . Let [him]708-the prince not seek for [Zara]152-zara , or for [me]708-the prince . [I]708-the prince shall not be long absent . "[708-the prince]

" Stay ! "[0-i] [I]0-i whispered hurriedly , " What are [you]0-i going to do ? Surely [you]0-i know the power of [Heliobas]104-heliobas . [He]104-heliobas is supreme [here]1773-here . [He]104-heliobas could find out anything [he]104-heliobas chose . [He]104-heliobas could - - "[0-i]

[Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan looked at [me]0-i fixedly .

" Will [you]0-i swear to [me]153-prince ivan that [you]0-i actually do not know ? "[153-prince ivan]

" Know what ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , perplexed .

[He]153-prince ivan laughed bitterly , sarcastically .

" Did [you]0-i ever hear that line of poetry which speaks of ' [A woman]1738-a woman wailing for [[her]1738-a woman demon - lover]2575-her demon - lover ' ? That is what [Zara]152-zara does . Of one thing [I]153-prince ivan am certain - [she]152-zara does not wail or wait long ; [he]104-heliobas comes quickly . "[153-prince ivan]

" What do [you]153-prince ivan mean ? "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed , utterly mystified . " Who comes quickly ? [I]0-i am sure [you]153-prince ivan do not know what [you]153-prince ivan are talking about . "[0-i]

" [I]153-prince ivan DO know , "[153-prince ivan] [he]153-prince ivan replied firmly ; " and [I]153-prince ivan am going to prove [my]153-prince ivan knowledge . Remember what [I]153-prince ivan have asked [you]0-i . "[153-prince ivan] And without another word or look , [he]153-prince ivan threw open the velvet curtains of the portiere , and disappeared behind them .

Left to [myself]0-i , [I]0-i felt very nervous and excited . All sorts of odd fancies came into [my]0-i head , and would not go away , but danced about like Will - o'-the - wisps on a morass . What did [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan mean ? Was [he]153-prince ivan mad ? or had [he]153-prince ivan drunk too much wine ? What strange illusion had [he]153-prince ivan in [his]153-prince ivan mind about [Zara]152-zara and [a demon]876-a demon ? Suddenly a thought flashed upon [me]0-i that made [me]0-i tremble from head to foot . [I]0-i remembered what [Heliobas]104-heliobas had said about twin flames and dual affinities ; and [I]0-i also reflected that [he]104-heliobas had declared [Zara]152-zara to be dominated by [a more powerful force than [his]104-heliobas own]877-a more powerful force than his own . But then , [I]0-i had accepted it as a matter of course that , whatever the force was , it must be for good , not evil , over a being so pure , so lovely and so intelligent as [Zara]152-zara .

[I]0-i knew and felt that there were good and evil forces . Now , suppose [Zara]152-zara were commanded by some strange evil thing , unguessed at , undreamt of in the wildest night - mare ? [I]0-i shuddered as with icy cold . It could not be . [I]0-i resolutely refused to admit such a fearful conjecture . Why , [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i , with a faint smile , [I]0-i was no better in [my]0-i imaginings than the so virtuous and ever - respectable Suzanne Michot of whom [Madame Denise]139-madame denise had spoken . Still the hateful thought came back again and again , and refused to go away .

[I]0-i went to [[my]0-i old place]878-my old place at the window and looked out . The moonlight fell in cold slanting rays ; but an army of dark clouds were hurrying up from the horizon , looking in their weird shapes like the mounted Walkyres in [Wagner]176-wagner 's " Niebelungen Ring , "[176-wagner] galloping to [Walhalla]31-walhalla with the bodies of [dead warriors slung before [them]880-them]879-dead warriors slung before them . A low moaning wind had arisen , and was beginning to sob round [the house]2038-the house like [the Banshee]188-the banshee . Hark ! what was that ? [I]0-i started violently . Surely that was a faint shriek ? [I]0-i listened intently . Nothing but the wind rustling among some creaking branches .

" [A woman]1738-a woman wailing for [her]1738-a woman demon - lover . "[0-i]

How that line haunted [me]0-i ! And with , it there slowly grew up in [my]0-i mind a black looming horror ; an idea , vague and ghastly , that froze [my]0-i blood and turned [me]0-i faint and giddy . Suppose , when [I]0-i had consented to be experimented upon by [Heliobas]104-heliobas - when [my]0-i soul in the electric trance was lifted up to [the unseen world]2550-the unseen world - suppose an evil force , terrible and all - compelling , were to dominate [ME]0-i and hold [me]0-i forever and ever ! [I]0-i gasped for breath ! Oh , so much the more need of prayer !

" Pray much and often , with as unselfish a heart as [you]0-i can prepare . "[0-i]

Thus [Heliobas]104-heliobas had said ; and [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i , if [all those who were on the brink of great sin or crime]883-all those who were on the brink of great sin or crime could only be brought to feel beforehand what [I]0-i felt when facing the spectral dread of unknown evil , then surely sins would be fewer and crimes never committed . And [I]0-i murmured softly , " Lead [us]2577-us not into temptation , but deliver [us]2577-us from evil . "[0-i]

The mere utterance of these words seemed to calm and encourage [me]0-i ; and as [I]0-i gazed up at the sky again , with its gathering clouds , one star , like a bright consoling eye , looked at [me]0-i , glittering cheerfully amid the surrounding darkness .

More than ten minutes had elapsed since [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan had left [the room]385-the room , and there was no sound of returning footsteps . And where was [Zara]152-zara ? [I]0-i determined to seek [her]152-zara . [I]0-i was free to go anywhere in [the house]2038-the house , only avoiding [[her]152-zara studio]690-her studio during [her]152-zara hours of work ; and [she]152-zara never worked at night . [I]0-i would go to [her]152-zara and confide all [my]0-i strange thoughts and terrors to [her]152-zara friendly sympathy . [I]0-i hurried through [the hall]572-the hall and up the staircase quickly , and should have gone straight into [[Zara]152-zara 's boudoir]888-zara 's boudoir had [I]0-i not heard a sound of voices which caused [me]0-i to stop precipitately outside the door . [Zara]152-zara was speaking . [Her]152-zara low , musical accents fell like a silver chime on the air .

" [I]152-zara have told [you]0-i , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said , " again and again that it is impossible . [You]0-i waste [your]0-i life in the pursuit of [a phantom]2578-a phantom ; for a phantom [I]152-zara must be to [you]0-i always - a mere dream , not [a woman such as [your]0-i love]2579-a woman such as your love would satisfy . [You]0-i are [a strong man , in sound health and spirits]2580-a strong man , in sound health and spirits ; [you]0-i care for [the world]264-the world and the things that are in it . [I]152-zara do not . [You]0-i would make [me]152-zara happy , [you]0-i say . No doubt [you]0-i would do [your]0-i best - [your]0-i wealth and influence , [your]0-i good looks , [your]0-i hospitable and friendly nature would make [most women]2582-most women happy . But what should [I]152-zara care for [[your]0-i family]2583-your family diamonds ? for [your]0-i surroundings ? for [your]0-i ambitions ? The society of [the world]264-the world fills [me]152-zara with disgust and prejudice . Marriage , as [the world]264-the world considers it , shocks and outrages [my]152-zara self - respect ; the idea of a bodily union without that of [souls]2490-souls is to [me]152-zara repulsive and loathsome . Why , therefore , waste [your]0-i time in seeking a love which does not exist , which never will exist for [you]0-i ? "[152-zara]

[I]0-i heard the deep , passionate tones of [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan in answer :

" One light kindles another , [Zara]152-zara ! The sunlight melts the snow ! [I]153-prince ivan can not believe but that a long and faithful love may - nay , MUST - have its reward at last . Even according to [[your]0-i brother]2260-your brother 's theories , the emotion of love is capable of powerful attraction . Can not [I]153-prince ivan hope that [my]153-prince ivan passion - so strong , so great , so true , [Zara]152-zara ! - will , with patience , draw [you]152-zara , star of [my]153-prince ivan life , closer and closer , till [I]153-prince ivan at last call [you]152-zara mine ? "[153-prince ivan]

[I]0-i heard the faint rustle of [Zara]152-zara 's silk robe , as though [she]152-zara were moving farther from [him]153-prince ivan .

" [You]0-i speak ignorantly , [Prince]2309-prince . [Your]0-i studies with [Casimir]152-zara appear to have brought [you]0-i little knowledge . Attraction ! How can [you]0-i attract what is not in [your]0-i sphere ? As well ask for the Moons of [Jupiter]32-jupiter or the Ring of [Saturn]33-saturn ! The laws of attraction and repulsion , [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan , are fixed by a higher authority than [yours]0-i , and [you]0-i are as powerless to alter or abate [them]2589-them by one iota , as [a child]369-a child is powerless to repel the advancing waves of [the sea]1792-the sea . "[152-zara]

[Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan spoke again , and [his]153-prince ivan voice quivered , with suppressed anger .

" [You]152-zara may talk as [you]152-zara will , [beautiful Zara]152-zara ; but [you]152-zara shall never persuade [me]153-prince ivan against [my]153-prince ivan reason .
