And now , "[0-i] [I]0-i added , loosening [my]0-i clasp of [her]152-zara , " have [I]0-i guessed well ? "[0-i]

[Zara]152-zara looked meditative .

" [I]152-zara do not know , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said , " why [you]0-i should imagine - "[152-zara]

" Stop ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed ; " there is no imagination in the case . [I]0-i have reasoned it out . Here is a book [I]0-i found in [the library]2646-the library on electric organs as they are discovered to exist in certain fish . Listen : ' [They]2647-they are nervous apparatuses which in the arrangement of [their]2647-they parts may be compared to a Voltaic pile . [They]2647-they develop electricity and give electrical discharges . ' "[0-i]

" Well ! "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara .

" [You]0-i say ' Well ! ' as if [you]0-i did not know ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed half - angrily , half - laughingly . " These fish have helped [me]0-i to understand a great deal , [I]0-i assure [you]152-zara . [[Your]152-zara brother]2260-your brother must have discovered the seed or commencement of electrical organs like those described , in [the human body]2649-the human body ; and [he]2260-your brother has cultivated them in [you]152-zara and in [himself]2260-your brother , and has brought [them]2647-they to a high state of perfection . [He]2260-your brother has cultivated them in [Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini , and [he]2260-your brother is beginning to cultivate them in [me]0-i , and [I]0-i hope most sincerely [he]2260-your brother will succeed . [I]0-i think [his]2260-your brother theory is a magnificent one ! "[0-i]

[Zara]152-zara gazed seriously at [me]0-i , and [her]152-zara large eyes seemed to grow darker with the intensity of [her]152-zara thought .

" Supposing [you]0-i had reasoned out the matter correctly , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said - " and [I]152-zara will not deny that [you]0-i have done a great deal towards the comprehension of it - have [you]0-i no fear ? do [you]0-i not include some drawbacks in even [Casimir]152-zara 's learning such a secret , and being able to cultivate and educate such a deadly force as that of electricity in [the human being]2650-the human being ? "[152-zara]

" If it is deadly , it is also life - giving , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " Remedies are also poisons . [You]0-i laid [the Prince]708-the prince senseless at [your]0-i feet , but [[your]0-i brother]2260-your brother raised [him]708-the prince up again . Both these things were done by electricity . [I]0-i can understand it all now ; [I]0-i see no obscurity , no mystery . And oh , what a superb discovery it is ! "[0-i]

[Zara]152-zara smiled .

" [You]0-i enthusiast ! "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said , " it is nothing new . It was well known to [the ancient Chaldeans]2653-the ancient chaldeans . It was known to [Moses]191-moses and [[his]191-moses followers]2654-his followers ; it was practised in perfection by [Christ]101-god and [[His]101-god disciples]2655-his disciples . To modern civilization it may seem a discovery , because the tendency Of all so - called progress is to forget the past . The scent of [the human savage]2656-the human savage is extraordinarily keen - keener than that of any animal - [he]2656-the human savage can follow a track unerringly by some odour [he]2656-the human savage is able to detect in the air . Again , [he]2656-the human savage can lay back [his]2656-the human savage ears to the wind and catch a faint , far - off sound with , certainty and precision , and tell [you]0-i what it is . [Civilized beings]2657-civilized beings have forgotten all this ; [they]2657-civilized beings can neither smell nor hear with actual keenness . Just in the same way , [they]2657-civilized beings have forgotten the use of the electrical organs [they]2657-civilized beings all indubitably possess in large or minute degree . As the muscles of the arm are developed by practice , so can the wonderful internal electrical apparatus of [man]282-man be strengthened and enlarged by use . The world in [its]2659-its youth knew this ; the world in [its]2659-its age forgets , as [an old man]2660-an old man forgets or smiles disdainfully at the past sports of [his]2660-an old man childhood . But do not let [us]2661-us talk any more to - night . If [you]0-i think [your]0-i ideas of [me]152-zara are correct - - "[152-zara]

" [I]0-i am sure they are ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried triumphantly .

[Zara]152-zara held out [her]152-zara arms to [me]0-i .

" And [you]0-i are sure [you]0-i love [me]152-zara ? "[152-zara] [she]152-zara asked .

[I]0-i nestled into [her]152-zara embrace and kissed [her]152-zara .

" Sure ! "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " [Zara]152-zara , [I]0-i love and honour [you]152-zara more than [any woman [I]0-i ever met or ever shall meet]2662-any woman i ever met or ever shall meet . And [you]0-i love [me]0-i - [I]0-i know [you]0-i do ! "[0-i]

" How can [I]152-zara help it ? "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said . " Are [you]0-i not one of [us]2663-us ? Good - night , [dearest]2664-dearest ! Sleep well ! "[152-zara]

" Good - night ! "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " And remember [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan asked for [your]0-i pardon . "[0-i]

" [I]152-zara remember ! "[152-zara] [she]152-zara replied softly . " [I]152-zara have already pardoned [him]153-prince ivan , and [I]152-zara will pray for [him]153-prince ivan . "[152-zara] And a sort of radiant pity and forbearance illumined [her]152-zara lovely features , as [we]923-we parted for the night . So might [an angel]284-an angel look on [some repentant sinner]925-some repentant sinner pleading for [Heaven]192-heaven 's forgiveness .

[I]0-i lay awake for some time that night , endeavouring to follow out the track of thought [I]0-i had entered upon in [my]0-i conversation with [Zara]152-zara . With such electricity as [Heliobas]104-heliobas practised , once admitting that human electric force existed , a fact which [no reasoning person]926-no reasoning person could deny , all things were possible . Even a knowledge of superhuman events might be attained , if there were anything in [the universe]2474-the universe that WAS superhuman ; and surely it would be arrogant and ignorant to refuse to contemplate such a probability . At one time [people]1754-people mocked at the wild idea that a message could flash in a moment of time from [one side of [the Atlantic]35-the atlantic]929-one side of the atlantic to the other by means of a cable laid under [the sea]1792-the sea ; now that it is an established fact , [the world]264-the world has grown accustomed to it , and has ceased to regard it as a wonder . Granting human electricity to exist , why should not a communication be established , like a sort of spiritual Atlantic cable , between [man]282-man and [the beings of other spheres and other solar systems]933-the beings of other spheres and other solar systems ? The more [I]0-i reflected on the subject the more lost [I]0-i became in daring speculations concerning [that other world]934-that other world , to which [I]0-i was soon to be lifted . Then in a sort of half - doze , [I]0-i fancied [I]0-i saw an interminable glittering chain of vivid light composed of circles that were all looped one in another , which seemed to sweep round [the realms of space]935-the realms of space and to tie up the sun , moon , and stars like flowers in a ribbon of fire . After much anxious and humble research , [I]0-i found [myself]0-i to be one of the smallest links in this great chain . [I]0-i do not know whether [I]0-i was grateful or afraid at this discovery , for sleep put an end to [my]0-i drowsy fancies , and dropped a dark curtain over [my]0-i waking dreams .

CHAPTER X.

[MY]0-i STRANGE DEPARTURE .

The next morning brought [me]0-i two letters ; one from [Mrs. Everard]152-zara , telling [me]0-i that [she]152-zara and [the Colonel]1857-the colonel had resolved on coming to [Paris]5-paris .

" [All the nice people]2665-all the nice people are going away from here , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara wrote . " [Madame Didier]107-madame didier and [[her]107-madame didier husband]317-her husband have started for [Naples]36-naples ; and , to crown [our]2667-we lonesomeness , [Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini packed up all [his]97-cellini traps , and left [us]2667-we yesterday morning en route for [Rome]6-rome . The weather continues to be delicious ; but as [you]2668-you seem to be getting on so well in [Paris]5-paris , in spite of the cold there , [we]2667-we have made up [our]2667-we minds to join [you]2668-you , the more especially as [I]152-zara want to renovate [my]152-zara wardrobe . [We]2667-we shall go straight to [the Grand Hotel]629-the grand hotel ; and [I]152-zara am writing to [Mrs. Challoner]156-mrs. challoner by this post , asking [her]156-mrs. challoner to get [us]2667-we [rooms]617-rooms . [We]2667-we are so glad [you]2668-you are feeling nearly recovered - of course , [you]2668-you must not leave [[your]2668-you physician]2624-your physician till [you]2668-you are quite ready . At any rate , [we]2667-we shall not arrive till the end of next week . "[152-zara]

[I]0-i began to calculate . During that strange interview in [the chapel]2310-the chapel , [Heliobas]104-heliobas had said that in eight days more [I]0-i should be strong enough to undergo the transmigration [he]104-heliobas had promised to effect upon [me]0-i . Those eight days were now completed on this very morning . [I]0-i was glad of this ; for [I]0-i did not care to see [Mrs. Everard]152-zara or [anyone]2062-anyone till the experiment was over . The other letter [I]0-i received was from [Mrs. Challoner]156-mrs. challoner , who asked [me]0-i to give an " Improvisation "[156-mrs. challoner] at [the Grand Hotel]629-the grand hotel that day fortnight .

When [I]0-i went down to breakfast , [I]0-i mentioned both these letters , and said , addressing [myself]0-i to [Heliobas]104-heliobas :

" Is it not rather a sudden freak of [Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini 's to leave [Cannes]4-cannes ? [We]2672-we all thought [he]97-cellini was settled for the winter there . Did [you]156-mrs. challoner know [he]97-cellini was going to [Rome]6-rome ? "[0-i]

" Yes , "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas , as [he]104-heliobas stirred [his]104-heliobas coffee abstractedly . " [I]104-heliobas knew [he]97-cellini was going [there]526-there some day this month ; [his]97-cellini presence is required [there]526-there on business . "[104-heliobas]

" And are [you]156-mrs. challoner going to give the Improvisation this [Mrs. Challoner]156-mrs. challoner asks [you]156-mrs. challoner for ? "[152-zara] inquired [Zara]152-zara .

[I]0-i glanced at [Heliobas]104-heliobas . [He]104-heliobas answered for [me]0-i .

" [I]104-heliobas should certainly give it if [I]104-heliobas were [you]0-i , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said quietly : " there will be nothing to prevent [your]0-i doing so at the date named . "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i was relieved . [I]0-i had not been altogether able to divest [myself]0-i of the idea that [I]0-i might possibly never come out alive from the electric trance to which [I]0-i had certainly consented ; and this assurance on the part of [Heliobas]104-heliobas was undoubtedly comforting . [We]940-we were all very silent that morning ; [we]940-we all wore grave and preoccupied expressions . [Zara]152-zara was very pale , and appeared lost in thought . [Heliobas]104-heliobas , too , looked slightly careworn , as though [he]104-heliobas had been up all night , engaged in some brain - exhausting labour . No mention was made of [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan ; [we]940-we avoided [his]153-prince ivan name by a sort of secret mutual understanding . When the breakfast was over , [I]0-i looked with a fearless smile at the calm face of [Heliobas]104-heliobas , which appeared nobler and more dignified than ever with that slight touch of sadness upon it , and said softly :

" The eight days are accomplished ! "[104-heliobas]

[He]104-heliobas met [my]0-i gaze fully , with a steady and serious observation of [my]0-i features , and replied :

" [[My]104-heliobas child]1853-my child , [I]104-heliobas am aware of it . [I]104-heliobas expect [you]1853-my child in [[my]104-heliobas private room]2676-my private room at noon . In the meantime speak to [no one]1820-no one - not even to [Zara]152-zara ; read no books ; touch no note of music . [The chapel]2310-the chapel has been prepared for [you]1853-my child ; go [there]526-there and pray . When [you]1853-my child see a small point of light touch the extreme edge of the cross upon the altar , it will be twelve o'clock , and [you]1853-my child will then come to [me]104-heliobas . "[104-heliobas]

With these words , uttered in a grave and earnest tone , [he]104-heliobas left [me]0-i . A sensation of sudden awe stole upon [me]0-i . [I]0-i looked at [Zara]152-zara . [She]152-zara laid [her]152-zara finger on [her]152-zara lips and smiled , enjoining silence ; then drawing [my]0-i hand close within [her]152-zara own , [she]152-zara led [me]0-i to the door of [the chapel]2310-the chapel . There [she]152-zara took a soft veil of some white transparent fabric , and flung it over [me]0-i , embracing and kissing [me]0-i tenderly as [she]152-zara did so , but uttering no word . Taking [my]0-i hand again , [she]152-zara entered [the chapel]2310-the chapel with [me]0-i , and accompanied [me]0-i through what seemed a blaze of light and colour to the high altar , before which was placed a prie - dieu of crimson velvet . Motioning [me]0-i to kneel , [she]152-zara kissed [me]0-i once more through the filmy veil that covered [me]0-i from head to foot ; then turning noiselessly away [she]152-zara disappeared , and [I]0-i heard the heavy oaken door close behind [her]152-zara . Left alone , [I]0-i was able to quietly take note of everything around [me]0-i . The altar before which [I]0-i knelt was ablaze with lighted candles , and a wealth of the purest white flowers decorated [it]943-it , mingling their delicious fragrance with the faintly perceptible odour of incense . On all sides of [the chapel]2310-the chapel , in every little niche , and at [every shrine]945-every shrine , tapers were burning like fireflies in a summer twilight . At the foot of the large crucifix , which occupied a somewhat shadowy corner , lay a wreath of magnificent crimson roses . It would seem as though some high festival were about to be celebrated , and [I]0-i gazed around [me]0-i with a beating heart , half expecting some invisible touch to awaken the notes of the organ and a chorus of spirit - voices to respond with the " Gloria in excelsis Deo ! "[0-i] But there was silence - absolute , beautiful , restful silence . [I]0-i strove to collect [my]0-i thoughts , and turning [my]0-i eyes towards the jewelled cross that surmounted the high altar , [I]0-i clasped [my]0-i hands , and began to wonder how and for what [I]0-i should pray . Suddenly the idea struck [me]0-i that surely it was selfish to ask [Heaven]192-heaven for anything ; would it not be better to reflect on all that had already been given to [me]0-i , and to offer up thanks ? Scarcely had this thought entered [my]0-i mind when a sort of overwhelming sense of unworthiness came over [me]0-i . Had [I]0-i ever been unhappy ? [I]0-i wondered . If so , why ? [I]0-i began to count up [my]0-i blessings and compare them with [my]0-i misfortunes . [Exhausted pleasure - seekers]946-exhausted pleasure - seekers may be surprised to hear that [I]0-i proved the joys of [my]0-i life to have far exceeded [my]0-i sorrows . [I]0-i found that [I]0-i had sight , hearing , youth , sound limbs , an appreciation of the beautiful in art and nature , and an intense power of enjoyment . For all these things , impossible of purchase by mere wealth , should [I]0-i not give thanks ? For every golden ray of sunshine , for every flower that blooms , for the harmonies of the wind and sea , for the singing of birds and the shadows of trees , should [I]0-i not - should [we]947-we not all give thanks ? For is there any human sorrow so great that the blessing of mere daylight on [the earth]374-the earth does not far exceed ? [We]947-we [mortals]949-mortals are [spoilt and petted children]950-spoilt and petted children - the more gifts [we]947-we have the more [we]947-we crave ; and when [we]947-we burn or wound [ourselves]947-we by [our]947-we own obstinacy or carelessness , [we]947-we are ungratefully prone to blame [the Supreme Benefactor]951-the supreme benefactor for [our]947-we own faults . [We]947-we don black mourning robes as a sort of sombre protest against [Him]951-the supreme benefactor for having removed some special object of [our]947-we choice and love , whereas , if [we]947-we believed in [Him]951-the supreme benefactor and were grateful to [Him]951-the supreme benefactor , [we]947-we should wear dazzling white in sign of rejoicing that [our]947-we treasure is safe in [the land of perfect joy where [we]947-we [ourselves]947-we desire to be]952-the land of perfect joy where we ourselves desire to be . Do [we]947-we suffer from illness , loss of money , position , or [friends]1768-friends , [we]947-we rail against Fate - another name for [God]101-god - and complain like babes who have broken [their]954-their toys ; yet the sun shines on , the seasons come and go , the lovely panorama of Nature unrolls itself all for [our]947-we benefit , while [we]947-we murmur and fret and turn [our]947-we eyes away in anger .

Thinking of these things and kneeling before the altar , [my]0-i heart became filled with gratitude ; and no petition suggested itself to [me]0-i save one , and that was , " Let [me]0-i believe and love ! "[0-i] [I]0-i thought of the fair , strong , stately figure of [Christ]101-god , standing out in [the world]264-the world 's history , like a statue of pure white marble against a dark background ; [I]0-i mused on the endurance , patience , forgiveness , and perfect innocence of that most spotless life which was finished on the cross , and again [I]0-i murmured , " Let [me]0-i believe and love ! "[0-i] And [I]0-i became so absorbed in meditation that the time fled fast , till a sudden sparkle of flame flashing across the altar - steps caused [me]0-i to look up . The jewelled cross had become a cross of fire . The point of light [I]0-i had been , told to watch for had not only touched the extreme edge , but had crept down among all the precious stones and lit them up like stars . [I]0-i afterwards learned that this effect was produced by means of a thin , electric wire , which , communicating with a timepiece constructed on the same system , illuminated the cross at sunrise , noon , and sunset . It was time for [me]0-i to join [Heliobas]104-heliobas . [I]0-i rose gently , and left [the chapel]2310-the chapel with a quiet and reverent step , for [I]0-i have always thought that to manifest hurry and impatience in any place set apart for the worship of [the Creator]2447-the creator is to prove [yourself]958-yourself one of the unworthiest things created . Once outside the door [I]0-i laid aside [my]0-i veil , and then , with a perfectly composed and fearless mind , went straight to [[the Electrician]959-the electrician 's study]960-the electrician 's study . [I]0-i shall never forget the intense quiet of [the house]2038-the house that morning . The very fountain in [the hall]572-the hall seemed to tinkle in a sort of subdued whisper . [I]0-i found [Heliobas]104-heliobas seated at [his]104-heliobas table , reading . How [my]0-i dream came vividly back to [me]0-i , as [I]0-i saw [him]104-heliobas in that attitude ! [I]0-i felt that [I]0-i knew what [he]104-heliobas was reading . [He]104-heliobas looked up as [I]0-i entered , and greeted [me]0-i with a kindly yet grave smile . [I]0-i broke silence abruptly .

" [Your]104-heliobas book is open , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " at a passage commencing thus : ' [The universe]2474-the universe is upheld solely by the Law of Love . A majestic invisible Protectorate governs the winds , the tides . ' Is it not so ? "[0-i]

" It is so , "[104-heliobas] returned [Heliobas]104-heliobas . " Are [you]0-i acquainted with the book ? "[104-heliobas]

" Only through the dream [I]0-i had of [you]104-heliobas at [Cannes]4-cannes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " [I]0-i do think [Signor Cellini]97-cellini had some power over [me]0-i . "[0-i]

" Of course [he]97-cellini had in [your]0-i then weak state . But now that [you]0-i are as strong as [he]97-cellini is , [he]97-cellini could not influence [you]0-i at all . Let [us]2681-us be brief in [our]2681-us converse , [[my]963-my child]1853-my child . [I]963-my have a few serious things to say to [you]0-i before [you]0-i leave [me]963-my , on [your]0-i celestial journey . "[963-my]

[I]0-i trembled slightly , but took the chair [he]963-my pointed out to [me]0-i - a large easy - chair in which [one]272-one could recline and sleep .

" Listen , "[104-heliobas] continued [Heliobas]104-heliobas ; " [I]104-heliobas told [you]0-i , when [you]0-i first came [here]1773-here , that whatever [I]104-heliobas might do to restore [you]0-i to health , [you]0-i would have it in [your]0-i power to repay [me]104-heliobas amply . [You]0-i ARE restored to health ; will [you]0-i give [me]104-heliobas [my]104-heliobas reward ? "[104-heliobas]

" [I]0-i would and will do anything to prove [my]0-i gratitude to [you]104-heliobas , "[0-i] [I]0-i said earnestly . " Only tell [me]0-i how . "[0-i]

" [You]0-i are aware , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas went on , " of [my]104-heliobas theories respecting the Electric Spirit or Soul in [Man]180-man . It is progressive , as [I]104-heliobas have told [you]0-i - it begins as a germ - it goes on increasing in power and beauty for ever , till it is great and pure enough to enter the last of [all worlds]2684-all worlds - [[God]101-god 's World]2685-god 's world . But there are sometimes hindrances to [its]2686-its progression - obstacles in its path , which cause [it]2686-its to recoil and retire a long way back - so far back occasionally that it has to commence its journey over again . Now , by [my]104-heliobas earnest researches , [I]104-heliobas am able to study and watch the progress of [my]104-heliobas own inner force or soul . So far , all has been well - prayerfully and humbly [I]104-heliobas may say [I]104-heliobas believe all has been well . But [I]104-heliobas foresee an approaching shadow - a difficulty - a danger - which , if it can not be repelled or passed in some way , threatens to violently push back [my]104-heliobas advancing spiritual nature , so that , with much grief and pain , [I]104-heliobas shall have to re - commence the work that [I]104-heliobas had hoped was done . [I]104-heliobas can not , with all [my]104-heliobas best effort , discover WHAT this darkening obstacle is - but [YOU]0-i , yes , [YOU]0-i "[104-heliobas] - for [I]0-i had started up in surprise - " [you]0-i , when [you]0-i are lifted up high enough to behold these things , may , being perfectly unselfish in this research , attain to the knowledge of it and explain it to [me]104-heliobas , when [you]0-i return . In trying to probe the secret for [myself]104-heliobas , it is of course purely for [my]104-heliobas own interest ; and nothing clear , nothing satisfactory can be spiritually obtained , in which selfishness has ever so slight a share . [You]0-i , if indeed [I]104-heliobas deserve [your]0-i gratitude for the aid [I]104-heliobas have given [you]0-i - [you]0-i will be able to search out the matter more certainly , being in the position of [one soul working for another]2687-one soul working for another . Still , [I]104-heliobas can not compel [you]0-i to do this for [me]104-heliobas - [I]104-heliobas only ask , WILL [you]0-i ? "[104-heliobas]

[His]965-his entreating and anxious tone touched [me]0-i keenly ; but [I]0-i was amazed and perplexed , and could not yet realize what strange thing was going to happen to [me]0-i . But whatever occurred [I]0-i was resolved to give a ready consent to [his]965-his request , therefore [I]0-i said firmly :

" [I]0-i will do [my]0-i best , [I]0-i promise [you]965-his . Remember that [I]0-i do not know , [I]0-i can not even guess where [I]0-i am going , or what strange sensations will overcome [me]0-i ; but if [I]0-i am permitted to have any recollection of [earth]1946-earth at all , [I]0-i will try to find out what [you]965-his ask . "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas seemed satisfied , and rising from [his]104-heliobas chair , unlocked a heavily - bound iron safe . From this [he]104-heliobas took a glass flask of a strange , ever - moving , glittering fluid , the same in appearance as that which [Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini had forbidden [me]0-i to drink . [He]104-heliobas then paused and looked searchingly at [me]0-i .

" Tell [me]104-heliobas , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said in an authoritative tone , " tell [me]104-heliobas WHY [you]0-i wish to see what to mortals is unseen ? What motive have [you]0-i ? What ulterior plan ? "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i hesitated . Then [I]0-i gathered [my]0-i strength together and answered decisively :

" [I]0-i desire to know why [this world]1957-this world , [this universe]2690-this universe exists ; and also wish to prove , if possible , the truth and necessity of religion . And [I]0-i think [I]0-i would give [my]0-i life , if it were worth anything , to be certain of the truth of Christianity . "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas gazed in [my]0-i face with a sort of half - pity , half - censure .

" [You]0-i have a daring aim , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said slowly , " and [you]0-i are [a bold seeker]2691-a bold seeker . But shame , repentance and sorrow await [you]0-i where [you]0-i are going , as well as rapture and amazement . ' [I]104-heliobas WOULD GIVE [MY]104-heliobas LIFE IF [IT]2692-it WERE WORTH ANYTHING . ' That utterance has saved [you]0-i - otherwise to soar into [an unexplored wilderness of spheres]2693-an unexplored wilderness of spheres , weighted by [your]0-i own doubts and guided solely by [your]0-i own wild desires , would be a fruitless journey . "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i felt abashed as [I]0-i met [his]104-heliobas steady , scrutinizing eyes .

" Surely it is well to wish to know the reason of things ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , with some timidity .

" The desire of knowledge is a great virtue , certainly , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas replied ; " it is not truly felt by one in a thousand . [Most persons]2694-most persons are content to live and die , absorbed in [their]2694-most persons own petty commonplace affairs , without troubling [themselves]2694-most persons as to the reasons of [their]2694-most persons existence . Yet it is almost better , like these , to wallow in blind ignorance than wantonly to doubt [the Creator]2447-the creator because [He]2447-the creator is unseen , or to put a self - opinionated construction on [His]2447-the creator mysteries because [He]2447-the creator chooses to veil them from [our]2696-our eyes . "[104-heliobas]

" [I]0-i do not doubt ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed earnestly . " [I]0-i only want to make sure , and then perhaps [I]0-i may persuade [others]324-others . "[0-i]

" [You]0-i can never compel faith , "[104-heliobas] said [Heliobas]104-heliobas calmly . " [You]0-i are going to see wonderful things that no tongue or pen can adequately describe . Well , when [you]0-i return to [earth]1946-earth again , do [you]0-i suppose [you]0-i can make [people]1754-people believe the story of [your]0-i experiences ? Never ! Be thankful if [you]0-i are the possessor of a secret joy [yourself]0-i , and do not attempt to impart it to [others]324-others , who will only repel and mock [you]0-i . "[104-heliobas]

" Not even to one other ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked hesitatingly .

A warm , kindly smile seemed to illuminate [his]104-heliobas face as [I]0-i put this question .

" Yes , to one other , [the other half of [yourself]0-i]2701-the other half of yourself - [you]0-i may tell all things , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said . " But now , no more converse . If [you]0-i are quite ready , drink this . "[104-heliobas]

[He]104-heliobas held out to [me]0-i a small tumbler filled with the sparkling volatile liquid [he]104-heliobas had poured from the flask . For one moment [my]0-i courage almost forsook [me]0-i , and an icy shiver ran through [my]0-i veins . Then [I]0-i bethought [myself]0-i of all [my]0-i boasted bravery ; was it possible that [I]0-i should fail now at this critical moment ? [I]0-i allowed [myself]0-i no more time for reflection , but took the glass from [his]104-heliobas hand and drained its contents to the last drop . It was tasteless , but sparkling and warm on the tongue . Scarcely had [I]0-i swallowed it , when a curiously light , dizzy sensation overcame [me]0-i , and the figure of [Heliobas]104-heliobas standing before [me]0-i seemed to assume gigantic proportions . [I]0-i saw [his]104-heliobas hands extend - [his]104-heliobas eyes , like lamps of electric flame , burned through and through [me]0-i - and like a distant echo , [I]0-i heard the deep vibrating tones of [his]104-heliobas voice uttering the following words :

" [Azul]106-azul ! [Azul]106-azul ! Lift up this light and daring spirit unto [thyself]2702-it ; be its pioneer upon the path [it]2702-it must pursue ; suffer it to float untrammelled through the wide and glorious [Continents of Air]37-continents of air ; give it form and force to alight on any of the vast and beautiful spheres it may desire to behold ; and if worthy , permit [it]2702-it to gaze , if only for a brief interval , upon the supreme vision of the First and [Last of worlds]2703-last of worlds . By the force [thou]2704-thou givest unto [me]104-heliobas , [I]104-heliobas free [this soul]2705-this soul ; do [thou]2704-thou , [Azul]106-azul , quickly receive it ! "[104-heliobas]

A dense darkness now grew thickly around [me]0-i - -I lost all power over [my]0-i limbs - [I]0-i felt [myself]0-i being lifted up forcibly and rapidly , up , up , into some illimitable , terrible space of blackness and nothingness . [I]0-i could not think , move , or cry out - [I]0-i could only feel that [I]0-i was rising , rising , steadily , swiftly , breathlessly ... when suddenly a long quivering flash of radiance , like the fragment of a rainbow , struck dazzlingly across [my]0-i sight . Darkness ? What had [I]0-i to do with darkness ? [I]0-i knew not the word - [I]0-i was only conscious of light - light exquisitely pure and brilliant - light through which [I]0-i stepped as easily as a bird flies in air . Perfectly awake to [my]0-i sensations , [I]0-i felt somehow that there was nothing remarkable in them - [I]0-i seemed to be at [home]1856-home in some familiar element . Delicate hands held [mine]0-i - a face far lovelier than the loveliest face of woman ever dreamed by [poet or painter]967-poet or painter , smiled radiantly at [me]0-i , and [I]0-i smiled back again . A voice whispered in strange musical murmurs , such as [I]0-i well seemed to know and comprehend :

" Gaze behind [thee]0-i ere the picture fades . "[0-i]

[I]0-i obeyed , half reluctantly , and saw as a passing shadow in a glass , or a sort of blurred miniature painting , [the room where [Heliobas]104-heliobas stood]968-the room where heliobas stood , watching some strange imperfect shape , which [I]0-i seemed faintly to recognise . It looked like a small cast in clay , very badly executed , of the shape [I]0-i at present wore ; but it was incomplete , as though [the sculptor]683-the sculptor had given it up as a failure and gone away , leaving it unfinished .

" Did [I]0-i dwell in that body ? "[0-i] [I]0-i mused to [myself]0-i , as [I]0-i felt the perfection of [my]0-i then state of being . " How came [I]0-i shut in such a prison ? How poor a form - how destitute of faculties - how full of infirmities - how limited in capabilities - how narrow in all intelligence - how ignorant - how mean ! "[0-i]

And [I]0-i turned for relief to the shining companion who held [me]0-i , and obeying an impulse suddenly imparted , [I]0-i felt [myself]0-i floating higher and higher till the last limits of the atmosphere surrounding [the Earth]38-the earth were passed , and fields of pure and cloudless ether extended before [us]970-we . Here [we]970-we met myriads of creatures like [ourselves]970-we , all hastening in various directions - all lovely and radiant as a dream of the fairies . [Some of these beings]971-some of these beings were quite tiny and delicate - some of lofty stature and glorious appearance : [their]971-some of these beings forms were human , yet so refined , improved , and perfected , that [they]971-some of these beings were unlike , while so like humanity .

" Askest [thou]2706-thou nothing ? "[972-the voice beside me] whispered [the voice beside [me]0-i]972-the voice beside me .

" Tell [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " what [I]0-i must know . "[0-i]

" [These spirits that [we]970-we behold]2707-these spirits that we behold , "[972-the voice beside me] went on the voice , " are [the guardians of [all the inhabitants of [all the planets]2710-all the planets]2709-all the inhabitants of all the planets]2708-the guardians of all the inhabitants of all the planets . [Their]2707-these spirits that we behold labours are those of love and penitence . [Their]2707-these spirits that we behold work is to draw other souls to [God]101-god - to attract [them]2707-these spirits that we behold by warnings , by pleading , by praying . [They]2707-these spirits that we behold have all worn the garb of mortality [themselves]2707-these spirits that we behold , and [they]2707-these spirits that we behold teach [mortals]949-mortals by [their]2707-these spirits that we behold own experience . For [these radiant creatures]2712-these radiant creatures are expiating sins of [their]2707-these spirits that we behold own in thus striving to save [others]324-others - the oftener [they]2707-these spirits that we behold succeed the nearer [they]2707-these spirits that we behold approach to [Heaven]192-heaven . This is what is vaguely understood on [[your]2714-your earth]2715-your earth as purgatory ; the sufferings of [spirits who love and long for the presence of [[their]2707-these spirits that we behold Creator]2717-their creator , and who yet are not pure enough to approach [Him]2717-their creator . Only by serving and saving [others]324-others can [they]2707-these spirits that we behold obtain at last [their]2707-these spirits that we behold own joy]2716-spirits who love and long for the presence of their creator , and who yet are not pure enough to approach him . only by serving and saving others can they obtain at last their own joy . Every act of ingratitude and forgetfulness and wickedness committed by [a mortal]2719-a mortal , detains one or another of [these patient workers]2720-these patient workers longer away from [Heaven]2721-heaven - imagine then what a weary while many of [them]2720-these patient workers have to wait . "[972-the voice beside me]

[I]0-i made no answer , and [we]973-we floated on . Higher and higher - higher and higher - till at last [[my]0-i guide , whom [I]0-i knew to be that being whom [Heliobas]104-heliobas had called [Azul]106-azul]974-my guide , whom i knew to be that being whom heliobas had called azul , bade [me]0-i pause . [We]973-we were floating close together in what seemed a sea of translucent light . From this point [I]0-i could learn something of the mighty workings of [the Universe]1-the universe . [I]0-i gazed upon [countless solar systems]975-countless solar systems , that like wheels within wheels revolved with such rapidity that they seemed all one wheel . [I]0-i saw planets whirl around and around with breathless swiftness , like glittering balls flung through the air - burning comets flared fiercely past like torches of alarm for [God]101-god 's wars against Evil - a marvellous procession of indescribable wonders sweeping on for ever in circles , grand , huge , and immeasurable . And as [I]0-i watched the superb pageant , [I]0-i was not startled or confused - [I]0-i looked upon it as [anyone]2062-anyone might look on any quiet landscape scene in what [we]973-we know of Nature . [I]0-i scarcely could perceive [the Earth]38-the earth from whence [I]0-i had come - so tiny a speck was it - nothing but a mere pin 's point in the burning whirl of immensities . [I]0-i felt , however , perfectly conscious of a superior force in [myself]0-i to all these enormous forces around [me]0-i - [I]0-i knew without needing any explanation that [I]0-i was formed of an indestructible essence , and that were all these stars and systems suddenly to end in one fell burst of brilliant horror , [I]0-i should still exist - [I]0-i should know and remember and feel - should be able to watch the birth of [a new Universe]1-the universe , and take [my]0-i part in its growth and design .

" Remind [me]0-i why these wonders exist , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , turning to [[my]0-i guide]977-my guide , and speaking in those dulcet sounds which were like music and yet like speech ; " and why amid [them]1-the universe all [the Earth]38-the earth is believed by [[its]38-the earth inhabitants]2722-its inhabitants to have merited destruction , and yet to have been found worthy of redemption ? "[0-i]

" [Thy]2723-thou last question shall be answered first , "[106-azul] replied [Azul]106-azul . " Seest [thou]2723-thou [yonder planet]2724-yonder planet circled with a ring ? It is known to [the dwellers on [Earth]38-the earth]2725-the dwellers on earth , of whom when in clay [thou]2723-thou art one , as [Saturn]33-saturn . Descend with [me]106-azul ! "[106-azul]

And in a breath of time [we]978-we floated downwards and alighted on [a broad and beautiful plain]979-a broad and beautiful plain , where flowers of strange shape and colour grew in profusion . Here [we]978-we were met by creatures of lofty stature and dazzling beauty , human in shape , yet angelic in countenance . [They]980-their knelt to [us]978-we with reverence and joy , and then passed on to [their]980-their toil or pleasure , whichever invited [them]980-their , and [I]0-i looked to [Azul]106-azul for explanation .

" To [these children of the Creator]2726-these children of the creator , "[981-that radiant guide] said [that radiant guide]981-that radiant guide , " is granted the ability to see and to converse with [the spirits of the air]2727-the spirits of the air . [They]2726-these children of the creator know [them]2726-these children of the creator and love [them]2726-these children of the creator , and implore [their]2726-these children of the creator protection . In [this planet]1811-this planet sickness and old age are unknown , and death comes as a quiet sleep . The period of existence is about two hundred years , according to [the Earth]374-the earth 's standard of time ; and the process of decay is no more unlovely than the gentle withering of roses . The influence of the electric belt around [[their]980-their world]2730-their world is a bar to pestilence and disease , and scatters health with light . All sciences , arts , and inventions known on [Earth]1946-earth are known [here]1773-here , only to greater perfection . The three important differences between [the inhabitants of [this planet]1811-this planet]2733-the inhabitants of this planet and [those who dwell on [Earth]38-the earth]2735-those who dwell on earth are these : first [they]2733-the inhabitants of this planet have [no rulers]2736-no rulers in authority , as [each one]1900-each one perfectly governs [himself]1900-each one ; second , [they]2733-the inhabitants of this planet do not marry , as the law of attraction which draws together [any two of opposite sexes]2738-any two of opposite sexes , holds [them]2733-the inhabitants of this planet fast in inviolable fidelity ; thirdly , there is [no creature in all the immensity of this magnificent sphere who has ever doubted , or who ever will doubt , the existence of the Creator]2739-no creature in all the immensity of this magnificent sphere who has ever doubted , or who ever will doubt , the existence of the creator . "[981-that radiant guide]

A thrill of fiery shame seemed to dart through [my]0-i spiritual being as [I]0-i heard this , and [I]0-i made no answer . [Some fairy - like little creatures]982-some fairy - like little creatures , [the children of [the Saturnites]193-the saturnites]983-the children of the saturnites , as [I]0-i supposed , here came running towards [us]984-us and knelt down , reverently clasping [their]982-some fairy - like little creatures hands in prayer . [They]982-some fairy - like little creatures then gathered flowers and flung them on that portion of ground where [we]984-us stood , and gazed at [us]984-us fearlessly and lovingly , as [they]982-some fairy - like little creatures might have gazed at some rare bird or butterfly .

[Azul]106-azul signed to [me]0-i , and [we]984-us rose while yet in [their]982-some fairy - like little creatures sight , and soaring through the radiance of the ring , which was like a sun woven into a circle , [we]984-us soon left [Saturn]33-saturn far behind [us]984-us , and alighted on [Venus]43-venus . [Here seas]985-here seas , [mountains , forests]986-mountains , forests , [lakes]987-lakes , and [meadows]988-meadows were [one vast garden]989-one vast garden , in which the bloom and verdure of [all worlds]2684-all worlds seemed to find a home . Here were realized the dreams of [sculptors]991-sculptors and [painters]2020-painters , in the graceful forms and exquisite faces of [the women]993-the women , and the splendid strength and godlike beauty of [the men]2008-the men . A brief glance was sufficient to show [me]0-i that the moving spring of [all the civilization of [this radiant planet]996-this radiant planet]995-all the civilization of this radiant planet was the love of Nature and Art united . There were no wars - for there were [no different nations]997-no different nations . [All the inhabitants]998-all the inhabitants were like [one vast family]999-one vast family ; [they]998-all the inhabitants worked for [one another]2396-one another , and vied with each other in paying homage to [those of [the loftiest genius among [them]998-all the inhabitants]1002-the loftiest genius among them]1001-those of the loftiest genius among them . [They]998-all the inhabitants had [one supreme Monarch to whom [they]998-all the inhabitants all rendered glad obedience]1003-one supreme monarch to whom they all rendered glad obedience ; and [he]1003-one supreme monarch to whom they all rendered glad obedience was [a Poet]2427-a poet , ready to sacrifice [his]1003-one supreme monarch to whom they all rendered glad obedience throne with joy as soon as [[his]1003-one supreme monarch to whom they all rendered glad obedience people]1005-his people should discover a greater than [he]1003-one supreme monarch to whom they all rendered glad obedience . For [they]998-all the inhabitants all loved not [the artist]348-the artist but the Art ; and selfishness was a vice unknown . Here , [none]1007-none loved or were wedded save [those who had spiritual sympathies]1008-those who had spiritual sympathies , and here , too , [no creature]1009-no creature existed who did not believe in and worship [the Creator]2447-the creator . The same state of things existed in [Jupiter]32-jupiter , [the planet [we]1012-we next visited , where everything was performed by electricity]1011-the planet we next visited , where everything was performed by electricity . Here persons living hundreds of miles apart could yet converse together with perfect ease through an electric medium ; [ships]1013-ships ploughed [the seas]1014-the seas by electricity ; printing , an art of which [the dwellers on Earth]2725-the dwellers on earth are so proud , was accomplished by electricity - in fact , everything in the way of science , art , and invention known to [us]1012-we was also known in [Jupiter]32-jupiter , only to greater perfection , because tempered and strengthened by an electric force which never failed . From [Jupiter]32-jupiter , [Azul]106-azul guided [me]0-i to [many other fair and splendid worlds]1016-many other fair and splendid worlds - yet none of [them]1016-many other fair and splendid worlds were [Paradise]44-paradise ; [all]1017-all had some slight drawback - some physical or spiritual ailment , as it were , which had to be combated with and conquered . [All the inhabitants of each star]1018-all the inhabitants of each star longed for something [they]1018-all the inhabitants of each star had not - something better , greater , and higher - and therefore [all]1017-all had discontent . [They]1018-all the inhabitants of each star could not realize [their]1018-all the inhabitants of each star best desires in the state of existence [they]1018-all the inhabitants of each star then were , therefore [they]1018-all the inhabitants of each star all suffered disappointment . [They]1018-all the inhabitants of each star were all compelled to work in some way or another ; [they]1018-all the inhabitants of each star were all doomed to die . Yet , unlike [the dwellers on [Earth]1946-earth]2725-the dwellers on earth , [they]1018-all the inhabitants of each star did not , because [their]1018-all the inhabitants of each star lives were more or less constrained and painful , complain of or deny the goodness of [God]101-god - on the contrary , [they]1018-all the inhabitants of each star believed in a future state which should be as perfect as [their]1018-all the inhabitants of each star present one was imperfect ; and the chief aim and object of all [their]1018-all the inhabitants of each star labours was to become worthy of attaining that final grand result - Eternal Happiness and Peace .

" Readest [thou]2740-thou the lesson in these glowing spheres , teeming with life and learning ? "[106-azul] murmured [Azul]106-azul to [me]0-i , as [we]1022-we soared swiftly on together . " Know that not one smallest world in [all the myriad systems circling before [thee]0-i]2741-all the myriad systems circling before thee , holds [a single human creature who doubts [his]2742-a single human creature who doubts his maker Maker]2742-a single human creature who doubts his maker . Not one ! except [[thine]0-i own doomed star]2743-thine own doomed star ! Behold it yonder - sparkling feebly , like a faint flame amid sunshine - how poor a speck it is - how like a scarcely visible point in all the brilliancy of the ever - revolving wheel of Life ! Yet there dwell [the dwarfs of clay]2744-the dwarfs of clay - [the men and women who pretend to love while [they]2745-the men and women who pretend to love while they secretly hate and despise one another secretly hate and despise [one another]2396-one another]2745-the men and women who pretend to love while they secretly hate and despise one another . There , wealth is [a god]2747-a god , and the greed of gain a virtue . There , genius starves , and heroism dies unrewarded . There , faith is martyred , and unbelief elected [sovereign monarch of [the people]2749-the people]2748-sovereign monarch of the people . [There]526-there , the sublime , unreachable mysteries of [the Universe]1-the universe are haggled over by [poor finite minds who can not call [their]2751-poor finite minds who can not call their lives their own lives [their]2751-poor finite minds who can not call their lives their own own]2751-poor finite minds who can not call their lives their own . There , nation wars against [nation]2752-nation , creed against creed , soul against soul . Alas , [fated planet]2753-fated planet ! how soon shalt [thou]0-i be extinct , and [[thy]0-i place]2754-thy place shall know [thee]0-i no more ! "[106-azul]

[I]0-i gazed earnestly at [my]0-i radiant guide . " If that is true , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " why then should [we]2755-we have a legend that [God]101-god , in the person of one called [Christ]101-god , came to die for so miserable and mean [a race of beings]2756-a race of beings ? "[0-i]

[Azul]106-azul answered not , but turned [her]1023-her luminous eyes upon [me]0-i with a sort of wide dazzling wonder . Some strange impelling force bore [me]0-i onward , and before [I]0-i could realize it [I]0-i was alone . Alone , in a vast area of light through which [I]0-i floated , serene and conscious of power . A sound falling from a great height reached [me]0-i ; it was first like a grand organ - chord , and then like a voice , trumpet - clear and far - echoing .

" Spirit that searchest for the Unseen , "[0-i] it said , " because [I]0-i will not that no atom of true worth should perish , unto [thee]0-i shall be given a vision - unto [thee]0-i shall be taught a lesson [thou]0-i dreamest not of . [THOU]0-i shalt create ; [THOU]0-i shalt design and plan ; [THOU]0-i shalt be worshipped , and [THOU]0-i shalt destroy ! Rest therefore in the light and behold the things that are in the light , for the tune cometh when all that seemeth clear and visible now shall be but darkness . And [they]2757-they that love [me]0-i not shall have no place of abode in that hour ! "[0-i]

The voice ceased . Awed , yet consoled , [I]0-i listened for it again . There was no more sound . Around [me]0-i was illimitable light - illimitable silence . But a strange scene unfolded itself swiftly before [me]0-i - a sort of shifting dream that was a reality , yet so wonderfully unreal - a vision that impressed itself on every portion of [my]0-i intelligence ; a kind of spirit - drama in which [I]0-i was forced to enact the chief part , and where a mystery that [I]0-i had deemed impenetrable was made perfectly clear and simple of comprehension .

CHAPTER XI .

A MINIATURE CREATION .

In [my]0-i heaven - uplifted dream , [I]0-i thought [I]0-i saw [a circular spacious garden in which all the lovely landscapes of [a superior world]1025-a superior world]1024-a circular spacious garden in which all the lovely landscapes of a superior world appeared to form themselves by swift degrees . The longer [I]0-i looked at [it]1024-a circular spacious garden in which all the lovely landscapes of a superior world , the more beautiful it became , and a little star shone above it like a sun . Trees and flowers sprang up under [my]0-i gaze , and all stretched themselves towards [me]0-i , as though for protection . Birds flew about and sang ; some of [them]1026-them tried to get as near as possible to the little sun [they]1026-them saw ; and other living creatures began to move about in the shadows of [the groves]1027-the groves , and on the fresh green grass . All the wonderful workings of Nature , as known to [us]1028-us in [the world]264-the world , took place over again in [this garden]1030-this garden , which seemed somehow to belong to [me]0-i ; and [I]0-i watched everything with a certain satisfaction and delight . Then the idea came to [me]0-i that [the place]2197-the place would be fairer if there were either [men]273-men or [angels]289-angels to inhabit [it]2197-the place ; and quick as light a whisper came to [me]0-i :

" CREATE ! "[289-angels]

And [I]0-i thought in [my]0-i dream that by the mere desire of [my]0-i being , expressed in waves of electric warmth that floated downwards from [me]0-i to the earth [I]0-i possessed , [[my]0-i garden]1034-my garden was suddenly filled with [men]273-men , [women]441-women and [children]1037-children , each of whom had a small portion of [myself]0-i in [them]1034-my garden , inasmuch as it was [I]0-i who made [them]1034-my garden move and talk and occupy [themselves]1034-my garden in all manner of amusements . [Many of [them]1034-my garden]1038-many of them knelt down to [me]0-i and prayed , and offered thanksgivings for having been created ; but [some of [them]1034-my garden]1039-some of them went instead to the little star , which [they]1039-some of them called a sun , and thanked that , and prayed to that instead . Then [others]324-others went and cut down the trees in [the garden]315-the garden , and dug up stones , and built [themselves]324-others little cities , where [they]324-others all dwelt together like flocks of sheep , and ate and drank and made merry with the things [I]0-i had given [them]324-others . Then [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i increased [their]1034-my garden intelligence and quickness of perception , and by - and - by [they]1034-my garden grew so proud that [they]1034-my garden forgot everything but [themselves]1034-my garden . [They]1034-my garden ceased to remember how [they]1034-my garden were created , and [they]1034-my garden cared no more to offer praises to [their]1034-my garden little sun that through [me]0-i gave [them]1034-my garden light and heat . But because something of [my]0-i essence still was in [them]1034-my garden , [they]1034-my garden always instinctively sought to worship [a superior creature to [themselves]1034-my garden]1042-a superior creature to themselves ; and puzzling [themselves]1034-my garden in [their]1034-my garden folly , [they]1034-my garden made hideous images of wood and clay , unlike anything in heaven or [earth]1946-earth , and offered sacrifices and prayer to these lifeless puppets instead of to [me]0-i . Then [I]0-i turned away [my]0-i eyes in sorrow and pity , but never in anger ; for [I]0-i could not be wrathful with [these children of [my]0-i own creation]1044-these children of my own creation . And when [I]0-i thus turned away [my]0-i eyes , all manner of evil came upon the once fair scene - pestilence and storm , disease and vice . A dark shadow stole between [[my]0-i little world]1045-my little world and [me]0-i - the shadow of [the people]2749-the people 's own wickedness . And as every delicate fibre of [my]0-i spiritual being repelled evil by the necessity of the pure light in which [I]0-i dwelt serene . [I]0-i waited patiently for the mists to clear , so that [I]0-i might again behold the beauty of [[my]0-i garden]1034-my garden . Suddenly a soft clamour smote upon [my]0-i sense of hearing , and a slender stream of light , like a connecting ray , seemed to be flung upwards through the darkness that hid [me]0-i from [the people [I]0-i had created and loved]1048-the people i had created and loved . [I]0-i knew the sound - it was the mingled music of the prayers of [children]1037-children . An infinite pity and pleasure touched [me]0-i , [my]0-i being thrilled with love and tenderness ; and yielding to [these little ones who asked [me]0-i for protection]1050-these little ones who asked me for protection , [I]0-i turned [my]0-i eyes again towards the garden [I]0-i had designed for fairness and pleasure . But alas ! how changed it had become ! No longer fresh and sweet , [the people]2749-the people had turned [it]1052-it into [a wilderness]1053-a wilderness ; [they]2749-the people had divided [it]1052-it into small portions , and in so doing had divided [themselves]2749-the people into separate companies called [nations]1054-nations , all of whom fought with each other fiercely for [[their]2749-the people different little parterres or flower - beds]1055-their different little parterres or flower - beds . [Some]302-some haggled and talked incessantly over the mere possession of a stone which [they]302-some called a rock ; [others]324-others busied [themselves]324-others in digging a little yellow metal out of the earth , which , when once obtained , seemed to make [the owners of it]1058-the owners of it mad , for [they]302-some straightway forgot everything else . As [I]0-i looked , the darkness between [me]0-i and [my]0-i creation grew denser , and was only pierced at last by those long wide shafts of radiance caused by the innocent prayers of [those who still remembered [me]0-i]1059-those who still remembered me . And [I]0-i was full of regret , for [I]0-i saw [[my]0-i people]1060-my people wandering hither and thither , restless and dissatisfied , perplexed by [their]1060-my people own errors , and caring nothing for the love [I]0-i bore [them]1060-my people . Then [some of [them]1060-my people]1039-some of them advanced and began to question why [they]1039-some of them had been created , forgetting completely how [their]1039-some of them lives had been originally designed by [me]0-i for happiness , love and wisdom . Then [they]1039-some of them accused [me]0-i of the existence of evil , refusing to see that where there is light there is also darkness , and that darkness is the rival force of [the Universe]2474-the universe , whence cometh silently [the Unnamable Oblivion of [Souls]194-souls]1063-the unnamable oblivion of souls . [They]1039-some of them could not see , [[my]0-i self - willed children]1064-my self - willed children , that [they]1039-some of them had of [their]1039-some of them own desire sought the darkness and found it ; and now , because it gloomed above [them]1039-some of them like a pall , [they]1039-some of them refused to believe in the light where still [I]0-i was loving and striving to attract [them]1039-some of them still . Yet it was not all darkness , and [I]0-i knew that even what there was might be repelled and cleared away if only [[my]0-i people]1060-my people would turn towards [me]0-i once more . So [I]0-i sent down upon [them]1060-my people all possible blessings - [some]302-some [they]1060-my people rejected angrily , some [they]1060-my people snatched at and threw away again , as though [they]1060-my people were poor and trivial - none of [them]1060-my people were [they]1060-my people thankful for , and [none]1007-none did [they]1060-my people desire to keep . And the darkness above [them]1060-my people deepened , while [my]0-i anxious pity and love for [them]1060-my people increased . For how could [I]0-i turn altogether away from [them]1060-my people , as long as but a few remembered [me]0-i ? There were [some of [these weak children of [mine]0-i]1069-these weak children of mine who loved and honoured [me]0-i so well that [they]1068-some of these weak children of mine who loved and honoured me so well that they absorbed some of my light into themselves absorbed some of [my]0-i light into [themselves]1068-some of these weak children of mine who loved and honoured me so well that they absorbed some of my light into themselves]1068-some of these weak children of mine who loved and honoured me so well that they absorbed some of my light into themselves , and became [heroes]2213-heroes , [poets]2473-poets , [musicians]1072-musicians , [teachers of high and noble thought]1073-teachers of high and noble thought , and unselfish , devoted martyrs for the sake of the reverence [they]1068-some of these weak children of mine who loved and honoured me so well that they absorbed some of my light into themselves bore [me]0-i . There were [[women]441-women pure and sweet , who wore [their]441-women existence as innocently as lilies , and who turned to [me]0-i to seek protection , not for [themselves]441-women , but for those [they]441-women loved]1075-women pure and sweet , who wore their existence as innocently as lilies , and who turned to me to seek protection , not for themselves , but for those they loved . There were [little children , whose asking voices were like waves of delicious music]1076-little children , whose asking voices were like waves of delicious music to [my]0-i being , and for whom [I]0-i had a surpassing tenderness . And yet all these were a mere handful compared to [the numbers who denied [my]0-i existence , and who had wilfully crushed out and repelled every spark of [my]0-i essence in [themselves]1068-some of these weak children of mine who loved and honoured me so well that they absorbed some of my light into themselves]1077-the numbers who denied my existence , and who had wilfully crushed out and repelled every spark of my essence in themselves . And as [I]0-i contemplated this , the voice [I]0-i had heard at the commencement of [my]0-i dream rushed towards [me]0-i like a mighty wind broken through by thunder :

" DESTROY ! "[0-i]

A great pity and love possessed [me]0-i . In deep awe , yet solemn earnestness , [I]0-i pleaded with that vast commanding voice .

" Bid [me]0-i not destroy ! "[0-i] [I]0-i implored . " Command [me]0-i not to disperse into nothingness [these children of [my]0-i fancy]2758-these children of my fancy , [some of whom yet love and trust to [me]0-i for safety]2759-some of whom yet love and trust to me for safety . Let [me]0-i strive once more to bring [them]2758-these children of my fancy out of [their]2758-these children of my fancy darkness into the light - to bring [them]2758-these children of my fancy to the happiness [I]0-i designed [them]2758-these children of my fancy to enjoy . [They]2758-these children of my fancy have not all forgotten [me]0-i - let [me]0-i give [them]2758-these children of my fancy more time for thought and recollection ! "[0-i]

Again the great voice shook the air :

" [They]2758-these children of my fancy love darkness rather than light ; [they]2758-these children of my fancy love the perishable earth of which [they]2758-these children of my fancy are in part composed , better than the germ of immortality with which [they]2758-these children of my fancy were in the beginning endowed . [This garden of thine]2760-this garden of thine is but a caprice of [thy]2761-thou intelligence ; the creatures that inhabit [it]2760-this garden of thine are soulless and unworthy , and are an offence to that indestructible radiance of which [thou]2761-thou art one ray . Therefore [I]0-i say unto [thee]2761-thou again - DESTROY ! "[0-i]

[My]0-i yearning love grew stronger , and [I]0-i pleaded with renewed force .

" Oh , [thou]2761-thou Unseen Glory ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried ; " [thou]2761-thou who hast filled [me]0-i with this emotion of love and pity which permeates and supports [my]0-i existence , how canst [thou]2761-thou bid [me]0-i take this sudden revenge upon [my]0-i frail creation ! No caprice was it that caused [me]0-i to design it ; nothing but a thought of love and a desire of beauty . Even yet [I]0-i will fulfil [my]0-i plan - even yet shall [these erring children of [mine]0-i]2762-these erring children of mine return to [me]0-i in time , with patience . While one of [them]2762-these erring children of mine still lifts a hand in prayer to [me]0-i , or gratitude , [I]0-i can not destroy ! Bid [me]0-i rather sink into the darkness of the uttermost deep of shadow ; only let [me]0-i save [these feeble little ones]2763-these feeble little ones from destruction ! "[0-i]

[The voice]1078-the voice replied not . A flashing opal brilliancy shot across the light in which [I]0-i rested , and [I]0-i beheld [an Angel]284-an angel , grand , lofty , majestic , with a countenance in which shone the lustre of a myriad summer mornings .

" Spirit that art escaped from [the Sorrowful Star]45-the sorrowful star , "[1078-the voice] it said in accents clear and sonorous , " wouldst [thou]0-i indeed be content to suffer the loss of heavenly joy and peace , in order to rescue [thy]0-i perishing creation ? "[1078-the voice]

" [I]0-i would ! "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " if [I]0-i understood death , [I]0-i would die to save one of [those frail creatures , who seek to know [me]0-i and yet can not find [me]0-i through the darkness [they]2764-those frail creatures , who seek to know me and yet can not find me through the darkness they have brought upon themselves have brought upon [themselves]2764-those frail creatures , who seek to know me and yet can not find me through the darkness they have brought upon themselves]2764-those frail creatures , who seek to know me and yet can not find me through the darkness they have brought upon themselves . "[0-i]

" To die , "[1080-the angel] said [the Angel]1080-the angel , " to understand death , [thou]0-i wouldst need to become one of [them]2764-those frail creatures , who seek to know me and yet can not find me through the darkness they have brought upon themselves , to take upon [thyself]0-i [their]2764-those frail creatures , who seek to know me and yet can not find me through the darkness they have brought upon themselves form - to imprison all that brilliancy of which [thou]0-i art now composed , into a mean and common case of clay ; and even if [thou]0-i couldst accomplish this , would [[thy]0-i children]2765-thy children know [thee]0-i or receive [thee]0-i ? "[1080-the angel]

" Nay , but if [I]0-i could suffer shame by [them]2764-those frail creatures , who seek to know me and yet can not find me through the darkness they have brought upon themselves , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried impetuously , " [I]0-i could not suffer sin . [My]0-i being would be incapable of error , and [I]0-i would show these creatures of [mine]0-i the bliss of purity , the joy of wisdom , the ecstasy of light , the certainty of immortality , if [they]2764-those frail creatures , who seek to know me and yet can not find me through the darkness they have brought upon themselves followed [me]0-i . And then [I]0-i would die to show [them]2764-those frail creatures , who seek to know me and yet can not find me through the darkness they have brought upon themselves death is easy , and that in dying [they]2764-those frail creatures , who seek to know me and yet can not find me through the darkness they have brought upon themselves would come to [me]0-i and find [their]2764-those frail creatures , who seek to know me and yet can not find me through the darkness they have brought upon themselves happiness for ever ! "[0-i]

The stature of [the Angel]195-angel grew more lofty and magnificent , and its star - like eyes flashed fire .

" Then , oh [[thou]2766-thou wanderer from [the Earth]38-the earth]2767-thou wanderer from the earth ! "[0-i] it said , " understandest [thou]2766-thou not [the Christ]2768-the christ ? "[0-i]

A deep awe trembled through [me]0-i . Meanwhile [the garden]315-the garden [I]0-i had thought [a world]1082-a world appeared to roll up like a cloudy scroll , and vanished , and [I]0-i knew that it had been a vision , and no more .

" Oh doubting and foolish [Spirit]196-spirit ! "[1080-the angel] went on [the Angel]1080-the angel - " [thou]2766-thou who art but one point of living light in the Supreme Radiance , even [THOU]2766-thou wouldst consent to immure [thyself]2769-thyself in the darkness of mortality for sake of [thy]2766-thou fancied creation ! Even [THOU]2766-thou wouldst submit to suffer and to die , in order to show [the frail children of [thy]2766-thou dream]2770-the frail children of thy dream a purely sinless and spiritual example ! Even [THOU]2766-thou hast had the courage to plead with the One All - Sufficing Voice against the destruction of what to [thee]2766-thou was but a mirage floating in this ether ! Even [THOU]2766-thou hast had love , forgiveness , pity ! Even [THOU]2766-thou wouldst be willing to dwell among the creatures of [thy]2766-thou fancy as one of [them]2771-them , knowing in [thy]2766-thou inner self that by so doing , [thy]2766-thou spiritual presence would have marked [[thy]2766-thou little world]2772-thy little world for ever as sanctified and impossible to destroy . Even [THOU]2766-thou wouldst sacrifice a glory to answer [a child]369-a child 's prayer - even [thou]2766-thou wouldst have patience ! And yet [thou]2766-thou hast dared to deny to [God]101-god those attributes which [thou]2766-thou thyself dost possess - [He]101-god is so great and vast - [thou]2766-thou so small and slight ! For the love [thou]2766-thou feelest throbbing through [thy]2766-thou being , [He]101-god is the very commencement and perfection of all love ; if [thou]2766-thou hast pity , [He]101-god has ten thousand times more pity ; if [THOU]2766-thou canst forgive , remember that from [Him]101-god flows all [thy]2766-thou power of forgiveness ! There is nothing [thou]2766-thou canst do , even at the highest height of spiritual perfection , that [He]101-god can not surpass by a thousand million fold ! Neither shalt [thou]2766-thou refuse to believe that [He]101-god can also suffer . Know that nothing is more godlike than unselfish sorrow - and the grief of [the Creator over one erring human soul]2774-the creator over one erring human soul is as vast as [He]101-god [Himself]101-god is vast . Why wouldst [thou]2766-thou make of [Him]101-god a being destitute of the best emotions that [He]101-god [Himself]101-god bestows upon [thee]2766-thou ? [THOU]2766-thou wouldst have entered into [[thy]2766-thou dream - world]2775-thy dream - world and lived in [it]2775-thy dream - world and died in it , if by so doing [thou]2766-thou couldst have drawn one of [[thy]2766-thou creatures]2776-thy creatures back to the love of [thee]2766-thou ; and wilt [thou]2766-thou not receive the Christ ? "[1080-the angel]

[I]0-i bowed [my]0-i head , and a flood of joy rushed through [me]0-i .

" [I]0-i believe - [I]0-i believe and [I]0-i love ! "[0-i] [I]0-i murmured . " Desert [me]0-i not , [O radiant Angel]2777-o radiant angel ! [I]0-i feel and know that all these wonders must soon pass away from [my]0-i sight ; but wilt [thou]2766-thou also go ? "[0-i]

[The Angel]1080-the angel smiled and touched [me]0-i .

" [I]1080-the angel am [[thy]2766-thou guardian]2778-thy guardian , "[1080-the angel] it said . " [I]1080-the angel have been with [thee]2766-thou always . [I]1080-the angel can never leave [thee]2766-thou so long as [thy]2766-thou soul seeks spiritual things . Asleep or awake on [the Earth]374-the earth , wherever [thou]2766-thou art , [I]1080-the angel also am . There have been times when [I]1080-the angel have warned [thee]2766-thou and [thou]2766-thou wouldst not listen , when [I]1080-the angel have tried to draw [thee]2766-thou onward and [thou]2766-thou wouldst not come ; but now [I]1080-the angel fear no more [thy]2766-thou disobedience , for [thy]2766-thou restlessness is past . Come with [me]1080-the angel ; it is permitted [thee]2766-thou to see far off the vision of the Last Circle . "[1080-the angel]

[The glorious figure]1085-the glorious figure raised [me]0-i gently by the hand , and [we]1086-we floated on and on , higher and higher , past little circles which [[my]0-i guide]977-my guide told [me]0-i were all solar systems , though they looked nothing but slender garlands of fire , so rapidly did they revolve and so swiftly did [we]1086-we pass [them]1088-them . Higher and higher [we]1086-we went , till even to [my]0-i untiring spirit the way seemed long . [Beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer , passed [us]1086-we every now and then , [some in bands of twos and threes]1090-some in bands of twos and threes , [some alone]1091-some alone ; and the higher [we]1086-we soared [the more dazzlingly lovely these inhabitants of the air]1092-the more dazzlingly lovely these inhabitants of the air seemed to be .

" [They]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer are all born of [the Great Circle]46-the great circle , "[195-angel] [[my]0-i guardian]1093-my guardian [Angel]195-angel explained to [me]0-i : " and to [them]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer is given the power of communicating high thought or inspiration . Among [them]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer are [the Spirits of Music , of Poesy , of Prophecy]2780-the spirits of music , of poesy , of prophecy , and of all Art ever known in [all worlds]2684-all worlds .
