"[195-angel]

Just then [I]0-i saw a Shape coming towards [me]0-i as of [a lovely fair - haired child , who seemed to be playing softly on a strange glittering instrument like a broken cloud strung through with sunbeams]1094-a lovely fair - haired child , who seemed to be playing softly on a strange glittering instrument like a broken cloud strung through with sunbeams . Heedless of consequences , [I]0-i caught at its misty robe in a wild effort to detain it . [It]1095-it obeyed [my]0-i touch , and turned its deeply luminous eyes first upon [me]0-i , and then upon the Angel who accompanied [my]0-i flight .

" What seekest [thou]2782-thou ? "[1096-the young shape] it asked in a voice like the murmuring of the wind among flowers .

" Music ! "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " Sing [me]0-i [thy]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer melodies - fill [me]0-i with harmonies divine and unreachable - and [I]0-i will strive to be worthy of [thy]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer teachings ! "[0-i]

[The young Shape]1096-the young shape smiled and drew closer towards [me]0-i .

" [Thy]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer wish is granted , [Sister Spirit]196-spirit ! "[1096-the young shape] it replied . " The pity [I]1096-the young shape shall feel for [thy]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer fate when [thou]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer art again pent in clay , shall be taught [thee]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer in minor music - [thou]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer shalt possess the secret of unwritten sound , and [I]1096-the young shape will sing to [thee]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer and bring [thee]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer comfort . [On Earth]38-the earth , call but [my]1096-the young shape name - [Aeon]197-aeon ! and [thou]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer shalt behold [me]1096-the young shape . For [thy]1096-the young shape longing voice is known to [the Children of Music]2783-the children of music , and hath oft shaken the vibrating light wherein [they]2783-the children of music dwell . Fear not ! As long as [thou]1089-beautiful creatures in human shape , but as delicate as gossamer dost love [me]1096-the young shape , [I]1096-the young shape am thine . "[1096-the young shape] And parting slowly , still smiling , the lovely vision , with its small radiant hands ever wandering among the starry strings of its cloud - like lyre , floated onward .

Suddenly a clear voice said " Welcome ! "[106-azul] and looking up [I]0-i saw [[my]0-i first friend]1097-my first friend , [Azul]106-azul . [I]0-i smiled in glad recognition - [I]0-i would have spoken - but lo ! a wide immensity of blazing glory broke like many - coloured lightning around [me]0-i - so dazzling , so overpowering , that [I]0-i instinctively drew back and paused - [I]0-i felt [I]0-i could go no further .

" Here , "[1093-my guardian] said [[my]0-i guardian]1093-my guardian gently - " here ends [thy]1093-my guardian journey . Would that it were possible , [poor Spirit]2784-poor spirit , for [thee]1093-my guardian to pass this boundary ! But that may not be - as yet . In the meanwhile [thou]1093-my guardian mayest gaze for a brief space upon the majestic sphere which [mortals]949-mortals dream of as [Heaven]192-heaven . Behold and see how fair is the incorruptible perfection of [[God]101-god 's World]2685-god 's world ! "[1093-my guardian]

[I]0-i looked and trembled - [I]0-i should have sunk yet further backward , had not [Azul]106-azul and [[my]0-i Angel - guide]1099-my angel - guide held [me]0-i with [their]1099-my angel - guide light yet forcible clasp . [My]0-i heart fails [me]0-i now as [I]0-i try to write of that tremendous , that sublime scene - [the Centre of [the Universe]1-the universe]1100-the centre of the universe - the Cause of all Creation . How unlike Heaven such as [we]1101-we in [our]1101-we ignorance have tried to depict ! though it is far better [we]1101-we should have a mistaken idea than none at all . What [I]0-i beheld was a circle , so huge that [no mortal measurements]1102-no mortal measurements could compass it - a wide Ring composed of seven colours , rainbow - like , but flashing with perpetual motion and brilliancy , as though a thousand million suns were for ever being woven into it to feed its transcendent lustre . From [every part of [this Ring]1104-this ring]1103-every part of this ring darted long broad shafts of light , some of which stretched out so far that [I]0-i could not see where they ended ; sometimes a bubbling shower of lightning sparks would be flung out on the pure ether , and this would instantly form into circles , small or great , and whirl round and round the enormous girdle of flame from which they had been cast , with the most inconceivable rapidity . But wonderful as the Ring was , it encompassed a Sphere yet more marvellous and dazzling ; a great Globe of opal - tinted light , revolving as it were upon its own axis , and ever surrounded by that scintillating , jewel - like wreath of electricity , whose only motion was to shine and burn within itself for ever . [I]0-i could not bear to look upon the brightness of [that magnificent central World]1105-that magnificent central world - so large that multiplying the size of the sun by a hundred thousand millions , no adequate idea could be formed of its vast proportions . And ever it revolved - and ever the Rainbow Ring around it glittered and cast forth those other rings which [I]0-i knew now were living solar systems cast forth from that electric band as a volcano casts forth fire and lava . [[My]0-i Angel - guide]1099-my angel - guide motioned [me]0-i to look towards that side of the Ring which was nearest to [the position of [the Earth]38-the earth]1107-the position of the earth . [I]0-i looked , and perceived that there the shafts of descending light formed themselves as they fell into the shape of a Cross . At this , such sorrow , love , and shame overcame [me]0-i , that [I]0-i knew not where to turn . [I]0-i murmured :

" Send [me]0-i back again , [dear Angel]2787-dear angel - send [me]0-i back to that Star of Sorrow and Error ! Let [me]0-i hasten to make amends there for all [my]0-i folly - let [me]0-i try to teach [others]324-others what now [I]0-i know . [I]0-i am unworthy to be here beside [thee]2787-dear angel - [I]0-i am unfit to look on [yonder splendid World]7-the world - let [me]0-i return to do penance for [my]0-i sins and shortcomings ; for what am [I]0-i that [God]101-god should bless [me]0-i ? and though [I]0-i should consume [myself]0-i in labour and suffering , how can [I]0-i ever hope to deserve the smallest place in that heavenly glory [I]0-i now partly behold ? "[0-i] And could [spirits]1108-spirits shed tears , [I]0-i should have wept with remorse and grief .

[Azul]106-azul spoke , softly and tenderly :

" Now [thou]2787-dear angel dost believe - henceforth [thou]2787-dear angel must love ! Love alone can pass yon flaming barrier - love alone can gain for [thee]2787-dear angel eternal bliss . In love and for love were all things made - [God]101-god loveth [His]101-god creatures , even so let [[His]101-god creatures]2789-his creatures love [Him]101-god , and so shall the twain be drawn together . "[106-azul]

" Listen ! "[1099-my angel - guide] added [[my]0-i Angel - guide]1099-my angel - guide . " [Thou]2787-dear angel hast not travelled so far as yet to remain in ignorance . [That burning Ring]2790-that burning ring [thou]2787-dear angel seest is the result of the Creator 's ever - working Intelligence ; from it all [the Universe]1-the universe hath sprung . It is exhaustless and perpetually creative ; it is pure and perfect Light . The smallest spark of that fiery essence in a mortal frame is sufficient to form a soul or spirit , such as [mine]0-i , or that of [Azul]106-azul , or thine , when [thou]2787-dear angel art perfected . [The huge world rolling within [the Ring]50-the ring]2791-the huge world rolling within the ring is where [God]101-god dwells . Dare not [thou]2787-dear angel to question [His]101-god shape , [His]101-god look , [His]101-god mien ! Know that [He]101-god is [the Supreme Spirit in which all Beauty , all Perfection , all Love]2792-the supreme spirit in which all beauty , all perfection , all love , find consummation . [His]101-god breath is the fire of the Ring ; [His]101-god look , [His]101-god pleasure , cause the motion of [[His]101-god World]2793-his world and [all worlds]2684-all worlds . There where [He]101-god dwells , dwell also [all pure souls]2795-all pure souls ; there all desires have fulfilment without satiety , and there all loveliness , wisdom or pleasure known in any or all of the other spheres are also known . Speak , [Azul]106-azul , and tell [this wanderer]2796-this wanderer from [Earth]1946-earth what [she]2796-this wanderer will gain in winning [her]2796-this wanderer place in Heaven . "[106-azul]

[Azul]106-azul looked tenderly upon [me]0-i and said :

" When [thou]2798-thou hast slept the brief sleep of death , when [thou]2798-thou art permitted to throw off for ever [thy]2798-thou garb of clay , and when by thine own ceaseless love and longing [thou]2798-thou hast won the right to pass [the Great Circle]46-the great circle , [thou]2798-thou shalt find [thyself]2798-thou in [a land where the glories of the natural scenery]2799-a land where the glories of the natural scenery alone shall overpower [thee]2798-thou with joy - scenery that for ever changes into new wonders and greater beauty . [Thou]2798-thou shalt hear music such as [thou]2798-thou canst not dream of . [Thou]2798-thou shalt find [friends]1768-friends , beyond all imagination fair and faithful . [Thou]2798-thou shalt read and see the history of all [the planets]1837-the planets , produced for [thee]2798-thou in an ever - moving panorama . [Thou]2798-thou shalt love and be beloved for ever by [thine]2798-thou own Twin Soul ; wherever that spirit may be now , it must join [thee]2798-thou hereafter . The joys of learning , memory , consciousness , sleep , waking , and exercise shall all be thine . Sin , sorrow , pain , disease and death [thou]2798-thou shalt know no more . [Thou]2798-thou shalt be able to remember happiness , to possess it , and to look forward to it . [Thou]2798-thou shalt have full and pleasant occupation without fatigue - [thy]2798-thou food and substance shall be light and air . Flowers , rare and imperishable , shall bloom for [thee]2798-thou ; birds of exquisite form and tender voice shall sing to [thee]2798-thou ; [angels]289-angels shall be [[thy]2798-thou companions]2803-thy companions . [Thou]2798-thou shalt have fresh and glad desires to offer to [God]101-god with every portion of [thy]2798-thou existence , and each one shall be granted as soon as asked , for then [thou]2798-thou wilt not be able to ask anything that is displeasing to [Him]101-god . But because it is a joy to wish , [thou]2798-thou shalt wish ! and because it is a joy to grant , so also will [He]101-god grant . No delight , small or great , is wanting in that vast sphere ; only sorrow is lacking , and satiety and disappointment have no place . Wilt [thou]2798-thou seek for admittance there or wilt [thou]2798-thou faint by the way and grow weary ? "[106-azul]

[I]0-i raised [my]0-i eyes full of ecstasy and reverence .

" [My]0-i mere efforts must count as nothing , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " but if Love can help [me]0-i , [I]0-i will love and long for [[God]101-god 's World]2685-god 's world until [I]0-i die ! "[0-i]

[[My]0-i guardian]1093-my guardian Angel pointed to those rays of light [I]0-i had before noticed , that slanted downwards towards [Earth]38-the earth in the form of a Cross .

" That is the path by which [THOU]2798-thou must travel . Mark it well ! [All pilgrims from [the Sorrowful Star]45-the sorrowful star]2805-all pilgrims from the sorrowful star must journey by [that road]2806-that road . Woe to [them]2805-all pilgrims from the sorrowful star that turn aside to roam [mid spheres [they]2805-all pilgrims from the sorrowful star know not of]2807-mid spheres they know not of , to lose [themselves]2805-all pilgrims from the sorrowful star in [seas of light]2808-seas of light wherein [they]2805-all pilgrims from the sorrowful star can not steer ! Remember [my]1093-my guardian warning ! And now , Spirit who art commended to [my]1093-my guardian watchful care , [thy]2798-thou brief liberty is ended . [Thou]2798-thou hast been lifted up to the outer edge of the Electric Circle , further [we]2809-we dare not take [thee]2798-thou . Hast [thou]2798-thou aught else to ask before the veil of mortality again enshrouds [thee]2798-thou ? "[1093-my guardian]

[I]0-i answered not , but within [myself]0-i [I]0-i formed a wild desire . The Electric Ring flashed fiercely on [my]0-i uplifted eyes , but [I]0-i kept them fixed hopefully and lovingly on its intensely deep brilliancy .

" If Love and Faith can avail [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i murmured , " [I]0-i shall see what [I]0-i have sought . "[0-i]

[I]0-i was not disappointed . The fiery waves of light parted on either side of the spot where [I]0-i with [[my]0-i companions]1111-my companions rested ; and [a Figure , - majestic , unutterably grand and beautiful]1112-a figure , - majestic , unutterably grand and beautiful , - approached [me]0-i . At the same moment a number of other faces and forms shone hoveringly out of the Ring ; one [I]0-i noticed like [an exquisitely lovely woman , with floating hair and clear , earnest , unfathomable eyes]1113-an exquisitely lovely woman , with floating hair and clear , earnest , unfathomable eyes . [Azul]106-azul and [the Angel]1080-the angel sank reverently down and drooped [their]1115-their radiant heads like flowers in hot sunshine . [I]0-i alone , daringly , yet with inexpressible affection welling up within [me]0-i , watched with unshrinking gaze the swift advance of that supreme Figure , upon whose broad brows rested the faint semblance of a Crown of Thorns . A voice penetratingly sweet addressed [me]0-i :

" Mortal from the Star [I]0-i saved from ruin , because [thou]2810-thy hast desired [Me]0-i , [I]0-i come ! Even as [thy]2810-thy former unbelief , shall be now [thy]2810-thy faith . Because [thou]2810-thy lovest [Me]0-i , [I]0-i am with [thee]2810-thy . For do [I]0-i not know [thee]2810-thy better than [the Angels]198-the angels can ? Have [I]0-i not dwelt in [thy]2810-thy clay , suffered [thy]2810-thy sorrows , wept [thy]2810-thy tears , died [thy]2810-thy deaths ? One with [[My]0-i Father]2013-my father , and yet one with [thee]2810-thy , [I]0-i demand [thy]2810-thy love , and so through [Me]0-i shalt [thou]2810-thy attain immortal life ! "[0-i]

[I]0-i felt a touch upon [me]0-i like a scorching flame - a thrill rushed through [my]0-i being - and then [I]0-i knew that [I]0-i was sinking down , down , further and further away . [I]0-i saw that wondrous Figure standing serene and smiling between the retiring waves of electric radiance . [I]0-i saw the great inner sphere revolve , and glitter as it rolled , like an enormous diamond encircled with gold and sapphire , and then all suddenly the air grew dim and cloudy , and the sensation of falling became more and more rapid . [Azul]106-azul was beside [me]0-i still , and [I]0-i also perceived the outline of [my]0-i guardian Angel 's form , though that was growing indistinct . [I]0-i now recalled the request of [Heliobas]104-heliobas , and spoke :

" [Azul]106-azul , tell [me]0-i what shadow rests upon the life of [him]106-azul to whom [I]0-i am now returning ? "[0-i]

[Azul]106-azul looked at [me]0-i earnestly , and replied :

" [Thou]0-i daring one ! Seekest [thou]0-i to pierce the future fate of [others]324-others ? Is it not enough for [thee]0-i to have heard the voice that maketh [the Angel]1080-the angel 's singing silent , and wouldst [thou]0-i yet know more ? "[106-azul]

[I]0-i was full of a strange unhesitating courage , therefore [I]0-i said fearlessly :

" [He]106-azul is [[thy]0-i Beloved one]2814-thy beloved one , [Azul]106-azul - [thy]0-i Twin Soul ; and wilt [thou]0-i let [him]106-azul fall away from [thee]0-i when a word or sign might save [him]106-azul ? "[0-i]

" Even as [he]106-azul is [[my]106-azul Beloved]2815-my beloved , so let [him]106-azul not fail to hear [my]106-azul voice , "[106-azul] replied [Azul]106-azul , with a tinge of melancholy . " For though [he]106-azul has accomplished much , [he]106-azul is as yet but mortal . [Thou]0-i canst guide [him]106-azul thus far ; tell [him]106-azul , when death lies like a gift in [his]106-azul hand , let [him]106-azul withhold it , and remember [me]106-azul . And now , [[my]106-azul friend]365-my friend - farewell ! "[106-azul]

[I]0-i would have spoken again , but could not . An oppressed sensation came over [me]0-i , and [I]0-i seemed to plunge coldly into a depth of inextricable blackness . [I]0-i felt cramped for room , and struggled for existence , for motion , for breath . What had happened to [me]0-i ? [I]0-i wondered indignantly . Was [I]0-i [a fettered prisoner]1116-a fettered prisoner ? had [I]0-i lost the use of [my]0-i light aerial limbs that had borne [me]0-i so swiftly through [the realms of space]935-the realms of space ? What crushing weight overpowered [me]0-i ? why such want of air and loss of delightful ease ? [I]0-i sighed restlessly and impatiently at the narrow darkness in which [I]0-i found [myself]0-i - a sorrowful , deep , shuddering sigh .... and WOKE ! That is to say , [I]0-i languidly opened mortal eyes to find [myself]0-i once more pent up in mortal frame , though [I]0-i retained a perfect remembrance and consciousness of everything [I]0-i had experienced during [my]0-i spirit - wanderings . [Heliobas]104-heliobas stood in front of [me]0-i with outstretched hands , and [his]104-heliobas eyes were fixed on [mine]0-i with a mingled expression of anxiety and authority , which changed into a look of relief and gladness as [I]0-i smiled at [him]104-heliobas and uttered [his]104-heliobas name aloud .

CHAPTER XII .

[SECRETS OF THE SUN AND MOON]1118-secrets of the sun and moon .

" Have [I]0-i been long away ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , as [I]0-i raised [myself]0-i upright in the chair where [I]0-i had been resting .

" [I]104-heliobas sent [you]0-i from hence on Thursday morning at noon , "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas . " It is now Friday evening , and within a few minutes of midnight . [I]104-heliobas was growing alarmed . [I]104-heliobas have never known [anyone]2062-anyone stay absent for so long ; and [you]0-i resisted [my]104-heliobas authority so powerfully , that [I]104-heliobas began to fear [you]0-i would never come back at all . "[104-heliobas]

" [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had not been compelled to do so ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said regretfully .

[He]104-heliobas smiled .

" No doubt [you]0-i do . It is the general complaint . Will [you]0-i stand up now and see how [you]0-i feel ? "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i obeyed . There was still a slight sensation about [me]0-i as of being cramped for space ; but this was passing , and otherwise [I]0-i felt singularly strong , bright and vigorous . [I]0-i stretched out [my]0-i hands in unspeakable gratitude to [him]104-heliobas through whose scientific power [I]0-i had gained [my]0-i recent experience .

" [I]0-i can never thank [you]104-heliobas enough ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said earnestly . " [I]0-i dare say [you]104-heliobas know something of what [I]0-i have seen on [my]0-i journey ? "[0-i]

" Something , but not all , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas replied . " Of course [I]104-heliobas know what worlds and systems [you]0-i saw , but what was said to [you]0-i , or what special lessons were given [you]0-i for [your]0-i comfort , [I]104-heliobas can not tell . "[104-heliobas] " Then [I]0-i will describe everything while it is fresh upon [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i returned . " [I]0-i feel that [I]0-i must do so in order that [you]0-i may understand how glad [I]0-i am , - how grateful [I]0-i am to [you]0-i . "[0-i]

[I]0-i then related the different scenes through which [I]0-i had passed , omitting no detail . [Heliobas]104-heliobas listened with profound interest and attention . When [I]0-i had finished , [he]104-heliobas said :

" [Yours]0-i has been a most wonderful , [I]1119-i may say almost exceptional , experience . It proves to [me]1119-i more than ever the omnipotence of WILL . [Most of those who have been placed by [my]1119-i means in the Uplifted or [Electric]51-electric [state of being]2819-state of being]2818-most of those who have been placed by my means in the uplifted or electric state of being , have consented to it simply to gratify a sense of curiosity - [few]275-few therefore have gone beyond the pure ether , where , as in [a sea]2821-a sea , [the planets]1837-the planets swim . [Cellini]97-cellini , for instance , never went farther than [Venus]43-venus , because in [the atmosphere of [that planet]2824-that planet]2823-the atmosphere of that planet [he]97-cellini met the Spirit that rules and divides [his]97-cellini destiny . [Zara]152-zara - [she]152-zara was daring , and reached [the outer rim of [the Great Circle]46-the great circle]2825-the outer rim of the great circle ; but even [she]152-zara never caught a glimpse of the great Central Sphere . [YOU]2826-you , differing from these , started with a daring aim which [you]2826-you never lost sight of till [you]2826-you had fulfilled it . How true are those words : ' Ask , and it shall be given [you]2826-you ; seek , and [ye]2826-you shall find ; knock , and it shall be opened unto [you]2826-you ' ! It is not possible , "[1119-i] and here [he]1119-i sighed , " that amid such wonders [you]0-i could have remembered [me]1119-i - it were foolish on [my]1119-i part to expect it . "[1119-i]

" [I]0-i confess [I]0-i thought nothing of [you]1119-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i said frankly , " till [I]0-i was approaching [Earth]38-the earth again ; but then [my]0-i memory prompted [me]0-i in time , and [I]0-i did not forget [your]1119-i request . "[0-i]

" And what did [you]0-i learn ? "[1119-i] [he]1119-i asked anxiously .

" Simply this . [Azul]106-azul said that [I]0-i might deliver [you]0-i this message : When death lies like a gift in [your]0-i hand , withhold it , and remember [her]2827-her . "[0-i]

" As if [I]104-heliobas did not always guide [myself]104-heliobas by [her]2827-her promptings ! "[104-heliobas] exclaimed [Heliobas]104-heliobas , with a tender smile .

" [You]1119-i might forget to do so for once , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Never ! "[1119-i] [he]1119-i replied fervently . " It could not be . But [I]1119-i thank [you]0-i , [[my]1119-i child]1853-my child , for having thought of [me]1119-i - the message [you]0-i bring shall be impressed strongly on [my]1119-i mind . Now , before [you]0-i leave [me]1119-i to - night , [I]1119-i must say a few necessary words . "[1119-i]

[He]1119-i paused , and appeared to consider profoundly for some minutes . At last [he]1119-i spoke .

" [I]1119-i have selected certain writings for [your]0-i perusal , "[1119-i] [he]1119-i said . " In them [you]0-i will find full and clear instructions how to cultivate and educate the electric force within [you]0-i , and thus continue the work [I]1119-i have begun . With these [you]0-i will also perceive that [I]1119-i have written out the receipt for the volatile fluid which , if taken in a small quantity every day , will keep [you]0-i in health , strength , and intellectual vigour , while it will preserve [your]0-i youth and enjoyment of life to a very much longer extent than that usually experienced by [the majority]2829-the majority . Understand [me]1119-i well - this liquid of itself can not put [you]0-i into an uplifted state of existence ; [you]0-i need HUMAN electric force applied strongly to [your]0-i system to compass this ; and as it is dangerous to try the experiment too often - dangerous to the body , [I]1119-i mean - it will be as well , as [you]0-i have work to do yet in this life , not to attempt it again . But if [you]0-i drink the fluid every morning of [your]0-i life , and at the same time obey [my]1119-i written manual as to the cultivation of [your]0-i own inner force , which is already existent in a large degree , [you]0-i will attain to certain advantages over the rest of [the people [you]0-i meet]2830-the people you meet , which will give [you]0-i not only physical , but mental power . "[1119-i]

[He]1120-he paused a minute or two , and again went on :

" When [you]0-i have educated [your]0-i Will to a certain height of electric command , [you]0-i can at [your]0-i pleasure see at any time , and see plainly , the spirits who inhabit the air ; and also [those who , descending to long distances below [the Great Circle]46-the great circle]2831-those who , descending to long distances below the great circle , come within the range of human electricity , or the attractive matter contained in [the Earth]38-the earth 's atmosphere . [You]0-i can converse with [them]2831-those who , descending to long distances below the great circle , and [they]2831-those who , descending to long distances below the great circle with [you]0-i . [You]0-i will also be able , at [your]0-i desire , to see the parted spirits of [dead persons]2832-dead persons , so long as [they]2832-dead persons linger within [Earth]38-the earth 's radius , which [they]2832-dead persons seldom do , being always anxious to escape from it as soon as possible . Love may sometimes detain [them]2832-dead persons , or remorse ; but even these have to yield to the superior longings which possess [them]2832-dead persons the instant [they]2832-dead persons are set free . [You]0-i will , in [your]0-i intercourse with [[your]0-i fellow - mortals]2833-your fellow - mortals , be able to discern [their]2833-your fellow - mortals motives quickly and unerringly - [you]0-i will at once discover where [you]0-i are loved and where [you]0-i are disliked ; and not all the learning and logic of [so - called philosophers]2834-so - called philosophers shall be able to cloud [your]0-i instinct . [You]0-i will have a keener appreciation of good and beautiful things - a delightful sense of humour , and invariable cheerfulness ; and whatever [you]0-i do , unless [you]0-i make some mistake by [your]0-i own folly , will carry with it its success . And , what is perhaps a greater privilege , [you]0-i will find that [all who are brought into very close contact with]2835-all who are brought into very close contact with [you]0-i will be beneficially influenced , or the reverse , exactly as [you]0-i choose to exert [your]0-i power . [I]1121-i do not think , after what [you]0-i have seen , [you]0-i will ever desire to exert a malign influence , knowing that the Creator of [your]0-i being is all love and forgiveness . At any rate , the greatest force in [the universe]2474-the universe , electricity , is [yours]0-i - that is , it has begun to form itself in [you]0-i - and [you]0-i have nothing to do but to encourage its growth , just as [you]0-i would encourage a taste for music or the fine arts . Now let [me]1121-i give [you]0-i the writings . "[1121-i]

[He]1121-i unlocked a desk , and took from it two small rolls of parchment , one tied with a gold ribbon , the other secured in a kind of case with a clasp . This last [he]1121-i held up before [my]0-i eyes , and said :

" This contains [my]1121-i private instructions to [you]0-i . Never make a single one of them public . [The world]264-the world is not ready for wisdom , and the secrets of science can only be explained to [the few]2838-the few . Therefore keep this parchment safely under lock and key , and never let any eye but [your]0-i own look upon its contents . "[1121-i]

[I]0-i promised , and [he]1121-i handed it to [me]0-i . Then taking the other roll , which was tied with ribbon , [he]1121-i said ,

" Here is written out what [I]1121-i call the Electric Principle of Christianity . This is for [your]0-i own study and consideration ; still , if [you]0-i ever desire to explain [my]1121-i theory to [others]324-others , [I]1121-i do not forbid [you]0-i . But as [I]1121-i told [you]0-i before , [you]0-i can never compel belief - the goldfish in a glass bowl will never understand the existence of [the ocean]2840-the ocean . Be satisfied if [you]0-i can guide [yourself]0-i by the compass [you]0-i have found , but do not grieve if [you]0-i are unable to guide [others]324-others . [You]0-i may try , but it will not be surprising if [you]0-i fail . Nor will it be [your]0-i fault . The only sorrow that might happen to [you]0-i in these efforts would be in case [you]0-i should love [someone]641-someone very dearly , and yet be unable to instil the truth of what [yon]0-i know into that particular soul . [You]0-i would then have to make a discovery , which is always more or less painful - namely , that [your]0-i love was misplaced , inasmuch as the nature [you]0-i had selected as worthy of love had no part with [yours]0-i ; and that separation utter and eternal must therefore occur , if not in this life , then in the future . So [I]1121-i would say beware of loving , lest [you]0-i should not love rightly - though [I]1121-i believe [you]0-i will soon be able to discern clearly the spirit that is by fate destined to complete and perfect [your]0-i own . And now , though [I]1121-i know [you]0-i are scarcely fatigued enough to sleep , [I]1121-i will say good - night . "[1121-i]

[I]0-i took the second roll of parchment from [his]1122-his hand , and opening it a little way , [I]0-i saw that it was covered with very fine small writing . Then [I]0-i said :

" Does [Zara]152-zara know how long [I]0-i have been absent ? "[0-i]

" Yes , "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas ; " and [she]152-zara , like [myself]104-heliobas , was surprised and anxious . [I]104-heliobas think [she]152-zara went to bed long ago ; but [you]0-i may look into [[her]152-zara room]2202-her room and see if [she]152-zara is awake , before [you]0-i [yourself]0-i retire to rest . "[104-heliobas]

As [he]104-heliobas spoke of [Zara]152-zara [his]104-heliobas eyes grew melancholy and [his]104-heliobas brow clouded . An instinctive sense of fear came upon [me]0-i .

" Is [she]152-zara not well ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [She]152-zara is perfectly well , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas answered . " Why should [you]0-i imagine [her]152-zara to be otherwise ? "[104-heliobas]

" Pardon [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " [I]0-i fancied that [you]104-heliobas looked unhappy when [I]0-i mentioned [her]152-zara . "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas made no answer . [He]104-heliobas stepped to the window , and throwing back the curtain , called [me]0-i to [his]104-heliobas side .

" Look out yonder . "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said in low and earnest tones ; " look at the dark blue veil strewn with stars , through which so lately [your]0-i daring soul pierced its flight ! See how the small Moon hangs like a lamp in Heaven , apparently outshining [the myriad worlds around [her]152-zara]2844-the myriad worlds around her , that are so much vaster and fairer ! How deceptive is the human eye ! - nearly as deceptive as the human reason . Tell [me]104-heliobas - why did [you]0-i not visit [the Moon]52-the moon , or [the Sun]53-the sun , in [your]0-i recent wanderings ? "[104-heliobas]

This question caused [me]0-i some surprise . It was certainly very strange that [I]0-i had not thought of doing so . Yet , on pondering the matter in [my]0-i mind , [I]0-i remembered that during [my]0-i aerial journey suns and moons had been no more to [me]0-i than flowers strewn on [a meadow]1123-a meadow . [I]0-i now regretted that [I]0-i had not sought to know something of those two fair luminaries which light and warm [[our]1124-we earth]1125-our earth .

[Heliobas]104-heliobas , after watching [my]0-i face intently , resumed :

" [You]0-i can not guess the reason of [your]0-i omission ? [I]104-heliobas will tell [you]0-i . There is nothing to see in either Sun or [Moon]52-the moon . [They]2845-they were both inhabited worlds once ; but [the dwellers in [the Sun]53-the sun]2846-the dwellers in the sun have ages ago lived [their]2846-the dwellers in the sun lives and passed to [the Central Sphere]55-the central sphere . [The Sun]53-the sun is nothing now but a burning world , burning rapidly , and surely , away : or rather , [IT]53-the sun IS BEING ABSORBED BACK INTO [THE ELECTRIC CIRCLE]2847-the electric circle FROM WHICH IT ORIGINALLY SPRANG , TO BE THROWN OUT AGAIN IN SOME NEW AND GRANDER FORM . And so with all worlds , suns and systems , for ever and ever . Hundreds of thousands of those brief time - breathings called years may pass before this consummation of the Sun ; but its destruction is going on now , or rather its absorption - and [we]1124-we on [our]1124-we cold small star warm [ourselves]1124-we , and are glad , in the light of [an empty world on fire]2848-an empty world on fire ! "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i listened with awe and interest .

" And [the Moon]52-the moon ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked eagerly .

" [The Moon]52-the moon does not exist . What [we]1124-we see is the reflection or the electrograph of what [she]52-the moon once was . Atmospherical electricity has imprinted this picture of [a long - ago living world upon [the heavens]2850-the heavens]2849-a long - ago living world upon the heavens , just as [Raphael]124-raphael drew [his]124-raphael cartoons for [the men of to - day to see]2851-the men of to - day to see . "[104-heliobas]

" But , "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed in surprise , " how about the Moon 's influence on the tides ? and what of eclipses ? "[0-i]

" Not the Moon , but the electric photograph of [a once living but now absorbed world]2852-a once living but now absorbed world , has certainly an influence on the tides . [The sea]1792-the sea is impregnated with electricity . Just as the Sun will absorb colours , so the electricity in [the sea]1792-the sea is repelled or attracted by the electric picture of the Moon in Heaven . Because , as a painting is full of colour , so is that faithful sketch of a vanished sphere , drawn with a pencil of pure light , full of immense electricity ; and to carry the simile further , just as a painting may be said to be formed of various dark and light tints , so the electric portrait of the Moon contains various degrees of electric force - which , coming in contact with the electricity of [the Earth]38-the earth 's atmosphere , produces different effects on [us]1124-we and on the natural scenes amid which [we]1124-we dwell . As for eclipses - if [you]2855-you slowly pass a round screen between [yourself]2855-you and a blazing fire , [you]2855-you will only see the edges of the fire . In the same way the electrograph of the Moon passes at stated intervals between [the Earth]374-the earth and [the burning world of the Sun]2857-the burning world of the sun . "[104-heliobas]

" Yet surely , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " the telescope has enabled [us]1124-we to see [the Moon]52-the moon as a solid globe - [we]1124-we have discerned mountains and valleys on [its]52-the moon surface ; and then it revolves round [us]1124-we regularly - how do [you]0-i account for these facts ? "[0-i]

" The telescope , "[104-heliobas] returned [Heliobas]104-heliobas , " is merely an aid to the human eye ; and , as [I]104-heliobas told [you]2855-you before , nothing is so easily deceived as [our]1124-we sense of vision , even when assisted by mechanical appliances . The telescope , like the stereoscope , simply enables [us]1124-we to see the portrait of [the Moon]52-the moon more clearly ; but all the same , the Moon , as [a world]1082-a world , does not exist . [Her]52-the moon likeness , taken by electricity , may last some thousands of years , and as long as it lasts it must revolve around [us]1124-we , because everything in [the universe]2474-the universe moves , and moves in a circle . Besides which , this portrait of the moon being composed of pure electricity , is attracted and forced to follow [the Earth]38-the earth by the compelling influence of [the Earth]38-the earth 's own electric power . Therefore , till the picture fades , it must attend [the Earth]38-the earth like the haunting spectre of a dead joy . [You]2855-you can understand now why [we]1124-we never see what [we]1124-we imagine to be [the OTHER SIDE of [the Moon]52-the moon]2860-the other side of the moon . [It]52-the moon simply has NO other side , except space . Space is the canvas - [the Moon]52-the moon is a sketch . How interested [we]1124-we are when a discovery is made of some rare old painting , of which [the subject]2861-the subject is [a perfectly beautiful woman]2862-a perfectly beautiful woman ! It bears no name - perhaps no date - but the face that smiles at [us]1124-we is exquisite - the lips yet pout for kisses - the eyes brim over , with love ! And [we]1124-we admire it tenderly and reverently - [we]1124-we mark it ' Portrait of [a lady]2863-a lady , ' and give it an honoured place among [our]1124-we art collections . With how much more reverence and tenderness ought [we]1124-we to look up at the ' Portrait of [a Fair Lost Sphere]2864-a fair lost sphere , ' circling yonder in that dense ever - moving gallery of wonders where [the hurrying throng of spectators]2865-the hurrying throng of spectators are living and [dying worlds]2866-dying worlds ! "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i had followed [the speaker]432-the speaker 's words with fascinated attention , but now [I]0-i said :

" Dying , [Heliobas]104-heliobas ? There is no death . "[0-i]

" True ! "[432-the speaker] [he]432-the speaker answered , with hesitating slowness . " But there is what [we]1124-we call death - transition - and it is always a parting . "[432-the speaker]

" But not for long ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed , with all the gladness and eagerness of [my]0-i lately instructed soul . " As worlds are absorbed into the Electric Circle and again thrown out in new and more glorious forms , so are [we]1124-we absorbed and changed into shapes of perfect beauty , having eyes that are strong and pure enough to look [God]101-god in the face . The body perishes - but what have [WE]1124-we to do with the body - [our]1124-we prison and place of experience , except to rejoice when [we]1124-we shake off its weight for ever ! "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas smiled gravely .

" [You]0-i have learned [your]0-i high lesson well , "[432-the speaker] [he]432-the speaker said . " [You]0-i speak with the assurance and delight of a spirit satisfied . But when [I]432-the speaker talk of DEATH , [I]432-the speaker mean by that word the parting asunder of [two souls who love each other]2867-two souls who love each other ; and though such separation may be brief , still it is always a separation . For instance , suppose - "[432-the speaker] [he]432-the speaker hesitated : ' suppose [Zara]152-zara were to die ? "[432-the speaker]

" Well , [you]432-the speaker would soon meet [her]152-zara again , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " For though [you]432-the speaker might live many years after [her]152-zara , still [you]432-the speaker would know in [yourself]432-the speaker that those years were but minutes in [the realms of space]935-the realms of space - "[0-i]

" Minutes that decide [our]2869-our destinies , "[432-the speaker] [he]432-the speaker interrupted with solemnity . " And there is always this possibility to contemplate - suppose [Zara]152-zara were to leave [me]432-the speaker now , how can [I]432-the speaker be sure that [I]432-the speaker shall be strong enough to live out [my]432-the speaker remainder of life purely enough to deserve to meet [her]152-zara again ? And if not then [Zara]152-zara 's death would mean utter and almost hopeless separation for ever - though perhaps [I]432-the speaker might begin over again in some other form , and so reach the goal . "[432-the speaker]

[He]432-the speaker spoke so musingly and seriously that [I]0-i was surprised , for [I]0-i had thought [him]432-the speaker impervious to such a folly as the fear of death .

" [You]432-the speaker are melancholy , [Heliobas]104-heliobas , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " In the first place , [Zara]152-zara is not going to leave [you]432-the speaker yet ; and secondly , if [she]152-zara did , [you]432-the speaker know [your]432-the speaker strongest efforts would be brought to bear on [your]432-the speaker career , in order that no shadow of obstinacy or error might obstruct [your]432-the speaker path . Why , the very essence of [our]2870-we belief is in the strength of Will - power . What [we]2870-we WILL to do , especially if it be any act of spiritual progress , [we]2870-we can always accomplish . "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas took [my]0-i hand and pressed it warmly .

" [You]0-i are so lately come from [the high regions]2871-the high regions , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said , " that it warms and invigorates [me]104-heliobas to hear [your]0-i encouraging words . Pray do not think [me]104-heliobas capable of yielding long to the weakness of foreboding . [I]104-heliobas am , in spite of [my]104-heliobas advancement in electric science , nothing but [a man]278-a man , and am apt to be hampered oftentimes by [my]104-heliobas mortal trappings . [We]2870-we have prolonged [our]2870-we conversation further than [I]104-heliobas intended . [I]104-heliobas assure [you]0-i it is better for [you]0-i to try to sleep , even though , as [I]104-heliobas know , [you]0-i feel so wide awake . Let [me]104-heliobas give [you]0-i a soothing draught ; it will have the effect of composing [your]0-i physical nerves into steady working order . "[104-heliobas]

[He]104-heliobas poured something from a small phial into a glass , and handed it to [me]0-i . [I]0-i drank it at once , obediently , and with a smile .

" Good - night , [[my]0-i Master]1787-my master ! "[0-i] [I]0-i then said . " [You]0-i need have no fear of [your]0-i own successful upward progress . For if there were the slightest chance of [your]0-i falling into fatal error , [all those human souls [you]0-i have benefited]2874-all those human souls you have benefited would labour and pray for [your]0-i rescue ; and [I]0-i know now that prayers reach [Heaven]2721-heaven , so long as they are unselfish . [I]0-i , though [I]0-i am [one of the least of [[your]0-i disciples]2877-your disciples]2876-one of the least of your disciples , out of the deep gratitude of [my]0-i heart towards [you]0-i , will therefore pray unceasingly for [you]0-i , both here and hereafter . "[0-i]

[He]1127-he bent [his]1127-he head .

" [I]1127-he thank [you]0-i ! "[1127-he] [he]1127-he said simply . " More deeds are wrought by prayer than [this world]1957-this world dreams of ! That is a true saying . God bless [you]0-i , [[my]1127-he child]1853-my child . Good - night ! "[1127-he]

And [he]1127-he opened the door of [[his]1127-he study]796-his study for [me]0-i to pass out . As [I]0-i did so , [he]1127-he laid [his]1127-he hand lightly on [my]0-i head in a sort of unspoken benediction - then [he]1127-he closed [his]1127-he door , and [I]0-i found [myself]0-i alone in [the great hall]739-the great hall . A suspended lamp was burning brightly , and the fountain was gurgling melodiously to itself in a subdued manner , as if it were learning a new song for the morning . [I]0-i sped across [the mosaic pavement]1130-the mosaic pavement with a light eager step , and hurried up [the stairs]1131-the stairs , intent on finding [Zara]152-zara to tell [her]152-zara how happy [I]0-i felt , and how satisfied [I]0-i was with [my]0-i wonderful experience . [I]0-i reached the door of [[her]152-zara bedroom]1132-her bedroom - it was ajar . [I]0-i softly pushed it farther open , and looked in . A small but exquisitely modelled statue of an " Eros "[1127-he] ornamented one corner . [His]1127-he uplifted torch served as a light which glimmered faintly through a rose - coloured glass , and shed a tender lustre over [the room]385-the room ; but especially upon the bed , ornamented with rich Oriental needlework , where [Zara]152-zara lay fast asleep . How beautiful [she]152-zara looked ! Almost as lovely as [any one of the radiant spirits [I]0-i had met in [my]0-i aerial journey]1134-any one of the radiant spirits i had met in my aerial journey ! [Her]152-zara rich dark hair was scattered loosely on the white pillows ; [her]152-zara long silky lashes curled softly on the delicately tinted cheeks ; [her]152-zara lips , tenderly red , like the colour on budding apple - blossoms in early spring , were slightly parted , showing the glimmer of the small white teeth within ; [her]152-zara night - dress was slightly undone , and half displayed and half disguised [her]152-zara neck and daintily rounded bosom , on which the electric jewel [she]152-zara always wore glittered brilliantly as it rose and sank with [her]152-zara regular and quiet breathing . One fair hand lay outside the coverlet , and the reflection from the lamp of the " Eros "[0-i] flickered on a ring which adorned it , making its central diamond flash like a wandering star .

[I]0-i looked long and tenderly on this perfect ideal of a " Sleeping Beauty , "[0-i] and then thought [I]0-i would draw closer and see if [I]0-i could kiss [her]152-zara without awaking [her]152-zara . [I]0-i advanced a few steps into [the room]385-the room - when suddenly [I]0-i was stopped . Within about a yard 's distance from the bed a SOMETHING opposed [my]0-i approach ! [I]0-i could not move a foot forward - [I]0-i tried vigorously , but in vain ! [I]0-i could step backward , and that was all . Between [me]0-i and [Zara]152-zara there seemed to be an invisible barrier , strong , and absolutely impregnable . There was nothing to be seen - nothing but [the softly - shaded room]1136-the softly - shaded room - the ever - smiling " Eros , "[152-zara] and the exquisite reposeful figure of [[my]0-i sleeping friend]1137-my sleeping friend . Two steps , and [I]0-i could have touched [her]152-zara ; but those two steps [I]0-i was forcibly prevented from making - as forcibly as though a deep ocean had rolled between [her]152-zara and [me]0-i . [I]0-i did not stop long to consider this strange occurrence - [I]0-i felt sure it had something to do with [her]152-zara spiritual life and sympathy , therefore it neither alarmed nor perplexed [me]0-i . Kissing [my]0-i hand tenderly towards [[my]0-i darling]1138-my darling , who lay so close to [me]0-i , and who was yet so jealously and invisibly guarded during [her]152-zara slumbers , [I]0-i softly and reverently withdrew . On reaching [[my]0-i own apartment]1139-my own apartment , [I]0-i was more than half inclined to sit up reading and studying the parchments [Heliobas]104-heliobas had given [me]0-i ; but on second thoughts [I]0-i resolved to lock up these precious manuscripts and go to bed . [I]0-i did so , and before preparing to sleep [I]0-i remembered to kneel down and offer up praise and honour , with a loving and believing heart , to that Supreme Glory , of which [I]0-i had been marvellously permitted to enjoy a brief but transcendent glimpse . And as [I]0-i knelt , absorbed and happy , [I]0-i heard , like a soft echo falling through the silence of [[my]0-i room]546-my room , a sound like distant music , through which these words floated towards [me]0-i : " A new commandment give [I]0-i unto [you]0-i , that [you]0-i love [one another]2396-one another , even as [I]0-i have loved [you]0-i ! "[0-i]

CHAPTER XIII .

SOCIABLE CONVERSE .

The next morning [Zara]152-zara came [herself]152-zara to awaken [me]0-i , looking as fresh and lovely as a summer morning . [She]152-zara embraced [me]0-i very tenderly , and said :

" [I]152-zara have been talking for more than an hour with [Casimir]152-zara . [He]2881-he has told [me]152-zara everything . What wonders [you]0-i have seen ! And are [you]0-i not happy , [dearest]2664-dearest ? Are [you]0-i not strong and satisfied ? "[152-zara]

" Perfectly ! "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " But , O [Zara]152-zara ! what a pity that all [the world]264-the world should not know what [we]2884-we know ! "[0-i]

" [All]1017-all have not a desire for knowledge , "[152-zara] replied [Zara]152-zara . " Even in [your]0-i vision of [the garden]315-the garden [you]0-i possessed , there were only [a few who still sought [you]0-i]2887-a few who still sought you ; for those few [you]0-i would have done anything , but for [the others]2888-the others [your]0-i best efforts were in vain . "[152-zara]

" [They]2887-a few who still sought you might not have been always in vain , "[0-i] [I]0-i said musingly .

" No , [they]2887-a few who still sought you might not , "[152-zara] agreed [Zara]152-zara . " That is just the case of [the world]264-the world to - day . While there is life in it , there is also hope . And talking of [the world]264-the world , let [me]152-zara remind [you]0-i that [you]0-i are back in [it]264-the world now , and must therefore be hampered with tiresome trivialities . Two of these are as follows ; First , here is a letter for [you]0-i , which has just come ; secondly , breakfast will be ready in twenty minutes ! "[152-zara]

[I]0-i looked at [her]152-zara smiling face attentively . [She]152-zara was [the very embodiment of vigorous physical health and beauty]1141-the very embodiment of vigorous physical health and beauty ; it seemed like a dream to remember [her]152-zara in the past night , guarded by that invincible barrier , the work of no mortal hand . [I]0-i uttered nothing , however , of these thoughts , and responding to [her]152-zara evident gaiety of heart , [I]0-i smiled also .

" [I]0-i will be down punctually at the expiration of the twenty minutes , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [I]0-i assure [you]0-i , [Zara]152-zara , [I]0-i am quite sensible of the claims of earthly existence upon [me]0-i . For instance , [I]0-i am very hungry , and [I]0-i shall enjoy breakfast immensely if [you]0-i will make the coffee . "[0-i]

[Zara]152-zara , who among [her]152-zara other accomplishments had the secret of making coffee to perfection , promised laughingly to make it extra well , and flitted from [the room]385-the room , singing softly as [she]152-zara went a fragment of the Neapolitan Stornello :

" Fior di mortelle Queste manine tue son tanto belle ! Fior di limone Ti voglio far morire di passione Salta ! [lari - lira]2891-lari - lira . "[152-zara]

The letter [Zara]152-zara had brought [me]0-i was from [Mrs. Everard]152-zara , announcing that [she]152-zara would arrive in [Paris]5-paris that very day , Sunday .

" By the time [you]0-i get this note , "[152-zara] so ran [her]152-zara words , " [we]2892-we shall have landed at [the Grand Hotel]629-the grand hotel . Come and see [us]2892-we at once , if [you]0-i can . [The Colonel]1857-the colonel is anxious to judge for [himself]1857-the colonel how [you]0-i are looking . If [you]0-i are really recovered sufficiently to leave [your]0-i medical pension , [we]2892-we shall be delighted to have [you]0-i with [us]2892-we again . [I]152-zara , in particular , shall be glad , for it is real lonesome when [the Colonel]1857-the colonel is out , and [I]152-zara do hate to go [shopping]2896-shopping by [myself]152-zara , So take pity upon [your]0-i affectionate[152-zara]

" [AMY]93-amy . "[152-zara]

Seated at breakfast , [I]0-i discussed this letter with [Heliobas]104-heliobas and [Zara]152-zara , and decided that [I]0-i would call at [the Grand Hotel]629-the grand hotel that morning .

" [I]0-i wish [you]152-zara would come with [me]0-i , [Zara]152-zara , "[0-i] [I]0-i said wistfully .

To [my]0-i surprise , [she]152-zara answered :

" Certainly [I]152-zara will , if [you]0-i like . But [we]2897-we will attend High Mass at [Notre Dame]57-notre dame first . There will be plenty of time for the call afterwards . "[152-zara]

[I]0-i gladly agreed to this , and [Heliobas]104-heliobas added with cheerful cordiality :

" Why not ask [[your]0-i friends]2125-your friends to dine here to - morrow ? [Zara]152-zara 's call will be a sufficient opening formality ; and [you]0-i [yourself]0-i have been long enough with [us]2897-we now to know that [any of [[your]0-i friends]2125-your friends]2899-any of your friends will be welcome [here]1773-here . [We]2897-we might have a pleasant little party , especially if [you]0-i add [Mr.]2902-mr. and [Mrs. Challoner]156-mrs. challoner and [[their]2897-we daughters]649-their daughters to the list . And [I]104-heliobas will ask [Ivan]153-prince ivan . "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i glanced at [Zara]152-zara when [the Prince]708-the prince 's name was uttered , but [she]152-zara made no sign of either offence or indifference .

" [You]104-heliobas are very hospitable , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , addressing [Heliobas]104-heliobas ; " but [I]0-i really see no reason why [you]104-heliobas should throw open [your]104-heliobas doors to [[my]0-i friends]336-my friends , unless , indeed , [you]104-heliobas specially desire to please [me]0-i . "[0-i]

" Why , of course [I]104-heliobas do ! "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas replied heartily ; and [Zara]152-zara looked up and smiled .

" Then , "[0-i] [I]0-i returned , " [I]0-i will ask [them]336-my friends to come . What am [I]0-i to say about [my]0-i recovery , which [I]0-i know is little short of miraculous ? "[0-i]

" Say , "[104-heliobas] replied [Heliobas]104-heliobas , " that [you]0-i have been cured by electricity . There is nothing surprising in such a statement nowadays . But say nothing of the HUMAN electric force employed upon [you]0-i - [no one]1820-no one would believe [you]0-i , and the effort to persuade [unpersuadable people]2906-unpersuadable people is always a waste of time . "[104-heliobas]

An hour after this conversation [Zara]152-zara and [I]0-i were in [the cathedral of [Notre Dame]57-notre dame]1145-the cathedral of notre dame . [I]0-i attended the service with very different feelings to those [I]0-i had hitherto experienced during the same ceremony . Formerly [my]0-i mind had been distracted by harassing doubts and perplexing contradictions ; now everything had a meaning for [me]0-i - high , and solemn , and sweet . As the incense rose , [I]0-i thought of those rays of connecting light [I]0-i had seen , on which prayers travel exactly as sound travels through the telephone . As the grand organ pealed sonorously through the fragrant air , [I]0-i remembered [the ever youthful and gracious Spirits of Music]1146-the ever youthful and gracious spirits of music , one of whom , [Aeon]197-aeon , had promised to be [[my]0-i friend]365-my friend . Just to try the strength of [my]0-i own electric force , [I]0-i whispered the name and looked up . There , on a wide slanting ray of sunlight that fell directly across the altar was the angelic face [I]0-i well remembered ! - the delicate hands holding the semblance of a harp in air ! It was but for an instant [I]0-i saw it - one brief breathing - space in which its smile mingled with the sunbeams and then it vanished . But [I]0-i knew [I]0-i was not forgotten , and the deep satisfaction of [my]0-i soul poured itself in unspoken praise on the flood of the " Sanctus ! Sanctus ! "[152-zara] that just then rolled triumphantly through [the aisles of [Notre Dame]57-notre dame]1148-the aisles of notre dame . [Zara]152-zara was absorbed in silent prayer throughout the Mass ; but at its conclusion , when [we]1149-we came out of [the cathedral]421-the cathedral , [she]152-zara was unusually gay and elate . [She]152-zara conversed vivaciously with [me]0-i concerning the social merits and accomplishments of [the people [we]1149-we were going to visit]1151-the people we were going to visit ; while the brisk walk through the frosty air brightened [her]152-zara eyes and cheeks into warmer lustre , so that on [our]1149-we arrival at [the Grand Hotel]629-the grand hotel [she]152-zara looked to [my]0-i fancy even lovelier than usual .

[Mrs. Everard]152-zara did not keep [us]1149-we waiting long in [the private salon to which [we]1149-we were shown]1153-the private salon to which we were shown . [She]152-zara fluttered down , arrayed in a wonderful " art "[152-zara] gown of terra - cotta and pale blue hues cunningly intermixed , and proceeded to hug [me]0-i with demonstrative fervour . Then [she]152-zara held [me]0-i a little distance off , and examined [me]0-i attentively .

" Do [you]0-i know , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said , " [you]0-i are simply in lovely condition ! [I]152-zara never would have believed it . [You]0-i are actually as plump and pink as a peach . And [you]0-i are [the same creature that wailed and trembled , and had palpitations and headaches and stupors]2907-the same creature that wailed and trembled , and had palpitations and headaches and stupors ! [[Your]0-i doctor]2200-your doctor must be [a perfect magician]2909-a perfect magician . [I]152-zara think [I]152-zara must consult [him]2200-your doctor , for [I]152-zara am sure [I]152-zara do n't look half as well as [you]0-i do . "[152-zara]

And indeed [she]152-zara did not . [I]0-i thought [she]152-zara had a tired , dragged appearance , but [I]0-i would not say so . [I]0-i knew [her]152-zara well , and [I]0-i was perfectly aware that though [she]152-zara was fascinating and elegant in every way , [her]152-zara life was too much engrossed in trifles ever to yield [her]152-zara healthy satisfaction .

After responding warmly to [her]152-zara affectionate greeting , [I]0-i said :

" [Amy]93-amy , [you]93-amy must allow [me]0-i to introduce [the sister of [[my]0-i doctor]2911-my doctor]2910-the sister of my doctor to [you]93-amy . [Madame Zara Casimir - Mrs. Everard]152-zara . "[0-i]

[Zara]152-zara , who had moved aside a little way out of delicacy , to avoid intruding on [our]1154-our meeting , now turned , and with [her]152-zara own radiant smile and exquisite grace , stretched out [her]152-zara little well - gloved hand .

" [I]152-zara am delighted to know [you]0-i ! "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said , in those sweet penetrating accents of hers which were like music . " [[YOUR]0-i friend]1987-your friend , "[152-zara] here indicating [me]0-i by a slight yet tender gesture , " has also become [mine]0-i ; but [I]152-zara do not think [we]1156-we shall be jealous , shall [we]1156-we ? "[152-zara]

[Mrs. Everard]152-zara made some attempt at a suitable reply , but [she]152-zara was so utterly lost in admiration of [Zara]152-zara 's beauty , that [her]152-zara habitual self - possession almost deserted [her]152-zara . [Zara]152-zara , however , had the most perfect tact , and with it the ability of making [herself]152-zara at [home]1856-home anywhere , and [we]1156-we were soon [all three]1157-all three talking cheerfully and without constraint . When [the Colonel]1857-the colonel made [his]1857-the colonel appearance , which [he]1857-the colonel did very shortly , [he]1857-the colonel too was " taken off [his]1857-the colonel feet , "[1857-the colonel] as the saying is , by [Zara]152-zara 's loveliness , and the same effect was produced on [the Challoners]177-the challoners , who soon afterwards joined [us]1156-we in a body . [Mrs. Challoner]156-mrs. challoner , in particular , seemed incapable of moving [her]156-mrs. challoner eyes from the contemplation of [[my]0-i darling]1138-my darling 's sweet face , and [I]0-i glowed with pride and pleasure as [I]0-i noted how greatly [she]156-mrs. challoner was admired . [Mrs. Everard]152-zara then wanted [me]0-i to remain with [her]152-zara for the rest of the afternoon ; but an instinctive feeling came upon [me]0-i , that soon perhaps [I]0-i should have to part from [Heliobas]104-heliobas and [Zara]152-zara , and all the wonders and delights of [[their]1165-the challoner family household]1169-their household , in order to resume [my]0-i own working life - therefore [I]0-i determined [I]0-i would drain [my]0-i present cup of pleasure to the last drop . " Say , "[156-mrs. challoner] interrupted [Mrs. Challoner]156-mrs. challoner , turning to [me]0-i at this juncture , " now [you]0-i are feeling so well , would it be asking [you]0-i too much to play [us]1177-us a piece of [your]0-i own improvising ? "[156-mrs. challoner]

[I]0-i glanced at the grand piano , which occupied a corner of [the salon where [we]1177-us sat]1176-the salon where we sat , and hesitated . But at a slight nod from [Zara]152-zara , [I]0-i rose , drew off [my]0-i gloves , and seated [myself]0-i at the instrument . Passing [my]0-i hands lightly over the keys , [I]0-i wandered through a few running passages ; and as [I]0-i did so , murmured a brief petition to [[my]0-i aerial friend]1178-my aerial friend [Aeon]197-aeon . Scarcely had [I]0-i done this , when a flood of music seemed to rush to [my]0-i brain and thence to [my]0-i fingers , and [I]0-i played , hardly knowing what [I]0-i played , but merely absorbed in trying to give utterance to the sounds which were falling softly upon [my]0-i inner sense of hearing like drops of summer rain on a thirsty soil . [I]0-i was just aware that [I]0-i was threading the labyrinth of a minor key , and that the result was a network of delicate and tender melody reminding [me]0-i of [Heinrich Heine]202-heinrich heine 's words :

" [Lady]2943-lady , did [you]2943-lady not hear [the nightingale]2944-the nightingale sing ? A beautiful silken voice - a web of happy notes - and [my]202-heinrich heine soul was taken in its meshes , and strangled and tortured thereby . "[202-heinrich heine]

A few minutes , and the inner voice that conversed with [me]0-i so sweetly , died away into silence , and at the same time [my]0-i fingers found their way to the closing chord . As one awaking from a dream , [I]0-i looked up . [The little group of friendly listeners]1179-the little group of friendly listeners were rapt in the deepest attention ; and when [I]0-i ceased , a murmur of admiration broke from [them]1179-the little group of friendly listeners all , while [Zara]152-zara 's eyes glistened with sympathetic tears .

" How can [you]0-i do it ? "[156-mrs. challoner] asked [Mrs. Challoner]156-mrs. challoner in good - natured amazement . " It seems to [me]156-mrs. challoner impossible to compose like that while seated at the piano , and without taking previous thought ! "[156-mrs. challoner]

" It is not [MY]0-i doing , "[0-i] [I]0-i began ; " it seems to come to [me]0-i from - "[0-i]

But [I]0-i was checked by a look from [Zara]152-zara , that gently warned [me]0-i not to hastily betray the secret of [my]0-i spiritual communion with the unseen sources of harmony . So [I]0-i smiled and said no more . Inwardly [I]0-i was full of a great rejoicing , for [I]0-i knew that however well [I]0-i had played in past days , it was nothing compared to the vigour and ease which were now given to [me]0-i - a sort of unlocking of the storehouse of music , with freedom to take [my]0-i choice of all its vast treasures .

" Well , it 's what [WE]2945-we call inspiration , "[199-mr. challoner] said [Mr. Challoner]199-mr. challoner , giving [my]0-i hand a friendly grasp ; " and wherever it comes from , it must be a great happiness to [yourself]0-i as well as to [others]324-others . "[199-mr. challoner]

" It is , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered earnestly . " [I]0-i believe [few]275-few are so perfectly happy in music as [I]0-i am . "[0-i]

[Mrs. Everard]152-zara looked thoughtful .

" No amount of practice could make [ME]152-zara play like that , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara said ; " yet [I]152-zara have had [two or three masters who were supposed to be first - rate]2948-two or three masters who were supposed to be first - rate . [One of [them]2948-two or three masters who were supposed to be first - rate]2344-one of them was [a German , who used to clutch [his]2344-one of them hair like [a walking tragedian]2950-a walking tragedian whenever [I]152-zara played a wrong note . But just because [he]2344-one of them worked [himself]2344-one of them into a sort of frenzy when [others]324-others went wrong , [everybody]1916-everybody praised [him]2344-one of them , and said [he]2344-one of them had such an ear and was so sensitive that [he]2344-one of them must be [a great musician]2953-a great musician . [He]2344-one of them worried [me]152-zara nearly to death over [Bach]203-bach 's ' Well - tempered Klavier ' - all to no purpose , for [I]152-zara ca n't play a note of it now , and should n't care to if [I]152-zara could . " [Schubert]175-schubert would have been [a grander master]2956-a grander master than [Beethoven]160-beethoven , if [he]175-schubert had only lived long enough , "[152-zara] said [Zara]152-zara ; " but [I]152-zara dare say very few will agree with [me]152-zara in such an assertion .
