"[708-the prince]

Overjoyed at [my]0-i success , [I]0-i answered : " [He]708-the prince is in [the chapel]2310-the chapel , but [I]0-i will fetch [him]708-the prince [here]1773-here . "[0-i]

Over [the Prince]708-the prince 's face a shadow of doubt , mingled with dread , passed swiftly , and [he]708-the prince seemed to be forming a resolve in [his]708-the prince own mind which was more or less distasteful to [him]708-the prince . Whatever the feeling was [he]708-the prince conquered it by a strong effort , and said with firmness :

" No ; [I]708-the prince will go to [him]708-the prince [myself]708-the prince . And [I]708-the prince will look again upon - upon the face [I]708-the prince loved . It is but one pang the more , and why should [I]708-the prince not endure it ? "[708-the prince]

Seeing [him]708-the prince thus inclined , [I]0-i made no effort to dissuade [him]708-the prince , and without another word [I]0-i led the way to [the chapel]2310-the chapel . [I]0-i entered [it]2310-the chapel reverently , [he]708-the prince following [me]0-i closely , with slow hushed footsteps . All was the same as [I]0-i had left [it]2310-the chapel , save that [the servants of the household]1444-the servants of the household had gone to take some needful rest before the morning light called [them]1444-the servants of the household to [their]1444-the servants of the household daily routine of labour . [Father Paul]204-father paul , too , had retired , and [Heliobas]104-heliobas alone knelt beside all that remained of [Zara]152-zara , [his]104-heliobas figure as motionless as though carved in bronze , [his]104-heliobas face hidden in [his]104-heliobas hands . As [we]1445-we approached , [he]708-the prince neither stirred nor looked up , therefore [I]0-i softly led [the Prince]708-the prince to the opposite side of the bier , that [he]708-the prince might look quietly on the perished loveliness that lay there at rest for ever . [Ivan]153-prince ivan trembled , yet steadfastly gazed at the beautiful reposeful form , at the calm features on which the smile with which death had been received , still lingered - at the folded hands , the fading orange - blossoms - at the crucifix that lay on the cold breast like the final seal on the letter of life . Impulsively [he]708-the prince stooped forward , and with a tender awe pressed [his]708-the prince lips on the pale forehead , but instantly started back with the smothered , exclamation :

" O God ! how cold ! "[708-the prince]

At the sound of [his]104-heliobas voice [Heliobas]104-heliobas rose up erect , and [the two men]1447-the two men faced [each other]2173-each other , [Zara]152-zara 's dead body lying like a barrier betwixt [them]1447-the two men .

A pause followed - a pause in which [I]0-i heard [my]0-i own heart beating loudly , so great was [my]0-i anxiety . [Heliobas]104-heliobas suffered a few moments to elapse , then stretched [his]104-heliobas hand across [[his]104-heliobas sister]2320-his sister 's bier .

" In [HER]152-zara name , let there be peace between [us]1447-the two men , [Ivan]153-prince ivan , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said in accents that were both gentle and solemn .

[The Prince , touched to the quick]1450-the prince , touched to the quick , responded to these kindly words with eager promptness , and [they]1447-the two men clasped hands over the quiet and lovely form that lay there - a silent , binding witness of [their]1447-the two men reconciliation .

" [I]153-prince ivan have to ask [your]104-heliobas pardon , [Casimir]152-zara , "[153-prince ivan] then whispered [Ivan]153-prince ivan . " [I]153-prince ivan have also to thank [you]104-heliobas for [my]153-prince ivan life . "[153-prince ivan]

" Thank [the friend who stands beside [you]153-prince ivan]3402-the friend who stands beside you , "[104-heliobas] returned [Heliobas]104-heliobas , in the same low tone , with a slight gesture towards [me]0-i . " [She]3402-the friend who stands beside you reminded [me]104-heliobas of a duty in time . As for pardon , [I]104-heliobas know of no cause of offence on [your]153-prince ivan part save what was perfectly excusable . Say no more ; wisdom comes with years , and [you]153-prince ivan are yet young . "[104-heliobas]

A long silence followed . [We]1451-our all remained looking wistfully down upon the body of [[our]1451-our lost darling]1452-our lost darling , in thought too deep for words or weeping . [I]0-i then noticed that [another humble mourner]1453-another humble mourner shared [our]1451-our watch - [a mourner whose very existence [I]0-i had nearly forgotten]1454-a mourner whose very existence i had nearly forgotten . It was [the faithful Leo]1455-the faithful leo . [He]104-heliobas lay couchant on the stone floor at the foot of the bier , almost as silent as a dog of marble ; the only sign of animation [he]104-heliobas gave being a deep sigh which broke from [his]104-heliobas honest heart now and then . [I]0-i went to [him]104-heliobas and softly patted [his]104-heliobas shaggy coat . [He]104-heliobas looked up at [me]0-i with big brown eyes full of tears , licked [my]0-i hand meekly , and again laid [his]104-heliobas head down upon [his]104-heliobas two fore - paws with a resignation that was most pathetic .

The dawn began to peer faintly through [the chapel]2310-the chapel windows - the dawn of a misty , chilly morning . The storm of the past night had left a sting in the air , and the rain still fell , though gently . The wind had almost entirely sunk into silence . [I]0-i re - arranged the flowers that were strewn on [Zara]152-zara 's corpse , taking away all those that had slightly faded . The orange - blossom was almost dead , but [I]0-i left that where it was - where the living [Zara]152-zara had [herself]152-zara placed it . As [I]0-i performed this slight service , [I]0-i thought , half mournfully , half gladly -

" Yes , [Heaven]192-heaven is thine , but this Is a world of sweets and sours - [Our]3403-our flowers are merely FLOWERS ; And the shadow of [thy]3404-thy perfect bliss Is the sunshine of ours . "[0-i]

[Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan at last roused [himself]153-prince ivan as from a deep and melancholy reverie , and , addressing [himself]153-prince ivan to [Heliobas]104-heliobas , said softly :

" [I]153-prince ivan will intrude no longer on [your]153-prince ivan privacy , [Casimir]152-zara . Farewell ! [I]153-prince ivan shall leave [Paris]5-paris to - night . "[153-prince ivan]

For all answer [Heliobas]104-heliobas beckoned [him]153-prince ivan and [me]0-i also out of [the chapel]2310-the chapel . As soon as [its]2310-the chapel doors closed behind [us]1458-we , and [we]1458-we stood in [the centre hall]1459-the centre hall , [he]104-heliobas spoke with affectionate and grave earnestness :

" [Ivan]153-prince ivan , something tells [me]104-heliobas that [you]153-prince ivan and [I]104-heliobas shall not meet again for many years , if ever . Therefore , when [you]153-prince ivan say ' farewell , ' the word falls upon [my]104-heliobas ears with double meaning . [We]1458-we are [friends]1768-friends - [our]1458-we friendship is sanctified by the dead presence of [one whom [we]1458-we both loved]3406-one whom we both loved , in different ways ; therefore [you]153-prince ivan will take in good part what [I]104-heliobas now say to [you]153-prince ivan . [You]153-prince ivan know , [you]153-prince ivan can not disguise from [yourself]153-prince ivan that the science [I]104-heliobas study is fraught with terrible truth and marvellous discoveries ; the theories [I]104-heliobas deduce from it [you]153-prince ivan disbelieve , because [you]153-prince ivan are nearly [a materialist]3407-a materialist . [I]104-heliobas say NEARLY - not quite . That ' not quite ' makes [me]104-heliobas love [you]153-prince ivan , [Ivan]153-prince ivan : [I]104-heliobas would save the small bright spark that flickers within [you]153-prince ivan from both escape and extinction . But [I]104-heliobas can not - at least , not as yet . Still , in order that [you]153-prince ivan may know that there is a power in [me]104-heliobas higher than ordinary human reason , before [you]153-prince ivan go from [me]104-heliobas to - night hear [my]104-heliobas prophecy of [your]153-prince ivan career . [The world]264-the world waits for [you]153-prince ivan , [Ivan]153-prince ivan - [the world]264-the world , all agape and glittering with a thousand sparkling toys ; it waits greedy for [your]153-prince ivan presence , ready to fawn upon [you]153-prince ivan for a smile , willing to cringe to [you]153-prince ivan for a nod of approval . And why ? Because wealth is [yours]153-prince ivan - vast , illimitable wealth . Aye - [you]153-prince ivan need not start or look incredulous - [you]153-prince ivan will find it as [I]104-heliobas say . [You]153-prince ivan , whose fortune up to now has barely reached a poor four thousand per annum - [you]153-prince ivan are at this moment [the possessor of millions]3410-the possessor of millions . Only last night [a relative of [yours]153-prince ivan , whose name [you]153-prince ivan scarcely know , expired , leaving all [his]3411-a relative of yours , whose name you scarcely know , expired , leaving all his hoarded treasures to you hoarded treasures to [you]153-prince ivan]3411-a relative of yours , whose name you scarcely know , expired , leaving all his hoarded treasures to you . When [you]153-prince ivan receive it remember [me]104-heliobas , and acknowledge that at least for once [I]104-heliobas knew and spoke the truth . Follow [the broad road]3413-the broad road , [Ivan]153-prince ivan , laid out before [you]153-prince ivan - [a road wide enough not only for [you]153-prince ivan to walk in]3414-a road wide enough not only for you to walk in , but for the crowd of toadies and flatterers also , who will push on swiftly after [you]153-prince ivan and jostle [you]153-prince ivan on all sides ; be strong of heart and merry of countenance ! Gather the roses ; press the luscious grapes into warm , red wine that , as [you]153-prince ivan quaff it , shall make [your]153-prince ivan blood dance a mad waltz in [your]153-prince ivan veins , and [fair women]3415-fair women 's faces shall seem fairer to [you]153-prince ivan than ever , [their]3415-fair women embraces more tender , [their]3415-fair women kisses more tempting ! Spin the ball of Society like a toy in the palm of [your]153-prince ivan hand ! [I]104-heliobas see [your]153-prince ivan life stretching before [me]104-heliobas like a brilliant , thread - like ephemeral ray of light ! But in the far distance across it looms a shadow - a shadow that [your]153-prince ivan power alone can never lift . Mark [me]104-heliobas , [Ivan]153-prince ivan ! When the first dread chill of that shadow makes itself felt , come to [me]104-heliobas - [I]104-heliobas shall yet be living . Come ; for then no wealth can aid [you]153-prince ivan - at that dark hour [no boon companions]3416-no boon companions can comfort . Come ; and by [our]3417-our friendship so lately sworn - by [Zara]152-zara 's pure soul - by [God]101-god 's existence , [I]104-heliobas will not die till [I]104-heliobas have changed that darkness over [you]153-prince ivan into light eternal ! - Fare [you]153-prince ivan well ! "[104-heliobas]

[His]1460-his words had evidently made a deep impression on [the young nobleman]1463-the young nobleman , who gazed after [his]1460-his retreating figure with a certain awe not unmingled with fear .

The morning had now fairly dawned , and within [the Hotel Mars]556-the hotel mars the work of [the great mansion]1469-the great mansion went on in its usual routine ; but a sombre melancholy was in the atmosphere - a melancholy that not all [my]0-i best efforts could dissipate . [The domestics]1470-the domestics looked sullen and heavy - eyed ; [the only ones in [their]1470-the domestics number who preserved [their]1471-the only ones in their number who preserved their usual equanimity usual equanimity]1471-the only ones in their number who preserved their usual equanimity were [the Armenian men]1472-the armenian men - [servants]1473-servants and [the little Greek page]1474-the little greek page . Preparations for [Zara]152-zara 's funeral went on apace ; they were exceedingly simple , and the ceremony was to be quite private in character . [Heliobas]104-heliobas issued [his]104-heliobas orders , and saw to the carrying out of [his]104-heliobas most minute instructions in [his]104-heliobas usual calm manner ; but [his]104-heliobas eyes looked heavy , and [his]104-heliobas fine countenance was rendered even more majestic by the sacred , resigned sorrow that lay upon it like a deep shadow . [[His]104-heliobas page]1475-his page served [him]104-heliobas with breakfast in [[his]104-heliobas private room]1476-his private room : but [he]104-heliobas left the light meal untasted . [One of [the women]993-the women]1477-one of the women brought [me]0-i coffee ; but the very thought of eating and drinking seemed repulsive , and [I]0-i could not touch anything . [My]0-i mind was busy with the consideration of the duty [I]0-i had to perform - namely , to see the destruction of [Zara]152-zara 's colossal statue , as [she]152-zara had requested . After thinking about it for some time , [I]0-i went to [Heliobas]104-heliobas and told [him]104-heliobas what [I]0-i had it in charge to do . [He]104-heliobas listened attentively .

" Do it at once , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said decisively . " Take [[my]104-heliobas Armenians]3426-my armenians ; [they]3426-my armenians are discreet , obedient , and [they]3426-my armenians ask no questions - with strong hammers they will soon crush the clay . "[104-heliobas] Then looking at [me]0-i scrutinizingly , [he]104-heliobas added kindly : " [You]0-i have eaten nothing , [[my]104-heliobas child]1853-my child ? [You]0-i can not ? [I]0-i swallowed it obediently , and as [I]0-i returned the empty glass to [him]104-heliobas [he]104-heliobas said : " [I]104-heliobas also have a commission in charge from [Zara]152-zara . " [I]0-i did not know ; but [I]0-i think [she]152-zara must have been , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" [She]152-zara was . [We]3428-we both were . [We]3428-we remained together in [the chapel]2310-the chapel all day , saying what parting words [we]3428-we had to say to [one another]2396-one another . [We]3428-we knew [her]152-zara death , or rather [her]152-zara release , was to occur at some hour that night ; but in what way the end was destined to come , [we]3428-we knew not . Till [I]1479-i heard the first peals of thunder , [I]1479-i was in suspense ; but after that [I]1479-i was no longer uncertain . [You]0-i were [a witness of the whole ensuing scene]3431-a witness of the whole ensuing scene . No death could have been more painless than [hers]152-zara . But let [me]1479-i not forget the message [she]152-zara gave [me]1479-i for [you]0-i . "[1479-i] Here [he]1479-i took from a secret drawer the electric stone [Zara]152-zara had always worn . " This jewel is [yours]0-i , "[1479-i] [he]1479-i said . " [You]0-i need not fear to accept it - it contains no harm ! it will bring [you]0-i no ill - fortune . [You]0-i see how all the sparkling brilliancy has gone out of it ? Wear it , and within a few minutes it will be as lustrous as ever . The life throbbing in [your]0-i veins warms the electricity contained in it ; and with the flowing of [your]0-i blood , its hues change and glow . It has no power to attract ; it can simply absorb and shine . Take it as a remembrance of [her]152-zara who loved [you]0-i and who loves [you]0-i still . "[1479-i]

[I]0-i was still in [my]0-i evening dress , and [my]0-i neck was bare . [I]0-i slipped the chain , on which hung the stone , round [my]0-i throat , and watched the strange gem with some curiosity . In a few seconds a pale streak of fiery topaz flashed through it , which deepened and glowed into a warm crimson , like the heart of a red rose ; and by the time it had become thoroughly warmed against [my]0-i flesh , it glittered as brilliantly as ever .

" [I]0-i will always wear it , "[0-i] [I]0-i said earnestly . " [I]0-i believe it will bring [me]0-i good fortune . "[0-i]

" [I]104-heliobas believe it will , "[104-heliobas] returned [Heliobas]104-heliobas simply . " And now let [us]1480-us fulfil [Zara]152-zara 's other commands . "[104-heliobas]

On [our]1480-us way across [the hall]572-the hall [we]1480-us were stopped by the page , who brought [us]1480-us a message of inquiry after [Zara]152-zara 's health from [Colonel Everard]92-colonel everard and [[his]92-colonel everard wife]322-his wife , and also from [the Challoners]177-the challoners . [Heliobas]104-heliobas hastily wrote a few brief words in pencil , explaining the fatal result of the accident , and returned it to [the messenger]1483-the messenger , giving orders at the same time that all the blinds should be pulled down at the windows of [the house]2038-the house , that [visitors]3335-visitors might understand there was no admittance . [We]1480-us then proceeded to [the studio]343-the studio , accompanied by [the Armenians carrying heavy hammers]1487-the armenians carrying heavy hammers . Reverently , and with [my]0-i mind full of recollections of [Zara]152-zara 's living presence , [I]0-i opened the familiar door . The first thing that greeted [us]1480-us was a most exquisitely wrought statue in white marble of [Zara]152-zara [herself]152-zara , full length , and arrayed in [her]152-zara customary graceful Eastern costume . The head was slightly raised : a look of gladness lighted up the beautiful features ; and within the loosely clasped hands was a cluster of roses . Bound the pedestal were carved the words , " Omnia vincit Amor , "[152-zara] with [Zara]152-zara 's name and the dates of [her]152-zara birth and death . A little slip of paper lay at the foot of the statue , which [Heliobas]104-heliobas perceived , and taking it [he]104-heliobas read and passed it to [me]0-i . The lines were in [Zara]152-zara 's handwriting , and ran as follows :

" To [[my]152-zara beloved [Casimir]152-zara]3432-my beloved casimir - [[my]152-zara brother]676-my brother , [[my]152-zara friend]365-my friend , [[my]152-zara guide]977-my guide and [teacher]3436-teacher , to whom [I]152-zara owe the supreme happiness of [my]152-zara life in [this world]1957-this world and the next - let [this poor figure of [his]104-heliobas grateful [Zara]152-zara]3438-this poor figure of his grateful zara be a memento of happy days that are gone , only to be renewed with redoubled happiness hereafter . "[152-zara]

[I]0-i handed back the paper silently , with tears in [my]0-i eyes , and [we]1488-we turned [our]1488-we attention to the colossal figure [we]1488-we had come to destroy . It stood at the extreme end of [the studio]343-the studio , and was entirely hidden by white linen drapery . [Heliobas]104-heliobas advanced , and by a sudden dexterous movement succeeded in drawing off the coverings with a single effort , and then [we]1488-we both fell back and gazed at the clay form disclosed in amazement . What did it represent ? [A man]278-a man ? [a god]2747-a god ? [an angel]284-an angel ? or [all three united in one vast figure]1493-all three united in one vast figure ?

It was an unfinished work . The features of the face were undeclared , save the brow and eyes ; and these were large , grand , and full of absolute wisdom and tranquil consciousness of power . [I]0-i could have gazed on this wonderful piece of [Zara]152-zara 's handiwork for hours , but [Heliobas]104-heliobas called to [the Armenian servants , who stood near the door awaiting orders , and commanded [them]1494-the armenian servants , who stood near the door awaiting orders , and commanded them to break it down to break it down]1494-the armenian servants , who stood near the door awaiting orders , and commanded them to break it down . For once [these well - trained domestics]1495-these well - trained domestics showed signs of surprise , and hesitated . [[Their]1495-these well - trained domestics master]1496-their master frowned . Snatching a hammer from one of [them]1495-these well - trained domestics , [he]1496-their master [himself]1496-their master attacked the great statue as if it were a personal foe . [The Armenians]1497-the armenians , seeing [he]1496-their master was in earnest , returned to [their]1497-the armenians usual habits of passive obedience , and aided [him]1496-their master in [his]1496-their master labour . Within a few minutes [the great and beautiful figure]1498-the great and beautiful figure lay in fragments on the floor , and these fragments were soon crushed into indistinguishable atoms . [I]0-i had promised to witness this work of destruction , and witness it [I]0-i did , but it was with pain and regret . When all was finished , [Heliobas]104-heliobas commanded [[his]104-heliobas men]1499-his men to carry [the statue of [[Zara]152-zara 's self]1501-zara 's self]1500-the statue of zara 's self down to [[his]104-heliobas own private room]1502-his own private room , and then to summon [all the domestics of [the household]786-the household]1503-all the domestics of the household in a body to [the great hall]739-the great hall , as [he]104-heliobas wished to address [them]1503-all the domestics of the household . [I]0-i heard [him]104-heliobas give this order with some surprise , and [he]104-heliobas saw it . As [the Armenians]1497-the armenians slowly disappeared , carrying with great care the marble figure of [[their]1497-the armenians late mistress]1507-their late mistress , [he]104-heliobas turned to [me]0-i , as [he]104-heliobas locked up the door of [the studio]343-the studio , and said quietly :

" [These ignorant folk , who serve [me]104-heliobas for money and food - money that [they]3439-these ignorant folk , who serve me for money and food - money that they have eagerly taken , and food that they have greedily devoured have eagerly taken , and food that [they]3439-these ignorant folk , who serve me for money and food - money that they have eagerly taken , and food that they have greedily devoured have greedily devoured]3439-these ignorant folk , who serve me for money and food - money that they have eagerly taken , and food that they have greedily devoured - [they]3439-these ignorant folk , who serve me for money and food - money that they have eagerly taken , and food that they have greedily devoured think that [I]104-heliobas am [the devil]1912-the devil or [one of [the devil 's agents]3442-the devil 's agents]3441-one of the devil 's agents , and [I]104-heliobas am going to prove [their]3439-these ignorant folk , who serve me for money and food - money that they have eagerly taken , and food that they have greedily devoured theories entirely to [their]3439-these ignorant folk , who serve me for money and food - money that they have eagerly taken , and food that they have greedily devoured satisfaction . Come and see ! "[104-heliobas]

[I]0-i followed [him]104-heliobas , somewhat mystified . On the way downstairs [he]104-heliobas said :

" Do [you]0-i know why [Zara]152-zara wished that statue destroyed ? "[104-heliobas]

" No , "[0-i] [I]0-i said frankly ; " unless for the reason that it was incomplete . "[0-i]

" It always would have been incomplete , "[104-heliobas] returned [Heliobas]104-heliobas ; " even had [she]152-zara lived to work at [it]3443-it for years . It was a daring attempt , and a fruitless one . [She]152-zara was trying to make a clay figure of [one who never wore earthly form]3444-one who never wore earthly form - the Being who is [her]152-zara Twin - Soul , who dominates [her]152-zara entirely , and who is with [her]152-zara now . As well might [she]152-zara have tried to represent in white marble the prismatic hues of the rainbow ! "[104-heliobas]

[We]1509-we had now reached [the hall]572-the hall , and [the servants]717-the servants were assembling by [twos and threes]1512-twos and threes . [They]717-the servants glanced at [[their]717-the servants master]1496-their master with looks of awe , as [he]104-heliobas took up a commanding position near the fountain , and faced [them]717-the servants with a glance of calm scrutiny and attention . [I]0-i drew a chair behind one of the marble columns and seated [myself]0-i , watching everything with interest . [Leo]100-leo appeared from some corner or other , and laid [his]100-leo rough body down close at [[his]100-leo master]1772-his master 's feet .

In a few minutes [all the domestics]1515-all the domestics , some twenty in number , were present , and [Heliobas]104-heliobas , raising [his]104-heliobas voice , spoke with a clear deliberate enunciation :

" [I]104-heliobas have sent for [you]1516-the small audience all this morning , because [I]104-heliobas am perfectly aware that [you]1516-the small audience have all determined to give [me]104-heliobas notice . "[104-heliobas]

A stir of astonishment and dismay ensued on the part of [the small audience]1516-the small audience , and [I]0-i heard one voice near [me]0-i whisper :

" [He]104-heliobas IS [the devil]1912-the devil , or how could [he]104-heliobas have known it ? "[0-i]

The lips of [Heliobas]104-heliobas curled in a fine sarcastic smile . [He]104-heliobas went on :

" [I]104-heliobas spare [you]1516-the small audience this trouble . Knowing [your]1516-the small audience intentions , [I]104-heliobas take upon [myself]104-heliobas to dismiss [you]1516-the small audience at once . Naturally , [you]1516-the small audience can not risk [[your]1516-the small audience characters]3446-your characters by remaining in the service of [the devil]1912-the devil . For [my]104-heliobas own part , [I]104-heliobas wonder [the devil]1912-the devil 's money has not burnt [your]1516-the small audience hands , or [his]1912-the devil food turned to poison in [your]1516-the small audience mouths . [[My]104-heliobas sister]614-my sister , [[your]1516-the small audience kind and ever - indulgent mistress]3450-your kind and ever - indulgent mistress , is dead . [You]1516-the small audience know this , and it is [your]1516-the small audience opinion that [I]104-heliobas summoned up the thunderstorm which caused [her]614-my sister death . Be it so . Report it so , if [you]1516-the small audience will , through [Paris]5-paris ; [your]1516-the small audience words do not affect [me]104-heliobas . [You]1516-the small audience have been [excellent machines]3451-excellent machines , and for [your]1516-the small audience services many thanks ! As soon as [[my]104-heliobas sister]614-my sister 's funeral is over , [your]1516-the small audience wages , with an additional present , will be sent to [you]1516-the small audience . [You]1516-the small audience can then leave [[my]104-heliobas house]3453-my house when [you]1516-the small audience please ; and , contrary to the usual custom of [accepted devils]3454-accepted devils , [I]104-heliobas am able to say , without perishing in the effort - [God]101-god speed [you]1516-the small audience all ! "[104-heliobas]

The faces of those [he]1517-he addressed exhibited various emotions while [he]1517-he spoke - fear contending with a good deal of shame . [The little Greek page]1474-the little greek page stepped forward timidly .

" [The master]3455-the master knows that [I]1474-the little greek page will never leave [him]3455-the master , "[1474-the little greek page] [he]1474-the little greek page murmured , and [his]1474-the little greek page large eyes were moist with tears .

[Heliobas]104-heliobas laid a gentle hand on [the boy]1519-the boy 's dark curls , but said nothing . One of [the four Armenians]1520-the four armenians advanced , and with a graceful rapid gesture of [his]104-heliobas right hand , touched [his]104-heliobas head and breast .

" [[My]104-heliobas lord]3456-my lord will not surely dismiss [[US]3457-we who desire to devote [ourselves]3457-we to [his]3456-my lord service]3458-us who desire to devote ourselves to his service ? [We]3457-we are willing to follow [[my]104-heliobas lord]3456-my lord to the death if need be , for the sake of the love and honour [we]3457-we bear [him]3456-my lord . "[104-heliobas]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas looked at [him]104-heliobas very kindly .

" [I]104-heliobas am richer in [friends]1768-friends than [I]104-heliobas thought [myself]104-heliobas to be , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said quietly . " Stay then , by all means , [Afra]241-afra , [you]241-afra and [[your]241-afra companions]3461-your companions , since [you]241-afra have desired it . And [you]1521-the tearful page , [[my]104-heliobas boy]3462-my boy , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas went on , addressing [the tearful page]1521-the tearful page , " think [you]1521-the tearful page that [I]104-heliobas would turn adrift [an orphan]3463-an orphan , whom [a dying mother]3464-a dying mother trusted to [my]104-heliobas care ? Nay , [child]1859-child , [I]104-heliobas am as much [[your]1521-the tearful page servant]3466-your servant as [you]1521-the tearful page are [mine]104-heliobas , so long as [your]1521-the tearful page love turns towards [me]104-heliobas . "[104-heliobas]

For [all answer the page]1522-all answer the page kissed [his]104-heliobas hand in a sort of rapture , and flinging back [his]104-heliobas clustering hair from [his]104-heliobas classic brows , surveyed [the domestics]1470-the domestics , who had taken [their]1470-the domestics dismissal in silent acquiescence , with a pretty scorn .

" Go , all of [you]1859-child , [scum of [Paris]5-paris]3467-scum of paris ! "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas cried in [his]104-heliobas clear treble tones - " [you]1859-child who know neither [God]101-god nor devil ! [You]1859-child will have [your]1859-child money - more than [your]1859-child share - what else seek [you]1859-child ? [You]1859-child have served [one of [the noblest of [men]273-men]3469-the noblest of men]3468-one of the noblest of men ; and because [he]3468-one of the noblest of men is so great and wise and true , [you]1859-child judge [him]3468-one of the noblest of men [a fiend]2466-a fiend ! Oh , so like [the people of [Paris]5-paris]3472-the people of paris - [they]3472-the people of paris who pervert all things till [they]3472-the people of paris think good evil and evil good ! Look [you]1859-child ! [you]1859-child have worked for [your]1859-child wages ; but [I]104-heliobas have worked for [HIM]3468-one of the noblest of men - [I]104-heliobas would starve with [him]3468-one of the noblest of men , [I]104-heliobas would die for [him]3468-one of the noblest of men ! For to [me]104-heliobas [he]3468-one of the noblest of men is [not fiend]3473-not fiend , but [Angel]195-angel ! "[104-heliobas]

Overcome by [his]1524-his own feelings [the boy]1519-the boy again kissed [[his]1524-his master]1772-his master 's hand , and [Heliobas]104-heliobas gently bade [him]1519-the boy be silent . [He]104-heliobas [himself]104-heliobas looked round on [the still motionless group of [servants]1473-servants]1527-the still motionless group of servants with an air of calm surprise .

" What are [you]1527-the still motionless group of servants waiting for ? "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas asked . " Consider [yourselves]1527-the still motionless group of servants dismissed , and at liberty to go where [you]1527-the still motionless group of servants please . [Any one of [you]1527-the still motionless group of servants that chooses to apply to [me]104-heliobas for [a character]3475-a character]3474-any one of you that chooses to apply to me for a character shall not lack the suitable recommendation . There is no more to say . "[104-heliobas]

[A lively - looking woman with quick restless black eyes]1529-a lively - looking woman with quick restless black eyes stepped forward .

" [I]1529-a lively - looking woman with quick restless black eyes am sure , "[1529-a lively - looking woman with quick restless black eyes] [she]1529-a lively - looking woman with quick restless black eyes said , with a mincing curtsey , " that [we]3476-we are very sorry if [we]3476-we have unintentionally wronged [monsieur]2167-monsieur ; but [monsieur]2167-monsieur , who is aware of so many things , must know that many reports are circulated about [monsieur]2167-monsieur that make [one]272-one to shudder ; that madame [[his]2167-monsieur sister]2320-his sister 's death so lamentable has given to all , what one would say , the horrors ; and [monsieur]2167-monsieur must consider [that poor servants of virtuous reputation]3483-that poor servants of virtuous reputation - "[1529-a lively - looking woman with quick restless black eyes]

" So , [Jeanne Claudet]242-jeanne claudet ! "[104-heliobas] interrupted [Heliobas]104-heliobas , in a thrilling low tone . " And what of [the child]3484-the child - [the little waxen - faced helpless babe left to die on [the banks of [the Loire]80-the loire]3486-the banks of the loire]3485-the little waxen - faced helpless babe left to die on the banks of the loire ? But it did not die , [Jeanne]242-jeanne claudet - it was rescued ; and it shall yet live to loathe [[its]3484-the child mother]3487-its mother ! "[104-heliobas]

[The woman]2044-the woman uttered a shriek , and fainted .

In the feminine confusion and fuss that ensued , [Heliobas]104-heliobas , accompanied by [[his]104-heliobas little page]1531-his little page and the dog [Leo]100-leo , left [the hall]572-the hall and entered [[his]104-heliobas own private room]1502-his own private room , where for some time [I]0-i left [him]104-heliobas undisturbed .

In the early part of the afternoon a note was brought to [me]0-i . It was from [Colonel Everard]92-colonel everard , entreating [me]0-i to come as soon as possible to [[his]104-heliobas wife]322-his wife , who was very ill .

" Since [she]322-his wife heard of the death of [that beautiful young lady]3488-that beautiful young lady , a death so fearfully sudden and unexpected , "[1857-the colonel] wrote [the Colonel]1857-the colonel , ' [she]322-his wife has been quite unlike [herself]322-his wife - nervous , hysterical , and thoroughly unstrung . It will be a real kindness to [her]322-his wife if [you]0-i will come as soon as [you]0-i can - [she]322-his wife has such , a strong desire for [your]0-i company . "[322-his wife]

[I]0-i showed this note at once to [Heliobas]104-heliobas . [He]104-heliobas read it , and said :

" Of course [you]0-i must go . Wait till [our]3489-our simple funeral ceremony is over , and then - [we]3489-our part . Not for ever ; [I]104-heliobas shall see [you]0-i often again . For now [I]104-heliobas have lost [Zara]152-zara , [you]0-i are [[my]104-heliobas only female disciple]3490-my only female disciple , and [I]104-heliobas shall not willingly lose sight of [you]0-i . [You]0-i will correspond with [me]104-heliobas ? "[104-heliobas]

" Gladly and gratefully , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied .

" [You]0-i shall not lose by it . [I]104-heliobas can initiate [you]0-i into many secrets that will be useful to [you]0-i in [your]0-i career . As for [[your]0-i friend]1987-your friend [Mrs. Everard]152-zara , [you]0-i will find that [your]0-i presence will cure [her]152-zara . [You]0-i have progressed greatly in electric force : the mere touch of [your]0-i hand will soothe [her]152-zara , as [you]0-i will find . But never be tempted to try any of the fluids of which [you]0-i have the recipes on [her]152-zara , or on [anybody]2324-anybody but [yourself]0-i , unless [you]0-i write to [me]104-heliobas first about it , as [Cellini]97-cellini did when [he]97-cellini tried an experiment on [you]0-i . As for [your]0-i own bodily and spiritual health , [you]0-i know thoroughly what to do - KEEP THE SECRET ; and make a step in advance every day . By - and - by [you]0-i will have double work . "[104-heliobas]

" How so ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" In [Zara]152-zara 's case , [her]152-zara soul became dominated by [a Spirit whose destiny was fulfilled and perfect , and who never could descend to imprisonment in earthly clay]3493-a spirit whose destiny was fulfilled and perfect , and who never could descend to imprisonment in earthly clay . Now , [you]0-i will not be dominated - [you]0-i will be simply EQUALIZED ; that is , [you]0-i will find the exact counterpart of [your]0-i own soul dwelling also in human form , and [you]0-i will have to impart [your]0-i own force to that other soul , which will , in its turn , impart to [yours]0-i a corresponding electric impetus . There is no union so lovely as such an one - no harmony so exquisite ; it is like a perfect chord , complete and indissoluble . There are sevenths and ninths in music , beautiful and effective in their degrees ; but perhaps none of them are so absolutely satisfying to the ear as the perfect chord . And this is [your]0-i lot in life and in love , [[my]104-heliobas child]1853-my child - be grateful for it night and morning on [your]0-i bended knees before [the Giver of all good]3495-the giver of all good . And walk warily - [your]0-i own soul with that other shall need much thought and humble prayer . Aim onward and upward - [you]0-i know [the road]3496-the road - [you]0-i also know , and [you]0-i have partly seen , what awaits [you]0-i at the end . "[104-heliobas]

After this conversation [we]1536-we spoke no more in private together . The rest of the afternoon was entirely occupied with the final preparations for [Zara]152-zara 's funeral , which was to take place at [Pere - la - Chaise]81-pere - la - chaise early the next morning . A large and beautiful wreath of white roses , lilies , and maiden - hair arrived from [Prince Ivan]153-prince ivan ; and , remembering [my]0-i promise to [him]153-prince ivan , [I]0-i went [myself]0-i to lay it in a conspicuous place on [Zara]152-zara 's corpse . That fair body was now laid in its coffin of polished oak , and a delicate veil of filmy lace draped it from head to foot . The placid expression of the features remained unchanged , save for a little extra rigidity of the flesh ; the hands , folded over the crucifix , were stiff , and looked as though they were moulded in wax . [I]0-i placed the wreath in position and paused , looking wistfully at that still and solemn figure . [Father Paul]204-father paul , slowly entering from a side - door , came and stood beside [me]0-i .

" [She]152-zara is happy ! "[204-father paul] [he]204-father paul said ; and a cheerful expression irradiated [his]204-father paul venerable features .

" Did [you]204-father paul also know [she]152-zara would die that night ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked softly .

" [[Her]152-zara brother]703-her brother sent for [me]204-father paul , and told [me]204-father paul of [her]152-zara expected dissolution . [She]152-zara [herself]152-zara told [me]204-father paul , and made [her]152-zara last confession and communion . Therefore [I]204-father paul was prepared . "[204-father paul]

" But did [you]204-father paul not doubt - were [you]204-father paul not inclined to think [they]3498-they might be wrong ? "[0-i] [I]0-i inquired , with some astonishment .

" [I]1335-the priest knew [Heliobas]104-heliobas as [a child]369-a child , "[1335-the priest] [the priest]1335-the priest returned . " [I]1335-the priest knew [[his]104-heliobas father]3500-his father and [mother]3122-mother before [him]104-heliobas ; and [I]1335-the priest have been always perfectly aware of the immense extent of [his]104-heliobas knowledge , and the value of [his]104-heliobas discoveries . If [I]1335-the priest were inclined to be sceptical on spiritual matters , [I]1335-the priest should not be of the race [I]1335-the priest am ; for [I]1335-the priest am also [a Chaldean]2087-a chaldean . "[1335-the priest]

[I]0-i said no more , and [Father Paul]204-father paul trimmed the tapers burning round the coffin in devout silence . Again [I]0-i looked at the fair dead form before [me]0-i ; but somehow [I]0-i could not feel sad again . All [my]0-i impulses bade [me]0-i rejoice . Why should [I]0-i be unhappy on [Zara]152-zara 's account ? - more especially when the glories of [the Central Sphere]3061-the central sphere were yet fresh in [my]0-i memory , and when [I]0-i knew as a positive fact that [her]152-zara happiness was now perfect . [I]0-i left [the chapel]2310-the chapel with a light step and lighter heart , and went to [[my]0-i own room]413-my own room to pack up [my]0-i things that all might be in readiness for [my]0-i departure on the morrow . On [my]0-i table [I]0-i found a volume whose quaint binding [I]0-i at once recognised - " The Letters of [a Dead Musician]1796-a dead musician . "[0-i] A card lay beside it , on which was written in pencil :

" Knowing of [your]3504-your wish to possess this book , [I]0-i herewith offer it for [your]3504-your acceptance . It teaches [you]3504-your a cheerful devotion to Art , and an indifference to [the world]264-the world 's opinions - both of which are necessary to [you]3504-your in [your]3504-your career . - [HELIOBAS]104-heliobas . "[0-i]

Delighted with this gift , [I]0-i opened the book , and found [my]0-i name written on the fly - leaf , with the date of the month and year , and the words :

" La musica e il lamento dell ' amore o la preghiera a gli Dei . "[0-i] Music is the lament of love , or a prayer to [the Gods]1541-the gods .

[I]0-i placed this treasure carefully in a corner of [my]0-i portmanteau , together with the parchment scrolls containing " The Electric Principle of Christianity , "[0-i] and the valuables recipes of [Heliobas]104-heliobas ; and as [I]0-i did so , [I]0-i caught sight of [myself]0-i in the long mirror that directly faced [me]0-i . [I]0-i was fascinated , not by [my]0-i own reflection , but by the glitter of the electric gem [I]0-i wore . It flashed and glowed like a star , and was really lovely - far more brilliant than the most brilliant cluster of fine diamonds . [I]0-i may here remark that [I]0-i have been asked many questions concerning this curious ornament whenever [I]0-i have worn it in public , and the general impression has been that it is some new arrangement of ornamental electricity . It is , however , nothing of the kind ; it is simply a clear pebble , common enough on [the shores of [tropical countries]1543-tropical countries]1542-the shores of tropical countries , which has the property of absorbing a small portion of the electricity in a human body , sufficient to make it shine with prismatic and powerful lustre - a property which has only as yet been discovered by [Heliobas]104-heliobas , who asserts that the same capability exists in many other apparently lustreless stones which have been untried , and are therefore unknown . The " healing stones , "[104-heliobas] or amulets , still in use in [the East]15-the east , and also in [the remote parts of the Highlands]1544-the remote parts of the highlands see notes to [Archibald Clerk]243-archibald clerk 's translation of ' Ossian ' , are also electric , but in a different way - they have the property of absorbing DISEASE and destroying it in certain cases ; and these , after being worn a suitable length of time , naturally exhaust what virtue [they]1545-they originally possessed , and are no longer of any use . Stone amulets are considered nowadays as a mere superstition of the vulgar and uneducated ; but it must be remembered that superstition itself has always had for it a foundation some grain , however small and remote , of fact . [I]0-i could give a very curious explanation of the formation of ORCHIDS , those strange plants called sometimes " Freaks of Nature , "[137-nature] as if [Nature]137-nature ever indulged in a " freak "[137-nature] of any kind ! But [I]0-i have neither time nor space to enter upon the subject now ; indeed , if [I]0-i were once to begin to describe the wonderful , amazing and beautiful vistas of knowledge that [the wise Chaldean]1546-the wise chaldean , who is still [[my]0-i friend]365-my friend and guide , has opened up and continues to extend before [my]0-i admiring vision , a work of twenty volumes would scarce contain all [I]0-i should have to say . But [I]0-i have written this book merely to tell [those who peruse it]1548-those who peruse it , about [Heliobas]104-heliobas , and what [I]0-i [myself]0-i experienced in [[his]104-heliobas house]2318-his house ; beyond this [I]0-i may not go . For , as , [I]0-i observed in [my]0-i introduction , [I]0-i am perfectly aware that few , if any , of [[my]0-i readers]1213-my readers will accept [my]0-i narrative as more than a mere visionary romance - or that [they]1213-my readers will admit the mysteries of life , death , eternity , and all the wonders of [the Universe]1-the universe to be simply [the NATURAL AND SCIENTIFIC OUTCOME OF A RING OF EVERLASTING ELECTRIC HEAT AND LIGHT]82-the natural and scientific outcome of a ring of everlasting electric heat and light ; but whether [they]1213-my readers agree to it or no , [I]0-i can say with [Galileo]244-galileo , " E pur si muove ! "[244-galileo]

CHAPTER XVII .

CONCLUSION .

It was a very simple and quiet procession that moved next day from [the Hotel Mars]20-hotel mars to [Pere - la - Chaise]81-pere - la - chaise . [[Zara]152-zara 's coffin]1551-zara 's coffin was carried in [an open hearse]1552-an open hearse , and was covered with a pall of rich white velvet , on which lay a royal profusion of flowers - [Ivan]153-prince ivan 's wreath , and a magnificent cross of lilies sent by tender - hearted [Mrs. Challoner]156-mrs. challoner , being most conspicuous among [them]1553-them . The only thing a little unusual about it was that [the funeral car]1554-the funeral car was drawn by two stately WHITE horses ; and [Heliobas]104-heliobas told [me]0-i this had been ordered at [Zara]152-zara 's special request , as [she]152-zara thought the solemn pacing through [the streets of dismal black steeds]1555-the streets of dismal black steeds had a depressing effect on [the passers - by]1556-the passers - by .

" And why , "[152-zara] [she]152-zara had said , ' should [anybody]2324-anybody be sad , when [I]0-i in reality am so thoroughly happy ? "[152-zara]

[Prince Ivan Petroffsky]153-prince ivan had left [Paris]5-paris , but [[his]153-prince ivan carriage , drawn by [two prancing Russian steeds]1559-two prancing russian steeds]1558-his carriage , drawn by two prancing russian steeds , followed [the hearse]1560-the hearse at a respectful distance , as also [the carriage of [Dr. Morini]235-dr. morini]1561-the carriage of dr. morini , and [some other private persons known to [Heliobas]104-heliobas]1562-some other private persons known to heliobas . [A few people]1563-a few people attended it on foot , and these were chiefly from among [the very poor]1564-the very poor , some of whom had benefited by [Zara]152-zara 's charity or [[her]152-zara brother]703-her brother 's medical skill , and had heard of the calamity through rumour , or through the columns of [the Figaro]1566-the figaro , where it was reported with graphic brevity . The weather was still misty , and the fiery sun seemed to shine through tears as [Father Paul]204-father paul , with [[his]204-father paul assistants]1567-his assistants , read in solemn yet cheerful tones the service for [the dead according to the Catholic ritual]1568-the dead according to the catholic ritual . [One of [the chief mourners at the grave]1570-the chief mourners at the grave]1569-one of the chief mourners at the grave was [the faithful [Leo]100-leo ; who , without obtruding [himself]100-leo in [anyone]2062-anyone 's way , sat at a little distance , and seemed , by the confiding look with which [he]100-leo turned [his]100-leo eyes upon [[his]100-leo master]1772-his master , to thoroughly understand that [he]100-leo must henceforth devote [his]100-leo life entirely to [him]1772-his master alone]1571-the faithful leo ; who , without obtruding himself in anyone 's way , sat at a little distance , and seemed , by the confiding look with which he turned his eyes upon his master , to thoroughly understand that he must henceforth devote his life entirely to him alone . The coffin was lowered , the " Requiem aeternam "[104-heliobas] spoken - all was over . [Those assembled]1574-those assembled shook hands quietly with [Heliobas]104-heliobas , saluted [each other]2173-each other , and gradually dispersed . [I]0-i entered [a carriage]1576-a carriage and drove back to [the Hotel Mars]556-the hotel mars , leaving [Heliobas]104-heliobas in [the cemetery]1578-the cemetery to give [his]104-heliobas final instructions for the ornamentation and decoration of [[his]104-heliobas sister]2320-his sister 's grave .

[The little page]1580-the little page served [me]0-i with some luncheon in [[my]0-i own apartment]1139-my own apartment , and by the time all was ready for [my]0-i departure , [Heliobas]104-heliobas returned . [I]0-i went down to [him]104-heliobas in [[his]104-heliobas study]796-his study , and found [him]104-heliobas sitting pensively in [his]104-heliobas arm - chair , absorbed in thought . [He]104-heliobas looked sad and solitary , and [my]0-i whole heart went out to [him]104-heliobas in gratitude and sympathy . [I]0-i knelt beside [him]104-heliobas as [a daughter]1583-a daughter might have done , and softly kissed [his]104-heliobas hand .

[He]104-heliobas started as though awakened suddenly from sleep , and seeing [me]0-i , [his]104-heliobas eyes softened , and [he]104-heliobas smiled gravely .

" Are [you]0-i come to say ' Good - bye , ' [[my]104-heliobas child]1853-my child ? "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas asked , in a kind tone . " Well , [your]0-i mission here is ended ! "[104-heliobas]

" Had [I]0-i any mission at all , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , with a grateful look , ' save [the very selfish one which was comprised in the natural desire to be restored to health]1584-the very selfish one which was comprised in the natural desire to be restored to health ? "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas surveyed [me]0-i for a few moments in silence .

" Were [I]104-heliobas to tell [you]0-i , "[104-heliobas] [he]104-heliobas said at last , " by what mystical authority and influence [you]0-i were compelled to come here , by what a marvellously linked chain of circumstances [you]0-i became known to [me]104-heliobas long before [I]104-heliobas saw [you]0-i ; how [I]104-heliobas was made aware that [you]0-i were [the only woman living to whose companionship [I]104-heliobas could trust [[my]104-heliobas sister]614-my sister at a time when the society of one of [her]614-my sister own sex became absolutely necessary to [her]614-my sister]3507-the only woman living to whose companionship i could trust my sister at a time when the society of one of her own sex became absolutely necessary to her ; how [you]0-i were marked out to [me]104-heliobas as a small point of light by which possibly [I]104-heliobas might steer [my]104-heliobas course clear of the darkness which threatened [me]104-heliobas - [I]104-heliobas say , were [I]104-heliobas to tell [you]0-i all this , [you]0-i would no longer doubt the urgent need of [your]0-i presence [here]1773-here . It is , however , enough to tell [you]0-i that [you]0-i have fulfilled all that was expected of [you]0-i , even beyond [my]104-heliobas best hopes ; and in return for [your]0-i services , the worth of which [you]0-i can not realize , whatever guidance [I]104-heliobas can give [you]0-i in the future for [your]0-i physical and spiritual life , is [yours]0-i . [I]104-heliobas have done something for [you]0-i , but not much - [I]104-heliobas will do more . Only , in communicating with [me]104-heliobas , [I]104-heliobas ask [you]0-i to honour [me]104-heliobas with [your]0-i full confidence in all matters pertaining to [yourself]0-i and [your]0-i surroundings - then [I]104-heliobas shall not be liable to errors of judgment in the opinions [I]104-heliobas form or the advice [I]104-heliobas give . "[104-heliobas]

" [I]0-i promise most readily , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied gladly , for it seemed to [me]0-i that [I]0-i was rich in possessing as [a friend]583-a friend and counsellor such a man as [this student of the loftiest sciences]1586-this student of the loftiest sciences .

" And now one thing more , "[1587-he] [he]1587-he resumed , opening a drawer in the table near which [he]1587-he sat . " Here is a pencil for [you]0-i to write [your]0-i letters to [me]1587-he with . It will last about ten years , and at the expiration of that time [you]0-i can have another . Write with it on any paper , and the marks will be like those of an ordinary drawing - pencil ; but as fast as they are written they disappear . Trouble not about this circumstance - write all [you]0-i have to say , and when [you]0-i have finished [your]0-i letter [your]0-i closely covered pages shall seem blank . Therefore , were the eye of [a stranger]544-a stranger to look at them , nothing could be learned therefrom . But when [they]3511-they reach [me]1587-he , [I]1587-he can make the writing appear and stand out on these apparently unsullied pages as distinctly as though [your]0-i words had been printed . [My]1587-he letters to [you]0-i will also , when [you]0-i receive them , appear blank ; but [you]0-i will only have to press them for about ten minutes in this "[1587-he] - and [he]1587-he handed [me]0-i what looked like an ordinary blotting - book - " and they will be perfectly legible . [Cellini]97-cellini has these little writing implements ; [he]97-cellini uses them whenever the distances are too great for [us]3512-us to amuse [ourselves]3512-us with the sagacity of [Leo]100-leo - in fact the journeys of that faithful animal have principally been to keep [him]97-cellini in training . "[1587-he]

" But , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , as [I]0-i took the pencil and book from [his]1587-he hand , " why do [you]1587-he not make these convenient writing materials public property ? They would be so useful . "[0-i]

" Why should [I]1587-he build up a fortune for [some needy stationer]3513-some needy stationer ? "[1587-he] [he]1587-he asked , with a half - smile . " Besides , they are not new things . [They]3514-they were known to [the ancients]1763-the ancients , and many secret letters , laws , histories , and poems were written with instruments such as these . Had [I]1587-he lived then and known what [I]1587-he know now , [I]1587-he could have made the white pages declare their mystery . "[1587-he]

" Has this also to do with electricity ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Certainly - with what is called vegetable electricity . There is not a plant or herb in existence , but has almost a miracle hidden away in its tiny cup or spreading leaves - do [you]1587-he doubt it ? "[1587-he]

" Not [I]0-i ! "[0-i] [I]0-i answered quickly . " [I]0-i doubt nothing ! "[0-i]

[Heliobas]104-heliobas smiled gravely .

" [You]0-i are right ! "[1587-he] [he]1587-he said . " Doubt is the destroyer of beauty - the poison in the sweet cup of existence - the curse which [mankind]258-mankind have brought on [themselves]258-mankind . Avoid it as [you]0-i would the plague . Believe in anything or everything miraculous and glorious - the utmost reach of [your]0-i faith can with difficulty grasp the majestic reality and perfection of everything [you]0-i can see , desire , or imagine . Mistrust that volatile thing called Human Reason , which is merely a name for whatever opinion [we]3518-we happen to adopt for the time - it is a thing which totters on its throne in a fit of rage or despair - there is nothing infinite about it . Guide [yourself]0-i by the delicate Spiritual Instinct within [you]0-i , which tells [you]0-i that with [God]101-god all things are possible , save that [He]101-god can not destroy [Himself]101-god or lessen by one spark the fiery brilliancy of [his]101-god ever - widening circle of productive Intelligence . But make no attempt to convert [the world]264-the world to [your]0-i way of thinking - it would be mere waste of time . "[1587-he]

" May [I]0-i never try to instruct [anyone]2062-anyone in these things ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [You]0-i can try , if [you]0-i choose ; but [you]0-i will find [most human beings]3521-most human beings like the herd of swine in the Gospel , possessed by devils that drive [them]3521-most human beings headlong into [the sea]1792-the sea . [You]0-i know , for instance , that angels and [aerial spirits]3523-aerial spirits actually exist ; but were [you]0-i to assert [your]0-i belief in [them]3524-them , [philosophers so - called]3525-philosophers so - called would scout [your]0-i theories as absurd , - though [their]3525-philosophers so - called idea of [a LONELY God , who yet is Love]3526-a lonely god , who yet is love , is the very acme of absurdity . For Love MUST have somewhat to love , and MUST create the beauty and happiness round itself and the things beloved . But why point out these simple things to [those who have no desire to see]3527-those who have no desire to see ? [The little page]1580-the little page now entered , and told [me]0-i that [the carriage]2340-the carriage was at the door in waiting . As [he]1580-the little page disappeared again after delivering this message , [Heliobas]104-heliobas rose from [his]104-heliobas chair , and taking [my]0-i two hands in [his]104-heliobas , pressed them kindly .

" One word more , [little friend]2430-little friend , on the subject of [your]0-i career . [I]104-heliobas think the time will come when [you]0-i will feel that music is almost too sacred a thing to be given away for money to [a careless and promiscuous public]3531-a careless and promiscuous public . However this may be , remember that [scarce one of [the self - styled artists who cater for [the crowd]286-the crowd]3533-the self - styled artists who cater for the crowd]3532-scarce one of the self - styled artists who cater for the crowd deserves to be called [MUSICIAN]2508-musician in the highest sense of the word . [Most of [them]3536-most of them]3536-most of them seek not music , but money and applause ; and therefore the art [they]3536-most of them profess is degraded by [them]3536-most of them into a mere trade . But [you]0-i , when [you]0-i play in public , must forget that [PERSONS with little vanities and lesser opinions exist]3537-persons with little vanities and lesser opinions exist . Think of what [you]0-i saw in [your]0-i journey with [Azul]106-azul ; and by a strong effort of [your]0-i will , [you]0-i can , if [you]0-i choose , COMPEL certain harmonies to sound in [your]0-i ears - fragments of what is common breathing air to [the Children of [the Ring]3539-the ring]3538-the children of the ring , [some of whom [you]0-i saw]3540-some of whom you saw - and [you]0-i will be able to reproduce [them]3538-the children of the ring in part , if not in entirety . But if [you]0-i once admit a thought of [Self]182-self to enter [your]0-i brain , those aerial sounds will be silenced instantly . By this means , too , [you]0-i can judge who are [the true disciples of music in [this world]1957-this world]3541-the true disciples of music in this world - [those who , like [Schubert]175-schubert and [Chopin]161-chopin , suffered the heaven - born melodies to descend THROUGH [them]3543-those who , like schubert and chopin , suffered the heaven - born melodies to descend through them as though they were mere conductors of sound as though [they]3543-those who , like schubert and chopin , suffered the heaven - born melodies to descend through them as though they were mere conductors of sound were [mere conductors of sound]3544-mere conductors of sound]3543-those who , like schubert and chopin , suffered the heaven - born melodies to descend through them as though they were mere conductors of sound ; or those who , feebly imitating [other composers]1998-other composers , measure out crotchets and quavers by rule and line , and flood [the world]264-the world with inane and perishable , and therefore useless , productions . And now , - farewell . "[104-heliobas]

" Do [you]3547-you remain in [Paris]5-paris ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" For a few days only . [I]1590-i shall go to [Egypt]83-egypt , and in travelling accustom [myself]1590-i to the solitude in which [I]1590-i must dwell , now [Zara]152-zara has left [me]1590-i . "[1590-i]

" [You]3547-you have [Azul]106-azul , "[0-i] [I]0-i ventured to remark .

" Ah ! but how often do [I]1590-i see [her]152-zara ? But [she]152-zara is near [me]1590-i - that [I]1590-i know - faithful as the star to [the mariner]3548-the mariner 's compass ! "[1590-i]

[He]1590-i raised [his]1590-i head as [he]1590-i spoke , and [his]1590-i eyes flashed . Never had [I]0-i seen [him]1590-i look more noble or kingly . [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i looked surprised ; [I]0-i certainly felt so , for nothing was further from [my]0-i thoughts than a visit to [Italy]27-italy .

[Heliobas]104-heliobas smiled , and said in a tone that was almost gay :

" Shall [I]104-heliobas draw the picture for [you]0-i ? [I]104-heliobas see [a fair city]3551-a fair city , deep embowered in hills and sheltered by [olive - groves]3552-olive - groves .
