[The woman]2044-the woman is [yourself]0-i ; [the stranger no other than [[your]0-i poor friend]3561-your poor friend , who now , for a brief space , takes leave of [you]0-i]3560-the stranger no other than your poor friend , who now , for a brief space , takes leave of you ! "[104-heliobas]

So rapidly had [he]1591-he drawn up this picture , that the impression made on [me]0-i was as though a sudden vision had been shown to [me]0-i in a magic glass . [I]0-i looked at [him]1591-he earnestly .

" Then [our]1594-our next meeting will be happy ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said inquiringly .

" Of course . Why not ? And the next - and the next after that also ! "[1591-he] [he]1591-he answered .

At this reply , so frankly given , [I]0-i was relieved , and accompanied [him]1591-he readily through [the hall]572-the hall towards [the street]2046-the street - door . [Leo]100-leo met [us]1594-our [here]1773-here , and intimated , as plainly as [a human being]1596-a human being could have done , [his]100-leo wish to bid [me]0-i good - bye . [I]0-i stooped and kissed [his]100-leo broad head and patted [him]100-leo affectionately , and was rewarded for these attentions by seeing [his]100-leo plume - like tail wave slowly to and fro - a sign of pleasure the poor animal had not betrayed since [Zara]152-zara 's departure from the scene of [her]152-zara earthly imprisonment .

At the door [the pretty Greek boy]1597-the pretty greek boy handed [me]0-i a huge basket of the loveliest flowers .

" The last from [the conservatory]383-the conservatory , "[104-heliobas] said [Heliobas]104-heliobas . " [I]104-heliobas shall need no more of these luxuries . "[104-heliobas]

As [I]0-i entered [the carriage]2340-the carriage [he]100-leo placed the flowers beside [me]0-i , and again took [my]0-i hand .

" Good - bye , [[my]100-leo child]1853-my child ! "[100-leo] [he]100-leo said , in earnest and kindly tones . " [I]100-leo have [your]1853-my child address , and will write [you]1853-my child all [my]100-leo movements . In any trouble , small or great , of [your]1853-my child own , send to [me]100-leo for advice without hesitation . [I]100-leo can tell [you]1853-my child already that [I]100-leo foresee the time when [you]1853-my child will resign altogether the precarious and unsatisfactory life of [a mere professional musician]3564-a mere professional musician . [You]1853-my child think no other career would be possible to [you]1853-my child ? Well , [you]1853-my child will see ! A few months will decide all . Good - bye again ; God bless [you]1853-my child ! "[100-leo]

[The carriage]2340-the carriage moved off , and [Heliobas]104-heliobas stood on the steps of [[his]104-heliobas mansion]1600-his mansion watching [it]2340-the carriage out of sight . To the last [I]0-i saw [his]104-heliobas stately figure erect in the light of the winter sunshine - a figure destined from henceforth to occupy a prominent position in [my]0-i life and memory . The regret [I]0-i felt at parting from [him]104-heliobas was greatly mitigated by the assurance [he]104-heliobas gave [me]0-i of [our]1601-our future meeting , a promise which has since been fulfilled , and is likely soon to be fulfilled again . That [I]0-i have such [a friend]583-a friend is an advantageous circumstance for [me]0-i , for through [his]104-heliobas guidance [I]0-i am able to judge accurately of many things occurring in the course of the daily life around [me]0-i - things which , seemingly trivial , are the hints of serious results to come , which , [I]0-i am thus permitted in part to foresee . There is a drawback , of course , and the one bitter drop in the cup of knowledge is , that the more [I]0-i progress under the tuition of [Heliobas]104-heliobas , the less am [I]0-i deceived by graceful appearances . [I]0-i perceive with almost cruel suddenness the true characters of [all those whom [I]0-i meet]1603-all those whom i meet . No smile of lip or eye can delude [me]0-i into accepting mere surface - matter for real depth , and it is intensely painful for [me]0-i to be forced to behold hypocrisy in the expression of the apparently devout - sensuality in the face of [some radiantly beautiful and popular woman]1604-some radiantly beautiful and popular woman - vice under the mask of virtue - self - interest in the guise of friendship , and spite and malice springing up like a poisonous undergrowth beneath the words of elegant flattery or dainty compliment . [I]0-i often wish [I]0-i could throw a rose - coloured mist of illusion over all these things and still more earnestly do [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could in a single instance find [myself]0-i mistaken . But alas ! the fatal finger of the electric instinct within [me]0-i points out unerringly the flaw in every human diamond , and writes " SHAM "[0-i] across many a cunningly contrived imitation of intelligence and goodness . Still , the grief [I]0-i feel at this is counterbalanced in part by the joy with which [I]0-i quickly recognize real virtue , real nobility , real love ; and when these attributes flash out upon [me]0-i from the faces of [human beings]2284-human beings , [my]0-i own soul warms , and [I]0-i know [I]0-i have seen a vision as of angels . The capability of [Heliobas]104-heliobas to foretell future events proved itself in [his]104-heliobas knowledge of the fate of [the famous English hero , [Gordon]245-gordon , long before [that brave soldier]1607-that brave soldier met [his]245-gordon doom]1606-the famous english hero , gordon , long before that brave soldier met his doom . At the time [the English Government]1608-the english government sent [him]245-gordon out on [his]245-gordon last fatal mission , a letter from [Heliobas]104-heliobas to [me]0-i contained the following passage :

" [I]104-heliobas see [Gordon]245-gordon has chosen [his]245-gordon destiny and the manner of [his]245-gordon death . Two ways of dying have been offered [him]245-gordon - one that is slow , painful , and inglorious ; the other sudden , and therefore sweeter to [a man of [his]245-gordon temperament]3565-a man of his temperament . [He]245-gordon [himself]245-gordon is perfectly aware of the approaching end of [his]245-gordon career ; [he]245-gordon will receive [his]245-gordon release at [Khartoum]84-khartoum . [England]10-england will lament over [him]245-gordon for a little while , and then [he]245-gordon will be declared [an inspired madman]3566-an inspired madman , who rushed recklessly on [his]245-gordon own doom ; while [those who allowed [him]245-gordon to be slain]3567-those who allowed him to be slain will be voted the wisest , the most just and virtuous in [the realm]3568-the realm . "[104-heliobas]

This prophecy was carried out to the letter , as [I]0-i fully believe certain things of which [I]0-i am now informed will also be fulfilled . But though there are persons who pin [their]1609-their faith on " [Zadkiel]246-zadkiel , "[0-i] [I]0-i doubt if there are [any who will believe in such a thing as ELECTRIC DIVINATION]1610-any who will believe in such a thing as electric divination . The one is mere vulgar imposture , the other is performed on a purely scientific basis in accordance with certain existing rules and principles ; yet [I]0-i think there can be no question as to which of the two [the public en masse]1611-the public en masse is likely to prefer . On the whole , [people]1754-people do not mind being deceived ; [they]1754-people hate being instructed , and the trouble of thinking for [themselves]1754-people is almost too much for [them]1754-people . Therefore " [Zadkiel]246-zadkiel "[0-i] is certain to flourish for many and many a long day , while the lightning instinct of prophecy dormant in [every human being]2290-every human being remains unused and utterly forgotten except by the rare few .

[I]0-i have little more to say . [I]0-i feel that those among [[my]0-i readers who idly turn over these pages , expecting to find a " NOVEL "[0-i] in the true acceptation of the term]1614-my readers who idly turn over these pages , expecting to find a " novel " in the true acceptation of the term , may be disappointed . [My]0-i narrative is simply an " experience : "[0-i] but [I]0-i have no wish to persuade others of the central truth contained in it - namely , THE EXISTENCE OF [POWERFUL ELECTRIC ORGANS IN EVERY HUMAN BEING , WHICH WITH PROPER CULTIVATION ARE CAPABLE OF MARVELLOUS SPIRITUAL FORCE]1615-powerful electric organs in every human being , which with proper cultivation are capable of marvellous spiritual force . The time is not yet ripe for this fact to be accepted .

[The persons connected with this story]1616-the persons connected with this story may be dismissed in a few words . When [I]0-i joined [[my]0-i friend]365-my friend [Mrs. Everard]152-zara , [she]152-zara was suffering from nervous hysteria . [My]0-i presence had the soothing effect [Heliobas]104-heliobas had assured [me]0-i of , and in a very few days [we]1618-we started from [Paris]5-paris in company for [England]10-england . [She]152-zara , with [[her]152-zara amiable and accomplished husband]1619-her amiable and accomplished husband , went back to [the States]1620-the states a few months since to claim an immense fortune , which [they]1618-we are now enjoying as [most Americans]1621-most americans enjoy wealth . [Amy]93-amy has diamonds to [her]93-amy heart 's content , and toilettes galore from Worth 's ; but [she]93-amy has [no children]3283-no children , and from the tone of [her]93-amy letters to [me]0-i , [I]0-i fancy [she]93-amy would part with one at least of [her]93-amy valuable necklaces to have a small pair of chubby arms round [her]93-amy neck , and a soft little head nestling against [her]93-amy bosom .

[Raffaello Cellini]97-cellini still lives and works ; [his]97-cellini paintings are among the marvels of modern [Italy]27-italy for their richness and warmth of colour - colour which , in spite of [his]97-cellini envious detractors , is destined to last through ages . [He]97-cellini is not very rich , for [he]97-cellini is [one of those who give away [their]1624-their substance to [the poor]2374-the poor and [the distressed]1626-the distressed]1623-one of those who give away their substance to the poor and the distressed ; but where [he]97-cellini is known [he]97-cellini is universally beloved . None of [his]97-cellini pictures have yet been exhibited in [England]10-england , and [he]97-cellini is in no hurry to call upon [the [London]2-london critics]1627-the london critics for [their]1627-the london critics judgment . [He]97-cellini has been asked several times to sell [his]97-cellini large picture , " Lords of [our]1628-our Life and Death , "[97-cellini] but [he]97-cellini will not . [I]0-i have never met [him]97-cellini since [our]1628-our intercourse at [Cannes]4-cannes , but [I]0-i hear of [him]97-cellini frequently through [Heliobas]104-heliobas , who has recently forwarded [me]0-i a proof engraving of the picture " L'Improvisatrice , "[104-heliobas] for which [I]0-i sat as [model]1629-model . It is a beautiful work of art , but that it is like [ME]0-i [I]0-i am not vain enough to admit . [I]0-i keep it , not as a portrait of [myself]0-i , but as a souvenir of [the man through whose introduction [I]0-i gained the best friend [I]0-i have]1630-the man through whose introduction i gained the best friend i have .

News of [Prince Ivan Petroffsky]153-prince ivan reaches [me]0-i frequently . [He]153-prince ivan is possessor of the immense wealth foretold by [Heliobas]104-heliobas ; the eyes of [Society]229-society greedily follows [his]153-prince ivan movements ; [his]153-prince ivan name figures conspicuously in the " Fashionable Intelligence ; "[153-prince ivan] and the magnificence of [his]153-prince ivan recent marriage festivities was for some time the talk of [the Continent]86-the continent . [He]153-prince ivan has married [the only daughter of [a French Duke]1632-a french duke]1631-the only daughter of a french duke - a lovely creature , as soulless and heartless as [a dressmaker]656-a dressmaker 's stuffed model ; but [she]1631-the only daughter of a french duke carries [his]153-prince ivan jewels well on [her]1631-the only daughter of a french duke white bosom , and receives [[his]153-prince ivan guests]1280-his guests with as much dignity as [a well - trained major - domo]1635-a well - trained major - domo . These qualities suffice to satisfy [[her]1631-the only daughter of a french duke husband]317-her husband at present ; how long [his]153-prince ivan satisfaction will last is another matter . [He]153-prince ivan has not quite forgotten [Zara]152-zara ; for on every recurring Jour des Morts , or Feast of the Dead , [he]153-prince ivan sends a garland or cross of flowers to [the simple grave in [Pere - la - Chaise]81-pere - la - chaise]1637-the simple grave in pere - la - chaise . [Heliobas]104-heliobas watches [his]104-heliobas career with untiring vigilance ; nor can [I]0-i [myself]0-i avoid taking a certain interest in the progress of [his]104-heliobas fate . At the moment [I]0-i write [he]104-heliobas is [one of the most envied and popular noblemen in all [the Royal Courts of [Europe]26-europe]1639-the royal courts of europe]1638-one of the most envied and popular noblemen in all the royal courts of europe ; and [no one]1820-no one thinks of asking [him]104-heliobas whether [he]104-heliobas is happy . [He]104-heliobas MUST be happy , says [the world]264-the world ; [he]104-heliobas has everything that is needed to make [him]104-heliobas so . Everything ? yes - all except one thing , for which [he]104-heliobas will long when the shadow of the end draws near .

And now what else remains ? A brief farewell to [those who have perused this narrative]1642-those who have perused this narrative , or a lingering parting word ?

In these days of haste and scramble , when there is no time for faith , is there time for sentiment ? [I]0-i think not . And therefore there shall be none between [[my]0-i readers]1213-my readers and [me]0-i , save this - a friendly warning . Belief - belief in [God]101-god - belief in all things noble , unworldly , lofty , and beautiful , is rapidly being crushed underfoot by - what ? By mere lust of gain ! Be sure , [good people]1644-good people , be very sure that [you]1644-good people are RIGHT in denying [God]101-god for the sake of [man]282-man - in abjuring the spiritual for the material - before [you]1644-good people rush recklessly onward . The end for all of [you]1644-good people can be but death ; and are [you]1644-good people quite positive after all that there is NO Hereafter ? Is it sense to imagine that the immense machinery of [the Universe]2474-the universe has been set in motion for nothing ? Is it even common reason to consider that [the Soul of [man]282-man]1647-the soul of man , with all its high musings , [its]1647-the soul of man dreams of unseen glory , its longings after the Infinite , is a mere useless vapour , or a set of shifting molecules in a perishable brain ? The mere fact of the EXISTENCE OF A DESIRE clearly indicates an EQUALLY EXISTING CAPACITY for the GRATIFICATION of that desire ; therefore , [I]0-i ask , would the WISH for a future state of being , which is secretly felt by [every one of [us]1650-our]2119-every one of us , have been permitted to find a place in [our]1650-our natures , IF THERE WERE NO POSSIBLE MEANS OF GRANTING [IT]1651-it ? Why all this discontent with the present - why all this universal complaint and despair and world - weariness , if there be NO HEREAFTER ? For [my]0-i own part , [I]0-i have told [you]1644-good people frankly WHAT [I]0-i HAVE SEEN and WHAT [I]0-i KNOW ; but [I]0-i do not ask [you]1644-good people to believe [me]0-i . [I]0-i only say , IF - IF [you]1644-good people admit to [yourselves]1644-good people the possibility of a future and eternal state of existence , would it not be well for [you]1644-good people to inquire seriously how [you]1644-good people are preparing for it in these wild days ? Look at society around [you]1644-good people , and ask [yourselves]1644-good people : Whither is [our]1650-our " PROGRESS "[1644-good people] tending - Forward or Backward - Upward or Downward ? Which way ? Fight the problem out . Do not glance at it casually , or put it away as an unpleasant thought , or a consideration involving too much trouble - struggle with it bravely till [you]1644-good people resolve it , and whatever the answer may be , ABIDE BY IT . If it leads [you]1644-good people to deny [God]101-god and the immortal destinies of [your]1644-good people own souls , and [you]1644-good people find hereafter , when it is too late , that both [God]101-god and immortality exist , [you]1644-good people have only [yourselves]1644-good people to blame . [We]1650-our are the arbiters of [our]1650-our own fate , and that fact is the most important one of [our]1650-our lives . [Our]1650-our WILL is positively unfettered ; it is a rudder put freely into [our]1650-our hands , and with it [we]1650-our can steer WHEREVER [WE]1650-our CHOOSE . [God]101-god will not COMPEL [our]1650-our love or obedience . [We]1650-our must [ourselves]1650-our DESIRE to love and obey - DESIRE IT ABOVE ALL THINGS IN [THE WORLD]7-the world .

As for the Electric Origin of [the Universe]1-the universe , a time is coming when [scientific men]1652-scientific men will acknowledge it to be the only theory of Creation worthy of acceptance . All the wonders of Nature are the result of LIGHT AND HEAT ALONE - [i.e.]1653-i.e. , are the work of the Electric Ring [I]0-i have endeavoured to describe , which MUST go on producing , absorbing and reproducing [worlds]1654-worlds , suns and systems for ever and ever . The Ring , in its turn , is merely the outcome of [God]101-god 's own personality - the atmosphere surrounding [the World in which [He]101-god has [His]101-god existence]1655-the world in which he has his existence - [a World created by Love and for Love alone]1656-a world created by love and for love alone . [I]0-i can not force this theory on public attention , which is at present claimed by [various learned professors]1657-various learned professors , who give ingenious explanations of " atoms "[1657-various learned professors] and " molecules ; "[1657-various learned professors] yet , even regarding these same " atoms , "[302-some] the mild question may be put : Where did the FIRST " atom "[302-some] come from ? [Some]302-some may answer : " [We]302-some call [the first atom GOD]3569-the first atom god . "[302-some] Surely it is as well to call [Him]101-god a Spirit of pure Light as an atom ? However , the fact of [one person]1659-one person 's being convinced of a truth will not , [I]0-i am aware , go very far to convince [others]324-others . [I]0-i have related [my]0-i " experience "[104-heliobas] exactly as it happened at the time , and [[my]0-i readers]1213-my readers can accept or deny the theories of [Heliobas]104-heliobas as [they]1213-my readers please . Neither denial , acceptance , criticism , nor incredulity can affect [ME]0-i personally , inasmuch as [I]0-i am not [Heliobas]104-heliobas , but simply [the narrator of an episode connected with [him]104-heliobas]1662-the narrator of an episode connected with him ; and as such , [my]0-i task is finished .

[APPENDIX]247-appendix .

In publishing these selections from letters received concerning the " Romance , "[247-appendix] [I]0-i am in honour bound not to disclose the names of [[my]0-i correspondents]1663-my correspondents , and this necessary reticence will no doubt induce the incredulous to declare that they are not genuine epistles , but mere inventions of [my]0-i own . [I]0-i am quite prepared for such a possible aspersion , and in reply , [I]0-i can but say that [I]0-i hold the originals in [my]0-i possession , and that some of them have been read by [[my]0-i friend]365-my friend [Mr. George Bentley]248-mr. george bentley , under whose auspices this book has been successfully launched on the sea of public favour . [I]0-i may add that [[my]0-i correspondents]1663-my correspondents are all strangers to [me]0-i personally - [not one of [them]1663-my correspondents]1666-not one of them have [I]0-i ever met . A few have indeed asked [me]0-i to accord [them]1663-my correspondents interviews , but this request [I]0-i invariably deny , not wishing to set [myself]0-i forward in any way as an exponent of high doctrine in which [I]0-i am as yet but [a beginner and student]1667-a beginner and student . - [AUTHOR]1668-author .

LETTER [I.]1669-i.

" [DEAR MADAM]3570-dear madam ,[1668-author]

" [You]3570-dear madam must receive so many letters that [I]1668-author feel it is almost a shame to add to the number , but [I]1668-author can not resist writing to tell [you]3570-dear madam how very much [your]3570-dear madam book , ' The Romance of Two Worlds , ' has helped [me]1668-author . [[My]1668-author dear friend]3571-my dear friend [Miss F]249-miss f - - , who has written to [you]3570-dear madam lately [I]1668-author believe , first read it to [me]1668-author , and [I]1668-author can not tell [you]3570-dear madam what a want in [my]1668-author life it seemed to fill up . [I]1668-author have been always interested in the so - called Supernatural , feeling very conscious of depths in [my]1668-author own self and in others that are usually ignored . ... [I]1668-author have been reading as many books as [I]1668-author could obtain upon Theosophy , but though thankful for the high thoughts [I]1668-author found in them , [I]1668-author still felt a great want - that of combining this occult knowledge with [my]1668-author own firm belief in the Christian religion . [Your]3570-dear madam book seemed to give [me]1668-author just what [I]1668-author wanted - IT HAS DEEPENED AND STRENGTHENED [MY]1668-author BELIEF IN AND LOVE TO [GOD AND HAS MADE THE NEW TESTAMENT A NEW BOOK]3572-god and has made the new testament a new book TO [ME]1668-author . Things which [I]1668-author could not understand before seem clear in the light which [your]3570-dear madam ' Vision ' has thrown upon [them]3573-them , and [I]1668-author can not remain satisfied without expressing to [you]3570-dear madam [my]1668-author sincere gratitude . May [your]3570-dear madam book be read by [all who are ready to receive the high truths that it contains]3574-all who are ready to receive the high truths that it contains ! With thanks , [I]1668-author remain , [dear Madam]3570-dear madam ,[1668-author]

" [Yours]3570-dear madam sincerely , M. S. "[1668-author]

LETTER II .

" [MADAM]3576-madam ,[1668-author]

" [I]1668-author am afraid [you]3570-dear madam will think it very presumptuous of [a stranger]544-a stranger to address [you]3570-dear madam , but [I]1668-author have lately read [your]3570-dear madam book , ' A Romance of [Two Worlds]87-two worlds , ' and have been much struck with it . It has opened [my]1668-author mind to such new impressions , and seems to be so much what [I]1668-author have been groping for so long , that [I]1668-author thought if [you]3570-dear madam would be kind enough to answer this , [I]1668-author might get a firmer hold on those higher things and be at anchor at last . If [you]3570-dear madam have patience to read so far , [you]3570-dear madam will imagine [I]1668-author must be very much in earnest to intrude [myself]1668-author on [you]3570-dear madam like this , but from the tone of [your]3570-dear madam book [I]1668-author do not believe [you]3570-dear madam would withdraw [your]3570-dear madam hand where [you]3570-dear madam could do good . ... [I]1668-author never thought of or read of the electric force or spirit in [every human being]2290-every human being before , but [I]1668-author do believe in it after reading [your]3570-dear madam book , and [YOU]3570-dear madam HAVE MADE THE NEXT WORLD A LIVING THING TO [ME]1668-author , and raised [my]1668-author feelings above the disappointments and trials of this life . ... [Your]3570-dear madam book was put into [my]1668-author hands at a time when [I]1668-author was deeply distressed and in trouble about [my]1668-author future ; but [you]3570-dear madam have shown [me]1668-author how small a thing this future of [OUR]3579-our life is . ... Would it be asking too much of [you]3570-dear madam to name any books [you]3570-dear madam think might help [me]1668-author in this new vein of thought [you]3570-dear madam have given [me]1668-author ? Apologizing for having written , believe [me]1668-author yours sincerely ,[1668-author]

" B. W. L. "[1668-author]

[I]0-i answered to the best of [my]0-i ability [the writer of the above]1670-the writer of the above , and later on received another letter as follows :

" Forgive [my]1668-author writing to [you]3570-dear madam again on the subject of [your]3570-dear madam ' Romance , ' but [I]1668-author read it so often and think of it so much . [I]1668-author can not say the wonderful change [your]3570-dear madam book has wrought in [my]1668-author life , and though very likely [you]3570-dear madam are constantly hearing of the good it has done , yet it can not but be the sweetest thing [you]3570-dear madam can hear - that the seed [you]3570-dear madam have planted is bringing forth so much fruit . ... The Bible is a new book to [me]1668-author since [your]3570-dear madam work came into [my]1668-author hands . "[1668-author]

LETTER III .

The following terribly pathetic avowal is from [a clergyman of [the Church of [England]10-england]1672-the church of england]1671-a clergyman of the church of england :

" [MADAM]250-madam ,[1668-author]

" [Your]3570-dear madam book , the ' Romance of [Two Worlds]87-two worlds , ' has stopped [me]1668-author on the brink of what is doubtless a crime , and yet [I]1668-author had come to think it the only way out of impending madness . [I]1668-author speak of self - destruction - suicide . And while writing the word , [I]1668-author beg of [you]3570-dear madam to accept [my]1668-author gratitude for the timely rescue of [my]1668-author soul . Once [I]1668-author believed in the goodness of [God]101-god - but of late years the cry of modern scientific atheism , ' There is [NO God]1729-no god , ' has rung in [my]1668-author ears till [my]1668-author brain has reeled at the desolation and nothingness of [the Universe]2474-the universe . No good , no hope , no satisfaction in anything - [this world]1957-this world only with all its mockery and failure - and afterwards annihilation ! Could [a God]2747-a god design and create so poor and cruel a jest ? So [I]1668-author thought - and the misery of the thought was more than [I]1668-author could bear . [I]1668-author had resolved to make an end . [No one]1820-no one knew , [no one]1820-no one guessed [my]1668-author intent , till one Sunday afternoon [a friend]583-a friend lent [me]1668-author [your]3570-dear madam book . [I]1668-author began to read , and never left it till [I]1668-author had finished the last page - then [I]1668-author knew [I]1668-author was saved . [Life]96-life immortal and love triumphant smiled again upon [me]1668-author in consoling colours , and [I]1668-author write to tell [you]3570-dear madam that whatever other good [your]3570-dear madam work may do and is no doubt doing , [you]3570-dear madam have saved both the life and reason of [one grateful human being]3587-one grateful human being . If [you]3570-dear madam will write to [me]1668-author a few lines [I]1668-author shall be still more grateful , for [I]1668-author feel [you]3570-dear madam can help [me]1668-author . [I]1668-author seem to have read [Christ]101-god 's mission wrong - but with patience and prayer it is possible to redeem [my]1668-author error . Once more thanking [you]3570-dear madam , [I]1668-author am ,[1668-author]

" [Yours]3570-dear madam with more thankfulness than [I]1668-author can write ,[1668-author]

" L. E. F. "[1668-author]

[I]0-i lost no time in replying to this letter , and since then have frequently corresponded with [the writer , from whose troubled mind the dark cloud has now entirely departed]1673-the writer , from whose troubled mind the dark cloud has now entirely departed . And [I]0-i may here venture to remark that the evils of " modern scientific atheism "[1668-author] are far more widely spread and deeply rooted than [the majority of persons]1674-the majority of persons are aware of , and that many of the apparently inexplicable cases of self - slaughter on which the formal verdict , " Suicide during a state of temporary insanity , "[1668-author] is passed , have been caused by long and hopeless brooding on the " nothingness of [the Universe]2474-the universe "[1668-author] - which , if it were a true theory , would indeed make of Creation a bitter , nay , even a senseless jest . [The cruel preachers of such a creed]1675-the cruel preachers of such a creed have much to answer for . [The murderer who destroys human life for wicked passion and wantonness]1676-the murderer who destroys human life for wicked passion and wantonness is less criminal than [the proudly learned , yet egotistical , and therefore densely ignorant scientist , who , seeking to crush the soul by [his]1677-the proudly learned , yet egotistical , and therefore densely ignorant scientist , who , seeking to crush the soul by his feeble , narrow - minded arguments , and deny its imperishable nature , dares to spread his poisonous and corroding doctrines of despair through the world , draining existence of all its brightness , and striving to erect barriers of distrust between the creature and the creator feeble , narrow - minded arguments , and deny its imperishable nature , dares to spread [his]1677-the proudly learned , yet egotistical , and therefore densely ignorant scientist , who , seeking to crush the soul by his feeble , narrow - minded arguments , and deny its imperishable nature , dares to spread his poisonous and corroding doctrines of despair through the world , draining existence of all its brightness , and striving to erect barriers of distrust between the creature and the creator poisonous and corroding doctrines of despair through [the world]264-the world , draining existence of all its brightness , and striving to erect barriers of distrust between the creature and [the Creator]2447-the creator]1677-the proudly learned , yet egotistical , and therefore densely ignorant scientist , who , seeking to crush the soul by his feeble , narrow - minded arguments , and deny its imperishable nature , dares to spread his poisonous and corroding doctrines of despair through the world , draining existence of all its brightness , and striving to erect barriers of distrust between the creature and the creator . No sin can be greater than this ; for it is impossible to estimate the measure of evil that may thus be brought into otherwise innocent and happy lives . The attitude of devotion and faith is natural to [Humanity]251-humanity , while nothing can be more UNnatural and disastrous to civilization , morality and law , than deliberate and determined Atheism . - [AUTHOR]1668-author .

LETTER IV .

" DEAR MADAM ,[1668-author]

" [I]1668-author dare say [you]3570-dear madam have had many letters , but [I]1668-author must add mine to the number to thank [you]3570-dear madam for [your]3570-dear madam book , the ' Romance of [Two Worlds]87-two worlds . ' [I]1668-author am deeply interested in the wonderful force [we]3589-we possess , all in a greater or lesser degree - call it influence , electricity , or what [you]3570-dear madam will . [I]1668-author have thought much on Theosophy and Psychical Research - but what struck [me]1668-author in [your]3570-dear madam book was the glorious selflessness inculcated and the perfect Majesty of the Divinity clear throughout - no sweeping away of the Crucified One . [I]1668-author felt [a better woman]3590-a better woman for the reading of it twice : and [I]1668-author know [others]324-others , too , who are higher and [better women]3592-better women for such noble thoughts and teaching . [... People]3593-... people for the most part dream away [their]3593-... people lives ; [one]272-one meets [so few who really believe in electrical affinity]3595-so few who really believe in electrical affinity , and [I]1668-author have felt it so often and for so long . Forgive [my]1668-author troubling [you]3570-dear madam with this letter , but [I]1668-author am grateful for [your]3570-dear madam labour of love towards raising [men]273-men and [women]441-women .[1668-author]

" Sincerely [yours]3570-dear madam ,[1668-author]

" R. H. "[1668-author]

LETTER V.

" [I]1668-author should like to know if [Marie Corelli]89-marie corelli honestly believes the theory which [she]89-marie corelli enunciates in [her]89-marie corelli book , ' The Romance of Two Worlds : ' and also if [she]89-marie corelli has any proof on which to found that same theory ? - if so , [the authoress]3598-the authoress will greatly oblige [an earnest seeker]3599-an earnest seeker after Truth if [she]3598-the authoress will give the information sought to[1668-author]

" A. S. "[1668-author]

[I]0-i sent a brief affirmative answer to the above note ; the " proof "[1668-author] of the theories set forth in the " Romance "[1668-author] is , as [I]0-i have already stated , easily to be found in the New Testament . But there are [those who do not and will not believe the New Testament]1681-those who do not and will not believe the new testament , and for [them]1681-those who do not and will not believe the new testament there are no " proofs "[1668-author] of any existing spirituality in [earth]1946-earth or heaven . " Having eyes [they]1681-those who do not and will not believe the new testament see not , and hearing [they]1681-those who do not and will not believe the new testament do not understand . "[1668-author] - AUTHOR .

LETTER VI .

" [DEAR MADAM]250-madam ,[1668-author]

" [I]1668-author have lately been reading with intense pleasure [your]250-madam ' Romance of [Two Worlds]87-two worlds , ' and [I]1668-author must crave [your]250-madam forbearance towards [me]1668-author when [I]1668-author tell [you]250-madam that it has filled [me]1668-author with envy and wonder . [I]1668-author feel sure that [many people]3600-many people must have plied [you]250-madam with questions on the subject already , but [I]1668-author am certain that [you]250-madam are too earnest and too sympathetic to feel bored by what is in no sense idle curiosity , but rather a deep and genuine longing to know the truth . ... To [some minds]3601-some minds it would prove such a comfort and such , a relief to have [their]3601-some minds vague longings and beliefs confirmed and made tangible , and , as [you]250-madam know , at the present day so - called Religion , which is often a mere mixture of dogma and superstition , is scarcely sufficient to do this . ... [I]1668-author might say a great deal more and weary [your]250-madam patience , which has already been tried , [I]1668-author fear . But may [I]1668-author venture to hope that [you]250-madam have some words of comfort and assurance out of [your]250-madam own experience to give [me]1668-author ? With [your]250-madam expressed belief in the good influence which each may exert over [the other]3602-the other , not to speak of a higher and holier incentive in the example of One in whom [you]250-madam also believe who bids [us]3603-us for [His]3604-his sake to ' Bear one another 's burdens , ' [you]250-madam can not , [I]1668-author think , turn away in impatience from the seeking of [a very earnest soul]3605-a very earnest soul .[1668-author]

" [Yours]250-madam sincerely ,[1668-author]

" B. D. "[1668-author]

[I]0-i have received about fifty letters written in precisely the same tone as the above - all more or less complaining of the insufficiency of ' so - called Religion , which is often a mere mixture of dogma and superstition " - and [I]1668-author ask - What are [the preachers of [Christ]101-god]3606-the preachers of christ 's clear message about that there should be [such plaintively eager anxious souls]3607-such plaintively eager anxious souls as these , who are evidently ready and willing to live noble lives if helped and encouraged ever so little ? Shame on [those men who presume to take up the high vocation of the priesthood]3608-those men who presume to take up the high vocation of the priesthood for the sake of self - love , self - interest , worldly advancement , money or position ! These things are not among [Christ]101-god 's teachings . If there are [members of [the clergy who can neither plant faith , nor consolation , nor proper comprehension of God]3610-the clergy who can neither plant faith , nor consolation , nor proper comprehension of god 's infinite Beauty and Goodness in the hearts of [[their]3610-the clergy who can neither plant faith , nor consolation , nor proper comprehension of god hearers]3611-their hearers , [I]1668-author say that [their]3610-the clergy who can neither plant faith , nor consolation , nor proper comprehension of god continuance in such sacred office is an offence to [the Master whom [they]3610-the clergy who can neither plant faith , nor consolation , nor proper comprehension of god profess to serve]3612-the master whom they profess to serve]3609-members of the clergy who can neither plant faith , nor consolation , nor proper comprehension of god 's infinite beauty and goodness in the hearts of their hearers , i say that their continuance in such sacred office is an offence to the master whom they profess to serve . "[1668-author] It must needs be that offences come , but woe to [that man by whom the offence cometh]1683-that man by whom the offence cometh ! " To such may be addressed the words , "[1683-that man by whom the offence cometh] Hypocrites ! for [ye]1684-ye shut up [the kingdom of heaven]1685-the kingdom of heaven against [men]273-men ; [ye]1684-ye neither go in [yourselves]1684-ye , neither suffer [ye]1684-ye [them]273-men that are entering to go in . " - [AUTHOR]1668-author .[1668-author]

LETTER VII .

" [MADAM]3576-madam ,[1668-author]

" [I]1668-author hope [you]3576-madam will not think it great presumption [my]1668-author writing to [you]3576-madam . [My]1668-author excuse must be that [I]1668-author so much want to believe in [he]1668-author great Spirit that ' makes for righteousness , ' and [I]1668-author can not ! [Your]3576-madam book puts it all so clearly that if [I]1668-author can only know it to be a true experience of [your]3576-madam own , it will go a long way in dispersing the fog that modern writings surround one with . ...[1668-author]

" Apologizing for troubling [you]3576-madam , [I]1668-author am faithfully [yours]3576-madam ,[1668-author]

" C.M.E. "[1668-author]

LETTER VIII .

" [MADAM]3576-madam ,[1668-author]

" [I]1668-author trust [you]3576-madam will pardon the liberty [I]1668-author take in writing to [you]3576-madam . [My]1668-author excuse must be the very deep interest [your]3576-madam book , ' A Romance of Two Worlds , ' has excited in [me]1668-author . [I]1668-author , of course , understand that the STORY itself is a romance , but in reading it carefully it seems to [me]1668-author that it is a book written with a purpose . ... The Electric Creed respecting Religion seems to explain so much in Scripture which has always seemed to [me]1668-author impossible to accept blindly without explanation of any kind ; and the theory that [Christ]101-god came to die and to suffer for [us]3616-us as an Example and a means of communication with [God]101-god , and not as a SACRIFICE , clears up a point which has always been to [me]1668-author personally a stumbling - block . [I]1668-author can not say how grateful [I]1668-author shall be if [you]3576-madam can tell [me]1668-author any means of studying this subject further ; and trusting [you]3576-madam will excuse [me]1668-author for troubling [you]3576-madam , [I]1668-author am , [Madam]3576-madam ,[1668-author]

" [Yours]3576-madam truly ,[1668-author]

" H. B. "[1668-author]

Once more [I]0-i may repeat that the idea of a sacrifice to appease [God]101-god 's anger is purely JEWISH , and has nothing whatever to do with Christianity according to [Christ]101-god . [He]101-god [Himself]101-god says , " [I]101-god am the WAY , the Truth , and the Life ; [no man]607-no man cometh to [the Father]204-father paul but BY [ME]101-god . "[101-god] Surely these words are plain enough , and point unmistakably to a MEANS OF COMMUNICATION through [Christ]101-god between [the Creator]2447-the creator and [this world]1957-this world . Nowhere does [the Divine Master]1689-the divine master say that [God]101-god is so furiously angry that [he]101-god must have the bleeding body of [[his]101-god own messenger]1690-his own messenger , [Christ]101-god , hung up before [Him]101-god as a human sacrifice , as though [He]101-god could only be pacified by the scent of blood ! Horrible and profane idea ! and one utterly at variance with the tenderness and goodness of " [[Our]1691-us Father]3619-our father "[101-god] as pictured by [Christ]101-god in these gentle words - " Fear not , [little flock]3620-little flock ; it is [[your]3620-little flock Father]3621-your father 's good pleasure to give [you]3620-little flock [the Kingdom]3622-the kingdom . "[101-god] Whereas that [Christ]101-god should come to draw [us]1691-us closer to [God]101-god by the strong force of [His]101-god own Divinity , and by [His]101-god Resurrection prove to [us]1691-us the reality of the next life , is not at all a strange or ungodlike mission , and ought to make [us]1691-us understand more surely than ever how infinitely pitying and forbearing is the All - Loving One , that [He]101-god should , as it were , with such extreme affection show [us]1691-us a way by which to travel through darkness unto light . To those who can not see this perfection of goodness depicted in [Christ]101-god 's own words , [I]0-i would say in the terse Oriental maxim :

" [Diving]252-diving , and finding no pearls in [the sea]1792-the sea , Blame not [the ocean]2840-the ocean , the fault is in [THEE]3620-little flock . "[1668-author] [AUTHOR]1668-author .

[LETTER IX]253-letter ix .

" [DEAR MADAM]250-madam ,[253-letter ix]

" [I]253-letter ix have lately been reading [your]250-madam remarkable book , ' A Romance of Two Worlds , ' and [I]253-letter ix feel that [I]253-letter ix must write to [you]250-madam about it . [I]253-letter ix have never viewed Christianity in the broadly transfigured light [you]250-madam throw upon it , and [I]253-letter ix have since been studying carefully the four Gospels and comparing them with the theories in [your]250-madam book . The result has been a complete and happy change in [my]253-letter ix ideas of religion , and [I]253-letter ix feel now as if [I]253-letter ix had , like [a leper of old]3625-a leper of old , touched the robe of [Christ]101-god and been healed of a long - standing infirmity . Will [you]250-madam permit [me]253-letter ix to ask if [you]250-madam have evolved this new and beneficent lustre from the Gospel [yourself]250-madam ? or whether [some experienced student in mystic matters]3626-some experienced student in mystic matters has been [[your]250-madam instructor]3627-your instructor ? [I]253-letter ix hear from persons who have seen [you]250-madam that [you]250-madam are quite young , and [I]253-letter ix can not understand how one of [your]250-madam sex and age seems able so easily to throw light on what to many has been , and is still , impenetrable darkness . [I]253-letter ix have been [a preacher]3628-a preacher for some years , and [I]253-letter ix thought the Testament was old and familiar to [me]253-letter ix ; but [you]250-madam have made it a new and marvellous book full of most precious meanings , and [I]253-letter ix hope [I]253-letter ix may be able to impart to those whom it is [my]253-letter ix duty to instruct , something of the great consolation and hope [your]250-madam writing has filled [me]253-letter ix with .[253-letter ix]

" Believe [me]253-letter ix ,[253-letter ix]

" Gratefully [yours]250-madam ,[253-letter ix]

" T.M. "[253-letter ix]

LETTER X.

" [MADAM]250-madam ,[253-letter ix]

" Will [you]250-madam tell [me]253-letter ix what ground [you]250-madam have for the foundation of the religious theory contained in [your]250-madam book , ' A Romance of Two Worlds ' ? Is it a part of [your]250-madam own belief ? [I]253-letter ix am MOST anxious to know this , and [I]253-letter ix am sure [you]250-madam will be kind enough to answer [me]253-letter ix . Till [I]253-letter ix read [your]250-madam book [I]253-letter ix thought [myself]253-letter ix [an Agnostic]3629-an agnostic , but now [I]253-letter ix am not quite sure of this . [I]253-letter ix do not believe in [the Deity]3630-the deity as depicted by the Churches . [I]253-letter ix CANNOT . Over and over again [I]253-letter ix have asked [myself]253-letter ix - If there is [a God]2747-a god , why should [He]2747-a god be angry ? It would surely be easy for [Him]2747-a god to destroy [this world]1957-this world entirely as one would blow away an offending speck of dust , and it would be much better and BRAVER for [Him]2747-a god to do this than to torture [His]2747-a god creation . For [I]253-letter ix call life a torture and certainly a useless and cruel torture if it is to end in annihilation . [I]253-letter ix know [I]253-letter ix seem to be blasphemous in these remarks , yet if [you]250-madam only knew what [I]253-letter ix suffer sometimes ! [I]253-letter ix desire , [I]253-letter ix LONG to believe . [YOU]250-madam seem so certain of [your]250-madam Creed - a Creed so noble , reasonable and humane - the God [you]250-madam depict so worthy of the adoration of [a Universe]1-the universe . [I]253-letter ix BEG of [you]250-madam to tell [me]253-letter ix - DO [you]250-madam feel sure of this beneficent all - pervading Love concerning which [you]250-madam write so eloquently ? [I]253-letter ix do not wish to seem [an intruder]3633-an intruder on [your]250-madam most secret thought . [I]253-letter ix want to believe that [YOU]250-madam believe - and if [I]253-letter ix felt this , the tenor of [my]253-letter ix whole life might change . Help [me]253-letter ix if [you]250-madam can - [I]253-letter ix stand in real need of help . [You]250-madam may judge [I]253-letter ix am very deeply in earnest , or [I]253-letter ix should not have written to [you]250-madam .[253-letter ix]

" [Yours]250-madam faithfully ,[253-letter ix]

" A. W. L. "[253-letter ix]

Of such letters as these [I]0-i have received enough to make a volume of [themselves]1693-themselves ; but [I]0-i think the ten [I]0-i have selected are sufficient to show how ardent and inextinguishable is the desire or STRAINING UPWARD , like a flower to the light , of the human Soul for those divine things which nourish it . Scarcely a day passes without [my]0-i receiving more of these earnest and often pathetic appeals for a little help , a little comfort , a little guidance , enough to make [one]272-one 's heart ache at the thought of so much doubt and desolation looming cloud - like over the troubled minds of many who would otherwise lead not only happy but noble and useful lives . When will [the preachers]1695-the preachers learn to preach [Christ]101-god simply - [Christ]101-god without human dogmas or differences ? When shall [we]1696-we be able to enter [a building set apart for sacred worship]1697-a building set apart for sacred worship - a building of finest architectural beauty , " glorious without and within , "[101-god] like the " [King 's Daughter]3634-king 's daughter "[101-god] of [David]163-david 's psalm - glorious with , light , music , flowers , and art of the noblest kind for Art is [God]101-god 's own inspiration to [men]273-men , and through it [He]101-god should be served , there to hear the pure , unselfish doctrine of [Christ]101-god as [He]101-god [Himself]101-god preached it ? For such [a temple]1699-a temple , the time has surely come - a nook sacred to [God]101-god , and untainted by the breath of Mammon , where [we]1696-we could adore [[our]1696-we Creator]1700-our creator " in spirit and in truth . "[101-god] The evils of nineteenth - century cynicism and general flippancy of thought - great evils as they are and sure prognostications of worse evils to come - can not altogether crush out the Divine flame burning in [the " few "[3635-the " few " that are " chosen] that are " chosen]3635-the " few " that are " chosen , "[3635-the " few " that are " chosen] though [these few]1701-these few are counted as [fools and dreamers]1702-fools and dreamers . Yet [they]1701-these few shall be proved wise and watchful ere long . The signs of the times are those that indicate an approaching great upheaval and change in [human destinies]1703-human destinies . [This planet [we]1696-we call [ours]1696-we]1704-this planet we call ours is in some respects like [ourselves]1696-we : it was born ; [it]1704-this planet we call ours has had [its]1704-this planet we call ours infancy , [its]1704-this planet we call ours youth , [its]1704-this planet we call ours full prime ; and now [its]1704-this planet we call ours age has set in , and with age the first beginnings of decay . Absorbed once more into the Creative Circle IT MUST BE ; and when again thrown forth among [its]1704-this planet we call ours companion - stars , [[our]1696-we race]1705-our race will no more inhabit [it]1704-this planet we call ours . [We]1696-we shall have had [our]1696-we day - [our]1696-we little chance - [we]1696-we shall have lost or won . [Christ]101-god said , " [This generation]3636-this generation shall not pass away till all [My]101-god words be fulfilled , "[101-god] the word " generation "[101-god] thus used meaning simply [the human race]3019-the human race . [We]1696-we put a very narrow limit to the significance of [the Saviour]254-the saviour 's utterance when [we]1696-we imagine that [the generation [He]101-god alluded to]1707-the generation he alluded to implied merely [the people living in [His]101-god own day]1708-the people living in his own day . In the depths of [His]101-god Divine wisdom [He]101-god was acquainted with all the secrets of the Past and Future ; [He]101-god had no doubt seen this very world peopled by [widely different beings to [ourselves]1696-we]1709-widely different beings to ourselves , and knew that what [we]1696-we call [the human race]3019-the human race is only [a passing tribe]1711-a passing tribe permitted for a time to sojourn here . What a strangely presumptuous idea is that which pervades the minds of [the majority of persons]1674-the majority of persons - namely , that [Mankind]258-mankind , as [we]1696-we know it , must be the highest form of creation , simply because it is the highest form [WE]1696-we can see ! How absurd it is to be so controlled by [our]1696-we limited vision , when [we]1696-we can not even perceive the minute wonders that a butterfly beholds , or pierce the sunlit air with anything like the facility possessed by the undazzled eyes of an upward - soaring bird ! Nay , [we]1696-we can not examine the wing of a common house - fly without the aid of a microscope - to observe the facial expression of [[our]1696-we own actors]1714-our own actors on the stage [we]1696-we look through opera - glasses - to form any idea of the wonders of the stars [we]1696-we construct telescopes to assist [our]1696-we feeble and easily deluded sight ; and yet - yet [we]1696-we continue to parcel out the infinite gradations of creative Force and Beauty entirely to suit [our]1696-we own private opinions , and conclude that [WE]1696-we are the final triumph of [the Divine Artist]1715-the divine artist 's Supreme Intelligence ! Alas ! in very truth [we]1696-we are [a sorry spectacle both to [[our]1696-we soberly thinking selves]1717-our soberly thinking selves]1716-a sorry spectacle both to our soberly thinking selves and [the Higher Powers]1718-the higher powers , invited , as it were , to spend [our]1696-we life 's brief day in one of [[God]101-god 's gardens]1719-god 's gardens as [[His]101-god friends]1720-his friends and [guests]1721-guests , who certainly are not expected to abuse [[their]1722-their Host]1723-their host 's hospitality , and , ignoring [Him]101-god , call [themselves]1722-their [the owners]1724-the owners and [masters of the ground]1725-masters of the ground ! For [we]1696-we are but [wanderers beneath the sun]1726-wanderers beneath the sun ; [a " generation "[1727-a " generation " which must most surely and rapidly " pass away " to make room for another] which must most surely and rapidly " pass away "[1727-a " generation " which must most surely and rapidly " pass away " to make room for another] to make room for another]1727-a " generation " which must most surely and rapidly " pass away " to make room for another ; and as the work of [the Universe]1-the universe is always progressive , that other will be of nobler capacity and larger accomplishment . So while [we]1696-we are here , let [us]1696-we think earnestly of the few brief chances remaining to [us]1696-we - they grow fewer every hour . On one side is the endless , glorious heritage of [the purely aspiring , Immortal Spirit]1728-the purely aspiring , immortal spirit ; on the other the fleeting Mirage of this [our]1696-we present Existence ; and , midway between the two , the swinging pendulum of HUMAN WILL , which decides [our]1696-we fate . [God]101-god does not choose for [us]1696-we , or compel [our]1696-we love - [we]1696-we are free to fashion out [our]1696-we own futures ; but in making [our]1696-we final choice [we]1696-we can not afford to waste one moment of [our]1696-we precious , unreturning time .

[MARIE CORELLI]89-marie corelli .
